reviews.name: Kristie A.
reviews.review: I used to love Panera which I don't know why. The only thing I constantly order from Panera is their medeteranian egg white breakfast sandwich but a couple of months ago, they changed the recipe. It used to have sundried tomatoes. Now, it has seasoned chopped tomatoes with maybe sundried tomato paste. Either way, Panera isn't all that.It's super expensive for what you get. Sure, it might be a healthier alternative than others but there are so many other alternatives like Newks which serves the same type of food. Better tasting and better price for the amount of food that you get.This location specifically is right next to Vanderbilt so it is constantly busy especially during lunch. The workers work fast and hard though so you really don't have to wait that much long. Somehow, even with that many people, there are also always tables available so it's not that bad.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: It is your standard Panera which means I love it.Menu lists calorie counts for each item which is nice when you are trying to be goodDelicious salads that change with season changesAbility to order online and pick up at a specified time - this seemed to be one of the few in town where you can do that. Convenient when you are picking up for a group at work - they will have it waiting there all ready with your name and receipt on it.DRIVE THROUGH - this is THE BEST

reviews.name: Owen T.
reviews.review: I ordered the chicken tortellini which came out literally frozen. I was very disappointed across the board as our bagged soup also came out cold.

reviews.name: Meaghan L.
reviews.review: Nice location, close to Vanderbilt university.  They offer healthy,  hearty items on their menu. They screwed up my order last night but when I asked them to give me the right dressing, they were so pleasant and gave me a complimentary bagel.

reviews.name: Shannon W.
reviews.review: Always a good place to sit and enjoy internet, people watching and good food. I decided to try something new today. Ordered the Southern Chicken Flatbread with corn chowder. I really like their corn chowder. The sandwich had a bit of a spicy kick, but the flatbread was too thick/heavy for the sandwich.Tasted more like a pita sandwich. They were very quick to get everything out and being early for lunch, there was plenty of space to find a seat.

reviews.name: Amol U.
reviews.review: I'm not a Vanderbilt student, but I'd imagine that I'd spend a lot of time here if I was. If you've been to a Panera before, I'll keep this review brief and say upfront that it's basically on par with any of their other locations.If you haven't been before, think of Panera as your typical cafe, in the same 'genre' of 'upscale fast food' as Cosi, Au Bon Pain, Starbucks, and the like. It's a very comfortable, relaxing place to grab a quick lunch, catch up with friends, or camp out with books and a laptop to get work done over a few hours. The wi-fi works great, and there's plenty of outlets if you need to bunker down for a while.The food at Panera is also pretty great, and pricing is a tad high but generally agreeable. The best option is the "Pick Two," where you can combine a half-sandwich with a soup or salad to get the most variety out of the menu. I also love the quiches, though you have to get there before 11am for that. It's nice that they rotate their menu pretty frequently; I'll visit Panera every few weeks, and there's often a new addition or two to the menu. Service at this location is pretty fast, which is also a plus, and the employees seem exceptionally friendly.

reviews.name: Daniella B.
reviews.review: You buy a seven dollar half salad you expect the dressing when you get home.  Come on.  It's not rocket science.  It's quality control. It's doing your job at minimum wage.  Come on.

reviews.name: Tonya M.
reviews.review: We ate at Panera Bread cafe 1697 for a light  lunch. Not being familiar with the menu, we tried to ask questions to the rude cashier, a young woman that must really hate her job. She wouldn't answer any our question, just the roll of her eyes. Wish I would have gotten her name. By the way, the food was delicious but someone with her personality is not the employee u want to represent your place of business.

reviews.name: Chris L.
reviews.review: As this is a chain it is important to make sure that the customer is able to have the "same taste" whichever location they go to.  I am a very good supporter of Panera because of their healthy foods.  As many know Panera is a little more pricey but never the less good food.  I gave this location a three because of the bruised apple I received, some what dirty bathrooms and terrible atmosphere.  When you walked into a place you definitely know if there is a good/clean atmosphere and it seems a little dirty when I walked in.  The food was still good and will definitely come back to a panera again.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Today, I only ate lunch here because the parking lot security guard at the adjoining parking lot told me that it was only for Panera customers. I had intentions to eat at San Antonio Taco Company. But alas, I did not want to re-park, so I went to Panera. Line was typical for lunch, read as LONG! Eventually ordered my staple Frontega Chicken Panini. Baked chips were okay, not much flavor besides salty. Overall, it was okay.

reviews.name: Corey G.
reviews.review: Panera always leaves something to be desired.  The prices are way too high for the portions and I always leave hungry.  The menu is projected to have fresh and healthy choices but its far from that.  The service at the Midtown location always seems very cold and they're not very helpful.  The parking situation can also be tough at times, they have a parking attendant during the day but not at night so it can be hard to find a spot.  I am a big fan of their bread and pastries but thats about it when it comes to this location.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: You know, I think the last time I went to Panera was around a 1.5 years ago... maybe longer? There are just so many great spots in town to get a sammich, salad, and soup so I put 'ol Panera on the backburner. However, thanks to our chilly and stormy weather of the last 2 days, I was feeling a bit apprehensive about which of the following:A. Leaving my bedB. Getting out of my car to face the cold wet precipitation C. Wearing head to to flannel (i.e. I was wearing my damn pajamas outside of my home - but I had on a long winter coat!)D. All of the aboveIf you said, you're likely a brilliant mind and have earned the spot of being my one call if I was ever in a pinch during my appearance as a contestant on a gameshow that allows me to do so. Just sayin'. I felt a bit guilty since I'm hypersensitive about supporting local businesses year round and we're right in the middle of this Yelp Shops Local campaign, but this broad was craving som comforting soup and a little carbs. I was bored with what was in my pantry and I happened to be nearby at the Post Office to use the drive-up mailbox since apparently my mail carrier hasn't grasped the concept of picking up my mail but instead shoves my magazines and other parcel on top... sorry, that is a whole other Yelp review. So. I gave in. I pulled up in the drive-thru line as apparently I shared the same sentiment as everyone else in Nashville and I waited. Anyone, who knows me will laugh at this because I become a complete brat when it comes to lines and am overall, I'm not exactly known for my patience.... Question 2: So what do I suck up and do it for? Answer: A Mediterranean Veggie Sandwich, Iced Green Tea, and a cup of theBlack Bean Soup (along with a bag of chips and chunk of bread that came with my order)Question 3: And, you know what? Answer: It was damn tasty! I enjoyed each and every last bite. The experience as a whole was very positive. From the drive-thru line moving efficiently to the extremely friendly (but not in the annoying way) drive-thru service, this location is very good at what they do. I'm appreciative of that and also due to the fact that I didn't even have to change out of my PJs to get a healthy and delicious meal. While I won't be a regular here or at any other chains, if I do get the urge, I'll be sure to come back to this location.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: This Panera "The Rockin' Bread Place" sits on the ashes of a Burger King.  Fortunately it has much more room than that Burger King ever offered, and one less Parking Lot Nazi.Overall the prices of Panera always seem a bit high, but they never seem to skimp on portion sizes, so its hard to be TOO critical. I can't say I ever have a CRAVING for Panera, but I always like my food when I am there.Also, if you are particularly fond of bread, this is your stop.

reviews.name: Caroline H.
reviews.review: I'm not the biggest fan of Panera sandwiches but their Greek salads and broccoli cheddar soup keep me coming back. As a qualifier, I walk here, so I know nothing of the sure-to-be-inconvenient parking sitch.Yes, this place is BUSY during lunch rush, but the line moves pretty quickly and the wait for the food isn't terrible. BUT seating is definitely sometimes hard to come by. Pro tip: DON'T come then! (11:45-1 ish?) When you come at a "non-traditional" lunch time you get a nice quietish place to sit on your laptop, drink refills of their oft-replenished hazelnut coffee (or iced coffee which is serve-yourself!!) and stare out the window from one of the little booths.

reviews.name: Nicole W.
reviews.review: I normally come here for lunch and get a soup and salad, their tomato is my favorite, but today I came for breakfast. Their pastries are good but their sandwiches are terrible. There was barely any cheese and egg on my sandwich. It was more bread then anything. Not worth it. I won't be getting the sandwich anymore.

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: Hard part for me is Panera does not have Gluten Free bread. If they had that I would eat here all the time. I had a salad and it was good. I just wish they made bread i could eat.

reviews.name: Christopher G.
reviews.review: Probably the worst Panera I've been to. Yesterday the line was ridiculous and too many employees seemed not to care. I actually went to Starbucks, which I hate. Today, my bagel was undercooked despite two efforts. And my hot chocolate was neither hot nor very chocolaty. How do you mess this up?

reviews.name: Sarah B.
reviews.review: Sometimes you have a love/hate relationship with a place.I love Panera as a rule... I realize to a lot of yelpers out there, it's not "cool" to review chain places.  I understand one location to the next is not often relevantly different, but I don't limit myself to only writing about the unique.This Panera location has one huge attribute:  a drive thru.It also has one huge downfall:  the drive thru.Parking here is scarce, I don't care when you go.  Years ago this parking lot connected to an alley in the back, and there was this overflow lot than Panera shared with Starbucks next door.  Alas, no more.  The alley now is separated from the Panera lot by concrete and medians, and when they're full, you are basically out of luck.It's a huge plus to be able to go thru a drive thru in this area and get a panini and soup for lunch rather than a burger and fries - and everybody knows it.  Their drive thru line will flow along the outer parking lot "rim" if you will, and folks scoping for parking will follow around and park adjacent to the drive thru lane of traffic squished (illegally) to the right.  Makes getting out that way a big hot mess if you're not in the actual drive-thru, warning.Also that overflow lot I mentioned from earlier?  If you circle the black the long way, it's still there, only now it's fenced and a Central Parking System pay $1 for 15 minutes.  And the wandering meter maid, trust me, she's close.  A little frustrating, but if you've got a hankering and no other choice, do it and just be careful in the alley - a little muddy and "rutty."This Panera is one of the worst for finding seats during lunch, makes you glare at the folks taking up booths with their laptops and day's worth of reading all spread out when you're carrying a tray wandering.  But I get that Panera is open way more hours than just lunch, so they're allowed.  Just glaring...My only real Panera issue that I just recently figured out, and it's small... when you order your entree, a Pick 2 would be my norm, you see all the info about add a bakery treat for 99 cents.  In the small print that I just noticed, you have to buy a drink.  If you are opting to drink more water, as my doctor suggested I try - and it's been working pretty well for weight loss - you pay bakery treat retail.Now, I fully admit that drinking water for weight loss and adding a cookie is counter productive.  And I fully realize that restaurants make the hugest part of their profits on drink sales as opposed to the food.  But I swear I never noticed that caveat before - maybe it's just me.

reviews.name: Cathy B.
reviews.review: Great location, right across the street from Vandy. Love the broccoli and cheddar soup, but the Wifi connection is horrible. Came here at 11am the other day, spent 20 minutes trying to connect to the Wifi so I could work while eating lunch. No luck connecting on computer or phone, finally gave up and just went back to school.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: I usually go to the Panera Bread on Commerce Street in Nashville near my job at the Bat Building for AT&T, but I had to go to the Doctor's office for my surgery at Vanderbilt and Tony had never eaten at Panera Bread before, so we chose this location.It is a great size and it has a great parking lot in size but it is so tight and always so full. You have to be careful parking, don't want to bump your door into a parked neighbors car. Tony opted to get the "New England Clam Chowder" in the bread bowl, with sweet tea since they don't serve alcoholic products. I opted to get the duo of a Spinach Power salad with a smoky onion dressing and a cup of my favorite soup Hearty Veggie with Pesto...I love this soup. I usually get this one or the french onion, I am pretty much set in stone for my soup choices. I usually get the Roast Beef sandwich because I love the Horsy mayo sauce..The sandwich is awesome!! But, I didn't get  the sandwich on this trip..but next time...I love that sandwich!!!It was really crowded. I had warned Tony about it. He hates crowds. He is old fashion about some things and sort of picky...ugh!!!He enjoyed his soup and tea, and he had to get a Double Chocolate Brownie Bar..and he said it was the best. I personally can't wait until my next trip to Panera Bread!!!What's your favorite?

reviews.name: Anthony C.
reviews.review: I usually go with the Pick Two option and order the Chicken Cuban Panini and either the French Onion Soup or the Asian Sesame Salad. The panini is on a nicely pressed piece of focaccia, and has ham, Swiss, sliced chicken breast, sweet and spicy pickles, and a really good chipotle mayo and sun-dried tomato ale mustard spread that makes this one of my favorite sandwiches here. The French Onion Soup is always really yummy, rich, and brothy. My only complaint is that they forget the little bag of seasoned croutons and cheese that go with it way too often. Come on, guys! This part is what makes it so good! The Asian Sesame Salad is simple, but one of my favorite salads. It has chicken breast, romaine lettuce, fresh cilantro, sliced almonds, sesame seeds, crispy wonton strips &  reduced-sugar Asian sesame vinaigrette. For the most part, I like this location fine for using the drive thru, but I would probably not choose to park and go in because the parking lot always seems to be chaotic and a high risk for a fender bender. The customer service is probably more of a 3.5 because of the above-mentioned missing croutons and cheese and a sense of being a little scattered at times. I would say that those little gripes aside, the food is consistently good and that is ultimately the most important part.

reviews.name: Tim M.
reviews.review: This Panera is similar to SATCo next door. They need new management and employees who actually want to be there. They are preying on Vanderbilt students and staff because it's close. I have seen staff literally fighting about who will stop what they are doing to take my order.Honestly, twice a week I buy a soda and cookie so I don't feel guilty about occupying a booth and the Internet for 2.5 hours.Sandwiches are average at best. Roast beef is served dry (as in I can't taste any spread.) Best 2 things in my opinion are the mac and cheese and chipotle chicken sandwich.After 20+ visits since August (hey, it's convenient), I finally learn that they have a frequent customer (MyPanera) card. Since I joined 5 weeks ago, I've already earned 2 free drinks and a dessert. They also added a sign promoting the card as you walk in.Honestly, they are overpriced but your choices are between SATCo, Subway, and Panera. Who do you think is going to win?

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: How many baguettes do you think one Panera goes through in a day? If you have ever pondered this question, I have an answer for you! (but you'll have to read the rest of my review before I give it up)As a Panera connoisseur, I must say that this is my go-to when I'm on the job. If you consider the major flaw being that they get busy do to their location on 21st and back up out the door, you are right. But I have found that timing is everything! If you are going for lunch aim to be there at  11:30 a.m. or 12:45 p.m. to start ordering because things just get barbaric at noon. People cut throats for tables and stalk you like wounded gazelle. All other times, I've been pleasantly surprised at how efficient this place functions. In fact, they have the drive through because they are the third highest selling Panera in the entire franchise. Go Nashville! The answer to the initial question is 1200. On average this Panera goes through 1200 baguettes a day. Combine that with their catering and you have a multimillion dollar idea.

reviews.name: Jenn Z.
reviews.review: I have been visiting Panera for years with my Sister as our "Friday lunch date spot", mainly because my Sister is a picky eater who is hesitant to try new things, and it's sort of become a tradition if you will. We decided about 2 years ago this location was in the "middle" between both of our jobs, so we meet here. Worst part of that plan: parking. It is an utter nightmare and I am not exaggerating. They have a security/parking person onsite, but honestly they can't create more parking spaces....they only help you squeeze in when the spaces are taken and you have to park on a curb. It appears much of the Vandy crowd comes in for lunch, and that is wonderful for all of us because many of them walk. That also makes it incredibly crowded and nearly impossible to find a seat. What's worse is the few people who sit there for wi-fi usage while others wanting to eat lunch have to table stalk until they can sit and eat. My Sister orders the same sandwich and the mac n cheese every time. We love the bread, love the mac n cheese. I typically get the over priced Mozzarella and Tomato Panini with the greek salad -  the pick two combo, I do enjoy the sandwich but it is not loaded with cheese like you might find in a real sandwich shop. I do agree with some of the reviewers that the portions are small for the price, and the customer service is inconsistent. I expect to pay a little more if the food is organic, purchased in smaller portions or locally but this is a chain. As far as service goes: for about a year we knew several of the cashiers, they remembered us and some times our orders every time, but they have moved on, possibly graduated and moved into careers. Since then it has been hit or miss with service. We visited today and our cashier was incredibly friendly and engaging so that was a "hit" and deserves recognition. I do love Panera's Hazelnut coffee, I often stop in to a nearby Panera when out to enjoy one, their pastries are also delicious. I just won't go out of my way to come here. I would prefer to hit a locally owned place with a bit better parking, more consistent service and better pricing for quality. But, I will continue to come if my Sis wants to on our Friday dates :)

reviews.name: Ruth L.
reviews.review: always have great food but a wee but pricey but its all healthy so small portions and little more expensive isn't a surprise. the service is slow, hard to find a seat since its always busy and a lot of students taking advantage of the free WiFi. even harder to find a parking spot and they have some one patrol to tow anyone that doesn't belong there but still hard to find a parking spot.  but the food is worth it!

reviews.name: Kim L.
reviews.review: I love Panera. This one is really big and they gave us free drinks! I

reviews.name: Sean H.
reviews.review: My first Panera experience! I made my friend take me, and I was pretty pleased. My chai and pastry were very satisfactory. Free coffee refills were legit. This location was really spacious, with lots of seating and power outlets.

reviews.name: Paul M.
reviews.review: If you don't like sandwiches or clean bathrooms then this is your place

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: Great Sandwiches, Salads & Soups, a nice place to meet for lunch.  Outside seating, even covered & heated outside seating.This location is very near Vanderbilt, always busy and parking can be hard to find. Free WiFi

reviews.name: Baroke L.
reviews.review: Beware of the drive thru. Twice this week I've had problems which is unacceptable. First they gave me the wrong order. They were very nice about it, so I chose to forgive and forget. What just happened is unforgivable though -- I was given a cream cheese packet that had the peel pulled part of the way off and appeared to have a scoop taken out of it. DISGUSTING. I don't know what is going on in the drive thru area, but I don't enjoy getting half eaten food.

reviews.name: Aaron F.
reviews.review: Hmm. An unremarkable place with a personality as unimpressive. I go here for a little breakfast and to use the wifi. After not listening to my order for a bagel and cream cheese, the guy charges me and asks me if I wanted anything on my bagel. I repeated cream cheese. He charges me $1.31. For a fricking pat of cream cheese. And I have to pay again? The guy seemed really out of it.Then as I am filling up my coffee, it runs out and no one behind the counter cares. After eating, I attempt to use the wifi (since mine isn't up yet) and it cuts me off after a half hour. The restaurant was empty, so why this draconian policy? I'm going to stick to Starbucks. Unlimited internet and better coffee. I never thought I'd say that!

reviews.name: Dante' T.
reviews.review: I love that this location has a drive-thru. I can swing through & grab fresh delicious food.  Nothing like wholesome options on days when I don't have time to cook... Considering the other reviews, the drive-thru might be the best option because I don't have to deal with parking... :-)

reviews.name: Jamie A.
reviews.review: You couldn't pay me to come here during weekday breakfast or lunch hours; but if I'm running errands late in the afternoon or on the weekend, it is not a bad stop.  I really love the creamy chicken and wild rice soup.  If I am counting Weight Watcher points, the black bean soup sans cheese/croutons is a tasty and filling winner.

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: A Panera is a Panera. There's nothing different about this location, except the parking. If you are planning on going around breakfast, lunch, or dinner, plan on going somewhere else. The parking situation is a nightmare. They even have a rent-a-cop in the lot directing traffic. Not really sure how they thought this 20 spot lot could handle the traffic in this area.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: I'm a huge Panera supporter in general. That's kinda of a big deal since it's a chain. I just can't stand this location. I've never had my order messed up so many times. I usually get something simple but for some reason or another they can't get it right. I like to study and read in Panera's too, but this one is always filled with people making that difficult. The parking is absolutely horrible, you have to really make up the parking spots if you ever want to get in. If Vandy is in session the line usually goes out the front door at lunch. I do like their outdoor seating area when the weather is nice though.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: Panera is a great place for a quick bite or a lunch meeting but don't expect anything fantastic out of the food. I usually go for their "you pick two" option and get a sandwich and salad. Their Chicken Caesar sandwich is pretty good and their salads are unique but not great. Depending on their day their soups can be good or mediocre (though on cold winter days they magically become fantastic). Panera's best attribute is that it provides a good healthy alternative to the usual fast food options located around campus.

reviews.name: Lauren A.
reviews.review: All I gotta say is that they have an amazing cinnamon crunch bagel - and delicious (and low fat!!) hazelnut cream cheese.  Other than that - I've always enjoyed their sandwiches (though I tend to find them a little pricey) and their soups are always great! I like that you tend to have 6 different soups to choose from as well.  But honestly - I only go here to get that bagel.  Maybe one day I'll branch out and try a healthier one, but since I only treat myself maybe once a month with this bagel, I think its ok.

reviews.name: mumin k.
reviews.review: If there is one place that I would rate as the absolute worst place to have a quick lunch that would be Panera .. I tried it a couple of times just because it is very close to work but just did not work for me. I tried their paninis and several of their sandwiches but did not like any of them. I was so excited to see them offer a turkey sandwich with an artchoke spread (which i love), but it was a total disaster. The worse though is their soups. Their soups are so salty that I can't stop thinking about how much preservatives they have to add to these.

reviews.name: Theresa B.
reviews.review: Oh my word...can we get any worse???...I called at 1130 to place an order for delivery..they said let me give you Tim our caterer..who I can picture sauntering to the phone as if why bother...then he asks when I want the order and I said as soon as possible..he says just a second...another wait..for a very surly and unhappy order taker to come on the line...she lets me place my order for 3 people and then says.."there's a $50 minimum for deliveries"..I guess that wasn't important to the 3 people before her to mention...It's a busy day at our office and we had already placed, 2 orders over $300.00..I mention this and she says let me have you speak to our store manager..the guy comes on and says this is Tim..I say didn't I just speak with you earlier??..He says "yup"..I said so you know I've been transferred 5 times now??..He said, "yup"....I'm just wondering, at this point..need I say more????..Oh I do have to tell you about Tim changing his name to Mike at the end of our conversation...LOL

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Happily the little Burger King was razed here, and Panera Bread rose up like a phoenix from the ruins!  Pretty (and smart) Vanderbilt University coeds like the salads here.  Future business ladies and gentlemen from Vandy's Owen business college come here to graph their economic models on their laptops.  Nurses and docs from the Vandy medical center take a break here from saving lives.  Et al.

reviews.name: Angeline W.
reviews.review: Just came out of there.. Had the best time of my life with some friends... They will be seeing me soon

reviews.name: Thommy S.
reviews.review: When I ate here, there was a lady that worked that Sunday, and she was very nice. It was my first time to try Jamaican food, and I had the oxtail. It was good.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: What a bunch of really nice people that own and work here.I got some awesome photos, I'll post of the people that work here.Went with a group of people and had a really good bowl of bone broth made from cow feet, to which they name the soup, "Bull Feet" soup.Milky white from the collagen, a few bits of vegetables, and a nice spicing.That bowl of soup lasted me all day long, as collagen should.Very good.  If you're feeling like you're coming down with something, that soup will keep you from getting sick, or make you feel much better.  That's the purpose of collagen.Everyone else sampled the menu with curries, jerks, a bake...Portions were HUGE, I didn't see any pigeon peas, but I did see black beans and rice mixed (morros).Everyone seemed to enjoy their meal, no one sent anything back and they handled our group so very well.All the food came out at the same time.A little Bob Marley music in the background, lots of good food, lots of good conversation and it was a great luncheon for all of us.Excellent for groups. They can handle it well!Highly recommend.VERY inexpensive.Plenty of parking everywhere.Good hours.

reviews.name: David E.
reviews.review: Love this place. You walk in and you are greeted with warm smiles.  The selection is simple and awesome - jerked chicken, curried goat, etc. I got the jerked chicken with rice and peas, plantains and a salad. The chicken was cooked just right but if you want it hot (relative term i know) you will need to ask for sauce. I will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Sincere R.
reviews.review: This place is pretty good Jamaican, for Nashville. Having lived in NYC, DC, and Chicago, I've been lucky enough to have some really good Jamaican food. Unfortunately, this place doesn't deliver a memorable punch. Don't get me wrong, the place isn't bad by at all; it just isn't great either. I ordered the jerk chicken and it was just mediocre. The cabbage was blah and the rice and peas tasted a little old.

reviews.name: Valerie A.
reviews.review: This is the best Jamaican food I have had from Nashville . Im from nyc so I am use to some good authentic Jamaican food and this hit the spot . My boyfriend and I (who loves Jamaican food too ) really enjoyed our jerk chicken.

reviews.name: Frankie B.
reviews.review: Nice... Hole in the wall... Authentic Caribbean Restaurant.

reviews.name: Rufus R.
reviews.review: This is the first Caribbean restaurant I've tried since moving to Nashville and also the first Caribbean restaurant that I remember going to that didn't have broken bones. Not sure if that's good or bad but no complaints there. The food was pretty good(I had curry chicken) but I'd be lying if I didn't say that I was disappointed in the portions and the fact that my cabbage was cold. Other than that.... I might go back, later than sooner

reviews.name: Lowell R.
reviews.review: Great!  My friend suggested we find a new restaurant for lunch today, so I did some research and found this little place.  The small amount of reviews I could find, all suggested that this place is really good.  We went, and I'm very glad we did.I ordered the curry goat, and my friend had the jerk chicken.  Both were excellent.  I'm a big fan of the curry goat at Jamaicaway, but this one was better.  There was much more meat.  The curry flavor was really good too.  My friend's chicken was good too.  Great grilled, charcoal flavor, and a good amount of heat, too.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone, and I don't find that there are lots of restaurants in Nashville that I can say that about.  We got out of there for $27 for 2 meals, 2 bottles of water, a fried bread order, tax and tip.  It can be a little hard to spot from the road, but if you pull in to the lot with the tofu house (one of Nashville's hidden gem restaurants, by the way), and park at the far end of the lot, you'll find yourself right outside the restaurant.

reviews.name: Josh S.
reviews.review: Excellent little hidden gem!  I had the curried goat, which was outstanding and the portions were more than adequate. Everything tasted fresh and authentically flavored. In addition to the food, the service was excellent.  Anna, the lady working,  was polite and very friendly. She answered my questions, offered a sample of the curry, and made sure that I had all that I needed. I would highly recommend!

reviews.name: Miriam W.
reviews.review: So I judge a coffee shop by its coffee, first and foremost, and Bond brews a good cup of joe; rich and full bodied with great balance. They were brewing the Cafe Kaldi on the morning of my visit. The decaf roast available in 12 ounce bags says "natural" process, which I'm assuming is Swiss water process, for those who care about less chemicals in your food. Hubby had a decaf Americano and pronounced it excellent. I had a bagel breakfast sandwich~eggs, cheese and sliced tomato (I skipped the bacon) on a sesame bagel, and found it quite tasty, although it lacked seasoning and needed salt & pepper. I asked the barista where the bagels were made, and while she couldn't remember the name of the bakery, she said they were local. They wouldn't win any awards in NYC, but it was a decent bagel. Muffins, pastry, specialty coffee drinks and tea are also available. They serve ice cream and sorbet also, and, while I did not partake, I noticed that this is a local and carefully sourced product made from hormone free dairy. Soon I hope this will be the norm and not notable at all; until then, I applaud all businesses that make the right decision and care for their customers in this way. The space is lovely and open with plenty of natural light. A pleasant place to enjoy your morning coffee.

reviews.name: Victoria L.
reviews.review: On a whim I decided to stop in Bond Coffee on my way to Juice Nashville. I have to say I was surprised to find this cozy little gem in the middle of the gulch. The atmosphere is what I would call "Coziness Elevated" The chandeliers serve as a nice compliment to the surplus of handwritten chalkboard signs. The baristas were extremely helpful and friendly. They rattled off the list of latte options with patience and enthusiasm. I love that they have soy AND almond alternatives. You'd be surprised how many places only offer soy. This may be a tiny but picky but I also like that their stoppers for to go coffee are only 1/4 the length of a regular stopper. I don't know if they are being economical or environmental but either way it was a tiny detail that made me like the place a little bit more. I had an almond cinnamon latte which was served up quickly and ran around $6.00. Which is pretty average for a medium latte with a milk alternative added. It was slightly less bitter than other lattes I've had in the past but I didn't find the cinnamon to be very noticeable. Overall I would say the latte was definitely above average. I would recommend this place to a friend without hesitation!

reviews.name: Jeff K.
reviews.review: I notice only positive reviews stay up when writing about Bond Coffee Co. Let me do it again. I am appalled at a total disconnect that the staff has with 1) how to operate a tv and 2) not having news available (they have a TV mind you, just set to daytime drama) to people that want  nt and desire to hear about an explosion in downtown Manhattan. There were more than just 2 couples that heard about a NY explosion and wanted to see the news but the staff didn't , couldn't, figure out how to use the TV. The coffee, the expertly made Cappuccino's were lackluster, expensive and even not warm. Ok, maybe "warm" but certainly not hot. Just wait till competition comes into this Gulch neighborhood, like a Starbucks or a Dunkin Donuts and you'll see me flee (along with others I bet) to a new and less staid and undefined coffee shop. No excuse for poor employees not knowing the systems of their workplace.

reviews.name: Jordan L.
reviews.review: Cute place! Came here because the place down the road was too crowded and I was by myself. Got the breakfast burrito and an iced mocha! Delicious little breakfast! Didn't give it 5 stars because it's a little pricy.. But not bad!

reviews.name: Rosemary D.
reviews.review: Slow service and rude employees. The food is extremely overpriced and generic, NOT made in-house. Oh, and my coffee had grinds in it. Biggest coffee shop disappointment ever.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: Extremely convenient for Gulch and especially Icon residents. You don't even have to go outside for coffee! I've had a couple lattes here, and they are just OK in my book. I definitely prefer the soy lattes over anything else, but there's just something about the espresso that I don't love... hmmm. The food is good, I like their sandwiches and the pastries look pretty awesome as well. Service is friendly and reasonably quick, and I think what bumps this place up is that their space is pretty solid and always clean. Great for Icon inhabitants and locals who are in the area, but don't make a trip out of your way to get here. Coffee is just alright.

reviews.name: Lisa C.
reviews.review: I was staying with my friend next door when I decided to stop in for a cup of coffee and a bite to eat. For someone who typically orders a plank old cup of coffee, I decided to be adventurous and got the Tracey bond; a latte with coconut, almond and chocolate milk. It was delicious and hit the spot. For a 5 dollars, the latte was reasonable and the ambiance in the cafe was nice too; I saw a couple people on their laptops. I will definitely be returning for another cup!

reviews.name: Marelise J.
reviews.review: Cute little coffee shop! Modern feel to it. Stopped here while my friends and I were visiting for the weekend.

reviews.name: Amelia A.
reviews.review: I'm not one for leaving yelp reviews, but woof, this place is a mess. after a wonderful trip in Nashville, we stopped here for coffee and breakfast before driving home. the cashier informed us that the food would be "a few minutes" because there were orders in front of ours. we did receive our coffees immediately, but the coffee was some of the worst I've ever had! it then took over 30 minutes for me to get my yogurt parfait. after 25 minutes, I asked the cashier how much longer it would be, and he reacted with incredible rudeness, saying something along the lines of "how should I know?" once we did receive our food it was under-salted and lukewarm. the table next to us was similarly disenchanted with the food and service. for the wait and cost there are plenty of places in Nashville that will treat you with respect, so I suggest avoiding this place.

reviews.name: Morgan O.
reviews.review: Tasty coffee and even tastier treats.Whether you're in the mood for brunch, coffee or a quick snack Bond has you covered.One of the staff suggested I allow them to heat up the banana chocolate chip muffin I had selected one afternoon... Rest assured of you also opt for this little trick you will have a new addiction on your hands. Yum!!!They also have a nice little brunch menu featuring sandwiches and other options that will leave you feeling totally satisfied. My only complaint is that they aren't open on Sundays which is a problem considering my new habit. Let me assure you warm and gooey banana chocolate muffin withdrawal can be an ugly thing. My favorite menu items: Iced Mocha, Banana Chocolate Muffins, Chicken Salad sandwich.

reviews.name: Ryan P.
reviews.review: Recently stopped here for a couple of hours on a Saturday morning while my wife was getting her hair done next door, and had a cup of coffee and a cookie while I read a book and waited. This is the perfect location and was very busy the entire time I was their. Service was fast and friendly, and the quality was very good. I was never rely bothered the hole time I was their and it was a peacefull way to spend a morning. Not much else I can realy say as it is a Coffee plae!

reviews.name: Katie Y.
reviews.review: Lost a star for being kind of pricey for the coffee. However, it is pretty delicious. Currently sipping a Strawberry Fields, a latte with white chocolate, Irish cream, and strawberry flavoring. So delicious! It came filled right to the brim and looked perfect.

reviews.name: Lex M.
reviews.review: Oh Gulch, how can you be such a pretentious part of an otherwise down to earth city?Alright, I stopped in after the gym to see what the coffee was like. I had a Honey Ryder latte which was pretty tasty but a little steep for $5. The place is super clean and well appointed but I don't think it's the kind of spot to come in your gym clothes and kick it (the stares I got!) but I guess that's just the neighborhood. Locally owned, I support that.

reviews.name: Elizabeth M.
reviews.review: This is a seriously classy coffee shop. Amazing espresso, love the London Fog specialty drink, and the Buchi brand kombucha is delicious and cheekily presented in glass beer bottles. I love the wrought-iron chandeliers and the smooth modern-yet-comfy decor. The customer service is fabulous/friendly/genuine and when they make the cookies in the back, the smell will knock your proverbial socks clean off.

reviews.name: Simone B.
reviews.review: Nice atmosphere -- good place for a quick bite of breakfast and a hot drink on a chilly morning. No complaints about the breakfast sandwich or latte I sampled - both were tasty. But nothing about my experience blew me away either. The kind of place I recommend if it's convenient to where you already happen to be. I'd definitely return if I was visiting the gulch area but probably wouldn't go out of my way to visit.

reviews.name: Lauren M.
reviews.review: This place is amazing. The barista that helped us was very pleasant and friendly. She made us a couple of the Carmel Eye (apple/caramel flavor) and it was amazing. The caramel/apple taste didn't overwhelm the coffee flavor. I would visit again if I come back to Nashville's Gulch!

reviews.name: Allison S.
reviews.review: Great little spot in the Gulch. I've had a few of their specialty drinks and sandwiches, which were all really good. Their breakfast burrito is my absolute favorite! Delicious and not over-priced. And they deliver in the Gulch area for just $1, with no minimum. There should be more places that do that around The Gulch - keeps me coming back to Bond  every week!

reviews.name: Victoria W.
reviews.review: Icon residents would really appreciate a coffee shop open on Sundays. Service is quite slow but the muffins are great!

reviews.name: Zachary J.
reviews.review: Went with the stock vanilla latte. Great Cup of coffee. A little pretentious, but it's the Gulch. My wife had to wait on her Tracey Bond, a coconut latte creation. In fact I was 3/4 finished with my latte by the time her drink  was up. Overall, pleasant locally owned coffee shop.

reviews.name: Carmen P.
reviews.review: eh.  if  you are already in the gulch and need a fix, this place will do.  they have the basics expected, and a few extra treats too. they also have bottled kombucha tea, but it's not made in house, nevertheless, bottled kombucha tea is better than no kombucha tea. there were lots of dudes wearing skinny jeans and throw-back connor oberst haircuts, and others who looked like their dogs just died, so if you like that i guess this would be reason for you to come out of your way here.

reviews.name: Ryan P.
reviews.review: I've had a couple different lattes from here and they've been really great, but the star of the show for me is the breakfast burrito.  It's dangerous that this place is on my way to the office, because I fear I'll get this monster every day.  Bacon, egg, cheese, tomato, avocado, salsa, and sour cream; not for the faint of heart, but absolutely delicious.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: I've been to every darn coffee shop in Nashville.  I go to places which have coffee, but focus on other things, I try coffee stands, I've been gobs of places out of Nashville, and I can say this for Bond Coffee Company:Best New Coffee Shop 2013Taking over the space previously held by Casablanca Coffee, they've stripped down the adornments, cleared the barriers, focused on the basics, and brought in St. Louis-based Kaldi coffee.  I am always interested in trying a new coffee, and this one works.  I could have more Kaldi Coffee in my life, and in short order, the relatively new baristas have figured out the art of making good coffee.They play the "Bond" gimmick way up, and I like it.  Tart L. mentioned, Kathleen Bond is a local Belmont graduate, so it's a family name as well as a movie callback, but they revel in unique drink names like "Honey Ryder" (from "Dr. No") and Tracey Bond (from "On Her Majesty's Secret Service").  Kathleen and her sister are stately, almost majestic, young ladies whom any dashing British MI5 agent would readily give up his gallivanting, continent-hopping lifestyle for.My feelings on coffee shops change like the wind.  Places that I loved before have fallen in my eyes, and places that I didn't care for have jumped with welcome changes.  But for a brand-new place with green-as-heck baristas, I cannot endorse this place enough.  Bond Coffee is top coffee agent, and the secret needs to get out.

reviews.name: Veronica D.
reviews.review: One of the best reasons I love this place is that they carry hemp milk!  Before they opened, they took the time to respond to me via FB regarding some allergies I have and they listened and considered the option. Lo and behold, they updated me when they opened that they would carry a brand of hemp milk that is also carrageenan free! I love having different coffee options, and we all know Nashville has some great ones, so I can't thank them enough. I'm really looking forward to stopping by for their salad options. Hoping they get gluten free items as well.

reviews.name: Lance L.
reviews.review: The friendly and trendy baristas know what they're doing here. I like to engage in jokingly sarcastic dialog with baristas (in general), and the Bond Coffee people are amused and happy to oblige.

reviews.name: Theresa S.
reviews.review: Always stop here when in the Gulch. Great environment...so clean! Very helpful staff. Next time I'll try to plan to stay for lunch.

reviews.name: Michael D.
reviews.review: Not your typical over roasted Starbucks knock-off, or even a HIPSTER snobby coffee dive...just a real, quality, laid-back, space for consumption of coffee and coffee related foods...in the middle of The Gulch in Nashville.  Your "respite" from hipster/trendy Gulchness.

reviews.name: Timothy N.
reviews.review: I used YELP as I was driving through and this place hit the spot.  Thanks.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Kathleen Bond is another proud Belmont U graduate running a 12 South coffeehouse. A BU grad earlier opened the Jam down the street at Wedgewood. I feel we can never have too many coffeehouses; caffeine is my buzz. Kathleen's barristas are a couple of neat Bond boys and girls whose smiles tell me they are happy to be there. I  like that the coffee is handed to me hot by the Bond barrista and not in a self-serve pot like some other spots. I also like the mystery of the latin Orbis Non Sufficit in Bond's coat of arms which I think means the world is not enough. The fresh pastries are coming from bakers like Silke's, while other menu items including parfaits are made in-house. This week it's mainly just coffee being served with a reeved-up menu of paninis and other sandwiches, salads and such next week.

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: Really cool atmosphere here. I'd already had about 3 cups of coffee by the time we stopped in here, so we both got the "Memorial Day Special" which was a root beer float - although they may always have those. It was just ice cream and root beer, but it was really delicious. The staff was REALLY nice and gave us tips of places to see in the area. I'm not giving it 5 stars because, at the end of the day, it's a normal coffee shop. But like I said, everyone was really nice and it was a really cool atmosphere.

reviews.name: Carolyn S.
reviews.review: Cool atmosphere. Staff was friendly. Had a good cup of tea, but was completely unimpressed by the chocolate espresso pie I tried.

reviews.name: Elizabeth H.
reviews.review: These burgers are as big as your face!  They are amazing.  The veggie burger is just as good (veggie and vegan friendly food, they also have a falafel which I have never had but not all Fat Mo's advertise these you just have to order them)!!!  The spicy fries, fried pickles, cheese sticks, chicken wings...I don't know that they make bad food!  Prices are great!  The service is friendly!  I'm kind of a regular...

reviews.name: Jason E.
reviews.review: Been here several times and always had good food and a welcoming atmosphere. Prices are pretty reasonable. The fruit tea is good. Always gotta go with greens as a side at a place like this, and cornbread. I think my favorite entree thus far is the meatloaf, but they don't always have it. Highly recommended! Not sure if I'd go after dark due to the area. But otherwise great :)

reviews.name: Tee H.
reviews.review: So I'm here at Harpers & besides the fact it took this woman literally 5 minutes 2 ring us out, mind u just myself & another so all I was thinking was now my food will b cold b4 I can sit down & eat, im asking questions about my food & she is literally pointing over my food so closely that it was the rudest thing I've ever seen b in my life!!!! It was pissing me off so badly! Mind u her nails were long & looked gross! Her attitude sucked!! Again this is someone's grandmother who should most definitely know how 2 treat her customers! She didn't greet us nor did she say thank u! The food was actually delicious! But u will pay Red Lobster prices! This was my 1st time here & this lady gave a lasting impression where I may not actually return! Again u will know who I'm speaking of because of the horrible attitude & funky nails!!! So sorry Harpers food is definitely 4 stars but the customer service is only getting u a 1 from me, oh she's not the 1 serving u but she is the 1 that u have 2 hand ur money to so idk which is worst!!!

reviews.name: Victoria E.
reviews.review: I went here with friends and I must say the food was great. We went on a early Sat afternoon and surprisingly it wasn't crowded. I had the cat fish, Mac-cheese, and spaghetti. I also got a glass of Georgia peach tea I believe it was. The cat fish was FABULOUS!!! Omg it was so good that I didn't have to put hot sauce on it lol they had it seasoned just right and it didn't have that fishy smell to it. The spaghetti was good and I think that was celery that was in it, anyway it was good. I never had spaghetti with celery. I love the pictures on the wall as u come in. We had no problem finding parking, however the place is located on Jefferson street which I don't recommend going on after hours lol I'm just saying..be aware of your surroundings

reviews.name: Q A.
reviews.review: How the hell you close at 8pm but around 3pm you never have any blackberry cobbler. It would only make sense to make more blackberry than peach but I guess they think differently. Other than that I rate the other food 4.0... Get it together Harpers!!!

reviews.name: Thomas K.
reviews.review: Great southern menu! Ribs falling off the bone goodness, and affordable. The staff very friendly and lots of TSU pictures to take in.

reviews.name: C.C W.
reviews.review: Very nice people working there and you will get your monies worth!

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: Located near Tennessee State University, Harper's is the best  southern cafeteria style restaurant around Nashville.  The fried chicken is really good an super crispy, much like Publix fried chicken.  They have all sorts of stuff like mashed potatoes, turnip greens( that is really a southern dish), and banana pudding.  While Harper's is not as heavy on the butter as some other southern style restaurants in Nashville, I would definitely consider it superb comfort food.  The thought of cafeteria style dinning usually conjures up thoughts of gross dim lit buffets with subpar food.  Harper's is the opposite, the food is super fresh and the folks who work there are really friendly.

reviews.name: Kari D.
reviews.review: My husband is from California and I'm from Florida, we know our sushi and we worship it. This is by far the best sushi in Nashville.The building it's in is a little sketchy looking from the outside, but they have been upgrading it over the last few months and it's starting to look pretty nice inside! The food (I'm only reviewing the sushi) however requires no change. It is incredible. Every time we come in we have the same server and the same old guy is back behind the bar rolling sushi. They can be a little slow on the service, but you won't be disappointed. It's always worth the wait!The prices are lower and the rolls are larger. If you want the best Nashville has to offer sushi wise then this is the place to go. We haven't tried anything else on the menu except for the squid salad and I could eat that all day. Don't miss out.

reviews.name: Alicia M.
reviews.review: Was in a sushi mood and stopped here on my way home from work.  Took a little while to get seated but I saw it as no big deal.  Had the Philadelphia and Boston rolls along with a side fried rice.  Portions were generous, fresh, and quite tasty!  Not badly priced either. The location is a little odd though.  Will go back nonetheless!

reviews.name: mike g.
reviews.review: This sushi is off the hook. I thought for the past year i lived in the nadshboro village that this restaursnt was abandoned as i drove past it. Im. Eating their sushi now...this sushi is great! Definitely my new sushi joint

reviews.name: Kj M.
reviews.review: Went here for dinner and I ordered the chicken teriyaki ...the chicken was dry and had a weird taste. The veggies on my dish didn't taste fresh ...the best thing I had was my glass of water to wash down the horrible after taste the food left in my mouth. I would not come here again .....

reviews.name: Julie M.
reviews.review: This place has some of the best sushi ever. The chef is fantastic and the lobster roll, geisha roll and Nashville roll are some of the best rolls I have ever had. However...the service is horrible. We actually got up and left one time after sitting for 12 minutes without  our drink order ever been taken. THAT IS ABSURD. They have no idea how to manage time with tables. We also once had a big party of 16 and they somehow had 2 other big parties that night and only 2 waiters. It was awful. They really need to step up their service game to match the food quality. I recommend take out only for this place.

reviews.name: Stephen C.
reviews.review: This is hands down The best sushi place in Nashville it has a two rolls for $11 and you cannot beat that anywhere not to mention the same guy makes all the rolls so it is a little slow but it's definitely worth it I will return many times.

reviews.name: Leigh M.
reviews.review: I just can't do it anymore.I want to like this place.I *used* to like this place. Hell, I've been here a ton of times.The service is just too miserable. Now it's not the servers' fault; they're pleasant enough and do what they can. It's apparent that the backup in this place occurs in the kitchen.Coming here in a group is a horrible idea. When I come here, it's usually with the rest of my team from work. There's typically 8 or 9 of us. The first few times we came here, things went fine. But for the last number of times, some of us are finishing just as the others are being served. Then there's days like today, where it's even worse. It took roughly an hour and twenty minutes for me to receive my order. Some of the people I was there with had been finished with their food for nearly an hour before mine was even delivered. I didn't order anything complicated, just one of their standard menu combos.Nothing was apologized for, nothing was comped.. if the meal hadn't been going on an expense account and I had actually been paying my own money for it, I would have been downright angry.I'm sorry, Kobe. We had a good run, but it's time for us to start seeing other people. I just can't be with you anymore. I'd rather remember you as a decently mediocre restaurant rather than an exercise in frustration.

reviews.name: Craig L.
reviews.review: Don't go here hungry for lunch. Food quality is okay but portion size is ridiculous. I got the Thai curry with pork and it was literally all liquid with about 5 pieces of pork and a few veggies. About 6 ozs of liquid left. I felt robbed.

reviews.name: Sid N.
reviews.review: Kobe is my go to place for affordable sushi. They have an excellent "2 rolls for $10.95" deal which is hard to resist. I recommend the Yum Yum, Spicy Salmon, Volcano, and Rainbow. I've tried the Thai offerings here and they were okay. I have tried the bento boxes yet; that is next on my list. The place can get pretty crowded at lunch so it's best to arrive early. They are also closed on Sundays.

reviews.name: Myan T.
reviews.review: It sucks to say, but Nashville has ridiculously awful Asian food and that's evident in the reviews that this place is getting.  Kobe serves up painfully mediocre food from a menu that's so all over the place, it can only be described as a hot mess.First of all, go look at a map of Asia.  Japan, Thailand, and China are in entirely different geographical regions and with entirely different climates and hence totally different cuisines.  I don't understand why restaurants continue to lump Japanese and Thai food together.  They are COMPLETELY different.I played it safe for lunch and ordered the chicken teriyaki.  The chicken itself was extremely dry and the sauce thoroughly disappointing...yet another place that chooses to use teriyaki from the jar instead of just making it themselves.  Seriously?  Teriyaki sauce is like 6 ingredients that EVERY Asian kitchen has anyway.  The veggies on the bottom were just flat.  Asian preparation for veggies involves a screaming hot wok or pan that allows the edges of the veggies to get slightly charred while the inside is still crisp.  My veggies tasted like they came straight out of a steamer bag in the microwave.The lunch came with an egg roll and egg drop soup...which is hilarious.  Egg drop soup is Chinese...I thought we were in a Thai/Japanese restaurant?  The soup also featured carrots and peas.  Um, OK.My boyfriend had the chirashi which he also said was just meh.  The fish was fresh but the sushi chef didn't know how to slice raw fish.  The pieces of fish were broken and bruised.  It was as if the chef applied too much pressure trying to hold the fish while slicing.  Amateur knife work.My coworker wanted steak but regrettably did not opt for the NY Strip hibachi.  His so-called steak hibachi came back extremely dry and hard to eat.  It was also gray and did not look like steak.Overall, a very disappointing lunch and we will not be back.  Rule of thumb: don't go to sushi/Thai restaurants.  They ALL suck no matter where you are. No exceptions.

reviews.name: Larisa N.
reviews.review: Awesome!!! My favorite place to eat sushi! Any 2 rolls for just $11 and they are so tasty. Also a mini lady is a great plate (mix of fishes and one roll). Great value and great customer services. I'm a regular client for the past 4 years!

reviews.name: Max C.
reviews.review: My local to go to place. Yeah the service is not the best but the food is awesome and the owners are super nice. The only authentic sushi in town. If you like Hollywood sushi with table side cooking go downtown.

reviews.name: Christopher P.
reviews.review: I was told by previous owner that his cousin was taking over and would be running the restaurant.  Maybe he forgot to tell his cousin that, because I don't think anyone at all is running this place anymore.I drive by Kobe on the way home and WAS a regular customer.  The service just keeps getting worse.  My orders have been wrong, or missing part of my meal.I just called to give them one more shot.  A lady answered and immediately put me on hold.  As she just put the receiver down, I heard mass confusion on the other end and heard an apology for giving someone the wrong food.  After about 5 min. Of being on hold, it was obvious the lady had forgotten I was on the phone.  I'm now sitting in front if Ginger Thai waiting for my dinner.  Oh well, Ginger is on my way home too. Hope it's good!

reviews.name: R B.
reviews.review: This use to be a great place to eat for lunch. Service was minimal...as in, they took you to your table but kept on walking. Service went straight to "what do you want to eat?!" Basically.Food came out lukewarm.Not coming back any more.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: This used to be a go to place for me and my co-workers. Some days you'd hit and the service would be slow, some days it would be great. Today, I had the worst experience. The waitress -- Tina -- was obviously overwhelmed and not handling it well. My food came and then 30 minutes -- yes, you read that right, 30 minutes later -- my friends' food came. The real kicker as to why I will never go back doesn't have to do with the delay but rather how the waitress acted when she brought the food. She set it down hard, didn't acknowledge either one of us and then THREW our ticket on the table. When I brought the situation to the manager, she didn't apologize or recognize that the behavior was unacceptable. Did they forget that I'm paying them for the experience? I'll be getting Publix sushi in the future.

reviews.name: Chris C.
reviews.review: Some of the best chicken pad thai in town. Their bento boxes are also very good.  The reason I rated it so low is the consistently poor service.  I've gone there multiple times over the past 4 years and it is always the same.  Getting a water refill is harder than pushing a bill through Congress.  The wait staff needs to be completely replaced.

reviews.name: Noel R.
reviews.review: Our dinner here was AMAZING! We had, probably the best sushi in the area! The rolls are generously sized and filled with fresh fish. I was hoping for more veggies with our habachi chicken but the fried rice was so good I practically forgot about them. The only thing you should really note, the food is very good, but the outside makes the place seem sketchy. If it hadn't been for the other reviews we probably would have gone somewhere else.

reviews.name: Meredith G.
reviews.review: Just ate here for the first time! It was hard to find the location, but so glad we did! We had vegetable tempura and salads with ginger. Both were awesome! I had the crunchy shrimp roll and spicy salmon roll. Crunchy shrimp is my favorite type of sushi so I have eaten it at many different establishments. This is the tastiest crunchy shrimp roll I've ever had in my life! Definitely coming back!

reviews.name: Shannon T.
reviews.review: Sushi was warm and my Chicken and Shrimp was so over cooked that I couldn't chew it!!!  My husband steak was the same was.  He ordered it medium and it came out like rubber.  Table Cloth was sticky and my elbow stuck to it.  The lady was mopping the floors while we are trying to eat.  YUCK!!!! I wanted a glass of wine that was on the menu and the server said we do to have our license to serve that.  OMG... Then y is it on the menu ? The servers states that they are their menus from the last restaurant.  Food tasted like it was too!!!!!

reviews.name: Adam W.
reviews.review: It would be easy to miss when driving but is deffently wprth stoping at.I've been to kobe twice and have not been disappointed either time. I tried their dumplings and a seared tuna over vegetable dish today and both was really good. Also the sushi is really good.

reviews.name: Asad K.
reviews.review: Best fried rice I ever had, just a word of caution, Friday lunch is crowded, service is usually late.

reviews.name: Q Y.
reviews.review: No offense to those who claimed the food is good here, it really just ordinary. Maybe it's been too long since last review. Small portion, cold (I'm not saying bad) service.

reviews.name: Betty T.
reviews.review: This is a Oriental Restaurant that I have driven by day after day. I few weeks ago I finally decided to try them after hearing good reviews from people in my community.  I went over their Menu item by item online so I would be familiar with all of their choices and could place my order quickly.  I had been sick with whatever was going around right before Christmas 2013 and definitely wanted Soup and Tempura.  So I ordered he Tom Yum Soup with Shrimp and Mixed Tempura.The soup arrived immediately and boy was I surprised.  It was very good but very spicy and hot.  I laughed that the Chili Oil would delete whatever germs I had left in my system.  The Tempura arrived shortly and the sweet dipping sauce was a great counter agent to the Soup.The place is not fancy buy any means, but was clean and that is what matters to me most.  I will definitely go back and see how their Sushi and Sashimi is.  I am so glad we have this Restaurant in our area.

reviews.name: Pickiest Eater A.
reviews.review: Ordered drunken noodles with beef.  Noodles were thin and reminded me of cheap egg noodles that usually go along with beef stroganoff and it was a bit greasy for thai food, reminded me more of a chinese buffet.  Many many better places but if you are looking for cheap--mixed cultural italian/chinese thai food then have at it.And the bathroom was a great feeling of a 3rd world country, did not even have paper towels.

reviews.name: Sara S.
reviews.review: My mother and I decided to go have sushi the other night, and we made the wrong decision in going to Kobe. When we arrived, the location was first a little difficult to get to and then it seemed a bit sketchy.The real issues didn't come until we got into the building though. When we were seated, there were only a handful of people waiting on to-go orders and one table occupied while all of the other booths had dirty dishes on them. We had been seated for fifteen minutes before anyone came to even ask for a drink order, and remember, the restaurant was almost completely empty.  At the time of placing our drink order, we also ordered an appetizer.Now, if there were a bunch of people in the location, I would have understood some of the other issues we had. Like, we then saw two other groups seated, and they had their drink orders taken. Then the waitress took their actual orders, and walked past my mother and I as we had our menus closed and our order form on the edge of the table. A major issue that we had with Kobe though came from the sushi chef. We saw him touch multiple doors and items that others had touched without gloves on, including placing his open palm against the door to the kitchen, and then go back to making orders without changing his gloves. He also was spending a lot of time standing around doing nothing letting to-go orders pile up, some of which had been there when we sat down that he didn't even work on when we decided to leave.The restaurant also needs to change some of the things on the menu. We tried to order sake but were told that they didn't have the license for it.By the time we left, it had been forty minutes, and we never even got our appetizer.Don't waste your time going here.

reviews.name: Tim M.
reviews.review: Family run restaurant and they are trying hard to make it work. Had the 2 roll special - rainbow and Tennessee roll. Both were smaller than I have had at other Japanese/sushi restaurants. There was too much of the orange flaky material as it was on all my rolls. Also, had a spicy tuna and white tuna sashimi. Both of these were just dripping liquid like it had been sitting in too much water.It seems like a popular place for nearby airport employees to frequent but I will not be going out of my way to return here in the future.

reviews.name: Dee a.
reviews.review: 2 huge rolls for $11 with a soup or salad? Yes please. Rolls were delicious and the people were very nice.

reviews.name: Erin S.
reviews.review: Amazing sushi at a very good price. My husband and I go here at least once a week. We have been searching for good sushi since moving from Florida and we have finally found great sushi after trying about a dozen other places!

reviews.name: Amber S.
reviews.review: I've been looking around for some good Pad See Ew ever since I moved to Nashville from California. I convinced my husband to give Kobe a shot since it was in our neighborhood and we've had pretty good luck with hole-in-the-wall places in our area. Walking in, I made the decision right then and there that our food would be to go. The restaurant was strangely dim and the floors and counter tops were grimy looking. The only table occupied in the good-sized dining room were an older group of people who stared at us silently the entire time we were in the building. Talk about uncomfortable. The man at the counter was very nice and took our order immediately, however he and his wife squabbled the rest of the time we were waiting for our food. They had a small daughter around the age of three who ran back and forth from the dining room to the kitchen, and at one point she yelled out something about ants. I tried really hard not to be skeeved out, took my food and ran.The portions were generous without being too large and came with rice and soup, and the Pad See Ew, while not the best I've had, was actually pretty decent. The noodles were thick, and the vegetables had a really good fresh flavor. I didn't try the sushi, but I'm not a sushi person anyway.It's not bad for the money, but based on the atmosphere alone, we probably won't go back.

reviews.name: Andy N.
reviews.review: Definitely the best deal for sushi I have come across to date in Nashville. I work very close to here and the $10 two-roll lunch special is hard to beat (with soup or salad).  Sit at the sushi bar and converse with the guys making your food...  they won't forget you!Great deal if you're looking for value, don't expect to be "wow'ed" when you walk into this place though.

reviews.name: Greg T.
reviews.review: Kobe Asian Restaurant tries to cover it all..japanese, thai, laos but fails to specialize in one style of cooking. we tried a laos spicy beef salad and a thai pad kee maw. beef salad had nice flavor but was way too salty. the pad kee maw was one dimensional in flavor..it lacked that fragrant, basil flavor this dish is famous for. service was friendly but I was completely turned off by the owner/manager setting up his laptop in the dining room and watching movies on it. at one time the chef came out of the kitchen and jumped on his laptop to do whatever. I'm not quite sure why asian restaurants in Nashville try to cover multiple styles of asian cuisine. why not specialize in one style and do it well?

reviews.name: Angelina T.
reviews.review: I've been here a few times while waiting to pick up some folks from the airport. They offer both Thai and sushi, and my advice is to stay away from the sushi. It was not fresh: it had a bad texture (potentially old) and did not taste quite right. (Then again, you get what you pay for).  I've split the pad thai (it's so big!) and that was OK. I've also tried the masaman curry, where the potatoes were really bad and ruined the dish.Bottom line: There are better options in both the Thai and sushi arena, so skip this place.

reviews.name: Brian S.
reviews.review: Best sushi in all of Nashville! Ask for a Big Daddy hand roll!

reviews.name: David B.
reviews.review: They have some good sushi.  I would stick to just sushi.

reviews.name: Carlos G.
reviews.review: Sushi is great, almost on par with Peter's.  That's all I eat there.  I do wish they would be a little more enthusiastic with their service.  They always look way too busy and stressed out.  VERY VERY bland looking inside.  They need some color in there bad.  Just looks thrown together.  Still, very nice people and the sushi is killer.

reviews.name: Travis A.
reviews.review: I love that this place is across the street from my office.  They have a great sushi lunch special with 2 rolls and a salad for like $10.  They also offer $1 Nigiri.Aside from the sushi, they offer some Thai and Chinese food.  The Golden Chicken is great.Easy to get in and out during the hour lunch break, or grab to go.  Recommended for a quick lunch break or sushi fix.

reviews.name: Mr Mrs J.
reviews.review: I've probably eaten at almost every Thai restaurants in Nashville to find the best Pho.  I came across this restaurant sometimes in the fall of 2010 and have been there 5 times now probably.  Every time, I would order the Pho Beef Noodle Soup and Sushi.  I have not been disappointed yet.  Thus the 4 Stars.  The soup is VERY flavorful and the Sushi is quite fresh every time.  The price --- wow, you can't beat it.  Great for lunch or dinner!  You'll never have to worry about waiting for seating.This place may look like a hole in the wall from the outside, but, it's not that bad at all.  Don't expect luxury or anything near that, but it's nice and clean enough that I will keep coming back until otherwise.I have been there with various people and all of them have liked it.  None of them ordered what I ordered and have said they liked it.  So no complaints so far.

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: I ordered a steak bento box. Wow the flavor was off! I could make better steak at home! The sushi was really bad too sight as soon as I pick the sushi up using chopsticks, the rice started falling out, that's a sign of bad sushi!  Im not gonna order japanese food from there anymore -_-

reviews.name: Spike J.
reviews.review: Great service, best Red Curry Chicken on the planet!  Ambiance was not their strong suit, but the value and food quality for my lunches while in town were superb.  The appetizer page on the menu could use some descriptions, but the staff was eager to help.  I eat Thai cuisine frequently, and also cook some at home.  This place is A+ for flavor and service.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: A-OK because we have found the things we like on this vast menu of Asian Food.  Fried Rice is really good, Han Ray Curry great, lots and lots of ginger.  Papaya Salad good if you order the correct hot level, bring it down to a 5 and you'll be OK.  As I said, a classic case of finding he handful of things on a vast menu that you like.  Friendly Laotian owners who will make off the menu the Laotian dishes with a bit of notice.

reviews.name: Brad C.
reviews.review: If you have never had sushi, or are planning to introduce someone to sushi, this is the place to go. The prices are more than fair and it has an extensive menu to allow some experimentation for even the most experienced pallet. Despite being a bit irritating to get to, this place is awesome.

reviews.name: Phil G.
reviews.review: 11am, no one but me in the restaurant, by 12 its almost packed.  Loved the food, service was ok. Cheapest lunch was $12.95 but it was a huge meal.Might come back if they get a more affordable menu,  food was good but I can get the same at a all u can eat buffet cheaper, just as good.

reviews.name: Amy S.
reviews.review: A fun sort of div-y Japanese joint. I've never been to one. We arrived at 6pm on a Thursday night and the place had only one other table occupied. We ordered chicken katsu bento boxes that came with delicious, generous tempura, California rolls, rice, miso soup, a weird "dessert" that we didn't like, and slightly overdone chicken katsu. I had a pot of jasmine tea for cheap and my husband drank the Thai tea--both up to par for a nice price. If the service had been better (instead of virtually nonexistent) and the ambience less creepy, I'd give it a four. Well maybe that's not true, as we've had far better bento boxes. Perhaps this place has such a stellar reputation because of the Thai aspect that we didn't taste? Or perhaps it's really good Japanese for Tennessee. But I'm giving it three stars compared to a my overall Japanese experiences in life. Oh and the bento boxes are close to $15, which takes the price to two $$, not one. But the proximity to the airport compared to the relatively inexpensive price makes it a nice go-to if you're traveling and need good food nearby. I would return.

reviews.name: Traveling M.
reviews.review: I have ate here several times.  The food is very good and fresh.  Today I had the Sesame seed chicken except there was very little chicken.  I mention this issue but only one person could speak English. There was a lot of fried dough but not much chicken.   I also had Lo Mein and it was great.  Their fried rice was good also.

reviews.name: Hank S.
reviews.review: I was surprised how good the sushi was. I had the Nashville roll.  Good lunch specials.

reviews.name: Siobhan R.
reviews.review: I've eaten at Kobe twice now. I've never been overly impressed by their offerings. Good for a quick fix on a lunch break but not a place I'd actively seek out.

reviews.name: Amol A.
reviews.review: By far the best place to enjoy a Sushi. Very reasonably priced and with 10 pieces to a roll its awesome. They have a 2 roll special which is a boat load of sushi for $11 or so and the fish is fresh the Sushi chef is a very friendly guy !. I also love their Panag curry and other curry dishes. I eat at this place about 4 or 5 times a week and I am serious about what I am recommending here. Not a great ambience but great people and great food for a great price. Cant beat that. And be sure to say hello to the Sushi chef while in there. He is awesome !

reviews.name: Amy S.
reviews.review: Oh my... I have had the longest day at work today, and I so wish Mrs Carol Ann was my personal cook. Let me start at the beginning... So, I walk in and got smacked right in the mouth with what I was going to have for dinner... The mouth watering, heart racing, eye bulging smell of yummy fried chicken!!! Shut the front door!!! It's on as of right now. I tell the southern belle behind the counter that I want a breast, and as my eyes swept over the pillows of sweet potatoes, yep, had to have that too. So, you know you can't forget the green beans. It all looked perfect and I was just not trying to buy the whole shooting match!!! So she packed it all up for me while not skimping on anything, and I was READY... Sooooooo Gooooood!!!!

reviews.name: Kate S.
reviews.review: Kind of a strange and quirky place. Went to the counter to order with no signs to tell us the price. We asked what our options were and the woman cheerfully explained that it was a meat and 2 with a range of prices. I got meatloaf, and my boyfriend got fried chicken. We saw a fountain drink machine when we came in, but when the server brought drinks we got cans. ??Meatloaf looked okay, but was barely warm. I ate it anyway because I was starving and hate sending food back. Also, the flavor was less than great, so I didn't think heating it up would honestly help. My sides of mac and cheese and mashed potatoes were hot but unseasoned. Boyfriend's chicken was stone cold. He sent it back after touching it once, and they microwaved the entire styrofoam plate and delivered it back to him. It was under seasoned and greasy. The people were nice, but the food just wasn't good enough to come back again.

reviews.name: Libby B.
reviews.review: A friend and I had driven by this place multiple times on our way to work, and decided to finally check it out one day.
