At first glance, it's like walking into your grandma's old attic - there is the most random stuff all over the walls - think signed Harry Potter posters with wands, framed on the walls, and an antique soda dispenser in the corner.The food was about average for your typical meat and 2, and was served lunch-line style. I had the baked chicken, mashed sweet potatoes, and the mac and cheese. Everything was pretty good, though I especially thought the mac and cheese was tasty. It all hit the spot though, and all in all made for a pretty good meal. I did think it was a tad on the expensive side for what we had, however.I really would like to come back here sometime at night, we happened to notice a full bar and a stage, looks like it might be a pretty hopping spot come evening!

reviews.name: Curtis S.
reviews.review: Excellence! Outstanding service when we were not expecting it. Not your normal meat and 3. We were treated great and the food was great.

reviews.name: jerry a.
reviews.review: A nightclub/bar cleverly disguised as a meat and 2/3!  The front area looks like an old time soda bar or ice cream parlor complete with the old school fountain stools!  Lunch is served cafeteria style with several rotating choices daily and they are open seven days a week.  I did not see a single vegetarian option.... which might be why they call them MEAT and 3's.;)   I had the chicken and dressing, white beans and greens.  The white beans could have simmered another hour, the greens were delicious but you only get a thigh for meat and the dressing was dry.  I actually went back and got a side of gravy to wet the dressing down.  The chicken was flavorful and delicious.  After I got done eating I was asking one of the ladies about the bar and she actually took the time to give me a little tour of the entire place and let me tell you, the outside is a little deceiving, the place is pretty good sized inside and there is a stage area where live music is played, Thursday nights happens to be Jazz night.  There is a full bar with beer and wine if you need that sort of thing during lunch.  My rating is 3 stars only because I thought I should have gotten more than a thigh for my over $10 meal.  This will not deter me and I will be back to sample other lunches and will definitely be more selective in my choices next time.

reviews.name: Lucien D.
reviews.review: Really lovely little coffee shop located in the symphony orchestra building, shielding us from the summer heat. Quaint and perfect for some coffee/tea.

reviews.name: Troy L.
reviews.review: Had an excellent meal with the meat & 3. The owners are great and really make you feel at home. Will definitely hit it up next time I'm in town. Next time I am going to hit the "Sing for Your Supper", you never know who you will meet!From California, Troy

reviews.name: Casey H.
reviews.review: I had a Groupon for this place. The food was pretty bland. Servers were nice but I wouldn't come back if I had to pay $13 for lunch. Head to Arnold's, they've got great food and cheaper. Also, this place is only opened during lunch. I didn't know this and tried a few times to come during dinner.

reviews.name: Samma A.
reviews.review: Meat 'n 3 in a bar is a handy idea for those of us who enjoy hanging at joints like the Blue Bar near Division. Since I know the bars and dives of midtown like Rebar, Losers and Winners across the street, I knew right where to find Lucy's eats inside the Blue Bar. Now just open for lunch till 3. You can get grub with fancy names at another meat 'n three diner but you just wouldn't have the real club vibe that makes it unique. For 13 bills you can eat the buffet, or get all you can eat without meat for $8. Delicious fried Spam, Copperhead chicken and Sisters mac and cheese are samples of what makes this lunch spot in a bar stand out. Eat the Dump Cake and you'll be ready to rumble across the street at Loser's.

reviews.name: Joseph R.
reviews.review: My wife Brandi and I had a GREAT lunch today at Lucy's Country Cafe for the first time. Owners Bobby Pinson and his wife Lucy showed true southern hospitality by checking on the tables to get input from their customers. They also obviously have a passion for good country cookin'. I would officially put the quality right up there with the areas most popular meat&3's or country buffets. You can taste the love in the food. The staff was first class and you felt comfortable from the minute you walked in. Brandi had a meat&2 for $7.99. Chicken Casserole, Turnip Greens and Mac & Cheese. I had the buffet because I wanted to try all 3 of their entrees. Fried fish, Shepherd's pie & Chicken casserole. For my veggies I had turnip greens and corn. Listen people, this food tastes just like your mom or grandma would make when you come in for a visit. It's a feast of country home cooking. One of the biggest issues with "home cooking" places is that they often over-season their veggies. That's not the case here. Everything was very tasty and was not over-seasoned. The food was hot and fresh. My favorite of the entrees was the chicken casserole. 100% YUM. The others were terrific as well. My wife LOVED her plate. We also had corn bread (one of the best i've ever had) and rolls (like mommas) which were brought out in a basket and handed out by the server. She was precious. They serve their drinks in a red solo cup which oddly enough made me want to find a sharpie to put my name on it. There is also a cold bar with salad, slaw, pasta salad, potato salad, fruit etc. Lucy's is also a great bang for the buck. Meat&1 is $6.99. Meat&2 is $7.99. Meat&3 is $8.99. All you can eat is $12.99. You can also just get veggies and the cold bar for $7.99. What's for desert? The BANANA PUDDING caught me off guard. It is not the "normal" banana pudding with wafers and chunks of bananas. It's just pudding....and I was skeptical at first, but now I want a gallon of it. I also had Bobby's Dump Cake. A buttery cake topping over cherries, pineapples and other cobbler goodness. WOW. Rich and YUM. Do yourself a favor and go to Lucy's Country Cafe. Open 11-3 Mon-Friday. Bobby Pinson is a smash hit songwriter (toby keith, sugarland, rascal flatts) and a recording artist in Nashville which is why, i'm sure, he was inspired to do a "Sing for your Supper" on Wednesdays from 7-11 with Live Music by friends of Bobby and a dinner special for the guests (no buffet). It will be a weekly visit for me. 5 stars because of the overall experience, atmosphere, quality of food, service and value.

reviews.name: Steph H.
reviews.review: With all the wonderful meat & three options in Nashville, I have no idea why anyone would come and eat here. Sure the location is convenient and there aren't any similar options nearby, but if you're craving some Southern staples for a weekday lunch, either drive over to Arnold's or to Monell's if you want to do all you can eat. Rather than spending $13 on the buffet here, I would recommend you just set that money on fire, because that would honestly be a better use for it rather than wasting it on the food here. My husband and I decided to try this place using a Groupon, and while I'm happy we only paid for one of our meals, I still left feeling really disappointed.My dissatisfaction comes down to one thing: the food here isn't any good. It's starchy, stodgy, and generally very bland. Yes, I'll grant you that the potato salad was awesome, as were the mashed potatoes, but they were anomalies since they were essentially the only items that had any flavor. The three mains (country fried steak, chicken & dumplings, copperhead pasta) were gloopy messes that literally had no seasoning whatsoever. And it wasn't just me or my palate, since I observed another diner take a big bite of the dumplings and immediately screw his face up in displeasure. He then proceeded to dump a ton of salt & pepper on his plate, as that was probably the only way to make the stuff remotely palatable. The country fried steak came with a sawmill gravy that had the consistency, and the same flavor profile (or so I would imagine), of wallpaper glue. The other sides we tried were fine (fried okra was decent), but nothing special, and apart from the potato dishes there just was nothing very tasty or exciting... except for the coleslaw which had the mystical property of somehow REMOVING FLAVOR from your mouth!!! The much-lauded "dump cake" was piping hot, but also was so sweet. Bottom line is the food here is great if you need to limit your sodium intake, but bad if you want to avoid diabetes.Overall, this was just an incredibly bland and depressing dining experience... and I'll admit the atmosphere doesn't help either. It's very obvious you're eating in a bar, and honestly there's a reason why we visit bars at night... they look bleak and hollow during the harsh light of day. All that stale cigarette smoke won't help whet your appetite either. I will say that the people working at Lucy's were really friendly and cheerful, but no amount of smiling would counteract the gloomy vibe pervading this place (though it will bump you up to a 2-star review). The owners clearly have a lot of heart, but whoever is in the kitchen really shouldn't be. I will not be back.

reviews.name: Jason D.
reviews.review: If you are in the Nashville area and want excellent home style food, stop by Lucy's located right off Broadway.  The food is outstanding, best pot roast I have ever had out.  The Copperhead Pasta was great.  Vegetables were wonderful.  They also have a cold bar with homemade desserts that was out of this world. Also the staff were wonderful.  This place is the best place that I have eaten in Nashville.  Lucy's is worth the trip.

reviews.name: Craig M.
reviews.review: Updating my review of Lucy's Country Cafe from Nov. 2012. My opinion has not changed one bit. I still am a regular and still think it is the best meat & 3 in Nashville. Recipes are hand me downs from Lucy's grandmother and everything is delicious, especially the fried chicken. Veggies are always fresh & tasty. Will continue to be a regular & recommend it to all my friends.

reviews.name: Mark S.
reviews.review: Good meat and three. I was the only person here for lunch. I don't know why. The food is really good. The fried okra seems homemade and reminds me of my mother's okra. It may not be the best meat and three in town, but it's really good and convenient to my work. Give it a try!

reviews.name: Ed K.
reviews.review: Resperados...a very big snow cone in a large glass.  It's a great drink to go with their fantastically, simple & delicious food.  Steak mulitas & tacos w/ a side of beans!  We'll keep coming back.

reviews.name: Candie D.
reviews.review: Coming from SoCal, we have been looking for an authentic taco experience. We stumbled upon this hidden gem recently and it did not disappoint.  Great, flavorful carne asada, tasty salsas and real horchata! Even the tortillas are made fresh! Stop by!

reviews.name: Brett B.
reviews.review: Hit the spot for my Mexican craving, any menu where meet options include tongue and guts gets me interested 1st time trying Pupusa and will be having again Tongue Torta also great not a spot to come for decor or environment just some great food

reviews.name: Dan D.
reviews.review: Not quite as delicious as the taco truck across the street, but decent street food with yummy salsas. They also have seating both indoors and outside, and a waitress! If you want to order sonic style she will even come to your car. We had carne asada mulitas (like a mini quesadilla or a taco with another tortilla on top) and the bean and cheese and mixta pupusas. Both were good. No tortilla chips but the waitress offered duros (? Fried wheat wheel thingies) instead, light chip-like things that were freshly made and delish. Definitely hit the spot. We paid cash, not sure if they take cards here.

reviews.name: Josh C.
reviews.review: This is a great chipotle location.  I do not like that there are so many high top tables, but the service and cleanliness are very good.Solid option if you are looking for some Chipotle.

reviews.name: Sue B.
reviews.review: Consistently delicious and fresh. Staff is friendly, but not passionate about excellent customer service. I'm a huge fan of the steak entrees. Sometimes steak isn't the leanest cut. Rest of options have tons of flavor.

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: The service was excellent and the food was the same as almost every chipotle that I've been to. I am giving this location one less star then the one on West End just because of its overall size. If your looking for some peace and quiet come to this location. Also, a good chance to dine and get away from the Vandy campus

reviews.name: Dew T.
reviews.review: I am a HUGE Chipotle fan and this location is an exception to everything else I've experienced. Less than stellar experience.#1 - I always order vegetarian. I have found meat in my bowl 3 different visits. That tells me that they're dropping meat and cross contaminating in all the food.#2 - They don't listen to my request. When I say, "a little bit of medium salsa," they just dump an entire scoop. #3 - They wear gloves, but they handle the food way too much. i.e. back to #1. I order meet free - they're touching the meat of the person in front of me and then they're handling/ touching my veggies right after that. I HATE IT! Quit touching my food.We continue to go back because it's the closest to where we live, but I'd happily take a different Chipotle if there was another close option.

reviews.name: Katie I.
reviews.review: I'm not sure I've given such a bad review. Chipotle is one of my favorite fast food chains. Healthy, fresh, we go all the time. However we always go to the Green Hills location, and they are a well-oiled machine. Fast, fresh, the long line moves quick.White Bridge Rd. is a different story.Clearly they just opened up. The build out is awful. There are mostly high top tables with the exception of maybe 2 or 3 regular height tables. First of all, some planner didn't think to realize a LOT of families go to chipotle and you can not put high chairs, boosters or small children at a high top table. Secondly, we went on a Friday night around 6. It was not busy yet, but several employees were congregating by the register on their cell phones. None of them cared to get back to work when customers walked in. The guy at the beginning of the line was a little slow, probably new, I'll give him the benefit of the doubt. Again, employees (girls) still looking at their phones while we move thru the line. When we get to the cash register, she finally puts her phone in her pocket. We sit down. My bowl has raw f'ing chicken. The same chicken my kids just ate in their quesadilla. I took a picture I will share . At first I thought it was just chewy. It was mixed with the overcooked last batch and the "fresh" raw chicken in this batch. I thought I was going to vomit. Normally I would go to the manager and say something, but there didn't look to be an employee over the age of 20, it seemed pointless. What were they going to do? This manager needs to lay down the law and perhaps have a MOD on a Friday night. By the time we left it had developed a big line, I felt anxiety for them because the guy doing the beans and rice was slow as can be. Oh and did I mention there were two employees eating food at a table? If they are on break or whatever, sitting at a table eating and chit chatting looks awful when the line starts getting long. Completely unprofessional. You would never see this at the Green Hills location.Will NOT be back to this location. Just awful. Praying I don't get salmonella....

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Overpriced Mexican food. Nothing exceptional or horrible. It is "meh". $2.15 for extra meat when the entire burrito is $6.50. Not great service either.  Four employees kept talking to each other when I was ordering & I had to repeat myself a couple times.  That doesn't even happen at the Golden Arches! Messy restrooms were the final touch on an otherwise mundane lunch.

reviews.name: Glen G.
reviews.review: So... I'm reviewing this because 2 stars is drastically low for this location. Have you ever been to chipotle? Good. Then you know what to expect. Tremendous portions of good food that you don't have to hate yourself for enjoying (unless you're a permaculture lovin' whole foods hatin' organic junkie). $6.75 for a bowl that's gonna give me two meals today? Yes. I have personally never experienced a delay,  always impressed by how fresh everything taste, and don't mind high chairs. I think I'ma go pick one up right now, actually.

reviews.name: Miranda P.
reviews.review: I love chipotle! This location is awesome and in a great area. I always get the salad bowl with chicken and it is always delicious. Nice staff and were very informative and told me things I was not aware of previously. Their onions and peppers are a must.

reviews.name: Morgan L.
reviews.review: Been to a TON of Chipolte's in my day but I have to say that this is my favorite location. The service is not just great it is WONDERFUL! I am very particular about my Chipolte (a little beans, no rice, and no sour cream or cheese) and every time I get the perfect portions at this location. They always listen to my portions and substitutions and get it spot on. This location is not the closest to my job but I always drive the extra mile just for the service and the smiles.

reviews.name: Daniel C.
reviews.review: While I visit several Chipotle locations around town this one is less than a mile from where I work. Unfortunately it doesn't get most of my business. This location is not bad, not great, just okay.

reviews.name: Amy M.
reviews.review: This Chipotle still needs some work. Staff is a little better now, but food quality is mediocre. The rice and/or beans are usually undercooked.

reviews.name: A W.
reviews.review: Tried to go for lunch today.  No chicken and super slow!  One guy working the line who didn't seem to worry about pacing at all.  The girl behind the cash register just stood there and watched rather than trying to help out.  The music is way too loud.

reviews.name: S G.
reviews.review: Slow line, music too loud, and seating arrangement is terrible.  Food is decent but there are no meaningful kid options because all meat is spicy.  I eat here more out of convenience than anything.

reviews.name: Stephanie S.
reviews.review: Decent quick meal if you're at Music City center.  They have pizza, panini, salad and soup options.  I got the Quattro formagio panini with the field green salad.  The sandwich was good, big and filling but nothing too special.  The salad on the other hand was delicious! Grilled peaches, candied pecans, goat cheese and sweet tea vinaigrette.  So good!! Other pros- quick service, good for groups or to go, plenty of outdoor seating, and very convenient for conference goers Overall I'd stop here for the convenience factor.  It's better than expected food for a decent price.

reviews.name: Doreen M.
reviews.review: Being a New York pizza snob, I didn't purchase pizza. The field green salad was quite tasty. It had goat cheese, dried cranberries, nuts, field greens and a nice dressing to pull it together. Reasonably priced at $7.50. The service however was slow and disorganized. They need to evaluate how the handle orders. I felt like jumping over the counter to get my salad.

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: My in-laws took my husband and I to Al Taglio after we attended a convention in the Music City Center. I was pleasantly surprised by the inexpensive, delicious pizza and full bar. The pizza was on focaccia bread, and they had various styles to choose from. I had the sausage pizza. It was no ordinary sausage, but thick slices of genuine, seasoned sausage, along with kale. It was really delicious, and I think only $4 for a big ole' piece. Beer was also very reasonably priced. We had pints of Tennessee Brew Works for $4. This place is a great deal and fast. I would definitely come back when I'm out and about downtown.

reviews.name: Chris J.
reviews.review: Went for lunch today with a coworker and I could only eat about two bites. In no way is this pizza. It was soggy, tasteless and gross. For $4 per slice, I'd expect it to be great, but sadly, it was anything but that. I'm not from Nashville and only come for work every so often, I'm sure there is better pizza somewhere in Nashville.

reviews.name: Angela G.
reviews.review: It's basically reheated pan pizza for 2x the price. Not worth it, not tasty.

reviews.name: Rose M.
reviews.review: Horrible!! You can't call that pizza!! It's disgusting!!I have never eaten or seen something like this!!They should be ashamed!!

reviews.name: Nina G.
reviews.review: The worst pizza ever . It is so disgusting .Do not eat here .soggy thick  , about 1inch . The worst ever .

reviews.name: Clay W.
reviews.review: Strengths: Nice and clean. Excellent service. Quick service without fast food feel. Not your run of the mill pizza places Opportunities:Came on Thursday at 11:15 am. No food ready. Not good for people on a lunch hour. Parking is limited. No big deal if you are already downtown and want to walk. Summary:Overall not bad. I would recommend it to anyone.

reviews.name: Kelly J.
reviews.review: Ok, so think delicious, thick French bread pizza. This isn't your traditional type of pizza place, but I think they're offering a product you can't find at other restaurants in Nash. I had the prosciutto and arugula slice. Along with the tangy tomato sauce, melty cheese, and thick, soft focaccia-style crust, well, it was a party in my mouth. Best part? You walk in, point at the slice you want, pay for it and you're on your way! They seemed to be really keen on keeping the slices rotated and fresh. I think this place is a great addition to downtown as many people are strapped for time on their lunch break and if you love pizza/Italian like I do, sometimes Sbarro just doesn't cut it. Quick, fresh, delicious! Also, if you have a little time or don't have to be right back to work they have a full bar! Specialty cocktails looked legit although I didn't have one myself, perhaps next time!

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: They featuring three things: square pizza, coffee, and a bar.  It's a an odd combination, and, frankly, they don't have enough room in the small space they have for all of that.  I can see enough room for the bad, or enough room for the pizza and coffee maker, but altogether they take up so much space, it' very cramped.I don't drink beer, but the Pizza can only be imagined in that same way that the school breadtangle of pizza can be.  It was absolutely terrible.  Not OK; not mediocre; not bad: absolutely terrible pizza.  Disgusting.Service is slow, primarily because no one hustles.  It was always this slowness.  I know there's not much for Pizza in SoBro, but this ain't it.  Sorry.

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: This place has great potential but i'm not sure they are using it... I hate the concept of not Wait service.  The pizza was good and the staff was very friendly.  I like the bar and that they offer liquor however if you sit at the bar you don't have to pay for your food with the cashier you pay at the bar.  A little bummed you can't really customize your any of the options because the kitchen is in the convention center and the food is made there.

reviews.name: N P.
reviews.review: We stopped by after the RCA Studio B tour on a whim, and I'm glad we did. The employees here were absolutely delightful. They went out of their way to make sure we had what we wanted, were gracious, kind, and helpful. The food: the crust isn't what we expected, it's a softer, thick, bubbly crust, light and airy, and unlike any crust we've had before. I would have preferred it be a tad crispier, but found myself enjoying the uniqueness of it. The flavor combinations were divine. We tried the pepperoni (my son is not yet adventurous); the sausage and broccoli raab; the cheese and spinach; and the banana pepper, mushroom, tomato, and sausage. They were all good, but our favorite was definitely the sausage and broccoli raab.

reviews.name: Lila T.
reviews.review: Horrible customer service! The two girls in the back had to finish their conversation while looking through the window in the kitchen door as I stood there and looked right at them. I took the Pizza back to my office and was not impressed. Way better specialty Pizza places close by.

reviews.name: Erica R.
reviews.review: Al Taglio is the sauciest pizza joint in town with a classy feel and a very fair price.  Intriguing topping variations they have.  If you go you have to meet Vern, he is quite the gentle kat.

reviews.name: Laura F.
reviews.review: So great to have a convenient option for food inside the Music City Center!  They have great unique pizza options (like pork belly & goat cheese!) and their sandwiches are huge. They have local beer on tap which is also great.

reviews.name: Aditya A.
reviews.review: Wonderful place! Very classy and very upscale! It could be more busier! The staff wear lovely hats!

reviews.name: Chuck B.
reviews.review: Bland pizza not worth the price. No tap water, only bottled for $2.50. Sadly, the super nice staff and upscale decor are not enough to compensate for the poor food value.

reviews.name: Timothy P.
reviews.review: Great location!  The employees are fun and courteous.  Vern who runs the shop is the best.  The pizza is good, but understand it is on the thick -- focaccia bread type crust.  The sauce is tasty and tart with a good tomato flavor that comes through.  All in all, a pleasant change from your run-of-the mill pizza place.

reviews.name: D M.
reviews.review: Great location. Clean. Bar seating and table availability. Pizza is a good size and is $4, selected wine beer and dessert menu. Has the quieter atmosphere. Great place to go if the ritzy places across the st are too loud crowded and expensive (Omni hotel).

reviews.name: Toni O.
reviews.review: Mediocre pizza, at best.  Limited selection and the pizza was not freshly made.  Think back to the pizza you had in high school.  (Very similar in taste). You pick your slice and they reheat it for you.  I didn't try the salads, but they looked edible.  The tomato basil soup was ok.  Counter service with a few communal tables for seating.  Will not be going back.

reviews.name: L D.
reviews.review: Tried Al Taglio for lunch and it was delicious.  I had the field greens salad and seasonal soup, which was white bean chili.  Very filling on a cold, gray day. The staff were all fantastically delightful - friendly and helpful.  I'll go back after work some day for happy hour because the bartender Juan was fun.

reviews.name: B B.
reviews.review: In a word, BAD. in two words, REALLY BAD. Lets see. $8.50 for a slice of cheese pizza that has been sitting under a lamp all day, then heated up. The crust was harder than a brick. And it tasted like a $3 Kroger frozen pizza. The panini was soggy and anything but a big. The salid was ok. Pizza, panini and salid with a bottled drink was $20. It's dark, has concrete floors, white walls with no decorations, one long table to for everyone to sit at. If you want pizza, order in. If you want to dine out, there are plenty of places very close by. The location has potential. Al taglios doesn't.  Next  please.

reviews.name: Yanik C.
reviews.review: authentic mexican food. very happy to have proper mexican food. if you are looking for americanized versions not the place to go.

reviews.name: Aaron A.
reviews.review: Came here on a whim. I pass by it everyday and it never looked all that appealing to me. Was going to go to Little Ceasars for a $5 Hot N Ready, but once i pulled into the Kroger lot I decided my body was already too neglected to shove yet another pizza in it for dinner. Once I walked in I was immediately greeted and seated. There were no more than 4 tables seated in the restaurant when I came in. After 7 minutes chips and salsa was brought to the table. After another 5 my waitress was kind enough to stop by and say hi and ask what I wanted to drink. She wasn't nice. Since I had nearly fifteen minutes to look over the menu before she showed up, I knew what I wanted to eat. Simple order: house margarita on rocks -with no salt and a chicken chimichanga with double rice (no beans). She was a little put off that I didnt want beans. I assured her I was in fact sure about the no beans situation and then she was off to the kitchen. Margarita came out after a few minutes by the bartender. Very strong. Good tequila. I finished the margarita before my food got to the table. I was sipping slowly and watching tv. Not sure how long it took. I would have to guess at least 15 minutes. At least. The kitchen staff brought my food out. I ordered a chicken chimichanga but got a beef chimichanga. I'm not Hindu so it didn't really bother me. I was tired of waiting and ready to eat. My waitress did not come back to the table until I was almost done with my food. I never got asked for a refill on my drink. Didn't see her until the incorrect food order was nearly fully digested. Moral of the story. I will go back for the margaritas. The service was terrible and she was tipped my minimum of 15%.

reviews.name: Jared K.
reviews.review: La Terraza is just down the street from our new house, so we had to try it out. As a native Texan, I'm rather particular when it comes to good Mexican food. Nashville is pretty far north of the border, but I tried to go in with an open mind. After all, they had a great patio which looked perfect for drinking adult beverages.The interior looked pretty welcoming, but the employees sadly were not. There was no "seat yourself" sign and no hostess stand, so we weren't sure what to do. No one greeted us upon entry, so we had to track down a waiter and ask to be seated. One person seated us and gave us menus. Another person brought us chips and salsa. A third person asked for our drink order, which would have been an easier task had we been provided with a drink menu (we had to ask for that, too). While waiting 10-15 minutes for our waiter to come back and take our order, we saw several subsequent customers seat themselves, yet others were seated by various waiters/waitresses. Who knows. Our waiter apologized for the delay in taking our order, but still. Throughout the rest of the meal, we had other employees check on us more often than our waiter did.We started with some of their cheese dip (I was a little surprised that they didn't call it "queso", but whatever). The white cheese dip had great flavor, but was kind of runny. I liked the spiciness though. Too bad nobody ever came back to refill our chip basket, so we couldn't eat all of it.For my entree, I had the "Parrillada Mar y Tierra," which is basically a surf and turf mixed grill. It consisted of steak, chicken breast, shrimp, fish fillet, and chorizo, served with a cheese quesadilla, rice, beans, tomatoes, and avocado slices. I kind of wanted the shrimp fajita nachos, but that seemed kind of redundant considering the aforementioned chips and dip.The quesadilla was tasty and cheesy, but uber greasy. The refried beans were really runny and had no flavor. As for the avocado slices, maybe I'm just lazy, but I was expecting them to be unpeeled. No, they just sliced a whole avocado and served it peel and all (no pit at least). Maybe they should have removed the produce sticker from the peel, which is yet another reason to peel the dang thing before you serve it.My steak had a nice sear, but was tough and chewy. A few bites were also REALLY salty. The chicken was razor thin, thinner than the fish fillet. It had a nice flavor, but was very dry. The shrimp had a nice sear and were cooked well. They were probably my favorite part of the dish. The fish was cooked well too. It was tender and flaky and tasty. The chorizo was incredibly greasy and had a weird mushy texture. I'm not sure why they removed it from the casings before serving it.If I come back here, it'll be for margaritas, but it sure won't be for food.

reviews.name: O S.
reviews.review: They brought us our check faster than anything else. The place was not busy but we did not even get chips, napkins,  or silverware without asking. The food was awful.  I will not be coming back anytime soon!

reviews.name: Courtney M.
reviews.review: Not nearly as good as it used to be before they became so formal and "corporate."  Food not as full of flavor.

reviews.name: Brian B.
reviews.review: Food is ok, service is terrible. Don't sit on the patio.....you will be forgotten about.

reviews.name: Taysha A.
reviews.review: Last night, myself and 4 others went here because H&Ts was closed. The ambiance was great, the waitress was nice but the food was not. A friend ordered an enchilada with no red sauce, just queso the cooks gave her red sauce. I ordered carne Asada, how can you mess that up? Well it's was unseasoned the steak, the refried beans were bland everything was unseasoned . We asked to speak to the manager. He was rude, and very stand offish. Needless to say we will never back there again! Horrible experience and

reviews.name: Tara T.
reviews.review: Super Cute Mexican restaurant!!! Very Tex-Mex... We loved the homemade tortillias, and the queso and salsa!  The kitchen is right in the main dining room which was really fun to watch everyone prepare the food!  Our kids loved it- they could be a little silly and loud with no worries!  The night we were there they advertised a fresh banana foster bar made to order!!! (We didn't order because we were sooo full but- it it it looked DEEELISH!)  We ate indoors and loves the atmosphere- but sitting outside was the most favorite for everyone that night!  I am glad we found this place thru Yelp while on our short trip to Nashville!!!

reviews.name: Ashwin M.
reviews.review: Surprisingly good restaurant for its location. I wasn't expecting too much, much less having a separate huevos section, especially, during lunch. I got the rancheros and the cheese quesadilla, and they both turned out pretty good. The huevos rancheros was not runny as it usually tends to be, but a lot firmer. In fact, I'd say it was the first time I had eaten a HR in this fashion. Free salsa and dips, and good choices for vegetarians.

reviews.name: Chris S.
reviews.review: My wife was robbed while we were sitting on the patio.  Keep your belongings under your table if you dine outside.  The police came and took our report.  Would've been nice if the restaurant had comped our dinner, but no.  No compassion.  We haven't dined there since then.  There are far better options for Mexican just a short drive down the road.

reviews.name: Billy H.
reviews.review: One of the better Mexican restaurants in Nashville. The chips are hot & the salsa is full flavored. Service is great & the food comes out very fast. The food isn't bland like a lot of the other Mexican restaurants in Nashville. I've never had a bad experience here. The margaritas are great but 17 dollars a (smallish) pitcher is a little pricey.

reviews.name: Chris S.
reviews.review: To preface this bad review, I want to say that I have been to this restaurant three times in the past.  My previous experiences were positive, but this time was absolutely ridiculous.This time I had a horrible experience with the wait time, service and food quality.  They may have been short staffed, as our waitress seemed to be split between too many tables/areas.  Our food took forever to get to us, and it was cold when it arrived.  Even after we complained, the manager was not apologetic in the least.  We had a guest in town from France, and this was her last meal before leaving tomorrow.  I will not be returning.

reviews.name: Victoria S.
reviews.review: I go here every now and then to get a switch up to one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Antioch, Camino Real! I actually just had lunch here today and I had a very enjoyable experience! It just felt very new here some reason! I'm not sure why, maybe new management but I saw some different faces that I've never seen before! We had one very pleasant, and attractive young man waiting our table. He gave us ample time to order from the lunch menu they have instead of the usual big book of different things to order and eat and I was ok with that. Prices are decent for a Mexican restaurant, I ordered the Burrito La Terraza while the little sis ordered her fave as usual, enchiladas supremas.The chips and dips were different this time, having a nice spice level that I enjoyed and thickness. Our food came out piping hot and neatly presented! I have never seen nothing like that presentation! I enjoyed every bite of my food and the Agua de Horchata to go along with was tasty as well, but way too much cinnamon! Our waiter asked if we wanted dessert, usually we get our fave sopapilla, they have the best! But we were way too full. He recommended the flan dessert as that was his personal favorite and claimed, "it was just made today". I couldn't help but say "yes, I'll have flan to go!" On our way home I took a bite of the flan and oh my! The tastiest flan I've ever tasted!! I love La Terraza, I'm not sure what's up with all the bad reviews but it seems to be getting a lot better than it used to and food is getting better too!

reviews.name: Jayla B.
reviews.review: This is our go to Mexican restaurant we've been eating here for almost 4 years and have never had a bad experience! Staff is always so kind and the food is delicious and always correct! Love eating here!!

reviews.name: Veronica S.
reviews.review: I must say my food was very good!! I had Fajita nachos ...yummy!! I also had two frozen margaritas!! Very very good and I had me a little buzz going! I would definitely eat there again. The waitress was very nice...she made sure we had everything we needed at all time! Great service!

reviews.name: Riley M.
reviews.review: Once a week spot for me. Great service and food everytime I come.

reviews.name: Jim R.
reviews.review: I thoroughly enjoy this place.  Probably one of the best Mexican restaurants in Nashville.

reviews.name: Jesse Q.
reviews.review: I just love this restaurant. .I come here a lot and I'm always greeted at the door and the service is wonderful not to mention the food. .which always starts with FREE chips and sauce. The food is always wonderful as well.

reviews.name: Natalie T.
reviews.review: Eating here is always a treat--great atmosphere and great margaritas. Its nicer than some of the basic mexican restaurants, and they have some interesting options. The service isn't always the best, but we enjoy this location anyway.

reviews.name: David F.
reviews.review: This place used to be great. I would go at least once a week for lunch since my office is right down the street. Today will be my last time. I have watched the prices go up and up and the food go down. It takes way longer then it used to as well. It seems that it is under new management, my guess would be sold and now there cutting corners. Sad was a great place. Today i went and i think they served me beef stew dog food in my chimichanga and it was soggy again. Gross. My wife got a burrito it was dry and nasty but they covered it in watery cheese so u might not tell.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: So my second time here for a work lunch and I finally try the enchiladas. Seriously, I have had better enchiladas at countless other tex-mex restaurants. Where was the cheese?! There was barely any cheese in the enchilada. I ordered a second ala carte which they forgot, and I had them take off the bill. Honestly, I hope the other tex-mex joints in the area where I live are better because this one, thus far has been far from promising.

reviews.name: Mell F.
reviews.review: Most Mexican restaurants around here are cut from the same cloth. It's not a bad cloth, in fact, I would give 90% of the one's I've been to a 3 star A-OK rating. This La Terraza is a step above for me for a few reasons:1. They bring little bowls that everyone can spoon their own salsa into, eliminating the distress of double dipping. I like that.2. Their Chorizo Tacos Autenticos' rock and are $2 each.  Very simple: Chorizo, onion and cilantro with lime and avocado slices if you're into that sort of thing. They cook the Chorizo until it has a slight crunchiness. So freaking good.3. The staff is fantastic. Haven't had a dud yet. 4. You can order a chicken chimichanga ala carte for $4. It comes covered in queso, so if you're gonna get one don't pay extra for queso with your chips. There's plenty.5. They just got these new chairs that are boss.

reviews.name: Andrea R.
reviews.review: Tasty, clean (98-100's on the health scores), Mexican by the numbers with nice staff. They also have a full bar. Also as you know, I rate a Mexican restaurant by heavily relying on their salsa, and theirs is the best of any of these joints. Plus the one time we ordered margaritas they were STRONGGGGGG. I damn near got knocked over, and I'm not a lightweight. I recommend the chicken enchiladas suiza.

reviews.name: Betty T.
reviews.review: This is the closest Mexican Restaurant to where I live and love their food and the atmosphere.  I have ordered a variety of dishes here, but I think my favorite is one of the Shrimp Dishes.  The Camarone's Fiesta is to die for.  In looking at there online Menu I just learned that they have added Grilled Shrimp Poblano.  Looks like that' what I'll be having for lunch tomorrow.La Terraza is always clean, the staff is friendly, the food is fresh and good, and their prices are inline with similar restaurants.

reviews.name: Donnie W.
reviews.review: Consistently exceptional food and service here. These guys are on the ball. Try the Cerviche, it's amazing.

reviews.name: Elisabeth S.
reviews.review: LOVE La Terraza!  I think it is the best Mexican in Nashville and I have been to A LOT!  They serve Ceviche (a delicious and light fish dish) for $4!  I ordered two the first time I got it because I thought one wouldn't be enough and couldn't eat half of it.  So, one is PLENTY!  Can't beat it!  Love the salsa too!

reviews.name: Angelina T.
reviews.review: This restaurant is a pretty good rendition of the typical Mexican-American restaurant. They serve chips and a quasi-spicy salsa to start. The chips were nice and crispy without being too oily. I ordered the lunch special of chicken fajitas. They tasted great. I filled my flour tortilla with chicken, beans, Mexican rice, cheese, guac, sour cream and a little lettuce. The amount of sides they bring is perfect and will fill you up! The service was pretty good as well, perhaps a little on the "fend for yourselves" side, but nothing to complain about. All in all, a good experience.

reviews.name: Katie C.
reviews.review: Best "authentic" Mexican food in the Franklin/Brentwood/Cool Springs/Spring Hill area.  Great staff and great food.  Absolutely love their guac and authentic tacos.  Also, they'll also serve some stiff gold margaritas.  When I'm not craving Chuy's, I typically want La Terraza.

reviews.name: Wendi T.
reviews.review: We are here at least once a week for fajitas.

reviews.name: Ravon B.
reviews.review: I go here alot. The food is good and the prices are good too. The owner knows us from around town and I can say this he will work his butt off to make sure you are taking care of. The food is real good and will fill you up

reviews.name: Dee a.
reviews.review: This place is close to our shop so we order from here often. We mostly get the a la cart tacos. The tacos authenticos are very good and remind me of the type we typically had back home (texas border town). The fajita nachos are good, we usually split those between two of us with an order of rice. The mexican rice is very good, not overly sticky like some resturants make. It also reminds me more of Texas then the usually Tennessee "mexican" rice. The salsa is ok but nothing special.

reviews.name: Kelley K.
reviews.review: When I worked at my last job they took us here every Friday. I always got tamales and rice. I still eat this and I still love it. This is my favorite mexican restaurant period!!!

reviews.name: May M.
reviews.review: Worth to try. Good and authentic food, not expensive to get a quick lunch. .

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: Not the best mexican food I've ever tried but the locals seem to enjoy it. It's not that bad but I'm not the type that will run here every second that I may get either.

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: meh. this place is decent, at best, since it's so close to my work. everything here seems so uninspired, even the coke. i think 2.5 stars would really have been the ideal rating for this place. i'll give the salsa two out of five starts for sure. nothing i've had here really sucked, but nothing i've ever had here was anything special either. utter meh.eric b

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: Let me start by saying I'm a guacamole snob. With that said, La Terraza has the best guac I've had in Nashville. I honestly go there only for that. They're chips are tasty and don't require extra salt like most places here. I'm a fan of their chimichangas as well, but wasn't too impressed by their quesadillas. Service is usually pretty good unless it's summer and you're sitting on the patio (really small) then it can take a while. Only order their beef taco salad if you're wanting a hop of beef smothering a very small portion of lettuce, I'm not saying it's bad I'm just saying I prefer a better lettuce to meat ration. This isn't the cleanest of places but that is to be expected. The kitchen is half exposed so that's comforting. Their salsa is better than most in Nashville; its very tomato-y, not too spicy, but not ketchup-y either. The queso is white cheese and very thin, nothing added. Tasty though. It is in the Kroger shopping center, so that means lots of parking.  I was a bit put off by the fact that it's in a shopping center but I make the trip out to Nashboro Village just for the guac.

reviews.name: Gregg F.
reviews.review: This is a great place with a friendly staff. The food is excellent. We dine just about every week here and I have only been disappointed one time with my meal. There is seating both indoors and out and a seperate bar.

reviews.name: Erick R.
reviews.review: This place is the best on weekends for lunch! They give generous scoops of meat. Especially when you ask them how their doing and make a little conversation.It gets busy over lunch and dinner hours, but they're usually fast.

reviews.name: Allyson G.
reviews.review: Chipotle is one of two fast food places it will actually eat at.... Until an article comes out and says it's actually not as healthy as I think. For now, they're quick service atmosphere, fresh ingredients, and price serve up a wonderful workday lunch. They service is always fast and to the point.I only wish they offered more of their products without red onions... But while the rest of the world accepts them, I can't imagine that will be anytime soon... so I'll continue to eat there."I love Chipotle, Chipotle is my lifffeee!" - cred to the little kid on YouTube. Hope you're a millionaire from royalties by now!

reviews.name: Christa P.
reviews.review: Chipotle is consistent and good. I always get the steak burrito with corn and hot salsa. The staff was friendly and efficient.

reviews.name: Catherine W.
reviews.review: This review is just for their catering. I ordered the "Two Meat Spread" and it was awesome! Everything was ready when we arrived at the agreed upon time and they helped carry it to my car. I ordered enough for 30 people but it fed more than that. The meats definitely went faster than the beans, rice, and other items; however, there was still some meat left over. It really made feeding a lot of people easy. The set up was fast and kept everything at the right temp.  I would highly recommend using Chipotle to cater your party. Loved it! We ate left overs for several days!! And I still have so much shredded cheese left over! I loved that they gave us plenty of guac. My only tip is that if you do plan to get more servings out of what you order, make sure you buy more bowls/plastic forks.

reviews.name: Alisha W.
reviews.review: Poor service today at Chipotle.  Going to Chipotle is like going to Disneyland for adults.  The staff at chipotle today was either all hung over or all just pissed off.  They just slopped the ingredients and gave so little.  When I asked for some more rice she gave 1/4 more if a spoonful.  They were low on ingredients so instead of filling my bowl to the correct portion and getting more they just gave a tiny amount.  I left very annoyed after this experience.  I suggest the West End location.

reviews.name: Megan K.
reviews.review: Always a great experience at Chipotle on 21st. I typically dart in for a quick to-go meal and while the line is usually insanely long at the lunch hour, it flows quickly.The ingredients are always fresh, the place is clean, and the team is efficient and pleasant. No wonder it's one of my weekly go-tos. Definitely recommend (and for reference, I always get a chicken burrito bowl, black beans, no rice, cheese and mild and medium salsa--sometimes guac if I'm feeling wild).

reviews.name: Randal V.
reviews.review: So I go to Chipotle every city I visit. Didn't realize the best service was at home in Nashville. Took my family and with two small kids, the lady that rang us up offered to carry our meals to the table so we could take the kids she also offered us a milk when we set down for the baby. The food was great as usual a da gentleman came by twice to check and see if everything was okay with our meal. I love the product and quality of this place but this time it was like a five star restaurant with service and atmosphere. The bathrooms were very clean and the parking was convenient. I enjoyed this very much and plan on coming back soon.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: My first time here... and it reminded me of Moe's..I had an hour lunch today, don't get that very often...my co workers wanted Taco Bell, but I wanted something more!!!So I thought what? what? what? I was driving in the Vandy area and saw Chipotle ...never been so I swung my van into the  parking lot and went in. The line wasn't too long, gave me enough time to check out the overhead menu.I opted for the chicken burrito bowl with brown rice, and black beans, with corn relish, pico, guac, fajita veggies and cheese...then I also got chips and salsa to go with a side of two different salsa...right at $10 not bad...this was to go back to my work cube...so by the time I got there, it was cold..not their faultwish I had eaten there, would have been much better served hotI would go again! Reminded me of Moe's...

reviews.name: Emily B.
reviews.review: LOVE chipotle. . Will actually drive 20+ miles to this location to get some lol as it is the closest!  I ordered three items on the app and my husband picked it up.   Everything was correct and fresh.   I always get barbacoa, extra rice, no beans, fajita veggies,  corn salsa, sourcream, lettuce and a tiny dab of their hotsauce.  PERFECTION!!! LOVE YOU CHIPOTLE!!!

reviews.name: Todd H.
reviews.review: Panhandlers hit you up for money, while you are waiting in line for food.  Not an ideal dining experience.

reviews.name: Natalie S.
reviews.review: This is the worst Chipotle Mexican Grill I have been to. Even when it is not jammed pack for lunch, they seem to undercook the beans and char the vegetables. I had a bad experience here in November and gave it another chance today, much to my disappointment. In addition, they are always in a rush, regardless of the amount of people in the restaurant. The staff has a bad attitude and the ratio of their servings is different each time. They are just unnecessarily sloppy and unprofessional.

reviews.name: Brian K.
reviews.review: Chipotle is pretty consistent wherever you go.  This Chipotle is right on the Vanderbilt campus so it stays pretty busy whenever school is in session.  The food is great and I usually go with a burrito.  One negative that I have noticed about this Chipotle is sometimes the steak is undercooked and seems to be very rare.  I usually like my steak medium but this steak is pink and I've noticed it on more than a couple occasions.  This doesn't stop me from going though and I would recommend Chipotle to anyone who loves burritos and tacos.

reviews.name: Lindsey B.
reviews.review: Worst chipotle in town. This is the 3rd time I've gone and they've been, "out," of crucial chipotle components, all times have been about an hour before close.  This current time. Not only were the employees rude to my brother and I, but to each other.  There was an obviously new guy on the line and the fellow employee was very rudely snapping at him.  The service I can look past but the ingredients, out of 2 of the 4 kinds of salsa? Out of CHIPS? That's a burger without fries, just not right. I love and will always love chipotle but I will go across town to purpose not go to this one again.

reviews.name: Mackenzie C.
reviews.review: This location routinely under seasons their food and under fills their bowls. I'm frustrated and disappointed (and left hungry) every time I choose the convenience of this location over West End.

reviews.name: Gabe F.
reviews.review: I'm normally a huge Chipotle fan. Last night I ordered a chicken burrito. They were out of chicken and frantically cooking and slicing chicken to keep up with the orders coming in. The person cutting the chicken signaled to another employee that it was ready and she went to the cutting board to get a spoon-full. She made a comment to the person cooking and cutting the chicken for a moment and then she brought it to the line and asked what else I'd like on my burrito. I mentioned to her that the chicken looked a little pink. She took it back to the cook and showed it to him and threw it out, came back and apologized to me. They made me another burrito and gave it to me for free. I'm appalled that it took 3 people to discover that a piece of chicken was dangerously undercooked. I won't be returning to this location again.

reviews.name: Caroline H.
reviews.review: I can't NOT be a fan of Chipotle. The line moves quickly and there are endless combinations of deliciousness. This particular location seems SUPER echo-y. I feel like it's tough to have a normal conversation inside (but that's probably because I am stuffing my face). It's really loud. It's great they have outdoor seating options for this reason. There are about 5 tables. TIP: don't go at noon! SUPER LONG line. Go at like 11:45 or 1:30.

reviews.name: Peter V.
reviews.review: I crave burritos on a regular basis and it seems that Chipotle is the best Nashville has yet to offer up to burrito lovers. It's sad to be honest. Chipotle will never have burritos that will compare to my personal favorite of nopales and tofu rancheros from my local taquaria in San Francisco. But its what happens when you move away from the source. If there are some veg friendly places I am overlooking, please drop some knowledge on this transplant.This is your standard Chipotle. If you like Chipotle in general, you will like this one. I work across the street and this is the best vegan option for my long days on campus. I tend to burrito here frequently (burrito is a verb here). If you don't like Chipotle, you won't like this one either.I find that Chipotle is a fix, but is not quite fully satisfying. It's like when you really want to have a satisfying beer and there is only light beer. Yeah, you will drink it, but it's no IPA. It serves it's purpose well.

reviews.name: Kristin Marie S.
reviews.review: Call me a heretic but I'd rather go to Qdoba.....sorry!!!!  Every time I go to Chipotle I get to the cash register and think, 'how the heck did I just spend $12 on lunch???'  I ordered a salad and an Izze's soda.  It tastes good, don't get me wrong but that price is crazytown to me!  Maybe it's because I'm not used to paying a lot for Mexican food, but no, it'll be another month until I forget the incident, go back in and like deja vu, 'how the heck did I end up spending $12 on lunch?'The theme is minimalism and the space is clean.  They have a patio to boot!  The place is usually packed during lunch but even so the staff is super efficient and I am in and out in a decent time.  If you don't mind the price I say go for it!  FYI, they don't have quesadillas.

reviews.name: Tim M.
reviews.review: NOTE: Will update this as Chipotle gets their act together.This is the 3rd different Chipotle that I had a chance to visit within weeks of opening. Consistency: their meat is always salty when new locations open as if they are using a predetermined recipe that might need some tweaking.Furniture: good mix of the new Chipotle cushion seats and regular chairs & tables.Staffing: They seem to have lot of employees and lines were moving. We'll see how the next few weeks look. I'm sure it was intentionally overstaffed during lunch time to serve the unpredictable Vanderbilt crowds.Subway, Panera: You got competition now.

reviews.name: Jenn Z.
reviews.review: Seriously with Kristin G. on this one, overpriced Americanized Mexicanish food? The menu is basic fresh ingredients, the resulting burrito (or bowl) is fairly tastey, but for one person: a veggie burrito and a drink I left with a $9 bill - a bit much considering the veggies and rice were under-seasoned and I could have scored the same burrito with a bit more flair for less, elsewhere. I have to disclose I have not had the meat options and those may be killer. I think that the trendy vibe is fun for people, and again the food is good for the most part, this location is packed with College students and Vandy employees as it is on 21st across from the medical center/college so location isn't hurting them if you are walking. Parking is a b*tch! small lot and arrive early as in 11am! Service is fast and typically friendly but the way the glass "burrito station" is set up and add in the background of a packed restaurant, it can be hard to hear when ordering the ingredients for your burrito. I repeated myself about 3 times as did the guy building my burrito, to the point we were both a bit irritated by the time it was done. Overall, I can see why people will frequent here, its easy, its fresh and convenient and maybe they are more comfortable with the price. I however will stick to some of my other favorites where I feel I get more value for my money.

reviews.name: Vincent K.
reviews.review: I normally love Chipotle, but my burrito this time was half the normal size! I pay for the big portions...

reviews.name: Will M.
reviews.review: Bowls are good, nice atmosphere, friendly service and decent price.  $7.56 for a bowl with a water.Brown rice, black beans, chicken, mild sauce and hot sauce, cheese and letttuce= tasty satisfying dinner.use the chipotle app to preorder and skip the line.  Asking for a mix of chicken and beef can yield more meat for the money.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: For some reason, every time I went to the old Chipotle, I left with the food being cold, and that bothered me.  I decided to try this out, just because I had a burrito craving, and always enjoy a new experience, and I like this location better than the West End Ave. store.First, the traffic situation is much easier.  You don't have to deal with trying to either get in, or find one of the so few parking spots.  Second, since there are fewer surrounding businesses, most of the spots are going directly to Chipotle.  Third, the way seemed a little faster (I probably hit it between the rushes), and finally, the burrito was warm, which makes such a difference.If you have the choice, I'd go to this Chipotle, It just seems better overall.

reviews.name: Dave K.
reviews.review: First, let me say that this review should not be a review of ALL Chipotle restaurants as every one of them EXCEPT for this one I have been to (and I have been to Chipotles in at least 4 different states) is EXCELLENT.  This Chipotle, however, falls well below the mark.   First off, I used the Iphone app mobile ordering.  Often, when you get to a Chipotle, there is a huge line for burritos, so I do the mobile ordering.  That way, you get to skip the line and go straight to the checkout and just pick up your food.  The app asks you when you want your food to be ready, so I specified 5:35 pm.  I showed up at 6:05 and walked up to the cashier and asked about my food.  He pointed me to the end of the line.  Confused, I walked to the end of the line and stood in it.  Apparently, they hadn't even begun to make my food.  So much for using the app and not waiting in line and paying ahead of time.  Never have I encountered that at a Chipotle before.  Never.  Secondly, as the woman was making my burrito, she put maybe a 1/4 cup of rice, layed three small pieces of carnitas on top of it and passed the burrito on to the next assembly line guy.  I was shocked.  The whole point of Chipotle is that they make GIANT burritos.  That is their whole deal.  That is their image.  Their drink cups extol the greatness of their huge burritos.  However, the burritos made at THIS Chipotle are nothing like that.  So, when my burrito got to the next guy, I complained about the tiny portions I had been given and told him that was not what I had come to expect from a Chipotle.  He said that that was the right amount and that the carnitas portion should fit in a tiny salsa cup.  Wow.  Usually when they finish my burrito, they can hardly wrap the tortilla around it because it is so full of their awesome ingredients.  However, at THIS Chipotle, there was so much tortilla left over that it was wrapped over on itself several times over.  I had a tiny torpedo burrito that cost $10.  Amazing.     Skip this Chipotle.  If this is the only one you ever go to, you'll think that they are all like this and be sorely disappointed.  Go to any other and you'll be happy.

reviews.name: Kevin E.
reviews.review: Another Chipotle, what can one say? Mainly quality food and a nice addition to the 21st Ave South food scene. This restaurant is located at the previous site of Peter Chinn's Korean BBQ and before that a Cheeseburger Charley's.

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: Apparently the name of the game at lunch on 21st is go early. I walked over to Chipotle at 11:30 a.m. before the rush and waltzed straight up to the counter. No sooner did I get the words out of my mouth to order my veggie burrito bowl (a tad of brown rice and a touch black beans) did I reach the cashier with a bag in my hand. Talk about an in-and-out burrito! Delicious.

reviews.name: Messiah H.
reviews.review: Service, food, portion, price.... How do I say.... AWESOME!!!!  We got a pork bowl with sour cream & guacamole, 3 tacos, and 2 fountain drinks for like $22...we were stuffed!

reviews.name: Peter C.
reviews.review: The greatest find this year so far?  A chicken bowl without sour cream, cheese or guac (how I usually like it) has FEW CALORIES than a Subway foot-long roast chicken sandwich (also without cheese or other trimmings)!  And it tastes better!  My abs thank Chipotle for keeping them visible.

reviews.name: Dawn D.
reviews.review: I love this place! I always get a chicken burrito bowl there, they are generous with their food, and you can add vegetables for free (Qdoba charges extra for that). They are always very nice, and the food is always super fresh.

reviews.name: AngieLeah S.
reviews.review: Every time a new hookah spot opens my husband and I have to try it,since we consider ourselves Hookah Connoisseurs. We went after they had been newly opened to celebrate my husbands birthday. It was on the weekend but quite and sort of dead but I expected that. Hookah was great, cuisine was interesting. We had never had indian and hardly knew what to order, so our party ordered a little of everything. Lollipop Chicken was pretty good, the atmopsher was expected since its a hooka lounge,service was alright the waitress was new and learning the drinks and menu so  i'll give it a pass. Since no other patrons were inside they allowed us to hookup our ipod and play music, nice touch.There is limited park behind the location,so be prepared. Drinks were good,def was a great night.Overall I liked it and hope to go back soon

reviews.name: Ashwin M.
reviews.review: Is it so difficult to open a hookah bar in this city that isn't sleazy or uncomfortable to step in? I tried this place last night, and bolted out of it within minutes. Loud hip hop music blared from the speakers as a handful of suspicious looking people smoked and tracked our entry. The interior was grungy and dingy, like straight out of a repurposed solitary confinement cell. The waiter headed in, and said something, and three heads stuck out to study us. We walked into a room that was so dimly lit, even the Hubble telescope would have had trouble spotting the low chairs. The same stupid music was forced into the room. People had only one option: to shut up and smoke and/or drink.The entire joint was unsavory, and so were the patrons. I packed up and left. Would never return here ever.

reviews.name: Robert M.
reviews.review: The Indian Queen Lounge and Bar is a very laid back establishment with a wonderful selection of Hooka.I really enjoyed there authentic Indian cuisine and low seating. Parking is conveniently located in the back and across the street with entrances in both front and back. They have a full bar and have created a nice selection of craft coctails that compliment the flavors of the hooka. Beer floats are as well offered, something I had not yet seen in Nashville. The Indian Queen is now at the top of my list places to enjoy on a night out.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: The staff/owners are very nice people and most accommodating.We sat down and large water glasses were put down for us.We were told that the menu was not available during the lunch hour, but the buffet was.Buffet was $8.99.One of the staff brought us out the lollipop chicken, for us to sample.. That was a nice gesture.  It was delicious!It was ok. They have been open for 2 weeks and I'm sure there is more to come.Not a large variety on the buffet. Salad was not really a salad.The naan bread was warmed and buttered.  It was irresistible.We'll wait a few months for improvement, before we return.There is no parking on the street. Parking is behind restaurant with a rear entrance, or across the street in another parking lot.. BUT not on the street.

reviews.name: Larisa N.
reviews.review: The hookah is quite good. The audience is mostly black dudes, especially on weekends. It's quite weird for an Indian place, but they have rap music on all the times. Their ginger tea is awful, don't even try it! What I also didn't like is that when I paid my bill (it was $36 and left $40), they didn't bring change back. Of course, I'd leave that $4 or more as a tip, but it would've been nice if they at least asked if I want any change back. But I come back to this place, because Tarboosh is always full and it's cold on winters and hot on summers.

reviews.name: Jennifer C.
reviews.review: This is the best hookah bar I have been to in Nashville. It is clean and comfortable and the family who operates it were very nice. I was surprised they served food and more surprised when I tasted it. I had the chicken curry and it was awesome!!  Very high quality food and delicious. We were there from 6-8pm on a Friday so we got great happy hour deals and it was not loud or crowded, just the opposite- very relaxed.

reviews.name: Nabilah L.
reviews.review: We stumbled across this place since our regular hookah spot was too crowded. We decided to stay amd check it out - best decision ever! The food is excellent, the prices are great, and the staff are all very friendly. I recommend the Fish Biryani or the Fish Tikka - you can't go wrong. They've also got a good selection of hookah flavors. We definitely plan to return again.

reviews.name: Melody P.
reviews.review: Great food! Clean restaurant! WIthin walking distance from my office... Will go back.

reviews.name: Hunt H.
reviews.review: This Piccadilly restaurant is on par with those in Baton Rouge, LA - where the company is headquartered as well as my hometown.  They serve all of Piccadilly's "standard dishes" and prepare them well.  My go-to "Dilly Plate" - - Chopped Beef Steak w/ Onions and Gravy- Green Beans- Mashed Potatoes, no gravy- Soft Roll- Chocolate PuddingHaving grown up around these recipes, I know how they should taste.  Piccadilly Nashville never fails me!Ms. Tammy rocks!

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: Was decent enough. You get ALOT of food for what you pay for though so you better come hungry. Came here for my birthday yesterday. I got the Chicken n' Dumplings, steamed broccoli and cheese, cornbread and a piece of pie (forget what kind, sorry). The Dumplings were a little salty but not too overbearing.. Should have added some pepper to em to even it out but i never thought about it. The broccoli was very good, soft but not too soft which in my opinion is a bit hard to do. Oh and the pie? Now that i think about it more it was a Chocolate Pecan pie. I was really impressed by the taste of it. Was rather good. Only reason why this place doesn't get 5 stars? They seem to be rather short handed so the wait time in the line for food was a bit long. If they'd hire a few more people i'm sure they'd get 5 stars from everyone who visited.

reviews.name: tron d.
reviews.review: Boy you can't beat the hospitality here. Food is mediocre but if you check in the Nashville Scene you'll find some coupons that'll make it cheap at least.Sit in Miss Tammy's section btw.

reviews.name: Erick R.
reviews.review: I love this place. We live and Brentioch and order from here all the time. They are always so happy to hear from us. I think it's a sweet family run business. They're delivery is fast and friendly, but we are always happy to pick up because we just enjoy the people at the restaurant. I have always recommended this place and I'll continue to do so. Thanks a lot guys!

reviews.name: Briana P.
reviews.review: My wife and I have eaten here at least a dozen times over the last couple of years since they opened. We've always enjoyed their food and you can't beat the prices.  It's not the greasy Chinese take-out that some places offer; I'm sensitive to grease (get headaches) and I've never had a problem here. My wife loves their shrimp and broccoli - huge shrimp and they give you a lot. My favorite is the kung pao shrimp - again, due to the huge shrimp you get.  And the hot and sour soup is awesome - I get it every time.  It's pretty much a take-out place, although they do have a few tables.  Customer service is good.  Actually, I was very surprised by how good it was.  In all our orders, we've never had any mix-ups until today. I ordered a quart of hot and sour soup along with our main dishes, and I didn't realize until I got home that they had given me a pint instead of a quart.  I called the restaurant to complain, and they offered to drive over a quart of hot and sour soup - which they promptly did (the guy arrived literally 5 minutes later).  It's a family-run business, which I like to support.  Try it out - you won't regret it!

reviews.name: Diane 8.
reviews.review: I ate here last night.i orderd for delivery at 6pm. I got my food around 8pm. The food was cold.and i was missing my soup and soda.but what i was told was disturbing.i was told my the young lady who brought my food that it took to long.because she likes serving brentwood area more because of the tips and money. She also said that the chinese people who work there.(owners) keep the delivery charge.and dont give it to the drivers. So on top of me paying three dollers for delivery charge. The driver still needs hers..when i called to ask questions .she hung up on me. Wow. i will never eat here again,.

reviews.name: Eric I.
reviews.review: Maybe we can bypass the 90 delivery time, after all, they do deliver and I was thankful for that, but . . . Do you know what you call Chinese food with no utensil . . . Inedible.  No worries, I'm in a hotel and I was able to go get some.  Unfortunately, I got no tip for doing so.

reviews.name: Hanna H.
reviews.review: The food is good but the service is horrible. We ordered in and after I over paid for a two liter I was told they have no cups. Changed the order to to-go and was meet with a bunch of attitude.

reviews.name: Nic D.
reviews.review: Great local place that delivers. Food gets delivered quicker than they say. It's hot and delicious upon arrival. This is your typical fast food American style Chinese takeout. So...basically exactly what you expect and want! You don't want to get dressed up for a Chinese steakhouse and sushi bar where you have to use chopsticks. You just want to shovel great amounts of fried rice into your face with a fork while sitting on your couch watching The Flash on CW. You're an American. So eat Chinese like one! Boom! (mic drop)

reviews.name: Jamie G.
reviews.review: After one bad experience with No. 1 Chinese we decided to give it a second shot but still got less than desired results. Both times it was if the chicken had some sort of membrane or coating that was practicality inedible. The same thing happened both times and it was just a few pieces of the chicken. They have a solid menu, the prices are good but there is much better in the area.

reviews.name: Adryan W.
reviews.review: One of my places I go for Chinese and I like it here .! They have your order ready in a good timing and the food is always hot and ready to go . I order online most of the time and love how you can tell them how spicy you want your food especially for the people who love spicy and who don't . Just make sure you grab your forks and spoons there on the side because they don't put them in for you . ( I forget about that numerous of times lol)

reviews.name: John D.
reviews.review: Have had this a couple of times and had it delivered as well. Super slow delivery. Took about 2 hours to arrive. Couldn't even finish the chicken the last time and had an upset stomach from it. Proceed with caution.

reviews.name: Jena S.
reviews.review: As some folks said, fairly average Chinese takeout place, but with that said, a good average. My hubby and I used to be exclusive with Evergreen Express, but within the last year or so something changed over there and the food hasn't been as good. So we finally gave this place a chance ( plus it's much closer to us). I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. Our favorite dish to order is orange chicken, and I live egg rolls. No. 1 Chinese doors both well. The chicken comes out hour and cripsy with a decent orange sauce. We love spicy, so I always order it "extra spicy", but we've yet to actually get a spicy orange chicken. So not the place to get your spicy fix. The rice is usually well steamed as well. It comes out hot and fluffy, so I'm usually pleased with it. Egg rolls are good - nothing to write home about, but I doubt you'd be disappointed either. Overall, I'd recommend the place. The ingredients are good, and the folks in the back know what they're doing.

reviews.name: Shirley F.
reviews.review: I've eaten here twice. I am thought my choices were very tasty. Shrimp lo mein was delicious. Fried rice was great. Delivery both times was great and very quick. Egg rolls were average. My only complaint is that you have to request condiments by selecting it on the menu. I didn't do that the first time and got 1 soy sauce. Fortunately I had a stash from another restaurant. That's no it a deal breaker though. I plan to order regularly when I am too busy to go out. Better than having to give up my cheat day because of having pizza!

reviews.name: Kati H.
reviews.review: We usually order from China King down the road, but we decided to give these guys a fair shot a few weeks ago. Here is how it came out...Better at No.1 Chinese:Fried RiceEgg RollsGeneral Tsao's ChickenBetter at China King:Wonton soupSesame ChickenThe sesame chicken at No. 1 Chinese had a great consistency (nice and crisp on the outside and juicy on the inside), but mine was OVERWHELMINGLY garlic-y. I mean, we eat a lot of garlic in this house, we put it in almost everything, and this was to the point that I almost could not eat it. So weird. I don't know if I caught them on an off night or what. I might give them another go at some point and see what happens.

reviews.name: Cristy H.
reviews.review: Very friendly, fast service. The owner(s) are great!  As far as Chinese take out goes,  the food is consistently good. They offer delivery and online ordering. The space is clean and it's conveniently located in Lenox Village.

reviews.name: Travis A.
reviews.review: This is average, strip mall Chinese food.  Nothing special, nor is it horrible.  WTF is wrong with some of you that's you're actually shocked that there isn't a Michelin star hanging on the wall?  Get a grip people.

reviews.name: Joanne L.
reviews.review: I have food allergies that make Chinese food generally safe.   But the woman who worked there was very abrupt and suggested that we go somewhere else.  We did.

reviews.name: Riley M.
reviews.review: This is a typical Chinese Food place. The last that takes orders is very nice and friendly. This place opened early in 2013 and looks very clean and presentable. I don't eat this type of food very often, but from now on I'll come here when I do. Also, they have a few tables/booths if you want to dine in.

reviews.name: Stefanie M.
reviews.review: Amazing......I never expected such amazing Chinese food....boy, was I surprised!  We usually get crab Rangoon, dumplings, Kung Pao Chicken and then another appetizer type thing and everything that we have eaten from there is incredibly fresh, hot and delicious!  I keep meaning to try some of the other places around here but the food is so good here I don't want to try anywhere else!Also, the owner, is extremely friendly!

reviews.name: McCray D.
reviews.review: This is our go-to for Chinese takeout. Always delicious! The only thing that's bothersome is that their children run around the place and are rambunctious.

reviews.name: Aj B.
reviews.review: The lady on the phone was really nice.  My husband said he'd get two meals out of the Chicken and Garlic Sauce he ordered. I was wanting something healthy and the steamed chicken and broccoli with white sauce was really good.  When I called I asked which food has MSG, and said that most food on their menu had a small amount in the sauces. I appreciated the honesty and though I don't usually like Chinese food but for only as a last resort, I'd be happy to order here again, especially since we just moved into the area. My husband just finished his meal and said immediately, "That was really good, not too hot, but had a kick to it!" There you have it!

reviews.name: Doug U.
reviews.review: When I went here the short Asian lady who took my order was screaming at the people in the back in Chinese, it was nuts. Food is expensive and takes forever.

reviews.name: Ann Marie S.
reviews.review: I absolutely LOVE this place! It's delicious (: I don't know how anyone could complain

reviews.name: Ali D.
reviews.review: Great food. Great service. They delivery is timely and the food is always fresh, hot and delicious. We have tried many different plates and never disappointed.

reviews.name: Alexandria R.
