reviews.review: They are the bomb. I get food delivered all the time from them and I just love it! They are all super friendly. The at-home delivery is easy and simple, it's great that you can order food online!

reviews.name: Debbie S.
reviews.review: Didn't get what we ordered.  Mongolian beef didn't have rice that was supposed to come with order. Beef tasted boiled. All in all a  very unsatisfactory experience.

reviews.name: Chris G.
reviews.review: We started ordering delivery here about a month ago. It's became a weekly event since then. The food is delicious, fresh, and always arrives very quickly. The lady who usually takes phone in orders is very polite and always goes back over the order to ensure it is correct. It is our go to delivery joint from now on. Try the boneless spare ribs combo! 5 stars every single time. My favorite delivery in Nashville.

reviews.name: Eric S.
reviews.review: We've eaten here several times, but this last trip was not very good. My wife got wonton soup, and the wontons were tough (the crispy noodles were also stale). We each got egg rolls, and the cabbage inside was tough and kind of "springy" (making me think that it too was stale). My chicken and broccoli was just OK--certainly nothing to rave about. Overall, not a very good experience.

reviews.name: Big S.
reviews.review: I give this place 4 stars for being what is is: a standard Chinese takeout place, nothing more, nothing less.  You should base your expectations accordingly.  It's clean in there and the wait is rarely more than 10 minutes.  Staff is friendly.  The menu contains the typical overkill of choices, all accompanied by a number for easy ordering.  The food consistently tastes good but is nothing to rave about.  Prices are reasonable.  Will I stop by there again the next time I'm too lazy to cook?  Yup, probably....

reviews.name: Mel W.
reviews.review: First time I came here I fell in love. Not so guilty fast food. I usually get their chicken avocado wrap. So good. Their wings....awesome! Corn soufflé was amazing. Fried yuca, plantain, and sauces all GREAT! Try the curry mustard!

reviews.name: Corey N.
reviews.review: I stopped in here on my way to Costco, my wife usually loves this franchise, and I wasn't sure if I had eaten here, or the other, similar franchise. The server was the highlight of this experience, as she was pleasant, witty, and helpful with the order. I told her I was dining in, was given a number, and advised that the meal would be brought to my table.This is where things started falling apart. I walked over to the first table, and noticed it was very dirty, looked around and noticed most of the tables in my sight were dirty. I found one of the relatively clean tables, and placed the number holder on the table. Now, Im going to pause here to advise that the next part here will be gross, and somewhat graphic, but it was my experience. I also will admit that I am a somewhat fastidious person, and had previously worked in the food service industry, so I know of the warning signs of a below average restaurant.As I walked towards the bathroom, I noticed that the trash cans were overflowing, and noticed several more dirty tables. This had me rightfully concerned and I was somewhat apprehensive of the condition I would find the bathroom in....Again, this will be gross, and you might want to stop reading here.... If not, just know you were forewarned:The bathroom has one urinal, a handicapped stall, and one sink, near the urinal. Some crazy customer, or perhaps a disgruntled employee had deficated into and onto the lip of the urinal! After the initial shock of sering this, I quickly went to the handicapped stall, which while not covered in feces, was still covered in urine. I quickly decided I could hold it, but as is my custom before eating I went to wash my hands. I tried to avert my gaze as much as possible, but could feel it staring me down from the urinal... Once my hands were washed, I of course saw that the paper towel dispenser was empty... This left me no choice, but to pass the urinal again, to get to the stall and grab enough toilet paper to cover my hands enough to allow me to open the door. Which I had to assume was as filthy as the rest of the bathroom.Once clear of this little house of horror I looked toward my table to see my food had not arrived. I normally would have cancelled my order and left; but I was extremely hungry, in a hurry to finish some errands before getting back home, and trying to give a newly opened restaurant the benefit of doubt. I decided to give the nice girl at the counter a heads up on the bathroom situation when I noticed my meal cooling off to the side of the counter. As I grabbed for the tray, another, extremely disinterested employee, and probably the one that was supposed to bring me the tray, asked if I needed any silverware... I of course said yes, and tried to discreetly mention the bathroom as there was a line of new customers with in easy earshot, and I wasn't trying to put the place on blast. The rep, quickly interrupted me,  stating "We'll get to it."The food was okay, it probably would have been better before it cooled off; however I could barely notice it as a couple more male patrons had walked out of the bathroom and were discussing the fecal disaster piece...In this time I had also noticed the plate my food was on was dirty as well, and that was when I got up and walked away. One star, only for the one good employee at the beginning of this horrible experience. My wife asked me why I didn't get a manager, and I responded that I just couldn't deal with telling a manager how to do their job correctly after going through so many examples of bad management. I was a Quality Assurance Engineer for years, and it was clear to me that this was more than just one bad or lazy employee, it was a poor system of managing employees. I will say that another employee did start taking out the trash as I walked out of the store.

reviews.name: Rodney B.
reviews.review: Though the chicken had a nice seasoning, the overall experience was not an enjoyable time for my family.  Server never returned with out extra plate request, burrito and rice tasted like both came from the freezer to a microwave then our plates.  Taco Bell definitely out ranks this experience.We will not return to this restaurant.

reviews.name: Julie K.
reviews.review: I went here Monday. New spot and I wanted to try it. The food was very inexpensive. I ate about 5 bites and it wasn't for me. Fast forward to 3am I woke up sick as a dog throwing up diarrhea chills. I called my doctor it is food poisoning. I will never be back and I am beyond thankful I didn't finish my food.

reviews.name: Andrea A.
reviews.review: Third time here and I'm in love. The first two time it was take out and third time we dined in. The chicken is juicy and nicely seasoned. We always get yellow rice with vegetables a mad black beans. The bread was ok but cold...could have been somewhat warm for me. We finally tried the ribs, great taste, nice flavor but a little fatty. For our dine in experience the tables were a little dirty but crew was overall pleasant. I think they need to have multiple persons on the floor. Keeping the tables cleaned and the condiments area stocked and cleaned as well. We'll be back

reviews.name: Brad H.
reviews.review: Today is the first day they are open and theorems a little of the expected chaos but not bad at all. I think this is going to be a great addition to Nashville West. I had a small Tropichop with pork and not only was it tasty, it was plenty big for me. I also had a side of corn soufflé and that was AWESOME. I'll be back on a regular basis. Welcome to the neighborhood!

reviews.name: Joshua P.
reviews.review: Great food; great atmosphere. The only thing I can fault them for is that tables were dirty but all were clean before we left. Vanessa did a great job.

reviews.name: Melinda R.
reviews.review: Food was excellent, fresh a& tasty!  Had the Tropichop with chicken and it was soooooo good!Deducted 1 star because it took awhile to get out=r food, but hopefully after they have been opened awhile, this will not be an issue.

reviews.name: Joe F.
reviews.review: The service was good but the chicken was bland. Food quality was not great. I love Cuban/Caribbean food but this place missed the mark. I was also hopeful that this place could compete with Chipotle. No contest. Won't be going back anytime soon.

reviews.name: Brittany S.
reviews.review: I placed an online order for the quesadilla salad. I figured I'd give a new restaurant a shot. When I got there, my order was being bagged... Very quick. Price seems very reasonable to me. The salad was delicious!!! I ate the cilantro garlic dressing on it, which was definitely a good call! I will get that again next time!

reviews.name: Bonnie H.
reviews.review: First time here..refreshing menu..had the pork rice black beans combo. .pork was very tasty..I ordered the small which was plenty..lots of others had the wings..need to try them..it is like the Chipotle concept..I liked it!

reviews.name: Lorelei S.
reviews.review: I have been seeing the ads for this place on social media and was so looking forward to healthy Caribbean food on the fly.  It is on my way home from work so I was prepared to have it be a dinner favorite.  Sadly, I did not like it.  The food was disappointingly flavorless and not served hot. The atmosphere was also odd with loud pushy customers, seemingly untrained staff, previously mentioned cleanliness issues, and no good system to manage customer flow. Napkins are needed on tables. I will say the mango punch drink was delicious. For a similar price much better food and service can be had at Calypso down the road.

reviews.name: miata a.
reviews.review: I rated Pollo Tropical in Smynar  with Five stars. I took my clients to the Smynar location for lunch meeting  from time to time.  I was so excited when found out another Pollo Tropical was under construction in Nashville, TN and near my house.   I bragged to the wife and kids that as soon they open , I wil take them there for diner. We had diner at this location two weeks ago and Oh Boy, I was wrong and embarrassed for taken the family there. We ordered three plates; roast chicken and wings.  I should said some thing immiditately when they brought  it to the table. The roast chicken's skin was dried out  the chicken looked deflated. The wings also looked dried and burnt.  I tasted both and they were dried (chicken jerky like). The wings were over cooked with burnt bitter taste.  The restaurant  just opened and there was hardly any customers there. I think instead of get rid of old food from earlier hours. They re-grilled the wings and let the roast chicken sat too long. Yes, they saved $$ from doing that  but they loose a regular customer  and free marketing from me.I hope the Manager or Onwer of this location read this review.

reviews.name: Edward M.
reviews.review: Chickens good. Menu looks nice. Problem here is there's nowhere to sit because they don't clean off the tables. Customers are cleaning off their own. When I left there were 15 dirty tables. The only ones that had gotten clean while I was there were by the customers. Staff brings out food then walks back to the kitchen leaving everything filthy. The dipping bar is pretty raunchy too. The garbage can is literally overflowing with trash, up over to the closest booth. Visited Saturday afternoon 8/22/15

reviews.name: Scott F.
reviews.review: New restaurant so everything was clean. Food is fresh and they actually grill the meat in front of a big window. I loved it and will definitely be a regular here!

reviews.name: David L.
reviews.review: Really tasty food.  I generally eat pescatarian, but make exceptions once in a while for something like this. The goat has been great.  Flavorful, mildly/moderately spicy once and fiery another time, when I asked for extra spicy.  (I lived in Thailand for a year, and I eat very spicy food regularly.) The garlic naan and other breads have been toasty and steamy and great.  The place is usually filled with almost entirely Southeast Asian/Indian customers speaking their native languages.  I take that as a good sign in a neighborhood with growing but still modest levels of ethnicity.I have a condo right next door. Always had to warn friends and family against eating at the old Indian place that was there.  Now, very pleased to have a nice place to eat something very good.  Yes, the decor is spartan. I always sit outside and watch the people going by.The manager is very pleasant and accommodating.  The wait is almost always long, and that should be taken into account when going.  Often quite busy, at least when I have gone, which may explain some of that.  I know this, and it doesn't bother me because I only go when I have time to sit and have a beer and chat with whoever I brought with me.

reviews.name: Randall F.
reviews.review: This place is pretty good... The Three star revolves around the fact that it's a bit difficult to order in.  Not being Indian and not understanding the food names- it was difficult to decipher the menu.  Additionally- the young lady helping us did not speak the best English- so it was a bit of a challenge.  English descriptions, or pictures would DEFINATELY help.  All of that said- she pointed us in the direction of some REALLY great food and the meal was quite enjoyable.  The decor of the place leaves a bit to be desired... so I would not really classify this place as "nice" or anything like it... it however is a nice close place to grab some Tasty food during the work-week.

reviews.name: Sophia A.
reviews.review: So nice to have a place within walking distance to work in the Gulch, that isn't Southern/American. Great customer service and very generous portions.Things to try: mango lassi, garlic naan, boneless chicken dum biryaniVery friendly staff.

reviews.name: Salman S.
reviews.review: If you are a Desi (Indian,Pakistani, Bengali) please move one and go to the other great buffets around town. I was excited to see them open up in downtown after having tasted them in other parts of the country. Walked in great customer service and began to see what biryanis they had. Seeing all of them I wanted them all but seeing the price 10.99 per plate I was shocked. Went ahead and ordered it to go, came home opened it up and I was given colored rice in a bowl with 2 pieces of chicken some gravy and raita on the side. So dip the spoon in the rice n taste it, this was the most bland biryani I had ever tasted. The meat was evev worse and blander. Please refrain from going there.So who should eat there? No one, the most untasteful food I have ever tried. Might be amazing for folks who r trying Indian food for the first time but someone who eats a lot of this will never return.Customer service 5stars food 0

reviews.name: Sandeep D.
reviews.review: Pathetic service, we had to wait for one hour for the order and even after that it was not served and had to cancel it finally.People coming after us their orders were taken and they were served too. This is really pathetic.

reviews.name: Mike J.
reviews.review: Flavorful Food, Decor Needs TLCWe arrived at 7 pm on a frozen Thursday night. We were the only diners when we arrived, and had the place all to ourselves for the duration of our dinner. Given the frigid conditions, we were happy to find the place open - many other restaurants were closed due to the ice.I had the boneless chicken biryani and it was GREAT - very flavorful rice, chicken was tender and full of spicy heat. The portion was huge - I was starving and I couldn't finish it. The garlic nan was fine, standard fare. The food here was excellent, but the decor was spartan. These two factors combined make this an excellent choice for take out. Add a few plants, pictures on the wall, upgrade the tables and chairs, and we'll be back for another sit down dinner.Oh, the manager (who took care of us) was friendly and gave us good suggestions.  Prices were fair.

reviews.name: kaycee b.
reviews.review: Very very slow... Missed an order and food that did come was not so great. My friend was really disappointed since she didn't get to eat

reviews.name: Munch B.
reviews.review: My regular spot. Tried couple of items here . Keema dosa,Gobi Manchuria, masala chai.Boneless  chicken biriyani is a must try . I would definitely recommend this place

reviews.name: Tejas D.
reviews.review: I really wanted to like this place . However , with their appalling service , I cannot be more dissatisfied . We waited 40 minutes to get our order only for them to serve my friends order and not what I ordered. She was done with her lunch and still there was no sight of my food. If you cannot serve two people at the same time , you shouldn't be having a restaurant . The worser part is seeing people who came after you get served .

reviews.name: Chanchala K.
reviews.review: Its Ok after my first encounter

reviews.name: Namu B.
reviews.review: This place is amazing...  Mutton/Chicken Biryani is so good. Moreover don't miss the chicken 555, it's out of this world...We come to this place whenever we get a chance...it has the real Indian taste

reviews.name: Jonathan V.
reviews.review: A solid fast food style Indian restaurant in Nashville. I ordered the goat biryani, chicken tikka, and tandoori chicken. The goat biryani portions were huge. The rice had a surprisingly authentic Hyderabadi taste - each bite was overwhelmingly flavorful, exactly what you would expect from a proper biryani. The chicken tikka masala was a pinch sweeter than spicy but still fingerlicking good. The tandoori chicken came with two chicken quarters and was enough to feed at least two people. Very flavorful, but not as strongly marinated as I would have liked. The server was very welcoming and polite. Parking here sucks but exactly what you would expect on Demonbreun. The spicyness level was also very mild - perfect if you can't stand gulping water down after every bite, but I'd strongly recommend asking to make each dish a bit more spicy. The extra kick would really have upped the taste.This is as close to an authentic Hyderabadi biryani place I will probably find in the south. I will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Ram R.
reviews.review: Best Boneless Chicken Biryani ever..

reviews.name: Ross E.
reviews.review: So I got the Sweater Weather. While the hint of Apple was delicious, I'm a little disappointed that there was no wool in it. I fully expected strands of sweater to be included, naturally. Also, the Neighborhood did not spontaneously serenade me...good drink but I was expecting something else.

reviews.name: Matt R.
reviews.review: Bongo Java is so disappointing, every time. - mostly because of how their staff behaves.  Everyone who works there seems generally uninterested in you being there to spend money and they are a bit snooty (which is a quality trait I just love getting from a 22 year old schmuck).  The owner is definitely not unaware of how his staff behaves, by the way .. the staff has had that same reputation for almost TEN YEARS!   The difference now in 2015 is that we have way more options in terms of local coffeehouses.Today at Bongo I paid $12 ($2 tip) on a small bagel sandwich and an iced coffee.The food runner didn't bring me napkins.They expect patrons to bus their own tables.Trust me - I know Nashville coffee.  And these days there are SO MANY other better options to get a great coffee experience.  Try Crema, Barista Parlor, Portland Brew, Edgehill Cafe, Frothy Monkey, The Well, The Jam, Ugly Mugs, Eighth & Roast, or Red Bicycle.

reviews.name: Shane S.
reviews.review: The coffee is good and strong, and the treats and pastries are great, but I admire this place more for the atmosphere and location. This is a great spot to settle in on the patio with a book, or establish a temporary office inside for a couple of hours. The crowd is diverse, can be eccentric and interesting; making it a great place to people-watch! The service was great and the staff was laid back and welcoming.

reviews.name: Jay R.
reviews.review: Before I begin I'd like to note that the coffee is very good here. Now that being said, it isn't mind blowing good. The real issue is the line, it moves so ridiculously slow that it quickly becomes frustrating. I realize people are ordering food and it takes time, but the wait is just too long.

reviews.name: Lidia M.
reviews.review: Rude and unprofessional employees .also the place is dirty and smells weird. The cappuccino that they served me was a disgrace . The worst cappuccino I ever tried . I've been to coffee shops all over USA but that coffee shop is a disgrace . The only reason that I gave them 2 stars it's because they have nice outside sitting area .

reviews.name: Meredith A.
reviews.review: I love this place. The OG independent coffee house in Nashville never disappoints. This coffee place is one of the main reasons why I consider relocating to Nash on the daily. Check out my Instagram post about this place @mosouthblog and follow for more fun food adventures and recipes

reviews.name: Drew N.
reviews.review: Bongo Java has good coffee but the customer service is something is that of something that is left to be desired. I stop in every now and then the cashiers and baristas all seem miserable and un-inviting. I now make it a point to go to Fido to get coffee instead when I'm in the area.

reviews.name: Allison F.
reviews.review: I can sum it up as such: standard coffee shop worth checking out at least once.

reviews.name: Sundance P.
reviews.review: the atmosphere in this spot is dope. Trendy folks & college kids making super strong coffee . Free wifi. Relatively chill staff. Malcolm Gladwell might understand why, but every time I eat here (not drink) I finish my food and exclaim "ah bongo! You never fail to disappoint." Good bagels. Strong coffee (sometimes confused with great coffee). Pure hype. But yes. Sure. Come here. Spend money.

reviews.name: Existential Y.
reviews.review: Barista asked me what I wanted. I said "To know whether it's possible to live a truly authentic life." They handed me a mocha.

reviews.name: John N.
reviews.review: If you don't mind waiting 25 minutes for a mediocre cup of joe, this is the place for you.  Stopped in for what I thought would be a quick cup of coffee before I met someone down the street for lunch.  If I went to Belmont and/or smoked a lot of weed, I might appreciate the place more.  Just not a draw for me.

reviews.name: Sarah E.
reviews.review: I am a regular since I work across the street. Bongo is wonderful. They have become my absolute favorite in Nashville.

reviews.name: Elizabeth S.
reviews.review: The first time I ever went into Bongo Java years ago, the customer service was below par. The cashiers/baristas were not friendly at all and seemed to not have any personality. I don't remember the quality of my coffee that visit.I decided to try it again a few weeks ago and was disappointed once again by the taste of the coffee which had no flavor, and the lack of personality from the staff.I had to call Bongo Java today to try and get some information and I was extremely disappointed at the tone I received from the man on the other end of the phone that didn't seem like he wanted to help me. I was as friendly as could be and felt like a bother when I called. I would NOT recommend Bongo Java at all. There are other coffee places in the area that I have had a more pleasant experience with (i.e. Frothy Monkey, Edge Hill Café and even Starbucks) that I would recommend.

reviews.name: Kenneth C.
reviews.review: The place is conveniently located as it is right across the street from where I live.  If I need a hot coffee before this is the best place to go. If you are meeting someone for work this is the place to go. Their drip coffee is decent, their food is really good especially the bongo basic including hashbrowns that will blow your mind. The staff are all really cool and have made friends with a few of them. Great place to hang, eat, and especially get coffee

reviews.name: Chuck S.
reviews.review: Poor customer service. Called ahead to ask if they had one of their bags of coffee beans in stock on location. Drove 20 minutes across town only to discover the employee we talked to on the phone mis-informed us.

reviews.name: Kati H.
reviews.review: I went to Belmont, so this place was conveniently located. It is right across the street. That being said, the service left such a bad taste in my mouth the first time I visited, that I only returned maybe a handful of times in five years. Coffee is just decent, nothing remarkable. They have a killer chipotle cream cheese. But, like I said, the service is straight up rude/snooty. My first time in there as a freshman and I wasn't really sure what to order - there wasn't much of a line, maybe one other person (it was an off hour), but the barista gave me major attitude and started trying to school me on how "a Starbucks macchiato is NOT a real macchiato." Which is fine, I love learning new things! But not when you act like I'm a total idiot for not being a regular. Not cool, hipster barista girl. I also wasn't sure if they would bring my coffee to me after I sat down, or if I had to go get it (first time, remember), and no one said anything, so my coffee sat on the counter for a good 5 minutes after she finished making it. After that experience, I only went in to Bongo a handful of times. The service never improved. Just skip this place unless you're desperate.

reviews.name: Sarah W.
reviews.review: I am really bummed I'm giving this place such a low rating. The first 2 times I've been at the Bongo Java, I had a great time with awesome Chai Tea Lattes & pretty good food. This 3rd time however, completely changed my mind. Here's what happened:First: The second we walk through the door, the entire staff acted as though we were the people not invited to the party, but showed up anyways. The cashier guy didn't even give the obligatory "Hi! How can I help you?" He just stood there looking at as. We ordered and went to our table.Second: Food arrived and the Hummus Plate I always order showed up, but the hummus looked different and tasted different too - VERY SPICY! Which all this is fine, but I'm not a fan of spicy food, so when my fiancé went to take it back in exchange for something else, the staff acted so annoyed with him. We ordered a sandwich instead. Third: Sandwich arrived looking delicious, but it came with a side of chips & salsa - not the side salad we ordered. When we mentioned to the waitress we had asked for the salad with the sandwich she just looked at us and said, "Oh, yeah I thought you said chips & salsa." And she walked away. That was it. As though, ya get what ya get. I was pissed. I went BACK up to the registrar to get the chips & salsa replaced, which as you can imagine was a big ordeal I even asked such a thing! They brought it back with a huge mound of salad as though to say, "There! Are you happy now!?"Unfortunately, I don't think I'll be coming back to a place that doesn't seem to want me there or my business. Which is a shame, because I really liked this place and it's atmosphere.

reviews.name: Rooster M.
reviews.review: Quality coffee and breakfast lunch fare   Downside is long lines at peak times if u just want coffee.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: The coffee was good but not worth the wait. We waited about 15 minutes for the coffee after we ordered. I will be back, I'm just assuming the barista was slow or new.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: As a Belmont alum and now grad student, of course I frequent Bongo Java.Although the Nun Bun is no more (yeah, that was here), this place still has plenty to offer. I love the fancy coffee drinks with cute designs in the foam (don't judge me for being impressed by that).  For lunch, I'm a big fan of the 'poultry bomb' bagel sandwich. The breakfast sandwiches are great, too, as are the desserts. I love the big patio (when it's not completely overtaken with smoke).My inner yuppie snob wishes there were some big comfy chair options inside, but that's ok. This place has a ton of personality and lots of deliciousness. Winner.

reviews.name: Nick G.
reviews.review: Really cool place to grab a coffee. Organic, local roast and all that jazz... Place is comfy... But.. Crazy expensive!! I'm visiting from Boston and it's no joke twice the price of anything at home.Sausage, egg, cheese bagelCoffeeTotal: $11.00!!!!

reviews.name: Emily Myles H.
reviews.review: I like bongo java! I have been to their location near belmont as well as the one in the omni hotel downtown.  Their coffee is tasty, I liked the iced mocha special I had.  Not my favorite coffee place in Nashville but I do really like it, they also have the tasty muffins that are also at Fido.  Cute merch at the front too!

reviews.name: Anna T.
reviews.review: This is purely a review of their coffee. I judge based on drip coffee since flavored drinks are pretty much the same everywhere. That being said,  I found it overpriced and on par with Starbucks (except they don't burn it). As other reviewers have said, the staff seemed like they could care less. Nashville has a lot of cool, trendy coffee shops, unfortunately this one just didn't do it for me.

reviews.name: Phillip S.
reviews.review: OK, visiting from Seattle, I'd heard about Bongo Java quality. I tried it at Fido and the quality was amazing. However, visited the cafe next to Belmont University. The staff were rude and the quality of the drinks using the same coffee beans sucks especially as it is super expensive. Tried it 4 times and same rudeness with different staff. Owner should hire quality staff.

reviews.name: Konstantin G.
reviews.review: I just have to say that Lauren was tremendously welcoming, pleasant and personable and the service alone is worth coming back for. Britt was also very cool and the chef, Nathan was able to cook me up something special, due to my allergies.

reviews.name: Bill H.
reviews.review: Fido, the flagship of the bongo java fleet has the best menu around, really five star hipster foodie hang. This one in the east end is a sinking ship... Lousy disinterested service, stale bagel, mediocre hummus, lousy veggie patty. No going off menu. No going back here again... C'mon guys,

reviews.name: Nicole R.
reviews.review: I've frequented Bongo many times because of the convenience. I've always felt the food was just ok and the staff seem uninterested in being there. But after visiting today, I decided it would be the LAST time I would give them my business. If I could give zero stars based on service alone I would. After waiting nearly 30 minutes for an egg on an English muffin (not too complicated), I asked the extremely unwelcoming guy at the counter who took my order, how long the wait would be, especially since customers that ordered after me seemed to get their orders. He then looked at me as if I were bothering him and replied by saying "I don't even know what you're asking me", and walks away. At this point I'm extremely annoyed. Then he returns from the kitchen with the same order I placed and gives it to another customer, whom again, ordered after me. I then proceed to the counter to get my money back and he questions me about the order that he took. By this time I can't even wrap my mind around waiting another 30 minutes for a simple sandwich and more importantly, giving this business who doesn't seem to care about their customers, my money. I asked for my money back and was never given an apology or anything. This place is a huge disappointment. Unfortunately, it's the only breakfast spot convenient to Belmont but I could never bring myself to spend my hard earned money on mediocre food and disrespectful customer service again.

reviews.name: Cynthia T.
reviews.review: If I were a college student near by, I would probably love Bongo Java a whole lot more and frequent it often.  Alas, I am not and rarely in that area for coffee.  Because of that, I feel like I haven't given it a fair chance.The entrance from the door to the counter feels a bit small but there is plenty of indoor and outdoor seating and an upstairs area where I saw plenty of students studying.  I think that their outside patio is a big draw especially in the nice fall weather.  They don't have a parking lot so be ready to fight for a spot on the streets.There's food and coffee offerings to make sure you check out their menu.  I'll happily offer a review update if I ever get to visit again.  Until then, I would say check out this local java spot!

reviews.name: Tracy S.
reviews.review: I hope that the owners of Bongo Java read all the reviews and then tweak their business.  Their site says..." We hire a professional staff who are focused on customer service."  Unfortunately this is not the case the few times we visited and unfortunately, I know that it is now getting a reputation for being an unfriendly cafe with the university students at Belmont.  A little more training of their staff to create a warm and welcoming place is needed OR start hiring friendly people from the Universities.  I am sure there are a lot of students in need of a paycheck.  Looking at the reviews, it seems it is a hit or miss when you go.  It should be a home run each and every time you walk into an establishment!   People can forgive errors in orders if the employees are friendly and happy to help.   I should add that we also visited the Fido Restaurant and even though the lines were long, there was a completely different atmosphere and it was a great experience and great staff.  I hope for the sake of this particular branch that the owners take note.

reviews.name: Chelsea J.
reviews.review: I cant stop thinking about the Big Bad Hash Brown. I had it two weeks ago and I probably dream about it every night and wake up in the morning asking myself, 'is this the day I can treat myself to another big bad hash brown?'. Hash browns are the best when they are crunchy and these bad boys have got the crunch going on perfectly. I would be satisfied here BUT Bongo Java goes to a whole new level when they add onion, tomato and a ton of melted cheddar cheese. Seriously so good. The hash brown is a big enough portion to be considered a meal, and bonus points - its only $3.50. Now that i've hit rock bottom and written PARAGRAPHS about hash browns I can move on. Bongo Java had a really good selection of tea and the barista (i think thats a Starbucks term? woops!) recommended this great lavender green tea that I would happily order again. I might try some more of their selection but I'm thinking the lavender green could be my go-to.  Really cool big patio where I can picture myself doing some school work in the future. You might see some gals with hairy armpits, and really all kinds of characters finding a spot to hang out on the patio, but that just adds to the ambience. Great little place, I'm hoping it doesn't get too crowded once school is back in session. I'm coming for you hash brown!

reviews.name: Clayton K.
reviews.review: Love the oatmeal, when they have it. Great place for breakfast. Newly re done patio section, much more space. Staff is always friendly and social.

reviews.name: Jim K.
reviews.review: If you like waiting 15 minutes for a burnt bagel this is your place!  Seriously every time.

reviews.name: Tuck L.
reviews.review: I live right around the corner from Bongo Java and have been going here for years. To me, it is the best kept secret in Nashville! Coffee is always hot, always good.  Not always easy to find a table but hey, that's the price you pay.

reviews.name: Betsy L.
reviews.review: Not a fan of Bongo Java. It was great when I was in college...convenient, cheap, a plethora of electrical plugs. But as I've gotten older, and I'm more aware of the quality of coffee I drink, I am just not impressed with Bongo Java. Their coffee always seems a bit bitter to me. Also, it is just packed with hipster college kids...I don't remember that many being there when I was their age! All in all, I'd say venture one street over to Portland or Fido. But it is a convenient shop if you need some cheap coffee.

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: The mocha, wi-fi, and ambiance earns this place three stars! The staff, table occupants, coffee, environment, and everything else at the mothership has it going on. My grades in grad school are a testament to the success of this place! HaIThis particular site of the Nashville based conglomerate isn't as idiotic as the Fido's store. Fido's seems to turn off the wi-fi instead of just insisting during certain hours to keep the "meter" running if you are going to keep a seat. I am one of those guys who will camp in a seat for 2 hours to work and enjoy coffee. However, I don't do this during "rush" hours or when a business request in the "sign on screen" to not keep a table if tables are needed. Fido's rocks...but their approach to managing their situation is pitiful. Back to Bongo...thanks for being you!

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: I always come here for the "Bongo Basic", which consists of 2 eggs, hash brown, choice of bread, and a cup of Joe. I usually just get an ice latte or their hot "Peru" coffee and both were good. I tried their French toast (3/5 stars) and smoked salmon salad (3/5 stars) which were average. I do recommend Bongo Basic if you want to grab a quick breakfast and coffee. They also offer free Wifi and don't try to rush you out of the door. The patio is also very nice but beware of the dirty chairs.2013/#3

reviews.name: Tonya K.
reviews.review: The worst omelette I have probably ever been served. Stone cold omelette and attitude from every person I encountered working at this location. It's great to be ultra cool when you can back it up with quality, then the pompous grunge wouldn't have bothered me as much. The only thing worth your salty attitude is the coffee, but need a bit more when I spend close to $20 for breakfast.

reviews.name: Amanda A.
reviews.review: Bongo on Belmont: It's like Fido but crappier.I actually had to decide whether I would rate Bongo 2 or 3, but considering they are under the same ownership as Fido, I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt and rounding up. I've been to this location about 4 times. The first time, I had a perfectly lovely experience. Went for brunch with a friend when I first came to visit Nashville before moving here. Sat on the patio in the spring, chatted in the sunshine, etc. etc. The next time, it was less pleasant: the barista was rude and somehow managed to take the order of a person behind me first. (How does that happen?) The third time, I ordered my coffee drink, and the cashier somehow never told the barista what I'd ordered. After waiting more than 10 minutes for my latte (after waiting in line to order), and seeing many people who'd ordered after me getting their drinks and going, I caught the barista's eye and asked about the drink. He hadn't gotten the order at all. He was very apologetic and said something to the cashier, who just stared at him blankly.To be honest, I don't even remember the last time I went. I know I got something and had some experience. I've blocked it out and I haven't gone back. The coffee and the food is good though. If you can run the gauntlet of attitude behind the register.

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: Great food, nice workers, great drinks, and decent outdoor seating make this a good place to study, hangout, or just grab a bite to eat or drink. I had the Gobbler Sandwich  ($7.50 worth the price) - roasted turkey, jack cheese, whole wheat bread, lettuce, tomato, mayo (I skipped that), and mustard. You can have it grilled OR cold. I had it grilled. I had a soup too, but I forget what kind. Great flavor, made for a nice brunch. There were lots and lots of people here and this did slow down the ordering and made finding a seat a little difficult. Not a big deal, but if you are expecting a quiet coffee house, you might be out of luck. (Bring earplugs or closed ear headphones). I had water instead of coffee and there is a small fountain near the cool neon clock for you to use.The Bonjo Java history is a good read. They are the areas oldest coffee shop! Check it out here: bongojava.com/about.phpGet their newsletter and stay up to date on events and items in their online store: bongojava.com/clubbongo.…

reviews.name: Krissy T.
reviews.review: I personally like all the changes. This is the only decent coffee near Belmont and I'm so glad not to have to hold my breath when walking up to the door. Not only does cigarette smoke stink and stick on you for days. it sucks for an asthmatic who is constantly made to walk through it.  Not only has their food improved but their service has improved immensely. Minus one star, I wish the east side one never moved the ambiance is terrible.

reviews.name: A A.
reviews.review: I have lived near Bongo Java for 10 years, and have never gone back in 7 years after an employee told me at a few minutes after seven a.m. that I was going to have to wait for him to finish his cigarette before he would open up.  And I smoke, so I wasn't being a hater.  Besides, who opens at 7 anyway?  After discussing it with someone who knows, they informed me that some people like crappy treatment and that it's part of the ambiance.  Whatever, I can find other places for that, and for coffee, it's not worth it.Since I've gotten older, I also don't like to wait in line in places where there is nowhere for a line to form or to form it with youngsters who fix up and dress themselves to look like they just woke up and got out of bed.  Seems like a lot of work for minimal effect, and I am only willing to enjoy them these days for good music; my fault, not theirs.  I would rather drive to Fivebucks and deal with all the folks in their fashionable workout clothes yacking importantly on their cell phones than ever set foot in Bongo Java again.  That's pretty bad.

reviews.name: Misty S.
reviews.review: I used to be a barista and I have worked in food service for several years. I have been a happy patron of Bongo Java since I was 15. I used to love it. For at least ten years I was a fanatical Bongo supporter. I even had a tee-shirt until I spilled paint on it about three years ago. After today, (I paid and tipped so that I could get my food order and coffee order incorrectly prepared and to be fussed at by the barista, but it is not just today. My coffee hasn't been prepared properly at Bongo in years. I was never an award-winning expert at espresso when I used to make it, but I know from experience it doesn't take a genius to make a good head of foam, just someone who cares. It ticks me off when I am handed my drink and I feel like I could go back there and fix it better myself. They axed my favorite meal, the plain quesadilla. The service is often less than friendly. ) I am NOT going back. Hot and Cold and Fido have not done me this wrong yet, so I'll still go there. But Bongo is out of my life and I'd rather go to Cafe Coco than any of them (though, Hot and Cold has the best ice cream in town, no bones about it. And they make a great iced americano with rosewater mint syrup!) at this point, anyway. Bongo has changed drastically in the last four or five years.I may never come back, but I hope that anyone who works at Bongo might read this review, think about it and make the experiences for the remaining customers better than mine have been for the last few years, especially my experience today!Thank you.

reviews.name: Leslie G.
reviews.review: There was a time (a *dark* time, mind you, one that makes you grit your teeth and get that steely look in your eyes when people ask about it) when I spent more time on the porch at Bongo Java than in my living room. That was, like, three years ago, though, so the useful bits of this review have to be sorted out of the larger legacy of secrets and shame.Let's get the boring stuff out of the way first: Bongo Java is a perfectly competent coffeehouse. They serve a very nice sweet iced tea (get the fruit tea if they have it), an excellent "basic breakfast" for a reasonable price, and some kind of insane coffee that I suspect is spiked with PCP or goofballs or Guatemalan Insanity Peppers or something because whenever I drink it I feel like I need to get into a shouting match with a hobo or wrestle a raccoon for ham scraps or something (no, I'm not a coffee wimp, you jerk, I drink the stuff as if the cold hand of Death itself was tugging at my laptop bag--but I swear there's some sort of bad juju in that coffee). They have wifi and places to sit and terrible music and snotty baristas, so yeah, it's a coffeehouse. Don't go on Saturday or Sunday mornings unless you're fond of waiting in line forever.What sets BJ (lord that's an unfortunate acronym) from other coffeehouses is the massive and well-populated porch, for which I forgive them most of their offenses. As others have noted, the patrons are mostly college-aged hipsters, as you might expect, but there's actually much more variance than that. There's a significant population of chess players who show up every so often to chain-smoke and punch the clock, providing a hypnotic ballet of strategy and vicarious nicotine intake. There are Vanderbilt grad students staring at their laptops in a concerted psychic effort to make their dissertations write themselves. There are off-duty baristas slouching about. And there's always one or two old guys hovering over the whole business. Given the general youth of the clientele, it's a bit strange to see them there all the time.Which leads me to my final point: Bongo Java, despite seeming to be an innocuous, inoffensive coffeehouse, is actually more similar to some kind of monstrous, kelp-besmirched sea creature that, krakenlike, winds its horrible tentacles around you and drags you down into its inky lair. Bongo Java doesn't want your money; it wants your SOUL. It wants you to remain on the porch forever, swilling coffee and talking about obscure movies. The signs are all there:Exhibit A) The business primarily serves an addictive substance (coffee)Exhibit B) This substance is commonly consumed with an additional addictive substance (nicotine)Exhibit C) The coffeeshop is a self-contained unit: since it serves food and drink, and since I suspect that the second floor of the converted house that contains it is still... a house, you could theoretically remain there indefinitelyExhibit D) You can find the same cast of characters there on any day of the week, at any time of the day or nightExhibit E) I strongly suspect that the old folks who can be found at all times on the porch are people who were lured in by Bongo Java and NEVER LEFTSo anyway, yeah. You should probably still go here, because the porch is nice and sunny and sometimes the cats from the neighboring houses come and visit. But don't fall for it if someone offers you some low-protein gruel and a place to crash while you're there.

reviews.name: Kyle C.
reviews.review: One of my favorite places to hang out on the patio, however, the coffee is pretty average at best. Not the best coffee in Nashville by any means. Also, the muffins are pretty bad. I've given them a chance a couple times, each time hoping for the best, but always ending up dry & old tasting. The employees aren't rude, but aren't really friendly either. They just kind of do their job & get on with it. I'm fine with that. I do love coming there in the mornings however to just have a small coffee, sit on the patio, & just relax. There is plenty of seating, inside & out. If you want a relaxing hang with average coffee to just wake you up, I definitely recommend this place. If you want a stellar cup of coffee, probably look elsewhere.

reviews.name: Sean K.
reviews.review: Four stars bc of the bongo basic breakfast but the employees ruin any chance of redemption. I've been here well over 30 times and have yet to experience a polite, friendly, or remotely enthusiastic employee. It's fine if you hate your job and the clientele, but that's not my fault so no need to take your disinterest out on me. A "thank you" is always met with rolling eyes, silence, or a shrug. Plus your coffee tastes like it was run through your kitchen staff's butt crack before serving.

reviews.name: Jonathan E.
reviews.review: 5-star coffee, 4-star food.  today, i'm rounding up!the ethopian here is amazing.  highly recommended.

reviews.name: Shannon J.
reviews.review: I've experienced the full spectrum of emotion (and service) at dear Bongo, and have come away feeling pretty 50/50 about the place. But despite my own personal feelings, here are a few highlights. FOOD: Always fresh, never ONCE had a problem. All of their bagel bombs and sandwiches are nom-worthy and their daily soup specials are 90% of the time outstanding. You do sometimes get that eyebrow-raising one passing through. If you're not sure if you'll be a fan of the soup, they give you a free sample. My recommendations would be the Bongo Basic for breakfast (the hash browns are just....so....good), the turkey pesto wrap, the gobbler, the new chicken salad sandwich (with fresh dill!) or a bomb. Be careful with the toasted bread...I always manage to scrape up the roof of my mouth when I eat the toasted sandwiches. Is that just me? Do I have a defect? Oh, and they carry Las Paletas Gourmet Popsicles. Need I say more?COFFEE: I've never been a fan of coffee black. If I'm given the option of a latte, I'll take it. With that said, their Irish cream latte is my absolute favorite coffee drink. Not just here - anywhere. That's high praise, Bongo. Fido in Hillsboro Villiage just got rid of their Irish cream syrup, so Bongo is getting a lot more of my business now. This latte iced is - dare I say it - almost more delicious than its hotter version. SERVICE: I like what another reviewer wrote about the service here: maybe some people like being treated like crap. And that pretty much sums it up. Maybe it's because they get a tick-inducing mix of music industry execs and college students. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. But - befriend one barista and you gain the world. AMBIANCE: The music is pretty loud, and the selection is a serious hit-or-miss. When Passion Pit or the Beatles come on, I give a nod of approval. As much as I love Mew, I'd rather not sit through their album while trying to pound out a paper that's due the next morning. There are a lot of nooks and crannies in the back and one table upstairs that give plenty of privacy if desired.CROWD: This place is an exhibit of hipsters in their natural habitat. Usually they won't bother you if you don't bother them, but you'll stick out like the yuppie you try so hard to not be when you pull your PC out of your bright purple L.L. Bean backpack. I switched to a Mac and started carrying a dirty over sized messenger bag just to stop the staring. All right, I exaggerate, but only a little. The front porch has turned into a general smoking section now that Belmont banned smoking campus-wide. If you'd like to enjoy your coffee smoke free, I recommend sitting indoors. The crowd volume can be seriously overwhelming during peak *cough - school - cough* hours and seasons, so try visiting during the summer or school breaks; the crowd dwindles to an almost normal volume.If you prefer a certain noise or service level, maybe wait until your preferences change to try the food and coffee. But if you're a foodie and could care less about much else, then Bongo is your new best friend.

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: Breakfast was very good, 2 eggs over easy with Hash Browns and Sourdough toast.Good Coffee and the employees were very kind.  I was looking for the English Muffin with the likeness of Elvis in it and was informed that they have a Cinnamon Bun with the likeness of Mother Teresa, very spiritual ! Pets are welcome on the deck outside.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: When I first started going to Bongo Java (14 years now?), it was the sort of place where people struck up conversations with random strangers, played chess on the front porch, drugs were dealt in the back room by employees and the coffee slingers were occasionally baked.  They had signs up everywhere about no outside food or beverage and had to shoo away the broke coffee-beggers.  The bathroom was a place to be feared, and the Nun Bun reigned supreme.I left for a while.  I moved back and the place, as far as I can tell, is a bunch of people on laptops sipping on lattes eating food that really has not changed much, other than price, from the beginning.  I saw reviews down a bit saying this is the place for counter-culture, but I start to wonder what counter culture war is being waged there... the counter talk-to-strangers war?  The counter be in a public space and act as though you're connected to that space and time war?  At least when I've seen it lately it's just a Starbucks with a slightly lower class of SUV driver and last year's Macbook pro.This may sound like I'm complaining, but I'm not.  Times change and places change.  Bongo has become gentrified, and that saddens me a bit.  The coffee still tastes burned to me every other time I go, but it's decent.  The special drinks, ok... the food, it is ok, pricey for just ok though.The line still queues out the door due to poor planning on placement of the counter.  New people there only need to know you wait for your drink near the counter and take your flag for any food.I miss my old Bongo Java, but times they change and so do your old haunts.  The place is now perfect if you want to go, open up a laptop and be antisocial in public while drinking pretty good coffee and eating ok food at a place that used to scare decent folk out.  If you're looking to find a place to drop off your 16 year old multi-tattooed kid, this isn't it anymore.Um, so yeah, I recommend this place if that were not evident through my nostalgia and dislike of the laptop people.

reviews.name: Nigel H.
reviews.review: Great stuff! Had the iced Mochahontas, as recommended by a friend, and it was incredible! Nice and friendly staff too!

reviews.name: Jeffrey M.
reviews.review: To say that I love this place would be an understatement.Staff is friendly and welcoming, coffee is great at the store and if you buy a bag and take it home.All around couldn't be happier with Bongo Java.

reviews.name: Elyse B.
reviews.review: Oh Bongo....where to start. First, I go here too much to give it less then 5 stars. The place is usually pretty packed, when it isn't i'm pretty surprised. Holiday weekends is the only time I see it dead, when all the college kids head back home for that week or so. Bongo is located directly across the street from Belmont college, so it seems to be the hang out spot before class, after class, instead of class....all that. Bongo is one of those coffee shops where the same people hang out, so as I head to there, I usually know i'm going to run into someone I know. But its kind of a nice feeling, its its own little community.Now the atmosphere is awesome. They hang local artwork, and have a great outdoor porch, with huge trees as shade. The coffee and food is all great. Im a fan of the Pesto Bagel Bomb, Fancy grilled cheese or the breakfast bagel.  I've tried many things on the menu, and never have I been disappointed. The staff is so friendly, and they know what they are doing. You know those coffee shops where everyone works good together, well.....with how busy Bongo can get with the line out the door, the staff here works so well together, that the waits are never too long, food always gets out pretty fast, and the specialty coffee drinks are always on point.

reviews.name: Shannon P.
reviews.review: Love the laid back, come as you are vibe here.  I only had coffee here - no food so I can't comment on the food, but the coffee, the people, and the atmosphere here are super.  You can opt to sit inside or out.  Would be a great place to sit and get work done....love it!

reviews.name: Kathy T.
reviews.review: Ack - I was more than a little disappointed with this establishment after experiencing some great coffee joints in and around Nashville.  I ordered a latte and received an extremely weak cup of tepid milk.  My "breakfast sandwich" consisted of a dry, barely heated english muffin with a rubbery egg slapped on top (no sauce whatsoever).  The tables were sticky and visibly dirty.  And the bathroom is unisex, unkempt and up a small flight of stairs (what ever happened to handicap-accessible?).  We won't be back.

reviews.name: Leonard S.
reviews.review: Well, my fiancé and I have been here before and have had a great experience. However on our return, we got the hummus plate again; apparently they changed the recipe to a very spicy version and didn't think that was important information. Not such a big deal, but when we asked if we could change it for something else the waitress gave a slight attitude. We asked for a sandwich instead and the woman asked what side we wanted. We chose the salad, but when the food came to the table we got chips and salsa instead. I said we ordered the salad and that same waitress shrugged her shoulders and said "I thought you said chips and salsa" and then just walked away with a smirk. I think this will be the last time we come here. The food is ok, nothing special, but the service was awful!

reviews.name: Pire T.
reviews.review: This place is cramped and dirty. Their coffee is also very poor quality.

reviews.name: Joanna F.
reviews.review: I came here quite often as a Belmont student. I usually came here to have breakfast or coffee with a friend. Every now and then, I'd come here to study, and though it can be quite loud, I was able to get a lot done. The food is like Fido since it's owned by the same group. The only brew I like to get if it's available is the Mystic Brew (Dark Roast). They do have a quite a list of coffee drinks, which are not too bad. I've had the granola, which was sooo tasty. Granola + Strawberries & Bananas + Soy Milk = So filling and yummy. I've also had their vegetarian burrito. It was filled with beans, peppers, onions?, and salsa. It was big and filling and tasty. Costs about ~$7. The staff is so friendly. They have an upstairs too and do have shows there occasionally. The patio is fun to sit at when the weather is nice. Usually when I'm outside, I end up talking to random people. Smoking is only allowed outside. If you're looking for parking, either park on the road or in the back.Like I said, it can be pretty loud with everyone's conversation. Sometimes the line is long to order which makes it difficult 'cause there isn't that much room there in the first place.There are so many different kinds of people that go there.  Lots of college kids especially during the school year. I give it 3 stars, 'cause I don't have that feeling that draws me to a place. Ya know what I'm talking about?

reviews.name: Nathan F.
reviews.review: Just what we needed!After a rough Friday night in Nashville we needed a good meal and a good strong cup of coffee.  We walked in and the first thing I noticed was the long line in a small space which made me think "we came to the right place!" With the time standing in line we had plenty of time to look over the menu, everything sounded so delicious but I finally decided on the southwestern breakfast burrito (Cant' remember the actual name of it) When it came out it was huge!! I wasn't sure that I was going to be able to finish but I was a champ and powered through it with no problem as it was the most delicious thing I put in my mouth that morning.  For some reason I thought I needed a coffee that morning, even though I'm not a big coffee drinker.  I just ordered it black and it was the strongest coffee that I have ever had......still didn't do much for my hangoverThe staff was super friendly and the clientele was pretty much what you would expect of a coffee shop.  With 2 rooms there was plenty of seating inside, I just wish that it would have been about 10 degrees warmer so we could have sat outside in the sun.  I don't know that I would go back on my next Nashville visit as I'm all for trying new places but if I lived in the area I would definitely become a weekend regular

reviews.name: Ali B.
reviews.review: People watching here is quite possibly my favorite Nashville pastime.

reviews.name: Samantha joelle A.
reviews.review: While I never felt I was trendy enough to hang out at Bongo, I always found myself here getting coffee before class, meeting groups for class projects, hanging out with close friends over a hot cup of tea. I used to frequent this place because it was so convenient when I went to Belmont. Now I come because I love it so much, and it brings back great memories. The coffee is great, I personally prefer a hot or iced Chai (depending on the time of year), but the "P-Diddy" peppermint mocha is pretty damn good too. I also love the apple pie, which is basically hot cider with whipped cream, which is perfect during the fall weather. While most people come just for the coffee, their food is worth trying. The breakfast sandwiches are awesome, along with everything else I've ever tried there. I love hanging out at Bongo on a beautiful sunny morning, sitting on the patio, sipping a drink, people watching. Its definitely one of my favorite places to simply chill in Nashville. I also love running into old Belmont friends and teachers on occasion. All in all, Bongo has a great vibe for all types of people, and I would choose it over Starbucks any day.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: The patio at this Bongo Java location is a delightful spot to hang out or to setup shop as your pseudo office for a couple of hours. Sure, the people watching can be distracting but the open air and casual layout equates to sheer happiness. Coffee is Bongo's fortay but I happen to be smitten with the Spicy Bean Burger ($7). The toasted bread makes such a big difference! I chose the side salad this time to accompany but really wanted the hashbrowns...pretty nifty deal for the price. The veggie sausage is also a great pick from the breakfast menu which is served all day.I happen to like my coffee black but for those who are adventurous, the specialty coffee menu is what dreams are made of. I order the Bounty which is espresso stirred into brewed coffee. Intense eh? If you dig apple cider, the Apple Pie is pretty scrumptious too. Depending on the time of the day, this area can be pretty congested due to it practically being on Belmont's campus. Parking can be a pain but totally worth the hassle.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: I prefer Bongo Java over Fido's because of their deck - the sparse tables outside Fido's are always filled up. And not as hipster-y, in my opinion.

reviews.name: Nicholas F.
reviews.review: I really really enjoy this place. It's usually bustling with young collegiate and while it is often hard to find a good place to sit the coffee is worth a trip in. Big outdoor patio space right up to the sidewalk makes it very inviting. ONE time, though, I was literally kicked off the premises for carrying in a Smoothie King drink. Alright, dude, I get it, no outside food or drink. Chiiiill

reviews.name: Amy O.
reviews.review: Good coffee, a bit pricey, slow internet, but a great porch area for nice fall afternoons!

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: Great coffee.  You pay for what you get.  They have some really good specials.  Only 24 hr coffee place in Nashville.  Staff is very friendly.  They are certainly swamped with the Vandy undergraduate population.  The big patio but there is often someone playing an instrument out there, which I don't always want to listen to.  Can be pretty noisy and it is usually packed with people.  They do have bands from time to time in the back and then it's VERY noisy.  Not what you want when you need to work. Way past what noise-cancelling headphones can do.  Only 3 or 4 spots in their parking lot that you won't get towed for parking in.  Otherwise it's street parking.

reviews.name: Valerie C.
reviews.review: My friend was interviewing at Belmont and having visited Fido earlier that morning (and freakin LOVING it!), I thought I'd give Bongo a shot.  The sun was beginning to peek out from behind the clouds and the temperature was slowly creeping well into the 80's. I was still caffeinated from my earlier session at Fido, so I decided on a salad with chicken salad (yes, that's how I ordered it) and an iced tea. I enjoyed my meal situated at a table in the outdoor seating section of the cafe. The building appeared to be an old home, which was fitting because the place emanates a homey feel!

reviews.name: HaileyTIffany M.
reviews.review: This place is like Fido, but with an outdoor porch, and a lingering B.O. odor inside  every single time I've been in there. The workers have the same "I am barely tolerating you, Earthling, please be gone from my world," type of vibe. Which is what I expect from all hipster coffee shops.  I don't want some cornfed smiler serving me indie coffee. But the B.O. odor is so truly bad that I just don't go here unless someone insists on meeting here. The food is total meh- no favorites after many visits. Whatever. Sorry, Bongo. I wanted to like you, cause I know everybody is totally in love with you. But not me. I think you smell, and I'm secretly gonna leave some deodorant in your gym locker after recess tomorrow!

reviews.name: Amber R.
reviews.review: This place used to be my favorite spot in Nashville. But they sold out. The owners renovated the building, made it nonsmoking, and increased the prices. If I wanted to go to an overpriced, pretentious coffeshop I'd go to Barista Parlor or Fido. Bongo Java Belmont was great because it had character, everyone was welcome. I understand that they felt the students/smokers might be deterring other customers from coming in and thus altered it to make those other customers feel more welcome. But they ousted a lot of regulars with this change. The food is still great. The coffee is the same as before.They have great fall special drinks.  This review is more in response to the way the vibe and feel of the coffeeshop changed with the renovations.

reviews.name: Benson C.
reviews.review: It's not surprise to see this place crowded all the time.  From morning til night, this place is always bustling with people.  The coffee here is great, especially if you live nearby and refuse to drive further for a national coffee chain. Bongo Java has one of the best coffees in Nashville.  The grilled cheese made my morning on one school day.  I couldn't believe grilled cheese could taste that great!  And their locally baked muffins are pretty good.  Those usually get delivered in the mornings and by the afternoon and evening, it's pretty difficult to find any muffins by the end of the night.   What's even better is the free wi-fi!  Which makes it awesome for the nearby Belmont University students.    The staff here are great and treat their customers well every time I visit here.  And makes an awesome place to hangout during the summer with the outdoor seating, underneath the filtered shade from the trees.   The only complaint I have is the small cramped bathrooms.    But overall, I would come here to study if it was 24 hours, or if any of their sister companies were 24 hours.

reviews.name: Ashwin M.
reviews.review: Good coffee, lots of hanging art, loosely pinned papers indicating music events and a snobbish Mac toting crowd that is absently pecking on their keyboard, sipping and flipping open their iSomethings every now and then perfectly defines Bongo Java. It's an offshoot of the main one in E. Nashville, but a much needed addition if one is going to thwart the Starbuckification of the city. More power to local coffee shops!

reviews.name: jana n.
reviews.review: The best coffee shop in Nashville.  I think it was the only one when I lived there.  I remember the nun-bun.  I think someone tried to steal it once.I went to poetry readings here and every now and then they had live entertainment.    I miss ya.

reviews.name: Megan C.
reviews.review: Located across from Belmont and the (original and current) home of the 'nun bun,' Bongo Java is a great place to grab a latte.  They've got a nice listing of specialty beverages and of course can make you anything that you invent.  Food is very similar to Fido (same company), so I'm quite a fan of the muffins and baked goods.  Haven't actually eaten any of the hot food at this establishment.  Crowd tends to be eclectic...tatoos and Toms to college students in sweatpants taking up a lot of table space and studying.  The inside area isn't huge and sometimes it's difficult to get a seat.  Bongo Java has a most excellent porch/patio though, so it's nice to sit outside on pretty days and people watch.  There is also a small theatre upstairs, I actually went to an improv comedy show here once that was super fun, so that's something else to check out if you hear of an event happening.

reviews.name: Anne F.
reviews.review: As a Belmont student, Bongo Java is the most convenient place on Earth.  It's always been a haven for the smokers both pre and post the tobacco ban on campus. The porch is an ideal place to spend a sunny morning or afternoon, and the cozy interior is ideal for rainy days. Either way, you'll most likely run into someone you know. If you're looking to make new friends, make a b-line for the community table in the middle of first floor. While the coffee doesn't necessarily excite me, their eclectic mug collection never fails to entertain and the caffeine gets the job done. Here you can find the best deal for a hearty breakfast - a mere $5 for toast, hash browns, 2 eggs the way you like them, and a cup of coffee. Later in the day I'd lean towards the fancy grilled cheese - tomato, mozzarella and pesto make for a killer combination - topped off with a side of chips and salsa.  With an "after-hours theater" upstairs, it's even a good place for a slice of night life. Considering Bongo, as it's affectionately nicknamed, was the first local coffee shop in town, it comes as no surprise that it's my go-to shop.

reviews.name: Mandy L.
reviews.review: Hip, organic flair with good and strong coffee-what more do you need? I just had a tastey warm beverage but the mister ordered a sammie and salad-which comes with their homemade dressing that was very hippie in essence and divine. Overall I enjoyed the clean tastey experience but the mister likes ranch so for him it was a bit granola. :)

reviews.name: Mark M.
reviews.review: Solid coffee shop. Tends to be full of colleges kids but whatever. Food and coffee are alway good. Recommended.

reviews.name: Lindsay M.
reviews.review: Great chocolate cake and cappuccino.  Perfect place to study for hours on end.

reviews.name: K C.
reviews.review: This is a destination for me when I am in the area, for sure!!  Great coffee shop across from Belmont with excellent food.  Service is always great and seems to be always busy. Great selection of beans, single origin coffee, and the staff has a passion for the place. Great breakfast sandwiches!!

reviews.name: Benjamin H.
reviews.review: If you're in nashville and you like coffee, then you probably have already been to bongos before. Probably the best coffee shop in town. Great drinks and a friendly place where many a college student come to get their fix. Fido is also great, and is run by the owner of bongo as well. Although the drinks differ at each place. At bongo, i love the icy samoan, and at fido the rollover is like a dream. Get off your butt and try either place if you never had!

reviews.name: Nathan L.
reviews.review: Nice outdoor patio area, good coffee as with most Bongo locations. No prices on the menu which I find distasteful. Good menu options though, and nice location.The internet connection is pretty bad, which I've come to expect from Bongo coffee shops. Just over 1MB down and 0.5MB up.  And it drops from time to time. Sprint's 4G coverage here is better, giving me just under 2MB down and 0.6MB up.

reviews.name: Jesse W.
reviews.review: The food was decent, service was mediocre at best. It took 15 minutes to get a simple bagel. The drink selection is decent but the staff and atmosphere is a little tight.

reviews.name: Elizabeth K.
reviews.review: Crowd: Packed with students, fine. NOT always the best place to put your head down and work.Food: It'll do, decently sized menu.  They run out of stuff (like the good bagels, oatmeal, etc), ALL THE TIME.  Annoying.Patio: Super nice.Staff: Hit or miss (On attitude, service, etc).Coffee: Not my favorite.  Kind of don't like it, but it is there, and I need a daily fix. Their iced coffee ALWAYS makes me feel weird but I ALWAYS want iced coffee.They do an a-ok job.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: My husband and I ducked in here to wait out the rain and revive ourselves after an afternoon window shopping.  I enjoyed the chai tea from a tea bag and my husband enjoyed the chai tea from a concentrate.  Staff was nice, artwork on the walls was fun, and the food looked high quality.

reviews.name: Gabriel H.
reviews.review: Very cool coffee shop. Had the Bounty (basically a red eye, brewed coffee with an espresso shot).  Had a very cool atmosphere with very nice art. Also had an awesome deck outside to sit and drink your coffee on.

reviews.name: Aaron D.
reviews.review: Not my scene, but folks who like a counter-culture vibe (tattoos and 'tude) will feel right at home.Decent eats (granola with yogurt - probably one of the healthiest things I've eaten recently in Nashville), but my wife wasn't impressed with her french toast.Didn't try the coffee so can't comment on that. The clientele didn't seem all that courteous. Lots of young 'uns sprawled out at tables with feet on opposite chair (one of my pet peeves). Unfortunately we had the misfortune of sitting next to the loudest and wildest table of 'mature' backgammon players in the world. Seriously, is it the norm to whoop and holler when playing backgammon in a crowded cafe?

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: This place is extremely popular, and for good reason.  The first I went (with my wife and two sons), the place was very crowded, even in the summer.  Somehow the service still shockingly fast.  Coffee was smooth and tasty, but the Mocha I had very little chocolate flavor.  Wife had Chai, and thought was great.  She also had smoked salmon and she loved it.  Despite the fact that we could barely find seats, we still had a great coffee experience On my second trip, coffee very smooth but also rich.  The iced mocha was pleasantly sweet, but still not strong on chocolate flavor.  As I thought he would be hungry, I decided to share an order of French toast with son.  The verdict: very good.  Addition of strawberries and banana was a nice touch along with the excellent french toast and good syrup.  The was service still lightning fast, so much so that my food came out before my drink was done being prepared.For excellent service, very tasty food, good coffee, and very good wifi, Bongo Java in the Belmont area should be on your short list coffee houses in Nashville.

reviews.name: M V.
reviews.review: The good: outside patio.  The bad: RUDE STAFF (Yes, it's getting even worse), slow internet, DIRTY TABLES and cigarette ASHES on most of the patio tables, peeking in the kitchen frightened me (look for yourself).  But most of all, the staff have been incredibly offensive.  I live nearby and won't bother returning.  This local customer has had enough.  Will review again in 6 months.

reviews.name: Lauren E.
reviews.review: Being a Vanderbilt student, hanging around campus, the atmosphere can get a little boring. Then I found Bongo Java. It's filled with many Belmont students and artsy locals, some families, as well. This is the home of Bongo Java roasting company, which makes the delicious coffee served there and at Fido's. The tables are unique, and decorated in a very fun manner. As in many other Nashville coffee shops, they have free wi-fi, so many people are sitting there with laptops. There's both indoor and outdoor seating, and a little upstairs theater area with occasional events. No prices are on the wall, which can be kind of frustrating, but the coffee is great!

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: I went here during a week day and the place was packed with people working, studying and eating at each table. I was able to grab a corner table to work at. Problem is not enough plug ins for your computer. I eventually had to switch tables with a guy who was reading so I could get some electricity for my computer. I had coffee (latte) and it was DELICIOUS! I did not get to eat any food off the menu but based on what I saw, the place looks like they have some good sandwiches and other cafe food.

reviews.name: Nicole D.
reviews.review: A quaint, hidden gem that native Nashvillans love, Bongo Java and Fido has luscious coffees and a delectable menu.My favorite (and very simply) menu item is the Bowl o' Hummus, as it is flavorful, simple, and blends beautifully with a light roast on their patio on a breezy spring day. My kids will eat their own plate, and refuse to share with me - which is a good testament to just how yummy it is! This easy-going, laid-back, cafe is just what the doctor ordered for the simple pleasures in life.

reviews.name: Kelly B.
reviews.review: I really wanted to love this place as much as I love Fido.. but eh just about sums it up. food is eh.. vibe is eh.. and it smelled like an odd mix of paint and chilli (????)however the Mochahontas drink I got was deeeelicious, staff was friendly, and theres free wifi, so I'll go here on the days I feel i've exhausted my other options and crave that yummy cinnamon-y drink again. Oh also, it was nice that they turned on the heat.. is it me or does every other Nashville coffee shop keep the a/c running?! ha.

reviews.name: Nathan K.
reviews.review: Interesting art.  Decent coffee.  Nice staff.  Music isn't as good as Fido.  Nice advantage over Fido is more places to plug-in laptops.  Parking is blah--but thats the area.  I always grab something on the hill next to the International Market.(4.5)

reviews.name: Roy K.
reviews.review: I can't say it better than the rest, def worth a visit. A good vibe coupled with good internet = productive days, however the pace of the place is the only distraction. Uber busy from what I can tell all of the time, thus seats are not a commodity. Good espresso. fair prices. good internet.

reviews.name: Brady O.
reviews.review: I go here quite a bit. I work from home and its just a few blocks away. Good lunch stop - or morning. I buy my coffee beans here. Good atmosphere and the staff is pretty nice. Big mix of people (which is nice). I might give a five star for an expanded menu or if it had a signature item. Always room for improvement.

reviews.name: Heather H.
reviews.review: I stopped in recently to pick up a 1 pound bag of coffee to bring home. They very kindly ground the beans for me and sent me on my way. After months of Maxwell House, imagine my delight upon the aroma of Bongo Java's Ethiopian blend. The coffee is roasted just right; a bitter cup has never been brewed. It's my new Saturday morning staple.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: I love getting coffee here, and sometimes tea depending on the day, but the place does get crowded.
