I can't say I blame the Belmont students that frequent it, I probably would have lived there during my college days had I attended here. I do enjoy sitting outside of this place to people watch the groups coming in and out. With all the people it's a chore that could go on for hours if I let it. I do tend to watch the baristas work, even when they're too busy to get me at the moment. They're always nice. I think the prices are very fair considering how great they are, the Bongo beans are always roasted perfectly and you can tell in their coffee.  I'd much rather drive across town to exclusively Nashville spots like this then go to the Starbucks that is about an eighth of a mile up the road.

reviews.name: Suede S.
reviews.review: Bongo Java is my coffee shop of choice for a few reasons.First, the coffee usually comes out really well.  I haven't had a bad cup yet and that is my number one priority when getting coffee.  The food also is good.  I have only had the breakfast food, but it hasn't disappointed.  The hashbrowns are crispy yet somehow full of grease.  There is nothing like stumbling in there after a hard friday night and having the greasy soak up all the booze that is left in my stomache.I enjoy the music selections.  They vary quite a bit so I always find that there is something to enjoy in them.  The only real downsides is that it does get pretty crowded and there aren't many laptop plugs.

reviews.name: Matthew S.
reviews.review: My favorite coffee spot in Nashville. It may not stack up with what some other cities have to offer, but it is the best we have around here. It fits in perfectly with the neighborhood. The vibe is just really right for this kind of place. The drinks are good, the breakfast is delicious, and you can't help feeling like you are part of something when you are there. They have rotating displays of local artists on the walls. They have a comfortable inside and a great deck. The staff is as laid back as they come. My favorite drink on a hot day is the Icy Samoan!It is truly refreshing to see a cafe that doesn't take itself too seriously.

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: My only complaint about this location of Bongo is that it gets ungodly crowded.  This is to be expected from a coffee shop that is right across the street from Belmont and well-within biking distance from Vanderbilt.  That being said, the Bongo coffee chain is overall a great addition to the Nashville community.  You'll find their beans in coffee shops and restaurants all over town.  It's delicious coffee.  Bongo makes a strong effort to provide organic and free-trade coffees.  The best part of this location of Bongo is the large deck.  It's got a pleasant view of Belmont and the foot traffic around it.  It's a great place to work in the fresh air with just enough distractions to keep you interested.

reviews.name: Eata B.
reviews.review: This joint's alright...internet's slow as what and Americanos are a bit steep...but how many places have both of those things in concert?

reviews.name: Keri M.
reviews.review: I've been going to Bongo Java for about 11 years. Great place to grab coffee and sit on the porch. Food's nothing special but it's not expensive and it's not bad. The major drawbacks are that it's a coffee house, so everyone who comes wants to camp out and it's often impossible to find a table, and the crowd of patrons can be annoyingly pretentious.

reviews.name: Sam D.
reviews.review: I like Bongo. I like the idea behind the entire empire. During the school year, this place is packed from 10 AM until the sun goes down. So, plan accordingly. You'll also probably wait in line to order your latte or cup of joe, too. It's easy to find, so that's good.

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: Stopped by here to grab a coffee and check my email after being in Nash-Vegas for work for the day.  Pulled it up using Yelp mobile, which was very good, and got here and was not disappointed.  OF course, the afternoon weather was picture perfect and what was to be a quick stop turned into a much longer stop with more than one coffee consumed.  Didn't want to hit the (too long) road back to ATL.  Electrical outlets on the outdoor deck were a great addition, and the place inside had plenty of good seating scattered around the nicely renovated old house, with tables scattered around up and down, but not too crowded with people as to be uncomfortable.  Staff friendly and they kept the place clean which was nice for a coffee house in a converted old house next to a university.  Was able to check my emails, reply and relax for a bit before hitting the road.  Definetly a must visit in Nashville!

reviews.name: Courtney B.
reviews.review: When I went to Belmont a few years back, I used to come here all the time.  It's so convenient to the college, and its a perfect place to grab some coffee or tea and do your homework.  They have free Wi Fi even if you're just into relaxing with a warm beverage and updating your brand of social networking site.  I think every group project meeting I had in college either started or ended at Bongo Java.  They're not just about delicious and unique coffee and tea drinks, Bongo Java also serves up some tasty treats.  I love their fresh bagels for breakfast, and you can get bagel sandwiches all day.  Everything just tastes fresh and there's something about a cup of their coffee and a breakfast sandwich to start your day with.  An added bonus is they serve organic and fair trade coffees and are veggie friendly.Don't let its popularity with the college kids scare you away.  Bongo Java is a hit with the entire neighborhood.  Drop in and you'll find people picking up a beverage on their way to the office or on their lunch break and neighborhood moms grabbing a caffeine fix before running errands as well as the college students across the way.  I love their front patio, its one of my favorites in Nashville.  Belmont Boulevard is a little quieter than a lot of the neighboring streets and its very relaxing to kick back with a book or my laptop and enjoy my coffee in peace.

reviews.name: Emma L.
reviews.review: For me, my coffee shop selecting schedule goes like this: Bongo for the day, Fido for the night. The food is good and cheap, and really doesn't normally take super long. I love meeting people here for breakfast, and the people tend to be less obnoxious, more friendly, and more down to Earth (more Belmont kids and music business people, less Hillsboro Village wannabes). People who work here aren't as friendly as those and Fido, and I can hardly imagine befriending any of them, but oh well. They do their job. This place is also better for studying than Fido.The inside is pretty small, but comfortable and cute. Coffee is given to you from behind the counter so it's not as easy to drop 50 cents in the box and get a coffee refill as it is at Fido.Highly suggested: Frozen mocha, big bad hash browns

reviews.name: Declan G.
reviews.review: The inside of Bongo Java gets crowded pretty easily, but outside on the deck and patio, there are plenty of tree-shaded tables.  Most afternoons, the tables inside are too close together and the volume is too high for me to get work done, although the deck outside is a great place to hang out or do some studying.Of course, Bongo Java's organic coffee is exceptionally high quality, and the bagels are good, but the hummus plate leaves something to be desired.  The line can get pretty long, so customers should be prepared to have some patience.  If you have trouble finding parking, just keep driving down Belmont Blvd. away from Magnolia Blvd. - I've always had luck finding a spot across from the church.

reviews.name: John W.
reviews.review: Act globally, drink locally. Nashville's best coffeehouse since 1993, this is the gathering place for all walks of life. You can sit inside at a table hand-painted by a local artist and rub elbows with college students pounding away on their MacBook, or you can enjoy yr coffee alongside chain-smoking hipsters on the city's largest outdoor deck. Also, Bongo Java's coffee is certified 100% organic and fair trade.

reviews.name: Jess R.
reviews.review: loved this place. i went twice in one weekend. the coffee was excellent, and the lattes, even better. i'm pretty particular when it comes to coffee, and was delighted by my experience. i do wish they offered pour over, but that was minor compared to the flavor and creativity of the offerings. additionally, a friend had an issue with her latte (the espresso machine was broken), and the staff made her a new drink right away. the front porch was lovely as well - definitely a five star experience.

reviews.name: Marri M.
reviews.review: Bongo is simply average. The food is good, and fairly reasonably priced. The coffee is not that great, and has a sort of grindy texture. But I think that's a matter of opinion...it is pretty cheap though. I really LOVE their fruit tea, though.If I had to describe I would say grungy/hipster. There's always people here studying/doing work. It's a good place for that..sometimes hard to find seating though. Inside seating is very limited.Also, the staff can be unfriendly and rude at times. They are always in a rush.

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: My favorite cafe in Nashville. This is a great place to study (inside) or visit with friends/meet interesting people (outside on the porch). The coffee and food are good, you can get a decent meal for cheap. The music definitely follows a large range, but never so loud that you can't focus on your work/hear your friends. There is good artwork on the walls as well to entertain you. On top of it all, it's in a great, relaxed and pretty location (right across from Belmont Uni).

reviews.name: Joseph Q.
reviews.review: Great place! Food is always good, coffee is always great, and its never a dull moment.

reviews.name: Lakisha J.
reviews.review: I stopped in this place for my second round of coffee for the morning.  I must say that I've never been in this part of town before even though it's just a street or two over from my main haunts.  Behind Belmont, people jogging and walking their dogs.  Back to the coffee house.  I give them props on the renovated house turned coffee house.  The patio area out front was nice.  The fellas taking my order looked to be the grungy-I'm in a band types but once I placed my order and made some eye contact, they were genuinely nice guys.  I ordered my coffee drink of the day, Cafe Au Lait but here in Bongo Java land it is Cafe O' Lei and their website gives the whole history behind the name.  I really didn't pay much attention to the food items they offered so I couldn't tell you much on that but I did notice the upstairs area, Bongo after hours, it's nice to have a coffee shop that actually has events and things to do when it's past the regular coffee shops bedtime.  I must go back for one of the events and order some food to do a full review.  I perused the area and the main sitting area had more of the usual tables and less of the comfy coziness which is expected from all self-respecting coffee shops.  There was a section in the very back that I didn't walk into so maybe all of the comfy cozy was hiding back there.  The only outdoor area is the front patio area.  Back to the main point of this review, the coffee, they do offer different types of brewed coffee's here.  You can get your coffee brewed in an aeropress, siphon pot, and a host of other ways and I believe that is one ways to tell a true coffee shop who actually has a love affair with it's coffee from those who just want to fill you with drip coffee.  Different brewing methods bring out the different flavors of the coffee.  My coffee was just the perfect blend of coffee and milk and I could actually taste the espresso.  The actual flavors of the coffee were present and not bitter and not overly strong.

reviews.name: Luis O.
reviews.review: Great hangout, and a place I go to when I want to really focus and study.  The surrounding area is really peaceful, and makes you forget that you are actually in a fairly large city.  My favorite drink is the Iced Single shot vanilla.  I had some of their food a while back, and it was serviceable. Not the best, but if you plan on studying here for a while and don't want to go down to subway or the Asian restaurant across the street, its a decent choice.

reviews.name: D.T. B.
reviews.review: Had lunch here and a nice iced chai.  Okay for quick, simple bite.  Great atmosphere and nice, speedy service.

reviews.name: Gia V.
reviews.review: Bongo Java is a great place to hang out, study, smoke a cigarette and enjoy a great cup of coffee. When I say great cup of coffee, I don't just mean that by my own personal taste. When coffee is evaluated, it's given something called a "cupping score". The perfect cupping score is 100 and most great coffee is a 90 or 85. Bongo scored a 95. Not to mention, the price is great! It's a lot cheaper than Starbucks and they have just as many frilly drinks on the menu. There can be a long wait at the busy points of the day when music industry people and Belmont students line up to try and grab a cup of coffee before the next meeting or class. Once you get your coffee, you can enjoy it outside on the fantastic wooden porch and enjoy Belmont Blvd or inside and enjoy the local art that's hung on the walls. Bongo is home to a lot of Nashville artwork. Every few months the paintings on the walls change to showcase another local artist. Even the tables inside were painted by local artists. Besides coffee and a great hang-out spot, Bongo has a little theater upstairs. It's small and quaint. Unplugged shows, stage play readings, etc. are held there on the weekends and sometimes throughout the week. Bongo is easily my favorite cafe in Nashville.

reviews.name: K M.
reviews.review: I had a little trouble deciding on a rating since I'm not familiar with coffee shops in Nashville.  Something tells me this is probably the best, and so I will give it the 5 stars :) First off, so very cute- I loved that as we were coming up the steps, people were eating on the patio in February, dogs in tow.  It also helped that we scored a parking spot right in front- that doesn't happen in Chicago, well, EVER.  There really was a wide range of people hanging out, particularly for a Friday mid-morning- and we could overhear lots of interesting discussions going on as well.  They had some very tasty sounding coffee drinks, and I had a lot of trouble deciding on one- this to me earns a coffee shop high marks right off the bat.  While there's not a lot of choices in the food - hey what can you expect at a little cafe right?- what was offered was really good; I had a breakfast burrito dish that came with great hashbrowns, and it was totally satisfying.  I wish I could have gone back for another round and hung out a bit, but alas, as I was a tourist, we had to move on.  Staff sesemed friendly enoughThis reminds me of places I loved to hang out and read in my college days.  I would highly recommend this to anyone, tourists or locals alike (ok who am I to give recommendations to the locals :))  This was one of the highlights of our trip to Nashville, definitely stood out in terms of quality and ambience (is that bad? oh well!)

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: Everybody loves this place and it's easy to see why. Depending on when you're here you could end up having breakfast next to Keith Urban and Nicole Kidman or listening to an awesome new band. They also have plays here. Who knew? As for the coffee - I'll take it all - yummy. I love their hashbrowns (the strip kind but way better than Waffle House). The hot cocoa is super too. Parking sucks, but that's a given around Belmont.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: Bongo Java is not only a great spot to grab a cup of coffee (or hot chocolate or tea for those of us that aren't addicted to caffeine) but it also is a great place to just sit around and do nothing. The place does get insanely packed with Belmont students, however, if you can manage to find a table at Bongo Java during the more Zen parts of the day, it's a great place to sit around, or study, or just people watch. I happened to stop in Bongo Java once when they were hosting an Open Mic night a while back, which showcased a really impressive line up of singer songwriters. Parking can be difficult but in general the area is great for the hipster lover in all of us. OH and they also make some great specialtly coffee which has is distributed only Nashville!

reviews.name: Cali L.
reviews.review: Delicious coffee and some sort of fancy popsicles! Colorful decor and energetic music. If I lived here I'd get my caffiine here! Also hilarious coffee sleeves.

reviews.name: Bob F.
reviews.review: The best coffee in town, hands down.  All beans roasted locally...and they only use Fair Trade coffee, so it feels good as well as tastes good!Nice menu of breakfast dishes and sandwiches.  Staff is sometimes a bit grumpy, but still worth the trip.  Free internet wireless, too.

reviews.name: kate c.
reviews.review: This place is a favorite when in Nashville, and the coffee beans to go make a great gift. Bonga Java was affectionately called Bon Jovi's by my friend's parents. The best coffee house in the south.

reviews.name: matt c.
reviews.review: owned by the owner of fido. it's greatest asset is a large wooden porch. the staff can be nice or surly, apparently without rhyme or reason. mixed crowd includes the quasi-elfin, latte-philic belmonters, teachers, locals and a heavy dose of scruffy loafers of no apparent origin or occupation. the art is usually of the naive artsy girl or blind hippie variety which should appeal to art-moms on break from running their shops on 12 south. the line at the counter is often inexpressibly slow. anything with a drop of espresso in it will take 10 minutes at least. however, this place is great for hangover mornings when you are least likely to notice anyone or anything around you and just want some greasy food (egg mcbongos) and mediocre coffee. the wifi is sketchy (often have to reset the router) but there is a free-use net computer whose 15 minute time limit regularly gets ignored.Update: Someone just wrote about flies in their review. I couldn't agree more. What, was Bungled Java built on top of a sacred fly mecca? Maybe it's just that everything is covered in a sticky fly-attracting patina of hippie muck.

reviews.name: Whitney R.
reviews.review: This place is the reason that whenever I smell clove cigarettes, I get violent flashbacks to being thirteen.

reviews.name: Dan C.
reviews.review: ok, there are several good things i could say about this place putting it into the 4-5 star range but in the end none of them matter because this place has FLIES!!! flies are gross, esp when they land on your reasonably priced and reasonable though not amazing but still pretty good-tasting french toast while you are enjoying wifi in an overall comfy non pretentious environment!!!

reviews.name: Jeff C.
reviews.review: Great place to hang out, especially on the porch. Interior furniture could be more comfortable. Coffee and food are weird.Home of the Mother Teresa cinnamon bun.

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: great big shady porch.  fun assortment of breakfast treats; I especially like the egg melt on english muffin.  coffee is good, too.  some of the best people-watching in town.

reviews.name: Daile J.
reviews.review: What a fun place!  Good food. Lots of different wing flavors. Ping pong. Pool. Great live music. So glad we have something like this in the neighborhood now!

reviews.name: Suz J.
reviews.review: The Night Owl is a Hoot. The girl behind the bar was funny and served me a delish Johnny Cash Burger that went well with the cabernet sauvignon I sipped. A young and older crowd of south Nashville folks were into the rocking live music played from the modest stage by three cute wacky musicians. The Cash Burger was worth the $8 and above average for bar fare. I'llbe back sometime to this easygoing community bar for more drinking, music and karaoke. OMY Night Owl Bar & Grill is AOK.

reviews.name: Mark W.
reviews.review: I love the environment! The only thing I would improve in would be the burgers. I ordered just s plain cheeseburger and ended up sending it back twice due to it being burnt and having no flavor. The fries were not salted either. I think this might just be the cook's fault as the owner is cool as hell! All in all, amazing little bar!

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: I have never ate inside this restaurant because we always deliver or pick up... their food is always very good. When just me, I do something simple with chicken and noodles but if I am sharing... my go is usually the Happy Family with extra lo mein and egg rolls.I can say that their prices are always good.  The quality of food is on spot and the portions are ample. This is my ( GO TO ) for Chinese cuisine.... what can I say... I love ME some China Moon !!!

reviews.name: Kyle V.
reviews.review: Great little Chinese takeout. Much better than many of the other one's I've tried. If you are looking for your simple Chinese takeout fix, don't pass this one up!

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: I was looking for something quick and easy tonight. I found China Moon online, and decided to give it a try. I was impressed with how easy their online ordering system was. I ordered and left right away to go pick it up -- it was ready when I got there (aprx. 10 mins). The staff was very friendly, and the food far exceeded my expectations. I'll be back!

reviews.name: Keith G.
reviews.review: Great food, cheap prices, and quick, friendly service!  I order here pretty frequently.  They usually have my food done in 10-15 minutes, if even that long.They have made special requests for me as well (General Tso's Tofu), though it took longer than usual to make.TIP:  Their hot oil / chili sauce is SUPER spicy.  If you love spicy food (like me), the 25c charge is worth it.

reviews.name: Charles S.
reviews.review: Meh. That's a pretty good explanation of my feelings towards China Moon. They do some things well, some things not so well, like many Americanized-Chinese-by-the-numbers takeout joints. Pluses:+They have steamed/fried pork dumplings, and for takeout, they're pretty good.+Mai Fun noodles are never overcooked and they are quite generous with their portion, especially when considering the low price.+Shrimp Tempura is delicious+Spend over $15 and they give your 2 free egg rolls, over $25 and you get a free order of crab rangoon+They DELIVER (although I usually go pick it up)Minuses-General Tso's is pretty sweet, and light on the broccoli-Lo Mein noodles have been overcooked more times than not. -Last time I was in, their health score had gone down 11 points (to an 87), and they use the front area as a storage/eating/tiny daughter sleeping area, which can be a bit off putting. -Also off-putting, on my last visit there was a  half pan of some sort of offal sitting, unrefrigerated, on one of the dining room tables. The staff is friendly, but I usually only order from there if I'm craving one of their pluses or feeling particularly lazy. I haven't gotten sick from their food, so at least there's that.

reviews.name: Hanna H.
reviews.review: I'm embarrassed to say we wanted cheap Chinese food last weekend. So that's out there now. We didn't really know of a place in our area so we came to Yelp for recommendations. It was nice you could see their menu and order online for pick up. We ordered chicken lo mein, general tso's, hot and sour soup and got the two free egg rolls with a $15 purchase. We ordered our meals medium spicy. The food wasn't ready when we went to pick it up. They actually had not seen the order sitting on their printer. Thankfully my husband is a very patient man so no biggie. The portions were generous for the low prices but our entrees were not spicy at all. Overall the food was good for what we were after and we will probably try it again if the cheap Chinese food mood strikes us again.

reviews.name: Jaime R.
reviews.review: YUP 5 stars! only because it was exactly what i wanted. went in on a Friday night, ordered at the counter. Awesome part: lady at counter spoke great english(not being facetious either). GREAT prices on food. Portions LARGE! i was told food would be ready in 10 minutes, food ready in 8 and EXACTLY how i requested it. A lot of shrimp in the fried rice=:) Friendly staff at a great little (american)Chinese food place. will return. Now..only if traffic were better in this stretch of nolensville rd. *shrugs*

reviews.name: Nicole M.
reviews.review: No stars soggy over cooked noodles. Hot and sour soup. Should have been call hot and not sour soup. I shouldn't have to spice up a soup that is already spicy. Will I eat here again nope I will not.

reviews.name: Rena S.
reviews.review: Excellant for a strip mall restaurant. They had no problem with our special orders and everything was delicious.

reviews.name: Mary H.
reviews.review: FABULOUS!!!!! I had the crab Rangoon (yummmmm), egg drop soup (not watered down and had flavor), and the sesame chicken (double yummmmm)!!!! They delivered within the time frame they gave  me (40-45 mins) and was the food was quality for the affordable price ($15)!  I will definitely call China Moon again!

reviews.name: G P.
reviews.review: I called in my carry out order at 11am and was told it would be ready in 10 minutes. I arrived to pick it up at 11:30 and had to wait 20 minutes to actually walk out the door with it.

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: I tried China Moon for the first time last night and they did a great job. First of all, I placed my order online and my food was ready when I went to pick it up about 25 minutes later.  It was still nice and warm.  The staff was very friendly and likeable.  I had Kung Pao Chicken, Wonton Soup, Fried Rice, and Wontons and all the food was very good.  I was impressed that the Kung Pao Chicken was actually spicier than I expected. I love spicy food but most places don't make the food spicy and hot enough for me.  When I want Chinese take in the future, I'm going to China Moon.

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: I order from here all the time...best service and food around for this cuisine. They serve the absolute best crab Rangoon.

reviews.name: Southern W.
reviews.review: I've been a faithful customer of this place for a decade.  Their food used to be extremely good and tasty.  However, the last several times I've been, the food has been different.  It's not as good as it once was.  The quality has definitely gone down.  The meat was once large chunks are now tiny bits and the sauces are not as good.  The Generl Tso's is not as spicy either.  I'm very disappointed in China Moon.  And I think it's time for me to find a new Chinese restaurant here in Nashville.

reviews.name: George M.
reviews.review: Great place for take out.  Great food fast service.

reviews.name: Kiran G.
reviews.review: I always order chicken friend rice for 3$. They make it spicy on my request. I love it. Cheap and best to keep it simple. They deliver but they have a minimum (i think 15$..plz check with them). Nice little place.

reviews.name: Nathan C.
reviews.review: There are many burgers in Nashville.  There are your standard thick backyard BBQ style meat monsters and your thin, shake shack style burgers. In my opinion,  the best kind of burger is made of ground meat that hasn't been smashed into the griddle. This way, the burger has an much larger surface area to crisp and brown and the cheese melts into the the cracks. Electric Sliders has perfected this style of burger (ahem, slider.) I tried all six sliders. Get the All American to try this ultimate experience, but you can't go wrong with any of the choices. The chicken slider is impossible tender and flavorful and the fig and goat cheese slider is like dessert between two buns.

reviews.name: Jared K.
reviews.review: We found the Electric Sliders truck at the Adventure Science Center's July 4th "Red, White & Blue" fireworks-viewing party. Score!Sliders can be a little boring, but the folks at Electric Sliders have put some serious innovation into their menu. With ingredients like apple-almond-fig jam, sriracha mayo, and lemon-herb cheddar cream cheese, these mini-burgers are anything but boring. Everything on the menu sounded great, but I ended up ordering a Two-Slider Combo with the Piggy Stardust and the Disco Demi.Their Piggy Stardust slider is stacked high with pulled pork, pimento cheese, fried pickled onions, and a bourbon-balsamic barbecue sauce on a brioche bun. Although the pulled pork wasn't as smoky as it could have been, it was certainly smokier than I expected it to be. It was also seasoned well, but I would have liked some bark in the mix. The fried onions added a great crunchy texture, while the pimento cheese gave it a nice creaminess. The barbecue sauce was more like a bourbon-balsamic vinaigrette, and I liked that much better.Despite its all-beef patty, the Disco Demi is a far cry from the standard cheeseburger. It's got sharp cheddar, pickled onions, arugula, white truffle vinaigrette, and a rosemary demi glace on brioche. Yum! The beef patty was delicious with an awesome sear on it, and the melty sharp cheddar was a perfect pairing. The pickled onions and arugula gave this burger a good crunch and a great flavor. The white truffle also made things super tasty, but I didn't catch any rosemary. Regardless, I liked it a lot.I made a huge mess of myself with these sliders, but it was totally worth it.

reviews.name: Shane C.
reviews.review: I don't like to eat tomatoes but when i do its on a BB&J from Electric Sliders.  And this is a specialty burger. Its unbelievable bacon jam tangy blue cheese & perfect jalepeno spice. The Bus stop burger and the sauce is an out of site sweet bbq peppery mix.  You cant go wrong with Chef Zac serving you sliders

reviews.name: Ryan C.
reviews.review: Some of the best sliders I've ever had!! Super friendly employees! Great taste and reasonable prices.

reviews.name: Meg B.
reviews.review: Wow! Talk about great food! Would recommend without hesitation. They catered a corporate lunch and did an excellent job.  Staff was not only friendly and efficient but knows their ingredients!

reviews.name: Maria P.
reviews.review: Super fast delivery. Exceptional sandwiches every time! I live downtown and Jimmy Johns is a must at least once a week for me. I've always been super pleased with this location. I normally have specific instructions for my order, and they always get it right.

reviews.name: Brian B.
reviews.review: After finding Rae's closed and sitting in line at the Frothy Monkey for 5 minutes and not moving an inch, I ended up at Jimmy John's for the first time.  They took my order quickly and made the sandwich just as fast.  I was in and out in probably about 3 minutes.  The sandwich was okay.  Nothing special, but passible.  They win on speed, not taste.

reviews.name: Apryl K.
reviews.review: Ordered #12 Beach Club as follows: Italian Vinaigrette (Extra)add onionsadd oreganoFrench BreadCut in halfmayo (Extra)Receive a dessert dry sandwich. I called the store and the guys say I could come by and let him add it to the sandwich. If I wanted to come to the store I would not have chosen delivery.

reviews.name: Alyssa T.
reviews.review: I used to go here regularly when I worked downtown. Then I found myself pulling a long blonde hair coated in mayonnaise from my mouth after taking a bite of my veggie sandwich. Seeing as how I am Asian, I knew it couldn't be mine. Never went back after that!

reviews.name: F. Daniel K.
reviews.review: I have always enjoyed this Jimmy John's when downtown. Much like most I have frequented while working across the country on assignment, they make great sandwiches (JJs Gargantuan Lettuce Wrap... Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm) and are usually very friendly and prompt even when it is packed and busy. Imagine my joy when I looked on Yelp while working at a friend's house just across the Cumberland and saw they were a little over a mile away.Imagine my disappointment upon calling for delivery they only deliver downtown because the "drivers" are all on bikes. Don't get me wrong. I am not hating on JJs for evolving their practices to suit their particular market. It just seems to me they would advertise said differences a bit more clearly for those who, like myself, expect they would otherwise operate pretty much the same as any other JJs establishment from cost to coast in which I have eaten. Otherwise, this would be a 4 star review. Great choice if you are anywhere downtown. Forget it if you want delivery outside that.

reviews.name: Jeff A.
reviews.review: When they say "freaky fast" they weren't kidding!!! Friendly staff here and pretty consistent with all of the other locations that I've been to.Here is something I did learn on this visit -- you can get ANY sandwich as a lettuce wrap. So of course I had to give it a try. I got my usual (#12 Beach Club) and they did not disappoint. I so love their avocado spread ... pile it on! But I do miss the sprouts that they used to have.Be warned. When they ask if you want a pickle, you will get a WHOLE pickle. I'm thinking I'll get a little pickle spear on the side which is pretty standard at most other places. I could've shared it with 3 other people (& I like pickles).

reviews.name: Tomeshia B.
reviews.review: The customer service was awful in a fashion. My arm is in a brace (severe work injury). I had to wind up bagging my own food while the ever so helpful sandwich(male) maker watched as I struggled. I was mortified! Beforehand I kindly show him my injured arm and he shoves a paper bag at me saying ....here..help yourself. I'm never  eating here again. I don't know. I was just raised to be helpful to people who are obviously unable to help themselves to a degree.

reviews.name: Gene J.
reviews.review: I'm a huge fan of Jimmy Johns, and they are the  restaurant  of choice whenever I'm in a city that has one. I rushed back from a Sounds game and was just a minute late after closing. I wanted to get an evening sandwich and one for my flight the next day.  One of the employees looked like he was going to make an exception, but the other shook his head, and turned his back but not before clearly making a expletive comment to me. There was no reason for this, I understood the locked door. A big fu to you punk, I am thinking of writing a letter to corporate about you, because this is not how this company operates and they surely don't need to have your rude a$$ as their representative.   This review not against the store , which some have given great praise for the product and service.  This is in protest for the worst  act of customer service I have experienced in a long time!

reviews.name: Katherine B.
reviews.review: Great sandwiches, BUT when I ordered my sandwich, the cashier casually asked "would you like a pickle?".  I said sure, not knowing that she would charge me $1.25 for it.  She did NOT tell me it was extra, and I feel that I was decieved into purchasing something I would not have purchased.SHAME ON YOU, JIMMY JOHN'S.

reviews.name: Rachel M.
reviews.review: We ordered lunch for our work crew one day.  They delivered to the Omni Hotel so we didn't have to go out and pick it up.  I personally love the unwiches.

reviews.name: Whitney F.
reviews.review: Best sandwich shop in Nashville! The customer servers is amazing! They're freaking fast:)

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: I LOVE JIMMY JOHNS. I would eat it every single day for lunch if I thought it was good for me physically and financially. However, I try to only have JJ's once a week or so. I do think the price is fair for the quality and amount of food and the friendliness and quickness of customer service and delivery. I either order online or over the phone, whichever I'm in the mood to do. My order is always there within 10 minutes and has always been correct. I was hesitant to order a drink because the delivery guys deliver on bicycles but it's not a problem. They have little sections in their backpack to hold it. I always get the Turkey Tom with no cucumber, add cheese. JJ's has the BEST bread and mayonnaise. And I LOVE their choc chip cookies and pickles. I never get chips because I'm just not a big chip eater. All of their sandwiches sound amazing but I haven't been brave enough to sway from my go-to because it's just so damn good!

reviews.name: Dee a.
reviews.review: Meh. Its a sandwich and decent portions.

reviews.name: Natalya S.
reviews.review: A standard Jimmy John's.  Their sandwiches are good and they make them quickly, I have never had to wait long for one.  I am not a big fan of the roast beef, but otherwise hard to go wrong with a sandwich.  Be advised, they put a lot of mayo on stuff.

reviews.name: Meredith H.
reviews.review: This was the second time I remember eating at Jimmy John's, and the first time was back in 2006, so it had been a while. I ordered online and let me tell you - if I go back, it'll definitely be because of the great customer service. They had my name obviously and they used it! They were all, "HI, Meredith! Here's you sandwich, Meredith, See you later, Meredith!" I'd rate the food about a 6 on a scale of 1-10, but I'm thinking it's just a one time thing and I"ll order something different next time. I can't wait to go back.

reviews.name: Seth N.
reviews.review: Fast. Friendly. Good sandwiches. The sandwiches can be ordered as normal or as lettuce wraps instead of bread. You can get a cheap lunch if you don't have much cash, and it will even still taste good!

reviews.name: Stuart S.
reviews.review: I love their pulled pork and mild sauce. Black eyed peas and mashed potatoes were good as well. Not a bad price on Pork BBQ plate at $9.29. Gave me lots of Q and was very lean, no fat or gristle. Not sure why the reviews are mixed but if you are going to eat at a BBQ place, you might want to order BBQ. Just saying!

reviews.name: Marc M.
reviews.review: Popular BBQ spot with lots of seating and surprisingly good pulled pork. The chicken looked a little dry, so I went with the pulled pork and was rewarded with a very generous heap of moist pork. I then opted to have it slathered with hot BBQ sauce which turned out to be quite tasty. Not sweet, not too hot, but it leaves you with a satisfying pepper tingle. At the tables there are squeeze bottles of the sauces since you can never overdo it.I'd return.

reviews.name: Tim A.
reviews.review: I travel a lot. I do like this airport and I've eaten here before but only a salad. This time I tried the chicken finger meal. Three pcs of the Chicken were dry and the other three were from frozen. Not good. Waitress was slow to get to me until they changed waitress. The sides were mediocre at best. Maybe the BBQ pork is better.

reviews.name: mark s.
reviews.review: This is location is in the Nashville airport and not as good as the other whitts, but I get the smoked turkey when I come through town. There is something special about that lonely pickle slice that sort of adds life to the sandwich. It's better than neeleys in the airport.

reviews.name: Les M.
reviews.review: Stuffed Baked Potato was under cooked had to ask 5 times for butter. Guy keep asking no meat??  Was very little meat  very is appointed even for airport food.  Will find someplace else next trip.

reviews.name: Dorene M.
reviews.review: Pretty good, it wasn't the best I've had and it wasn't the worst. The staff was very nice and accommodating so I would the service a 4. The food had good flavor but not great, I would give it a 3. I think for airport food and the price it was a good deal. I had the pork sandwhich with Cole slaw on it and a side of mac and cheese and it was $9. I don't think you will get a better deal then that in the airport. So if you are looking for a decent meal that's reasonably priced this is the place to go.

reviews.name: Lisa L.
reviews.review: I love good BBQ----and I tried this place two times in 2 weeks at the airport.  Both times, I thought, "Meh."  (I only tried it the 2nd time because it was the only option available when my flight left late at night.)Though I'm not much of a complainer, honestly, these were not my best meals (even when only compared with other airport restaurants around the USA---and maybe even when compared to meals I've had in-flight!).  The good:*  The pulled pork was very tender and not fatty. (Serving was ample.)  Truly, it was good! The "Meh:"*  The BBQ sauce (both hot and mild) just didn't resonate with me.  I've had a lot of different sauces over the years and I just felt these didn't have much depth.  The were too "one-note" for me--- a little vinegary and just not "delicious."   I felt like I was eating at a 4-H fair food truck (and not an awesome one).*  I ordered a cornbread roll the first visit---and it was dry and hard.  I ordered a regular roll on the second visit and it was hard as a rock ---it felt like someone put it in the microwave for over a minute and then put it on my plate.  Hard as concrete and inedible.* I ordered the mac-and-cheese as my side and it was nothing special.  Pasta was overdone and cheese sauce just tasted like tasteless generic cheese sauce that had very little flavor or "umph" to it.  Kraft M&C would have blown this stuff out of the water--and that's not saying much!The service was fine---but the food left a lot to be desired.  It essentially turned out to be a "checklist" meal:  Empty calories that "cured hunger."

reviews.name: Catina C.
reviews.review: Kinda meh for me. It wasn't bad as some reviewers said amd it wasn't amazing as others have said. It was a great value. Pulled pork with two sides IS a much better value than a banana and a cold turkey sandwich. I liked the lounge playing the live country music and I'm not even a big time country music fan. It was mellow country music and made me feel like I was not in the airport.Sauces: lovedBbq: Pulled pork. Extremely tender.Black eyed peas: meh kinda bland and a little hard...a little better with the Whitts sauce:)Lasagna looking spaghetti: mehPeach cobbler: a little sweeter than I likeIt might sound like a bad review but I consider it average compared to restaurants but above average compared to airport options. There was nothing inedible. I loved the Sauce. I debated straddling the bottles on the table. Hot it not super hot but then there are beads of sweat on my forehead.

reviews.name: Alyse H.
reviews.review: This is one of the few places I will eat in the Nashville airport.  Keep on walking past the food court and deep into the Southwest concourse to find Whitt's.  I got a huge breakfast sandwich loaded with scrambled eggs and bacon on an English muffin for $4, which absolutely blows the airport competition out of the water!!  Lunch is also very tasty...they have great BBQ and an assortment of sauces on the tables adjacent the restaurant.

reviews.name: Sheila S.
reviews.review: Happy to discover the veggies, including the greens and blackeye peas, are meat-free. Had a good plate of greens, peas, and Mac-n-cheese, but the service was deplorable and the place was not clean. The tray was dirty, the counters were dirty, the USB ports for charging did not work, and I had to go to 5 tables to find condiment bottles that weren't empty. I had to go back and ask for lemon for my tea; the cashier disappeared into the back without a word and didn't return for over 5 minutes. I went back to my table to eat, since my food was getting cold, and when he came back he just set a small container with 3 lemon slices on the counter without making any effort to tell or bring them out to me. The woman who had gotten my food was busy during all of this time digging in her purse and then taking her break. The food was fine but I doubt I'll choose them next time.

reviews.name: Rick W.
reviews.review: Good pulled pork, Mac & cheese and slaw. The BBQ sauces were very good. Have I had better? Yes, but this was really good food for an airport. Service was great. I will go back again.

reviews.name: Paul C.
reviews.review: I don't recommend. Sitting on my flight feeling terrible. Help at the counter was very dismissive, requested mild BBQ and gave me HOT and wouldn't change it. Go to the other place in the airport

reviews.name: Larry P.
reviews.review: Good BBQ. Had the pulled pork, Mac and cheese and collards. Top of the line by airport food standards. Also you can get the Witt's BBQ at Tootsie's, which is connected, and listen to live music at the same time.

reviews.name: Pam H.
reviews.review: The place was so dirty. I had the pulled pork and it was okay but not as good as the last time I had Whitts barbecue. They need to keep the floor cleaner. I would have enjoyed one of the food court restaurants more than Whitts. Probably won't eat there again.

reviews.name: Michael M.
reviews.review: Airport food, like hospital food, is often uncommonly bad. As airports across the country upgrade their facilities, airport managers are starting to attract restaurants with better reputations. Those awful Host brand vendors are starting to either align with better food providers or fade away. Good riddance. Whitt's Barbecue is a popular restaurant in Nashville that has for several years had a presence at the airport. The thing that makes a Barbecue rise above the pack is the sauce. Whitt's sauce, especially the spicy sauce, is very tasty. I almost hope I have to change planes in Nashville just so I can visit them.Their facilities are definitely fast food oriented. Order at the counter and wait for your number to be called. Helter skelter tables that get wiped down once in awhile. But, hey, it's an airport.

reviews.name: Mike B.
reviews.review: Airport food is usually just gut fill, this place is pretty good bbq, and I am from Kansas city! Get the breakfast sandwich on English muffin...very good!

reviews.name: Young-Jin M.
reviews.review: Not a BBQ expert but this pulled pork plate I ordered is delicious! My mouth was watering (I was extra hungry already so factor that in lol). I forgot it was airport food!

reviews.name: Michael S.
reviews.review: This was the highest rated food in the terminal and I would have otherwise looked this one over. But great pork and extra sauce is waiting at the tables.

reviews.name: RONALD W.
reviews.review: Darn good to great for airport BBQ. Sandwiches and meat/2 sides plates.Had the pulled pork plate with turnip greens and green beans. It was definitely delish.Enjoyed the live music bleedover from Tootsies too.

reviews.name: Jason G.
reviews.review: It was the only place open when we got to the airport, but was pleasantly surprised.  We Had the Breakfast wrap while waiting for a flight out! Tasted fresh, and it was very delicious! The coffee was good too

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: I love the baked potatoes with the barbecue pork shoulder on top, this location is great so when you are in Donelson you should pay them a visit.

reviews.name: Julia W.
reviews.review: This is some damn good airport food!I grabbed a to-go plate of pulled pork with spicy bbq sauce, greens and mac 'n cheese to eat at my departure gate.  More than one person interrupted my gorging to ask where I'd gotten such delicious-smelling food and one woman went so far as to make a snatching motion at my pork.  No way, lady.  This pile's all mine!Looking forward to my next layover in Nashville, as long as Whitt's in my terminal!

reviews.name: Don W.
reviews.review: Absolutely the WORST BBQ brisket EVER!!!!!Looked like pork....cut with the grain...cooked in an oven,,,,,zero taste. !!!!!!

reviews.name: Bryan H.
reviews.review: Pork sandwich was good but costly airport food and sides looked old.

reviews.name: Rich S.
reviews.review: Horrible food, horrible service. If you're a minority don't go here!

reviews.name: Diana L.
reviews.review: This place is pretty pricey but we are in Nashville where Korean restaurants are somewhat limited. My favorite dishes are the bibimbap and the pork bulgogi. However, please do order the hot stone bibimbap. You will not regret it (this dish is basically a korean version of fried rice.) The stone bowl is super hot and makes your rice super crispy. The red pepper paste you mix in with the rice is so delicious, too! Their side dishes are pretty tasty and they give a good variety. However, I feel that sometimes their service is lacking.

reviews.name: Enokcuay E.
reviews.review: Other than my masters wife's cooking this is my favorite of any type of Asian food in Nashville.  The place is always very clean.  We think the owner cooks a lot of the food here to keep it consistent.  Every time I come here it feels just like Christmas morning!

reviews.name: Thommy S.
reviews.review: I love, love, love this place! If you go, the bbq on the table is a must try! I usually order the kalbi, they bring it out, and we grill it ourselves on our table.  Their grill is the real wood/charcoal grill.  I'm in love with their red sauce they use for dipping.  Because of them, I am in love with Korean bbq.

reviews.name: Aubrey W.
reviews.review: I've reviewed one of Nashville's Korean restaurants, Korea House, but have been wanting to try the other for a while.  Seoul Garden is actually closer to where I live than Korea House, but both restaurants are very different!  Since people always ask me about local Korean restaurants, I felt I needed to experience both to offer a solid reco.I liked that Seoul Garden had the cooktop tables I'm used to seeing in Korean restaurants that serve BBQ.  There is a two-order minimum on BBQ to sit there, but we knew we wanted MEAT!  We started with some steamed mandu dumplings, and they served the requisite banchan small plates.For our BBQ, we ordered my favorite kalbi beef ribs, as well as spicy pork dwaeji gogi.  I felt like they were a bit stingy on the kalbi, but they provided an ample plate of the pork.  There was even enough for leftovers.  Both were tasty, but I'm all about Korean BBQ beef, so if I came back I might ask for double if I'm sharing.We also ordered bibimbap, the dolsot version in the stone pot.  My sister and Mom don't like the stone pot version as much, but Lauren loved how the rice got crispy where it touched the pot.  I agree that it made it even yummier!We enjoyed cooking our meat at the table, and everything tasted great.  The service wasn't that great once our meat was cooked, but there was a decent crowd for a weeknight.The best part about Korean food is that it is shared.  We ordered three entrees, but we all ate bits and pieces of everything.Overall, I'd say that I like both of Nashville's Korean restaurants.  Both are authentic, though not the same as what you'd experience in major Korean hubs like New York and L.A.There are things on the menu at Korea House that they don't have at Seoul Garden, and the price is a bit more reasonable.  But for the cooktop experience, I do enjoy Seoul Garden's setup.  They have more seating as well, and Korea House had a wait the last time we visited.  I'd say that if you want laid back dining with a lot of selection (like casual dish dokbokki), choose Korea House.  If you want BBQ cooked at your table with a hungry larger group, go Seoul Garden.  I think my mother would approve of both (and already likes Korea House) but would choose KH for the prices any day.

reviews.name: Ssw W.
reviews.review: Since yelp won't post my initial review of this restaurant I will revise some of it. People need to be aware of everyone's experience not just pick and choose which to post. I am 1/2 Korean speak it & understand it well just can't read it. Seoul Garden was my everything when it came to Korean food in Nashville, but today was the worst experience I ever had there. It saddens me because I have been dining there for 4-5 years now. I come for the side dishes mainly & then the BBQ.  Today a friend and I noticed that we didn't get any egg side dish and the table before us had some so I asked for the egg side dish she said they ran out. Fifteen minutes later a new table gets seated  & guess what they get egg side dish. The waitress didn't realize we were all waiting in the front, 42 mins earlier to be seated in the order in which we came for BBQ table. I ask the waitress why did the new table get the egg side dish & she tried to say they were here before us ...I called her on the lie & we paid for the uneaten food & left. Never going back she was so rude from the beginning.The same waitress had did the same previously but I believed her that time since it was late but now I'm the wiser. The food is way over priced, it's ridiculous how much they charge for seafood pancake in Nashville $16-$20 when in Clarksville it's half the price $5-$9 depending on size @ New Korea. Seoul garden you are no longer my favorite restaurant! Never eating there again and my friends feel the same. Guess we'll be making the drive to Atlanta, GA for best quality table-side Korean BBQ!Pros: best Korean side dish accompaniment compared to others in Nashville sadly*Only place in Nashville table BBQLimited lunch menu optionsqClean restrooms Cons: Over priced Korean foodMenu items not available although listed like beef-rib soupLong wait for BBQ table Inconsistent poor customer service if you're not native Korean won't give the usual accompaniments since they think you don't know to appreciate as much

reviews.name: Norra T.
reviews.review: I would've given this 1 star but my family left with lots of memories.We sat immediately. We waited probably 15 minutes before a server came to take our order. She didn't want us to put in a drink order yet. She said to order our meals first. We sat at a grill table. She mentioned she would be back for our drink order. 25 minutes passed... no drink order taken. I had to wave down another waitress to take our order. Sake was luke warm at best.We found a bone, probably from a galbi order, under our table. We tried to grill our food but no server turned it on for us so we sat for 15 minutes trying to get our own charcoal to burn. The galbi and bulgolgi was average not bad but not the best either. With a party of 6 adults and a $200 bill we left hungry.  We stopped by a taco stand afterwards. The tacos were the highlight of our night.

reviews.name: Joe C.
reviews.review: Now that I know that Seoul Garden is 5 minutes from my house, my Korean food intake is about to dramatically increase.We got some steamed dumplings as a starter and they were really good. Kimchi Jigae was fantastic and perfectly spiced. My wife got the Bibimbop and it was really good as well.

reviews.name: Laila S.
reviews.review: My friend recently went here due to it being the only place that has do it yourself BBQ, they went for a special occasion, a birthday and anniversary. When they arrived, they were told, sorry no BBQ, because they were about an hour from closing. the food was terrible, just thrown together to get them out the door. Im so disappointed for them! They drove 45 mins to this place, passed their favorite (and now mine) Korea House. Boo for terrible customer service and food. don't waste your money.

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: Seoul Garden gets major props in my book for the fact that they are the only Korean restaurant in Nashville to have a tableside BBQ option - which is one of the parts of Korean food I enjoy so much and miss from the other Korean places in town.  Our experience dining there, however, left a little something to be desired.  We walked in and were seated at one of the non-BBQ tables almost immediately.  And then we sat and waited for someone to take our order.  And waited.  And waited.  We nearly got up to leave when finally a waitress rushed to our table to take our drink orders.  At this point, we were ready to order our food as well.  When we mentioned we wanted the tableside BBQ, we were told that we *should* have told them that from the beginning.  The waitress ran away to ask someone else if we could be seated at one of the BBQ tables, and 10 minutes later, came back to move us and take our orders.We ordered 3 main dishes (hey, we were hungry): the beef bulgogi, the sirloin and spicy squid with noodles.  The first 2 were BBQ dishes.  The waitress came back to the table with the typical Korean side dishes, all of which were good, none of which were stellar.  The problem wasn't with the side dishes - it was with the fact that they were thrown at us (literally tossed onto the table) so she could get to one of the other tables.  Same with the raw meat for the BBQ - there was no demonstration on how to cook it.  After we'd let the grill heat for a bit, we placed the meat onto the BBQ and the waitress quickly came back to tell us we were doing it wrong and we shouldn't have started without her.  Um, if you say so.  After rushing back to us (seriously, this woman was logging some miles that night), she turned the meat over and almost pulled it off the grill to serve to us - halfway cooked.  We politely asked her to keep it on for a bit longer, which she did.  We began pulling the meat off ourselves when we were ready to eat it.The spicy squid was pretty good, though we didn't care for the angel-hair pasta served with it.  We were expecting an udon-type noodle, so the thin, weak strands of pasta threw us for a textural loop within the dish.Would we return?  Maybe, if we were craving BBQ.  We live too far away to return just because we're craving Korean.  My husband joked that if we were going to go that far for Korean food, we might as well hop a plane and head to NYC - or Korea, for that matter!

reviews.name: Leigh M.
reviews.review: I came here on the suggestion of Yelper Aaron D. from Nashville and I'm glad I followed his advice!It's unfortunate that good Korean food is hard to find in middle Tennessee but luckily there are a couple in close proximity to my office, one of which is Seoul Garden. The food is really tasty and their lunch specials are a really good value. They also offer middle-of-the-table BBQ. The banchan here are always good, and they do mix them up a bit. I don't think I've ever been given the exact same selections twice in a row. I highly suggest the gogi bokum, and the gyoza soup is fantastic for warming yourself up on a cold day.I've been here quite a few times since first trying it and I've never had a bad experience with the food or the service. They're different enough from close-by Korean restaurant So Gong Dong Tofu House that I frequent both now, depending on what I'm in the mood for. SGD is still tops when it comes to tofu soups, but I think I prefer Seoul Garden for non-soup items.

reviews.name: Kaleena 'Kala' H.
reviews.review: My husband and I went here with a couple of friends one night while they were in town. They really wanted to have some Korean food before going back home, but the place they wanted to go to was closed. So after searching around, we discovered Seoul Garden.We tried several varieties of food, and all were delicious! I had never tried Korean food before, so it was quite an experience and a fun change of pace. It was also fun to see that they had their television tuned to a Korean music channel...as I am familiar with Korean Pop (or K-Pop), it was fun to listen to. Only negative was that we had to wait awhile before anyone came over to take our order...it seemed to be at least 20 minutes before we finally were able to get someone's attention to bring our drinks and put in our food order.I definitely would love to come back and try more food!

reviews.name: Matthew D.
reviews.review: The worst service I have ever experienced. The waitress asked us to finish up quicker because it is about 20 minutes to closing. I have never been to a restaurant where waitress asked us to finish quicker. That is like kicking us out. I will never return to that place again, ever.

reviews.name: Ashley G.
reviews.review: Bland and overpriced. Nice decor and great grilling tables, but a lot of times it is very loud. Not my fave.

reviews.name: Raj H.
reviews.review: This place was amazing.  My nephew and niece are adopted from South Korea and have visited there.  My sister and the kids went there and they said the food was completely authentic.  It's awesome to be able to barbecue the different marinated meats on the grill found right in the center of the table.  The service is amazing and the food, as authentic as it is, is still very appealing to an American palette.  You will see many Koreans there, which I take as a good sign as far as the authenticity and quality of the food.The only complaint we had was that since a lot of the dishes you order or kind of community dishes as is customary with most Asian cuisine, the table was way too small to hold all the food while being able to be able to barbecue meat and still be able to eat your food too.  That was the reason for a lack of one star.Apart from that, if you like authentic Asian cuisine and trying something different, then I highly recommend this place!Also, for those comments about the staff not being friendly, my nephew and niece, who though are Korean by blood, were raised in the States, said that on their visit to Seoul last year they found out that at restaurants their, servers and hostesses are trained to simply serve food and not bother patrons at all.  They only come by when they are summoned and they are not taught to be friendly and smiley with customers as that is not something that is practiced there the way it is in the United States.

reviews.name: Larissa S.
reviews.review: Highly recommended if you want to wake up your taste buds! I enjoy their bulgogi which is marinated beef, and their fried dumplings. They have good side items, I love the kimchi. The reason I give 3 stars is because off their staff. They are slow and could be friendly, it wouldn't hurt to crack a smile!

reviews.name: Tom S.
reviews.review: When I enter restaurant, 3 waitress look at me and not say a word. 10 minutes later one waitress come to me and lead to me to the table. I ask Gal bi than I have to wait another 15 minutes for table. Gal be was ok but taste little MSG in the food. I ask them two more Gal bi but they bring only one and it was not whole pecs. I ask more green paper but they told me they don't have any. I order cold noodle and ask Guy Ja which will go with noodle. Young waitress say ok but she was  not come back. I ask another waitress. She told me that they don't have that. I just feel that I ate sushi without soy sauce. I also ask more sauce and etc, I have to told them at least 2-3 time. Their service is not good. And food is not really ready for service.

reviews.name: Kathryn E.
reviews.review: This was my first foray into Korean BBQ- pretty good stuff! We loved our meat choices and I was almost sure we would never finish off what looked like 4 pounds of meat...but um, we did (between 4 girls). Thankfully my friend lived in Korea for 3 years and she knew exactly what to do and how to work the grill. Fun times! We liked trying each of the side dishes and waking up our taste buds with some of the unique flavors.The atmosphere and service left a bit to be desired- but the food was great. Highly recommend if you're tired of your routine dining choices- you'll be glad you did!We also did a round of karaoke in one of their private rooms- super fun and random night out.

reviews.name: Michelle L.
reviews.review: I never thought that I would be eating Korean food in Nashville. I'm from Southern California where Asian restaurants are a dime a dozen and I was really skeptical about eating Korean food in the South, but the group I was with wanted to eat KBBQ so I went along with it. Upon walking in, I noted that it was pretty crowded and as expected, the service was a little slow as a result. The servers were really friendly though and looked like they genuinely wanted to make sure you have a good meal. Although my boyfriend and I are regular KBBQ eaters, his friend and girlfriend weren't so we decided order more marinated meat than non-marinated. I find that to truly enjoy KBBQ though, you should definitely stick with the non-marinated. We ordered servings of Bulgogi, Chicken, and the classic pork for the meats, and ordered the Seafood Pancake as an appetizer. The seafood pancake while tasty was really lacking in the ingredients. It was more filler than anything. I was quite happy with the side dishes though. They were tasty with my rice. The KBBQ itself was a little less satisfactory. I appreciate that they were going for authenticity with the coal grill but this means that you're going to have to cook your meat fast before the coals die out. I did not like this at all because towards the end, we simply just didn't have enough heat to cook our meat through fast enough. Because of this, we had a lot of downtime and our meal was a lot longer than expected. However, the flavor of the marinade itself wasn't too bad. I preferred the taste of the chicken over the bulgogi but in the end would really have preferred to eat non-marinated since the pork was delicious. It's hard to find decent Asian food in the South and I get that this restaurant has to work with what they have. For the location, it's worth a shot. 3/5

reviews.name: Tin N.
reviews.review: It's still 5 stars. Don't care what the whiners say. Don't care what the southerners say. I brought family and friends from K-town in southern California. They all agree: Seoul Garden is legit Korean food even for California standards.'nuff said.

reviews.name: Amy K.
reviews.review: Horrible service ! Went there and ordered the kbbq. Didn't get any side dishes for our 30 mins wait almost an hour wait. Never going back again & they still want to charge for the soju should have gotten for free... Ugh horrible just horrible

reviews.name: Greg Y.
reviews.review: Greg's Review for Korean tastesEvery dishes : normalSide dishes : also normalThere are several rooms for guests.Waitress need to be more kind.I hope that there should be more large-scale korean restaurant like this. Even though its taste is normal, it is very popular.

reviews.name: Jt S.
reviews.review: Food is decent. Their kimchi is allright. Their bimbimbap is missing doraji and shigeumchi (spinach). Their bulgogi is ok. I grew up in San Franciso Bay Area with a lot of authentic korean restaurant, korean market (El Camino Real - Santa Clara) and homemade korean banchan. I've eat so many variety korean dishes. I'm sorry that I have to give only 3 star but their service is good.

reviews.name: Janet Y.
reviews.review: I don't know that I've been to Seoul Garden enough to get a good read of how well it does Korean food. My first visit there was stellar. The bulgogi  and pork bulgogi were pretty delish as was the spicy tofu soup. However, in my most recent visit, I ordered a beef broth soup and was a little disappointed. The meat was a little tough. I also noticed they did away with a dumpling that used to come with the lunch special.I do like that there is the option of cooking Korean BBQ at your table. I haven't done that yet, and that will be the key to how legit this place is! Overall, service is always consistent. Servers are sweet and attentive. I also like that they have authentic Korean television playing!

reviews.name: Trilce M.
reviews.review: First time eating Korean food and I have to say it was delicious. My husband and I decided to go with the Korean BBQ and we enjoyed the whole experience. The service was great, our server was really attentive and she took the time to explain us how everything works. She even stayed and helped us to cook part of the meat while she was asking us if we were enjoying the food. I loved this place, We will be back! My husband didn't stop telling me what a great choice I made for picking that place. The food was not only delicious but so healthy.

reviews.name: Enrique L.
reviews.review: Seoul Garden is epic Korean food restaurant and they always bring out a lot of good foods. There is something about this place that I really like in the way that the place is laid out. There are some rooms that are really cool to eat in if you are in a group and want privacy. Seoul Garden is good and that guy Tooyun is always eating here because he likes it.

reviews.name: Janette C.
reviews.review: So the service isn't spectacular but that's not what I'm here for.  I'm here for the most traditional Korean BBQ in Nashville! The staff leave you alone and their English isn't great.  But the food is completely worth it! Love the assortment of dishes they bring out first and the beef bulgogi is a favorite dish. Looking forward to trying this some time with a group and experiencing the BBQ table!

reviews.name: Piyush S.
reviews.review: I was highly disappointed. This is based purely on one lunch experience in Seoul Garden and I must admit that the food did not taste very fresh and korean bbq must taste fresh to be really appreciated. The pork bulgagi was dry and the beef bbq was very bland. I have eaten a lot better korean bbq in Chicago and Korea House in Nashville. However, I have eaten here only once and that was not the table bbq. If I ever go here again, which I do not think is happening, I will give the table bbq a shot. Till then 2 stars is all this place gets.

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: Food was good. Place is legit minus the wooden chop sticks.  Koreans use metal chop sticks.  I did the spicy pork, which is always my favorite, and the bulgogi, which is safe.  There were two of us and I'd say we could only finish 2/3 of the food, and I can eat a LOT of Korean BBQ.  I'm not sure if I paid more to sit at the grill, but the bill seemed higher than the prices on the menu.  They were expecting to cook the food for me on the grill and serve it up, but I insisted I cook it.  I didn't care much because it was good, and there was lots of food.  I'll be back.

reviews.name: Micheal P.
reviews.review: I think I should also note that as far as I know, it's the only place in nashville to get authentic, grill at your table, korean bbq. Just like in korea, folks. So, for that alone, I think it deserves 5 stars.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: I have only been to 2 Korean restaurants. However has been the best. The food was great, (definitely authentic) and the service was good. So many interesting dishes to try and all very tasty. My only complaint is that the kimchee was lacking quite a bit of flavor. Otherwise I would gladly come back here again!

reviews.name: Tim M.
reviews.review: Yes, we know Asian places - service sucks. No surprise here. When they come by, just make sure you are ready to order or it might be a while before they come back. On this 1st occasion, my group was 20+ so I won't penalize them for terrible service and then charge us 20% gratuity.The fried and steamed dumplings were good. I recommend an order of both as appetizers - $6.95 for 10.As another posted states, the use of hot coals on the grill leads to lot of fluctuations in heat for cooking food. Also, the staff is insistent in changing the grill often which is kind of annoying.Had the chicken bulgogi which was flavorful, grilled well, and enjoyable.All drinks (except water) are in cans and/or bottles - beers (good assortment), sodas, etc.

reviews.name: Michael B.
reviews.review: If i could give then zero stars I would. They are the rudest Restaurant owners I have ever met!!! I know Korean people are generally rude but man!!! This is coming from a fellow Korean... And I can't even handle their incredible lack of decorum and general courtesy that should be offered to every patron. Their food is sub par and the service was lackluster. On top of all that it was incredibly expensive!!! If you want real Korean food at an affordable price with the service to match. Try Hae Woon Dae on Antioch pike. Seoul garden does not deserve your business.

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: This is probably the only place in Nashville that offers Korean BBQ on your table. May be that's why it's so overpriced? Be aware that they expect you to tip 20% or more when you have this service or they'll run after you. Yes, I am for real. This actually happened to one of my friends. She tipped 15% and got chased. She didn't think they deserved the 20% tip because service was lackluster. The food here is very average compares to the food at Tofu House, except the Stirred Fried Squid and the Kimchee (very crunchy!). What I love about this restaurant is they always play KPOP music shows on TV and I am a big KPOP fan. Sometimes I come here to eat just to watch the shows...Well, if you're a KPOP fan like me, you have the best of both world here. Eating Korean food while watching your favorite stars perform on TV hah. Plus, they have 3 Karaoke rooms here...well after watching those videos, I'm sure you'd feel like signing right? Just make sure to close the door. I never had problem with the service and I usually get seated quickly.

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: Yep, the service still sucks, but who cares when you're planted in a hot steaming bowl of kimchi stew.  I could wax poetic about their kimchi...they must put crack in it, it's ADDICITIVE.I wish they would sell their kimchi by the jar.

reviews.name: Mele R.
reviews.review: Wow! This is the best Korean food I have had outside of Korea! I went on a Tuesday after work and I was one of three groups in the place, so my food came out fast. They have about 4 tables with grills where you can cook your own meat. I am going to try that next time when someone else comes with me. I had the beef ribs or Galbi or Kalbi - I have heard it both ways - and an order of steamed mandu and had to take a majority of the food home with me. The food was just as good heated up 2 days later! This place really makes me miss Korea! They even played Korean pop music TV. I felt right at home!

reviews.name: Constanza Z.
reviews.review: I really love coming here with my family. We always order the same thing, but we've tried different things on the menu. We find it to be expensive, but since they give you so much food it's worth it. I can never eat all of mine. I usually get the Jap Chae. It's sweet potato noodles with veggies in sesame oil and other things. It has a sweet taste. Very delicious (I especially recommend it with tofu).There are a lot of really great soups too. A lot of the dishes are spicy, but they have non-spicy options as well, which is good for those who are not  used it. There is a  neat option to sit at  the grilling tables, which just means you can cook your meat while you enjoy their yummy side dishes. There are only four of these tables and they seat large groups, on busy nights you might want to call ahead and make reservations. Another neat thing, which I still need to try is the private Karaoke rooms. They apparently have options in several languages. It's on my 'to try list'. Over all, we enjoy this place because they serve you a lot of veggies and my family and I really enjoy that. We are not big meat eaters, so it works perfect for us. However, this place is definitely for the meat lovers, since they have a lot of it on their menu and it's the smell that welcomes you when you walk in.

reviews.name: Kenneth D.
reviews.review: Food was wonderful especially the bulgogi BBQ grille...much better than the bulgogi from the kitchen.  The side dishes were very bland...however, I was able to eat the kimchi which is usually much spicier/hot.  However, service was awful.  My large party was seated in the back private room.  Drinks and refills were slow.  We had to ask for plates and silverware after our food came.  But what we got was disposable forks/spoons and styrofoam little plates!!!

reviews.name: Simon K.
reviews.review: Alright, so there are 3 major Korean restaurants in and around Nashville.  And they are all pretty far from each other.  So if you're in the area, you're not gonna go wrong with going to this place.Comparatively though, it's a little more expensive than the others.  HOWEVER, it is the nicer looking of the 3.  I've been to all 3 multiple times, depending which side of town I'm in.  I personally like Hai Woon Dai the best. Its got tables, w/ grills built in, to have you're meat cooked in front of you.  If you want to get a Korean experience, then this is probably the spot.  Again, the high point is the look of the place, food is good, and the service is not bad.  But this may not be the first pick amongst the local Koreans.Overall: It's safe, you're not gonna have a bad experience.

reviews.name: Tina P.
reviews.review: We enjoyed our dinner last night. all four of us really enjoy ethnic cuisine...We sat at  a BBQ table which was fun and good. Table of 4 , 3 appetizers and 4 entrees were a lot of food. We also had very good fast service ! Will be back !

reviews.name: Aaron D.
reviews.review: I heart Seoul Garden.Decor and ambience are far ahead of some of the other Korean options in town (although I do think it would be nice if they upgrade the bench/banquette seating to something slightly more cushioned and less stained).Either service has massively improved since other Yelpers reviewed this place or my standards are on a different level, because I thought we got greater service and it looked like other patrons were getting good service too. There were a couple of little slips at the beginning (we received our dumplings before we had any chopsticks and then had to ask for a couple of small plates since we were sharing), but later on I thought the service was terrific with our waitress (Hailey?) frequently keeping an eye on our table from a discrete distance just to make sure we didn't need anything. A subtle hand gesture or nod of the head and she was winging our way to our table to bring us more banchan or get us a go box.All of this would be pleasant but relatively meaningless unless the food was tasty. Fortunately, Seoul Garden serves up some delicious Korean comestibles.As others have mentioned, the kimchee is great. There were two kimchee banchan and both had fantastic bite. In addition to the regular banchan, we also received complimentary bowls of a subtle soup/broth enriched with a wealth of crunchy bean sprouts. Not sure if that was standard or a daily special.We each ordered the dol sot bi bim map (rice bowl in a stone hot pot with lots of veggies and beef on top). I ordered the regular and my wife sprang for the $2 (or $3?) upgrade with higher quality gal bi beef. Both were good, but I'd suggest paying more for the gal bi as it boosted the dish to a higher level of deliciousness.The menu is extensive and we definitely plan to go back and try some of the other options including sul lang tang (ox broth soup) and maybe a squid dish recommended by the waitress.So excited to have found this place. Love that it is open kind of late (until 10:30 on weekends). If I can convince my wife, maybe we'll even give the karaoke room a whirl sometime...

reviews.name: Jennie C.
reviews.review: AWFUL SERVICE.Almost broke the cardinal rule by walking out. Yes, I know you're not supposed to, but it was just that close.I came with my parents to visit since Korea House was out of the way. Not only did it take forever to get water, I had to remind a different waitress to get barley tea. Not only did our order took forever, but other peoples' orders were served when they have arrived in the restaurant AFTER we had ordered.We also did not get banchan until 40 minutes after we ordered.
