reviews.review: After not patronizing this place for a few years, I went in there last month looking for a couple of Asian ingredients for a meal.  Not only did they have what I wanted, it was cheaper than where I had been going to get them and a few miles closer as well.Once inside, I decided to partake in some hot soup, and it was really good.  For the price, I couldn't complain.I gave it a 5th star instead of 4 because when I was in there a really pretty Asian girl flirted with me.  Wow, was she ever hot!

reviews.name: Marie W.
reviews.review: My fiancee and I came here after hearing that the food was very good.       -____-  This was the worst meal we have ever eaten in Nashville.First off, you walk in and past a small row of asian groceries and food stuffs at the end of which you end up at the beginning of a caffeteria style spread of food. They have a menu that you can order from or you can look at the ready made food and pick from it.Maybe if you ordered off the menu and had things made to order it would be good, but we unwisely decided to get the ready made stuff. It looked suspect. Like it had been overcooked then sat out too long on top of that. And it tasted like it too. Everything was bland at best and inedible at worst. The spicy beef dish I ordered had almost no meat in it and overcooked tasteless green beans for the rest. The fiancees curry soup was bland and lackluster. The only thing that was ok was the curry eggroll. It was only OK though. I will NOT be back and can NOT recommend this as a place for anyone else to eat at.

reviews.name: Sunny Y.
reviews.review: Pros: The grocery side is pretty interesting. A mix of Thai, Korean and Japanese dried or instant food and other little knick-knacks. I bought some canned curry and coconut milk and made some at home. It was pretty good.Mehs: My friend thinks this place has the best tom yum.Be forewarned: the soup is VERY thick and strong-flavored. Heavily seasoned with a LOT of lemongrass. The two guys I ate with didn't like it as much and said they couldn't taste anything else afterwards. I liked it okay and it was pretty addictive. But at the end of the day I prefer the milder ones at Thai Phooket or Siam Cuisine.We ordered three other dishes. Pad thai with tofu, lard na and something else. Pad thai was under-seasoned or tasted under-seasoned because our tongues were numb from the tom yum. I liked the tofu in it though.Don't even remember much about lard na and the other dish because we couldn't taste them.....Cons:I didn't try anything from the buffet. Everything looked utterly unappetizing. But maybe it's better at lunch time, like the other reviewer said.

reviews.name: Matthew S.
reviews.review: Great prices, great food, great people. That said, lets break it down...Food on buffet line: Ranging from reasonably good to amazing, her prepared dishes are full of flavor, very approachable, and very well priced. They have really added their own flare to many of these dishes with some delicious variations on things you may find elsewhere. The shining stars for me: the curried tofu and the seaweed salad. The tofu is bursting with flavor and just enough heat. The seaweed salad is the best I have ever had because i so beautifully balances the sweet, sour, and heat. Food to order: This place reminds me of my grandmother's house, if my grandmother were Thai. If they have the ingredients, they can make it. That said, there is not a specific menu with all of the things people like to order. From soups to noodle dishes, they do it all. My recommendation? Keep a very close eye on other people in line. They may be ordering the dish that will rock your world, but unless you watch, you won't know it exists. I could live in their Tom Yum soup. Try the veggie dumplings. I think the Beatles put it best when they said, "..had I looked the other way I might have never been aware, but as it is I'll dream of her tonight"Patty's House Salad: Did you catch the article about it in the Scene? If not, allow me to blow your mind. Start the process by getting together a group of at least 4 to 6 people (the minimum and suggested maximum). Then call at least 2 days in advance and choose your meat, tofu, seafood, or whatever you want. Start preparing for an interactive feast. Patty comes out with somewhere in the neighborhood of 27 different ingredients. She then instructs you on how to fill a lettuce leaf appropriately some of every single ingredient and eat it in one bite. This was not a suggestion, but a requirement. You have to be willing to put absolutely everything into your wrap and stuff this gargantuan piece of loveliness into your mouth all at once. You will be glad of the challenge though, as each time you chew you get a different burst of flavor. This is genuine Thai family style. You spend most of your time walking around the table, stuffing food in your hand, then your mouth. You are strongly encouraged to go outside and walk around the block for fresh air from time to time. This allows things to settle a little so you can go back in for another round. Even though you will eat until you explode, it is SUPER FRESH and very light. Not that same old soul food coma afterward. The only downside is that it costs $30 per person. But with the amount of prep work and love that goes into this dish, it is totally worth it when you want to splurge a little and have one of the most incredible food experiences of your life. Market: A small but nice selection of Asian market items. The Gen Mai Cha (Green Tea with toasted rice) is a low grade, but super yummy and very cheap. Try the peanuts, coated in-house with honey, sesame seeds, and apparently something very addictive. There is a very nice assortment of curry pastes to play with and some very attractive Sake and tea sets. Don't forget to pick up a bottle of Sriracha while you're there. Everything is Miscellanea:   The decor is a ton of fun. Super casual, but laced with Thai treasures. Each table has an amazing set of condiments to customize your dish to perfection. They definitely take care of their regulars, so loyalty pays off here. There are some amazing seasonal treats. Fall brings coconut custard in baby pumpkins. You eat the pumpkin with the custard and it is both adorable and delicious. This place is not quite a 5 star for me because of several small imperfections, but I would still eat here almost every day if I still lived close enough. An unequivocal gem.

reviews.name: Rachel B.
reviews.review: International Market is a great spot for a meal on the cheap or to pick up any specialty ingredients.I have been going to International Market for years, and my loyalty is stronger today than ever. Especially after I discovered the Special Menu items. Although the buffet is pretttyyy good, it can be hit or miss.  However,  the egg rolls, bamboo shoots and fried rice at the buffet are generally pretty tasty. Even tastier considering the $3-5 price  for the combination. BUT the Special Menu is definitely the way to go.  My favorite dish is the India Noodle.   I literally day dream about slurping down this spicy coconut noodle soup with your-choice-of-meat and vegetables topped with crushed peanuts and fresh cilantro. MMMMMMMM.

reviews.name: Jessica C.
reviews.review: I was brought here by a long time Nashvillean, being from Richmond this is my first time here. I love hole-in-the-wall restaurants and this place delivered in uniqueness. I was not expecting a buffet/cafeteria style meal, but it was interesting and there was a really nice selection. The food is a little bland and I didn't enjoy the egg rolls, but it was a so-so take on Thai food. We did come in at dinner time so I can see how the food could have been more fresh. I enjoyed eating in the restaurant more than I did the food (which was still pretty good). The people were really nice and it was really fun to eat here! They have a ton of plants in the front and things to look at/buy. I'm sure next time I go I'll find a dish I like better, the selection is pretty large. I got fried rice (bland, but good), pepper steak (delicious!) and rice noodle with broccoli (decent but sat out for a while).

reviews.name: The Yelp-inator W.
reviews.review: I like this place.. it is a great place for a quick lunch.  They have a little buffet/cafeteria line with some pretty good choices.  You pay for what you get.  They have several curry dishes, veggie rolls, etc.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: I give them stars for price only. The food is good don't' get me wrong but I honestly don't know that it's the best Thai I have ever had. However, it's good and even better because it's cheap.  Lots of good options of not just Thai origin. There is a little grocery in the building and it seems well stocked. Otherwise, the restaurant is cafeteria style and you walk through the line and get your items. The portions are generous and the rolls are good. The service is friendly. If you are on a college budget or just needing a quick fix, then this is a great option on the west side.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: Has we not just eaten, I would have loved to try some of the food from the buffet, but settled for looking at the beer selection and the market portion. I ended up grabbing a Tiger Beer, which I have never in my life heard of, and some Pocky so the total would be enough to allow for a credit card payment. The lady working there was sooo funny. She kept teasing us about taking the beer in public, i.e., walking it to our car. "Just hide it," she joked when we asked for a bag. I'd go back just to talk with the lady at the register. And to buy one of those waving cats.

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: It is virtually impossible to beat the prices at the restaurant in the International Market across from PM.  The food is displayed buffet style and they offer a huge selection of entrees, appetizers, sides, and fruit.  Last time I was there I had the curry tofu with a side of  fresh sliced mango and the veggie dumplings.  It was all delicious, especially the dumplings which also won the presentation award.  The meal filled me up for about $6.The market itself is a lot of fun too.  If features Asian specialty groceries you can't find a lot of places in Nashville.  My friend bought a can of vegetarian "duck".  I'll have to ask her how that turned out...

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: Having just returned from Thailand I have been stalking Nashville in hopes to find a little piece of Thailand in music city, which is how I fell upon the International Market & Restaurant. The market area is small, but you will definitely find some staples for your Thai dishes, as well imported tourist trinkets. I'm not a big fan of their Chinese restaurant style buffet set up (mostly because it upsets my just having come back from Thailand sensitivities) but I will tell you that their prices are seriously unbeatable. Aside from the multitude of dishes available for you to peruse, they also have Pad Thai waiting for you to order it from their kitchen. This place is a gem to anyone wanting good food with out having to spend a lot of money.

reviews.name: Elizabeth M.
reviews.review: I love this place for its cheap prices and huge portions. I tend to get a Thai tea and Pad See Ew (which I've never had to spell before) and camp out with schoolwork. I've also gotten takeout. The people who work here are super nice and the grocery is an awesome eclectic mix off dried goods, teas, and candy. Sometimes the buffet looks a little sketch, but I always order fresh from the back.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: I was just here last night when some friends and I tried to go to PM across the street and the wait was much too long. International Market has been around for a long time. The food is served cafeteria style and is a definite bargain. There were plenty of Thai and Chinese dishes to choose from, and the nice lady last night told us that we could also special order items from the kitchen. Honestly, it's not really my type of cuisine, so I couldn't being to tell you how it rates against other places. However, I know lots of people who love this place. Including the 8 other people I was with last night.It's a fast and cheap lunch spot conveniently located. I agree with Sharon that it is kind of "no frills." You aren't going here for any kind of ambiance or to impress anyone. As their name implies, they do have groceries for purchase as well. If you need a quick and cheap Thai fix, I'd say give it a go.

reviews.name: Sharon K.
reviews.review: This market has a great lunch menu and buffet. I once had the most amazing bowl of soup here... it was one of those days where your spirits are low and you just need a hug. Well I didn't get a hug but I did get a bowl of very spicy  chicken soup and a bottle of beer which soothed me inside and out. The place is definitely a no frills kinda spot.  You get a tray and get in line.  The room is very lived in.  You could probably get a good taste of what's on the menu by licking the ceiling tiles. It's not a dirty spot like in a violating the health code sort of way, but it is a very independent shop that is more worried about cooking good food than up keeping the dining room. Stop in for lunch and get something with chicken.  I would also definitely recommend the soup.

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: While I haven't ever really done any shopping here, I've stopped in for a quick lunch on countless occasions, and I must say, it's a very tasty little place.  It's right next door to Belmont (practically on campus), and it's the sort of place that caters to young people with big appetites and not a lot of cash.I typically just breeze through the buffet when I visit the Market, and they have all the basics: Pad Thai, spicy and sweet and sour chicken, et cetera.  Nothing there is the best I've ever had, but it's all pretty solid.The staff at International Market is very nice, and because servings are large and prices aren't, it's the type of place that the locals frequent.  I've bought little Asian candies and treats here before, but that's about it as far as the non-restaurant items.  I know quite a few people do actually shop here regularly, and it seems like a great spot to pick up the essentials for your Chinese, Thai and various Asian cuisine concoctions.

reviews.name: Johnny N.
reviews.review: It is what it is and it is decent, cheap, quick Asian food. Come as you are. Cheap. I crave it at times.

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: someone mentioned the pad thai on the menu here that isn't on the buffet. it's good, yes... but they also serve a nice bowl of pho here, too. the beef is pretty shit, to be honest, but the broth is heavenly! no need for beef paste or hoisin sauce here, the broth is good excellent as is. they don't serve you mint leaves like in other places, but i'm telling you... it's all right. this is the first place i ever tried pho at, and if you've never had it before, i suggest you try it here first. then you can branch off to other, more vietnamese places.and pho is pronounced like "fuh" not "foe". so you don't look like an idiot LOL.eric b

reviews.name: Rayid G.
reviews.review: This is only the review for food and not the grocery store. The store itself looked useful if i was in need of grocery but when i did go there, i was hungry and was disappointed. I ordered pad thai from the "thai menu" and it was nothing like pad thai. Soggy noodles, with some bland sauce, and half cooked chicken. The best thing about the place was the hot sauce collection.

reviews.name: Emma L.
reviews.review: This place makes me so happy.Quite good food, but don't go at weird times, as sometimes it's been sitting for a while... The food is certainly better at some times than others, but that's a part of the cafeteria style fun!All the stuff they sell is so, so sweet. Surprisingly, they sell a bunch of really cute and well-priced bags, necklaces, etc. They also sell well-priced and huge bags of jasmine rice.They've got my heart.

reviews.name: Lauren E.
reviews.review: A convenient place to pick up ingredients if you are planning to venture into asian cooking. Things are surprisingly inexpensive, which is nice. They also sell local honey, and a bunch of asian candies to choose impulsively as you exit. Note that you don't have to pick from the buffet, they make food to order as well.

reviews.name: Alan W.
reviews.review: I've never had anything off the buffet here, but you absolutely cannot beat this place for takeout. Walk in, pick up a spring roll or crab rangoon, order something from the kitchen, and pick up your freshly prepared food by the time you finish your appetizer. Nothing from the kitchen has ever disappointed me in any way.

reviews.name: Liz H.
reviews.review: I LOVE International Market!  This Thai owned family restaurant has been around 30+ years.  My family used to walk down the street to eat here as a child.  The food is delicious and still reasonably priced in an age where everything seemd to be skyrocketing.  Although their delicious papaya juice is no longer "on tap", you can buy a similar bottled product.  Spicy chicken on a stick, crab wontons, the eggplant, and bamboo shoots are some of my favorite dishes.  You can now even order specialty dishes from the kitchen in addition to ordering from the buffet classics.  For dessert, treat yourself to the white rabbit milk candy, rice candy (comes with a sticker), or a fortune cookie!The atmosphere here is casual and colorful with art, instruments, and import items displayed on the walls, and available for purchase on shelves lining the entrance way.  Parking could be a problem as the area has become more congested with development over the years.

reviews.name: Brett W.
reviews.review: I'm not an Asian food aficionado by any means.  Though I do enjoy Chinese food, before moving to Nashville my main exposure to it was at the buffet line of various establishments typically run by Latinos that included taquitos, fried chicken, and chocolate pudding right next to the sweet and sour chicken.  International Market was my first taste of something different.Now, I know that International Market isn't the pinnacle of Asian cuisine.  It's not even my favorite Chinese restaurant in town (that honor goes to Chinatown near Green Hills Mall).  But International Market was there first, so it gets a nod.The staff at IM are always very quick and courteous, which considering this is a cafeteria style eatery, that puts you in the right state of mind right from the start.  The Chinese options are fairly typical fare, but they are all consistent and tasty.  I suggest the pepper steak over some fried rice if you're a first timer and not a vegetarian.  I'm also addicted to the chicken on a stick, because really, any food on a stick automatically gets points just for being on a stick, right?  And for dessert, skip the confections by the checkout counter, and opt instead for the fried sweet potatoes, lightly battered in tempura batter, which they've had all but one time when I've been there and are absolutely delicious.  I can't speak for the Thai options that IM has, but my girlfriend has had the Pad Thai with fried tofu on many occasions and has always enjoyed it.International Market may not be the best place in Nashville for Asian food, but for the price (we always eat for far less than twenty bucks) and the portions, you really can't beat it for a good, quick, cheap meal.

reviews.name: matt c.
reviews.review: Good for the price. Dishes to think about: Green curry, Singapore noodles, noodle soup (esp. w/ shrimp), Pad Thai.

reviews.name: John G.
reviews.review: I love this place. I've never had a bad meal here, although I did just have a lunch that was only "good."  I have never ordered from their extensive buffett, in favor of ordering from the kitchen.  I love the chicken satays, they are really amazing. The Panang is great, and the Tom Ka soup is great too. I get them both with chicken.  You can also find some good imported teas and beers in their coolers. Everytime I have been here I have heard an asian person order in Thai (I assume). So that is a good sign to me. Very affordable too.

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: International Market has the most inexpensive Thai food that you can find in Nashville.  Located across from Belmont University, the restaurant features a Chinese Buffet style setup and a menu to order from.  I am a big fan of all things Pad Thai, and I must say that International Market has some of the best that I have tried in Nashville.  Even with that said, my favorite thing on the menu has got to be the chicken noodle soup with garlic.  Seriously, it is the best chicken noodle soup that I have had (don't tell mom), it really hits the spot if you feel ill or if it is freezing outside, like it will be in about a month!

reviews.name: Theresa M.
reviews.review: lemongrass soup with chicken, bown rice and veggies is delish!  i crave it!!!

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: if you want food poisoning go here!  this place made me so sick,  and it wasn't even from the icky buffet.  NOT CLEAN ENTER AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.name: moore t.
reviews.review: simply put, all the food tastes the same.

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: Your typical Asain market with the to-go buffet in back, except this one blends South Asain and Chinese fare in with its Thai buffet.  The result is quite tasty, but not spectacular.  Try the chicken and bamboo shoots in green curry.  I give it 4 stars instead of 3 only because it is very cheap and, unlike most Asain markets, the place is laid out really well and you can spread out and spend some time at one of the many comfortable tables in the middle of the store.update: second visit, the food was bland.  downgraded to 3 stars.

reviews.name: Lauren A.
reviews.review: I love this place.  Its down the street from my house, so it is very convenient.  The portions they give you are huge and the price tag is small, which makes for a great place to eat when you're on a budget.. and if you're like me and can't eat all the food they serve you, you take home the leftovers and have another meal for the next day.  the veggie rolls are my favorite, especially when craving an egg roll.  They also have a decent little asian market, which is great for when you need some hard to find asian ingredients.  They finally started carrying matcha powder (which is green tea powder) that is a great little ingredient when you want to make an interesting treat (i use it to make green tea cheesecake).  They also have black sesame seeds for a great price (just think of smokey flavored sesame seeds, so good).  I also like to get a pack of the rice candy when checking out..  a nice treat to carry around in my purse.  The staff here is really friendly, so thats another reason to keep going back.  Also, I don't think its on their menu but you can order Thai Iced Tea when checking out..  one of my favorite things to drink (although it can sometimes be a little too sweet).  I don't have a negative thing to say about this place.  I think the owner of International Market also owns PM across the street... so if you're paying attention, you'll notice that employees are always running back and forth across the street to take care of both spots.  I really hope Belmont doesn't run them out... as I've heard rumored before.

reviews.name: Phil S.
reviews.review: I eat lunch here once or twice a week.  I like it because it has good, fresh cooked food with a good choice of vegetables.  It's been run by the same woman for 30 years, and it has a nice homey feeling.  I can get a very nice lunch for about $5.

reviews.name: Kathy C.
reviews.review: My 40 year search for AUTHENTIC DELICIOUS Mexican food in Tennessee is finally over! We had a family get together last week. Our daughter heard about this truck from a friend. She ordered a few of each item so we could sample the menu in case we wanted to return. The first bite confirmed that my eternal search is FINALLY OVER! Home made tortillas, grilled chicken, vegetables and beef, authentic Mexican rice- all delicious! Not only was the food incredible but we bought a lot of it for less than $45.00! Yes it's a food truck, who cares? They're located on Charlotte Pike permanently. The green sauce ( served on the side in little containers) is very hot. Great food! The search is over...

reviews.name: Kina L.
reviews.review: So bummed out. It' usually a great sign when you see 15+ construction workers waiting in line and drinking jarritos while waiting for some tacos from a very homely, non blinged out taco truck....Sadly I failed this time. I ordered 3 tacos- lingua, carne asada, and carnitas. My tacos were on a very oily and soggy corn tortilla. The toppings were skimpy and there was no flavoring to my meats. I'm really hoping this was just an off day as I look forward to eating from plastic fold out tables while people watching on Charlotte Pike again.:[

reviews.name: Krystal S.
reviews.review: Ah the chicken street tacos are amazing!! I ate here yesterday for lunch and loved it so much I came back today. I work in a large office and 2 other depts questioned where I got the food. :) I will recommend this taco truck to everyone!!

reviews.name: Mo P.
reviews.review: My favorite taco truck. Delicious el paisa style tacos. Yeah you'll have an advantage if you can speak a little Spanish but it's fine if you don't. Just order a bunch of tacos and make your mouth happy as hell. It's not a rough neighborhood it's just not super affluent. No one is going to stab you, you're probably not even on their radar. Get some tacos. Eat them. Go back to your gentrified part of town. Come back again next week. It's yummy.

reviews.name: Ong L.
reviews.review: This place was decent.  They cook the meat fine.  It's flavorful but it's average.  Had one slice of lime for three tacos which does not make me happy.  I'm a condiments junkie.  Carrots weren't fully pickled nor were they spicy.  Roasted serrano pepper didn't have any flavor.  Red sauce was pretty good.I grew up eating taco truck food from Cali, so my standards are high. Would I still go there?  Maybe, if I'm dying for some street tacos. But if I have time, I rather drive down Nolensville and hit up the rest of the other taco places until I find the holy grail.

reviews.name: Tara S.
reviews.review: Hmm...not bad. Not bad at all. Grabbed a few steak tacos and they were pretty tasty. The peppers it came with are HOT! I didn't eat them but my husband did and it was the funniest thing ever! Automatic hiccups in 3 seconds flat. Lol I'll be back to try the burritos and quesadillas.

reviews.name: Dan D.
reviews.review: Try the mulitas, they're awesome!! We had the asada, carnitas, and pollo and all were good, the asada was my favorite. (Mulitas are like mini quesadillas - 2 corn tortillas with cheese, meat, grilled onions and lettuce in between, grilled til it all melts together. Yum.) The salsas that came with them were spicy and fresh. I loved the big fresh pickled carrots and thick grilled onion slices. The corn tortillas were freshly made and tasty. The white cheese they use is perfect, especially the crispy parts that got a little burned on the grill... I will be hitting this truck up again for sure. It's next to a super mercado now and I think the full name on the truck is taqueria la mulita express #2. Cheap prices ($2 mulita $1.25 taco) and well seasoned food that definitely exceeded my expectations.

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: Holy Stupid Hipster Pants Batman!!!I felt like I was going to get stabbed from behind the entire time I waited for my burrito's to get made.  But alas.  They were damn good.So with that said.  Since I'm pale as all hell, just note that English is not the 1st language in this part of town but the food is damn good.The might be the only location in the world where a Luchador mask would not only keep you safe but it would be a welcomed site.  That is unless you want to get kidnapped in Mexico City.

reviews.name: Catherine W.
reviews.review: .99 cent tacos! I've been here twice, both were good. There's not a ton of options, but they have good tacos. Their quesadilla is good too, not too greasy. Although it's on a flour tortilla, but their tacos come on corn tortillas. You can also phone in your order and then just come pick it up.

reviews.name: C W.
reviews.review: Love this truck.  But just got a burrito. A torta and 2 taco plates at 5 dollars each and some rice and beans.  22 dollars of food.  But a new, young guy I'd never seen charged me 32.  I'm happy to patronize the truck and the super mercado.    But not if they rip me off

reviews.name: Teresa B.
reviews.review: This is a pretty decent truck.  They have a high health score rating and the burritos and quesadillas are great!  Oh, and you gotta try the chicken torta - very yummy!

reviews.name: Yifei W.
reviews.review: Best tacos around town. Cheap and flavorful. They do make it fresh on order(10-15 min wait time) so take a walk to the supermercado next door and check out some mexican candies.

reviews.name: Tin N.
reviews.review: Located next to Super Mercado.This food truck provides the best Mexican food in greater Nashville area. When I moved here from soCal 3 years ago, I constantly craved quality Mexican food that was plentiful back home. My two Mexican classmates (one from East LA and other from Fullerton) and I spent so much time and money looking for decent Mexican food in Nashville.After 6-8 months, we gave up on actual restaurant establishments throughout Nashville. They all catered to non-Hispanic clientele, substituted quality by slabbing beans and/or cheese, or were regularly devoid of customers overall (for good reason). Instead, the three of us tried EVERY Mexican food truck that we came across over the last three years. We were very religious about this. If one of us spot a Mexican food truck, we'd take note of the intersection and made sure we'd try it before the end of the week. I've eaten well over a dozen or two Mexican food trucks in Nashville over the years. One truck(s) came out consistently on top: Taqueria Express. I have two soCal Mexican friends to back that up (one of them surprisingly cooks very well).Even if several of these trucks populate the same block or two on Charlotte, Taqueria Express always had considerably more Hispanic customers. Even while waiting for my order, at least two or three cars would drive up, park, and place orders. This does not happen at other Mexican food trucks and I don't blame them: they're not as good as Taqueria Express.I'll be honest in stating that I've been disappointed by the rave reviews that a number of Mexican restaurant establishments have received on Yelp. That's why when it comes to ethnic foods in Nashville, I trust the crowding of ethnic customers more so than high scores on Yelp (ie Seoul Garden). Taqueria Express is another great example.Don't get me wrong, a few other Mexican food trucks will provide an item or two that will top Taqueria Express. Some tacos will be better found elsewhere, depending on your personal preference on the ratio and balance of various ingredients. But as a whole, the meats are more flavorful, more juicy, and remind me of the food I've eaten within 1 hour from the Mexican border.My personal favorite meats at Taqueria Express, in this exact order: 1 pollo (chicken), 2 pastor (spicy pork), and 3 beef (carne asada). I personally like the quesadillas, mulitas, sopes, and burritos.This is where my confusion lies. There are a small number of food trucks in Nashville called "Taqueria Express". With my limited Spanish (and their limited English), the employees have stated that these "Taqueria Express" trucks are from the same company. I'm not sure if they're all owned by one person who licenses out these trucks, if they're distributed as a franchise, or are jointly operated by the Mexican Mafia. If you look at the city licenses taped on each of these trucks, they're all registered with a slightly different name, address, or person. Yet the menu items are identical, the menu pictures are identical, the prices are similar, and if you ask the people who work there, they say they share the same recipes and ownership.I've asked each truck how many trucks are under the "Taqueria Express" company (my classmates have asked them in Spanish as well). Each truck has given a different number, whether it's 5, 6, 7, or 8, all in the greater Nashville area. My classmates and I have located, pinpointed, and eaten at exactly four of these Taqueria Express trucks. We have searched high and low for the remaining 1, 2, 3, or 4 trucks (your guess is good as mine). I'll post reviews of the three remaining Taqueria Express trucks (that I've found) on Yelp as well... I hope the Yelp gods and goddesses don't mind me copying and pasting since their food items are almost identical. ;-)I'm so happy to post this review--now I can finally check-in at Taqueria Express several times per week. I love the chicken quesadilla. Be warned though: a number of the non-English speaking customers will hand you their odd business cards for who knows what. I've collected a stack of business cards from other Mexican customers over the last 3 years. I have no idea what these businesses do. I don't speak enough Spanish and they don't speak enough English to explain to me what that's all about.Prices at the Charlotte location are a tiny bit higher than at the other three Taqueria Express locations. No idea why!

reviews.name: Joe K.
reviews.review: Friendly staff and service, I ordered my food and it came up quickly. My salad was really good, I got it with honey mustard dressing.  I ordered the turkey chipotle panini and it was no mistake I really enjoyed it! I will definitely be coming back!

reviews.name: Truman W.
reviews.review: The service is terrible. The workers were very rude and give ridiculously small portions. Also, if they don't have something pre-made, they won't make it.

reviews.name: Ingrid H.
reviews.review: Great salad option in the food court at Opey Mills. You select your greens and then up to 4 toppings. Each additional topping is .79 more. There were lots of dressing choices, from traditional to some odd ones. I tried the sesame mandarin orange. It was fre

reviews.name: Mike D.
reviews.review: If you were dragged to this mall as a 'baggage handler' and need a break, head towards the food court. But remember, most everything here will cause you to crash or fall into a diabetic coma. Hence Green Leaf's. Choose your greens (Spring mix, romaine, or spinach), 4 included toppings, and any of the variety of dressings (mixed in or on the side) to keep you healthy and support your physique as you carry all of your (or your significant other's) shopping bags around this enormous mall...

reviews.name: Michele M.
reviews.review: The Far East salad was good.  I asked for the grilled chicken instead of the soupy chicken that was supposed to come on it.  Green Leafs can be a healthy option in the mall food court.

reviews.name: Eboni S.
reviews.review: This place has amazing hibachi. The server was super attentive. We were waiting on friends, and she was patient with us. The cook was extremely entertaining. He made jokes, conversed with us, and did some neat tricks. He did all this while cooking a delicious meal. I ordered a sushi roll that was really good! The sake was strong so I left a little tipsy! Lol!The cook is the reason I'm giving them 5 stars. He really made our experience worth while. Usually when you are watching your food being prepared you may grow impatient because of hunger, but he made the wait worth it!  Shout out to Scooby!

reviews.name: Cory D.
reviews.review: My wife and I love going to hibachi restaurants, and have been to several in the area. We noticed this one when coming out of Kroger about a week ago, and wanted to give it a try. I looked online and found some good reviews so after work on Friday we tried it out. When we arrived there weren't a lot of people, so we were a little concerned but when we were greeted our concern was put to ease. They had friendly service, a good menu and a really nice layout. Our "cook" came over and was very friendly ( we had our 2 year old and he went out of his way to get her name and include her ), the "show" was one of the better I'd seen and the food was great. Seasoned well, and tasted excellent. One of the people at our table ( not in our party ) didn't like onions and they did a great job ensuring she was taken care of. Overall it was a great dinner, and I know we will be back. My only disappointment was how empty it was, part of the experience is the "electricity" of other tables. I had heard the prior restaurant there wasn't good and I know people can be scared to go back again, but I assure you if you like hibachi you will enjoy your time here. On a side note I worked in restaurants for over 18 years and am normally highly critical of service, food and environment....these guys get high marks on all three. Give Oya a chance and I know you'll enjoy it. Plus it would be nice to support a small business owner who took over a project.

reviews.name: Anita A.
reviews.review: Ok this is definitely the best hibachi I found in Nashville!  Ask for J.R.!!! Scallops and filet were cooked to perfection!!! The filet pretty much melts in your mouth all I do is add some fresh ground pepper to it...  I will definitely be back! I really want to try other things on the menu as well. The soup and seafood egg rolls were very delicious as well!!!

reviews.name: Jill N.
reviews.review: Yum!! We ate hibachi style. The restaurant was quiet. The food was delicious. The chef was awesome! I'm not sure why more people don't know about this place. Check them out!!

reviews.name: Courtney A.
reviews.review: This would have been a 4-5 star review, but today's experience was not as enjoyable enjoyable. We walked in for an early dinner at 5 so we could have a quick dinner with our toddler and we are the only people there. We order, eat our soups and salad and then right as I think it's time to start the hibachi they sit others at our table who walk in. So that adds another 20 minutes of us waiting for them to order and then eat their soup and salad. This was not fun with an impatient hungry toddler. Regardless of liking the food, this experience alone made me decide that I would rather drive to nippers corner than eat next door.

reviews.name: Melanie B.
reviews.review: Oya used to be called Minami in the Kroger shopping center on Nolensville Rd at Concord Rd. Minami was fairly decent for just a nearby hibachi place when you wanted something different without having to go too far, but they are now under new management. The family who owns Sushi O Sushi in Lennox Village bought this place and remodeled it and changed the menu. It has really improved. The sushi is so much fresher and the chef is amazing. We loved him at the other place and we're so glad he's here now. They have a good variety of sushi rolls without being overwhelming, and all the standards, of course. Delicious. The miso soup is great. Before the changeover, it was just broth and some scallions, but Oya's soup definitely has more substance. The new level of quality extends to the hibachi as well. It's not high-dollar hibachi, but it's very good for a little neighborhood restaurant. It's nice to have something so close by that's fun and different. You can order all the hibachi meals at the regular tables in the sushi area as well, and that's nice when you're not in the mood for the show. Highly recommend!

reviews.name: Bill W.
reviews.review: Had a to go order of the Bento Box Special they gave you plenty of good food for the price. I also got and extra Spicy Crab roll which was excellent just to much food didn't need the extra roll.

reviews.name: Linz L.
reviews.review: The drinks were overpriced and the food was super salty.  The service was good but the kitchen took forever.  Our salads were covered, no they were smothered in dressing.  The soup was just chicken broth (like the kind in the can) and that was it.  We ordered the hibachi dinner and never received our shrimp appetizer that was supposed to come with it.  They really just didn't seem to have it together.

reviews.name: Kimberly E.
reviews.review: Excellent sushi and service! We have dined at Sushi O Sushi for years now and love that Oya is even closer to our home. Our server was very accommodating and even had the sushi chef split our children's order when she noticed that they were no longer sitting next to each other. The seaweed salad was the freshest I've ever tasted and our table full of rolls were perfect. We had a great experience and we will be back!

reviews.name: Nancy P.
reviews.review: This was Minami. It is in the Kroger shopping center near Concord and Nolensville Rd. When I reviewed Minami I commented that they could not stay in business. The new owners have beautifully renovated it. The food was good. The service was very good. I hope that they are very successful!

reviews.name: Adam W.
reviews.review: My wife and i went to the former Japanese Steak House that was located here. It was horrible. Thankfully we went back when the ownership changed and we LOVED it! Atmosphere has improved but even more important, the food has dramatically improved!!

reviews.name: Ki K.
reviews.review: New name, new restaurant!  I was excited to check out Oya as I had heard there were new owners running the place.  Sure enough, from the interior of the restaurant to the food and the service, I was pleased with everything I saw.  I ordered a Sweet Heart roll, which was absolutely divine (and recommended if you are a big tuna fan!).  The menu had so many options with informative pictures of each sushi roll.  Plus, as someone who enjoys perusing the menu before going to the restaurant, it is available online in its entirety on their website, which I appreciated.My significant other had the Hibachi Filet Mignon.  The portions were generous as he consumes a large amount of food and was stuffed by the end of the meal!  Tip: be sure to ask for some of their famous YumYum sauce to dip the meat in or mix it with some fried rice!  Delicious.All in all, I have eaten at multiple hibachi restaurants in Nashville and was pleasantly surprised to see how affordable Oya's prices are in comparison.  Great quality of food, friendly service, and easy on the wallet (well, for the type of food you're eating!).  I will definitely be going back!

reviews.name: Arian T.
reviews.review: We were very hesitant to try this restaurant but after reading a few reviews we decided it was worth a try and I'm glad we did! The food is great, the service is awesome, the place is clean. I definitely recommend anyone who is a fan of good, quality food to give this place a try.

reviews.name: Sara K.
reviews.review: The sushi here is great! It's one of the best sushi spots we've found in Nashville since moving down here from Chicago a few years ago. We had the sweet potato roll, spicy tuna roll, hello kitty roll and the sweet heart roll. Each was rolled well, fresh and flavorful. We were impressed with the quality of the fish and also the fairness of the pricing. The owner was present, which I think is always a plus, and they did a great job with the redecorating. We'll definitely be regular customers.

reviews.name: Kimberly S.
reviews.review: Super tasty, clean,  and fast. What more could you want? Those milkshakes.... nom nom nom....

reviews.name: Adam R.
reviews.review: Flavors: ExcellentFood: Great!Serving size: DependsWhen you order the chicken strips, be prepared for tiny little tenders. These used to be a good size, now they are about 1/2 what they used to be. They are still seasoned and prepared well (and taste AWESOME with the Zax sauce), but the portion sizes are quite sad for the meats/protein.The fries and sides, however, are usually always quite good and there is usually more than enough with regards to portions.Overall: I'll be back!

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: I think I'm generally going to undertake a fellow Yelper's rating system of not giving chains more than 3 stars with few exceptions like Ruth Chris, Flemings, Roy's, and things like that, but I'm going to make an exception here because this Zaxby's was extremely clean (granted it's brand new), the employees were really nice (When I was tossing my leftovers away one noticed I was about to toss out most of my fried cheese bites, I told her I didn't care for them, and as I was walking out she handed me a coupon for a free appetizer for next time), and the fried chicken was quite, quite good.   Sorry for that super long sentenceThe nibbler literally took me by surprise, and the chicken strips has batter on them that didn't all come off at once, but was tiny grain-like.  The best chain fried chicken I've had.  Their "medium" drink is absurdly large.   I'm still curious how I spent $12 here, too.  I had the cheese bites, 5 chicken strips, a nibbler and a medium drink.  I'll be back.

reviews.name: Marko J.
reviews.review: Paid 10 bux for 10 small dried out wings. Got a salad that was ok. But for the price.....not happy. ZAXBYS........ZUCKZ.

reviews.name: Dana B.
reviews.review: As always - food is terrific!  Cobb salad as good as any Resturant -  and staff is friendly and fast!

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: I know they're just starting out, and this may be only for opening month, but I found this Zaxby's to have the friendliest employees of any fast food restaurant! This is how fast food should be!!! Of course, the food was superb as always. You gotta try the fried chicken zalad! As for the guy above me who refuses to give anything more than 3 stars, you suck. Giving something 5 stars doesnt mean its a 5 star restaurant, just means a 5 star experience, based on what it is. Some people....

reviews.name: Jessie L.
reviews.review: First time that I've ever had Zaxbys! Where have I been?! Haha. Food was great, restaurant was clean, and the staff were extremely friendly and patient! I will definitely go back.

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: I've had a couple of items off the menu and they were both fine. Nothing amazing, but neither were bad. I would say the positives are that the inside of the restaurant was clean and new and they also have the cool touch screen Coke machine that lets you add your choice of flavors to your soda. The negatives are it's kind of average food and it's on the pricey side for fast food.

reviews.name: Susan T.
reviews.review: A place with a decent chicken salad. My current favorite is the zen salad. My grandson is happy with his chicken and fries. And now my husband has joned the fan club.  Calls to see if I have started to cook. If I haven't the sly guy asks if I would like a zaxby's salad. I have my sandwich moods. Have not found one I wouldn't try again. The only down side is it took so long to get one in Hermitage.  The staff is always friendly. The order is always correct. The food is always what I excect. The dining area nice and clean. I like that there isn't anything that prevents my grandson from focusing on his meal and he gets his finished and ready to leave.

reviews.name: Lady C.
reviews.review: First time at this Zaxbys and it was by far, the best experience I have had with this franchise. I dealt with a guy named Q who was very enthusiastic and was having fun with his job! I normally don't do fast food and Zaxbys high-calorie options are definitely a nemesis of mine but the great customer service make keep me coming back for more!

reviews.name: Mike F.
reviews.review: Wait until East Nashville discovers that this joint is right in its backyard.Is it the best BBQ in Nashville? No. But damn if 8 bucks doesn't buy you a plate so chock full of meat and grease that you don't cry yourself to sleep that night.This joint is exaclty the kind of hole in the wall that I can't get enough of - dingy decor, shit falling off the walls (or better yet - the walls are falling off the building), no air conditioning, and people complaining about the lack of air conditioning. You know, the kind of joint were BBQ comes from. The heart and soul of BBQ.The plates - pork shoulder, quarter chicken, short rib - must be a good half to three quarters of a pound - and two sides. The sides are straight out of a can, and even served right from a crock pot behind the counter.4 stars for super cheap and tasty meat. One star off because the sides aren't much to write home about.

reviews.name: Dionne N.
reviews.review: This is NOT Cantrells from the 80's and 90's!!!!!! The food was terrible! I didn't notice at first but where is the smoker or grill. Is the food even cooked there! Don't waste your money!

reviews.name: Jacob M.
reviews.review: The food was fine, nothing spectacular. There is no indoor seating, and little outdoor seating. The service wasn't very friendly. I would suggest other bbq in Nashville.

reviews.name: Jay F.
reviews.review: It was good, nothing that wow'd me, but I like supporting small local operations. I was grossed out that pickles were places on the meat as an automatic thing, but that's my weird OCD. Huge portions, food I thought was just ok, I will try it again and order something different and re evaluate.

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: The rack of ribs is a great deal - 15.95 for a pile of bones that fed me and my wife for two meals with about a pound of meat left to freeze for something creative later. Excellent dry rub and strong smoke flavor, with plenty of tenderness balanced by some nice chew. The pulled pork sandwich and chicken plate were more forgettable. I will stick with the ribs in the future. Sides were fine.

reviews.name: Kest S.
reviews.review: I've only been in town a month, and i've only gotten food here once, so I reserve the right to change my opinion. That said- a whole, bar-b-que, succulent chicken for 8 dollars and fifty cents? Could life get any better? That's cheaper than a convenience store pizza! Crazy! We got a rack of short ribs (16 dollars, a solid half a pig, enough for four, or three if you are very hungry) and it was so good we didn't even need the sauce, so just used that on our own pork the next day.It's mostly a take out place- which works out for me, since it's on the way home for my dude, and I can call him up and ask him to pick it up- which I plan to do regularly. They do have some outdoor seating- I didn't see any indoors, but i wasn't looking, either.

reviews.name: Glenn S.
reviews.review: Wonderful food, great service, and the best vinegar BBQ in Nashville!  Prices are reasonable and portions are huge.

reviews.name: J G.
reviews.review: Best pulled pork in town- very moist and full of flavor.  Staff is always nice, and it's mainly a to-go place- good for picnics, family get togethers, etc.  Smoked chicken is great, greens are so good, and bbq baked beans are tasty as well.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: Good Bar-B-Que from a quaint family style Restaurant.  They have platters available or you can just order bulk shoulder, ribs, or chicken.  A nice spot that is a little out of the way, but worth the trip.

reviews.name: Da Deacon H.
reviews.review: Came here with a group of friends to watch the pacquiao fight....What do you expect from Hooters..good wings, cold beer, decent looking chicks in hooters outfits ( NOT LIKE I WAS LOOKING..:) )  with good service! And thats pretty much what we got. It sucks that you have to pay a cover to watch a fight here but at least it was only 5$ instead of 10$ that most places charge!  Service was a bit slow even before the fight but other then that i will return!

reviews.name: Charlie M.
reviews.review: Terrible service, ordered 50 boneless wings and got 50 bone wings and when we said something to the waitress she said"let me go get my manager" after waiting a while she came back and said that they would take off half of the bill. We said that was okay and moved on but when I went to go to the bathroom it was disgusting! The doors were falling off, urinals were smelly! I will.never go back to this one!!

reviews.name: Mike P.
reviews.review: Terrible. Maybe because I was at the bar and got a water. Who knows. The bartender checked one me once. I ordered a 12 piece and they charged me for a 24 piece. When I got the tab, she gave me the bill that did not have a space to tip her (I always tip despite poor service.) I have eaten there quite often, but never again. You lost me as a customer.

reviews.name: Wg M.
reviews.review: This place is filthy. Waitress were decent, food was good, but it was so dirty and nasty.

reviews.name: Jesse Q.
reviews.review: Today I had the shimp poor boy with a coke it was free because I attend a boxing match here had to pay 10.00 admission but received a 10.oo coupon so it was a win win..The servers were nice the manager meet me at the door encouraging me  to smile I like that. .now back to the delicious food

reviews.name: Leigh M.
reviews.review: Came here for dinner with a few coworkers when we were having to work late. This is the first time I've been to a Hooters in years.I had a chicken sandwich. Hooters is supposedly known for their chicken, right? So ordering it in sandwich form should have been a safe bet, right? Nope. All I tasted was salty grease with a bit of cheese. If dinner had been coming out of my pocket instead of an expense account, I would have been terribly disappointed. One of my dining partners had some boneless wings which he described as "blah"  and the others didn't seem terribly impressed with their selections either.What really got me was how incredibly long it took to get our food. It wasn't very busy; I'd say maybe 50% of tables were filled at most. Yet it took forever for our mediocre food to come. Absolutely do not come here if you're under any sort of time constraint; you'll be late. Our server was as prompt with things as she could be and the food was piping hot when it arrived, so I'm inclined to believe that the wait was due to a slow kitchen rather than slow service. In fact, our friendly server was the only redeeming aspect of eating here. She was very nice, stayed on top of our drinks, and did her best despite the dismally slow kitchen.Not really planning on coming here again..

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: Came here because no where downtown shows UFC fights for some reason.... They did have the fight & there was no cover & like most other places it was non-smoking! The service was touch & go however our waitress was as nice as can be.  I know I have an unexplained love for Hooters wings & once again they were awesome!

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: Cheap and bad attitude. Ah where did you heard this before? Right, at every Hooters. I've been to this location many times, with big groups (guys and girls) and girls only. When I went with the guys, the service was top-notch. We had 3-4 girls served our table. They kept refill our drinks and brought out the wings even before we asked for them. I guess the guys I hung out with were big rollers. It was the opposite when I went with my girlfriends. The waitress  rarely stopped at our table and when we asked for new plates and utensils, she snarled at us "For what!?" and stopped going to our table after that. Yo, I've never expected good customer service at places like Hooters but damn girl, you need a chill pill. Let's talk about the food. The men said, "They have good chicken." Well, we all know they were just showing their BS skill and I'm not talking about a college degree. Chickens here are the worst. Too greasy and too much breading. After all these negative remarks, I bet you're wondering why I didn't just go ahead and give them one star. The Buffalo Sliders are what saving them from it. These are the truth! Get them with the fries and you won't be disappointed. Half-shell oysters were tiny and average. If you want good oysters, try the Southern Steak & Oysters. The Drunken Mussels (bathed in butter) were a scam ($9.99). I found about 8-10 pieces of mussels and there were about 20+ shells. I believe these were frozen as I had the exact mussels at Costco before ($3.99). They have a nice beach volleyball court in the back. Great for big groups. Half-price appetizers start at 10 PM.Cheap food. Waitresses with bad attitude.2013/#64

reviews.name: Antwaune D.
reviews.review: This is the best Hooters in Nashville! My personal favorite....get the Buffalo Platter!!!

reviews.name: Julie G.
reviews.review: Prob was a nice location 10 years ago, has a cool sand pit, etc. But now....it is really ran down and rough around the edges. Time has taken it's toll. With much nicer places just a few miles down the road, I say keep on driving!

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: At the end of a long Labor Day, on which me and my wife were celebrating our 2nd anniversary, with people following our random updates about where we were / what we were doing on various sites, we decided to come here.  Mostly as it was the most twisted end to a rainy night that had started at Holland House, went through the dripping cave of Italia in East Nashville, now it was time for Hooters.I don't think I'd been to a hooters in 10 years or so. Being a vegetarian there's not much to eat there, and being somewhat a realist I find it a little odd to go to a restaurant specifically to look at the scantily clad waitstaff... something about orange shorts and crazy bras doesn't do it for me.However, it was the perfect time to go, if just for a beer and a check-in that would make people laugh (it did) and a story "yup, that's what we did on our second".We got there, sat at the bar, I was reminded that this was not really my thing but we were having a fairly fun time. A waitress and I guess a patron were playing a game of Wii baseball on a red Nintendo Wii. I thought that was pretty amusing in itself until she got a home run and then... well... it wasn't exactly Man Show Girls on Trampolines, but close. A cacophonous shriek went up, and the waitress did some sort of short catwalk of victory jiggle back and forth... making enough noise that all eyes went there.Had that been it, I would have thought it just exuberance for the run batted in. 3 more times. Holy hell I've never seen anyone continue to be so excited that they were beating a customer 4-0. I sort of felt it would have been appropriate at the end of that show to toss a dollar or two at her or suggest she go on the price is right.We had our couple of beers, read the menus, contemplated getting a shirt but decided against it. Realized the prices really were quite reasonable if chicken was your thing.It was fun.. if chicken, orange shorts and beer are your thing, this is the place to go.

reviews.name: Berge B.
reviews.review: This was our first time to Hooters and it was a good experience.  Our waitress Aisha was very friendly, helpful and efficient. Food was good as well.

reviews.name: Janet K.
reviews.review: Okay I do have to clear my name here....being a regular at Hooters is not something I am proud of, however I work on the "wrong" side of town and my choices are limited.What can I tell you....the girls are cheap....Hold your judgments; it doesn't have anything to do with their boobs.  I have a great set myself.  It is about class; get some please!Service leaves a little to be desired, food is okay and prices are also.Will I go back, yes because my only other option is some fast food joint or Apple-bee's.  Jealous aren't you.So if you are in the neighborhood.....

reviews.name: Chris Y.
reviews.review: The worst server on the face of the earth works at this establishment.  Arrived at 11:30 and it was confirmed by the manager that the order was not put in until 12:20.  My wife went looking for our server and found her playing "ride the upside down stool" in the front of the restaurant.  When the food finally arrived via the manager, my enitre order was forgotten.  WTF??  Steer clear people...

reviews.name: Kaitlyn K.
reviews.review: Yes, I'm a girl, and I went to Hooter's.  My softball team and I decided to have a pre-game beer, and this Hooter's was the closet bar to the field at Paragon Mills Park.  The drinks were fine - decently priced.  Can't really go wrong.The actual restaurant was really old, dated and run down.  I don't expect Hooters to have the finest tables and stools, but it was pretty rough in there.  Our waitress was not really on top of it, and appeared to be high.  Her bra was even hanging out.  Attractive.  Many of the waitresses were also "chilling" - not working, and a number of them were getting massages from the men customers.  It was awkward.  I have a friend who used to work for a Hooters restaurant, and she would have died.  She is classy and extremely well put together - and this was the EXACT opposite.  We ordered the fried pickles and a basket of 911 wings (which is supposed to be as hot as they come).  The pickles weren't bad, they just weren't good.  The wings were WAY too fried, and the sauce was not spicy at all.  We also got a plate of carrots and celery, and the carrots were soggy.  It was gross.  I'd give this place one star, but beer is beer, ya know?Final piece of hilarious information:  We couldn't sit on the patio, and a large portion of the parking lot was blocked off because - get ready - there was a WEDDING that day.  Yep.  A wedding.  Congrats to Mr. & Mrs. Hooters!  Instead of beautiful flower arrangements, they went with the more festive, plastic, light-up, orange Hooters palm trees.  Much better choice, don't you think? :)

reviews.name: Johnny B.
reviews.review: I am such a big fan of the Hooters franchise, that I hate writing a bad review, so this one pains me a bit.  The service was slow and spotty, the waitress would say I'll be right out with that and take her time, except with the check, she brought that out quickly.  While I am aware chickens have feathers and the occasional pin feather  might make it to my table, I DON'T expect to have to pull them off 8 wings out of the 10 I am served.  The music alternating between "twangy" country crap and rock was sure to offend everyone with every second song.  This Hooters is off my list, only one of two for me to avoid, which is saying a lot, as I have frequented 77 different locations.

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: i once ate 45 wings here, lol.eric b

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: I love ALL Cracker Barrels! I really really really love this one. They could be full of themselves, but they are nothing but wonderful and good and fast! Have had breakfast, lunch and dinner here and each time, wonderful and fast. It is Cracker Barrel. One Yelper did not have a good experience. I would have called and made sure this would not happen again, but again, I have had nothing but wonderful experiences. Parking is easy but it is usually packed. Great for the tourist ready to see Nashville. I have had salad's, catfish and breakfast sandwiches with biscuits and corn muffins as usual. I love all servers and the tea is wonderful. My friend had the strawberry lemonade. She loved it!

reviews.name: Larry B.
reviews.review: I am a major fan of Cracker Barrel...but they really missed the mark tonight.  I had my usual breakfast sampler.  The food took a long time to come out for 9:30 pm.  The restaurant was basically empty.  Obviously, my food sat in the kitchen.  I would have sent it back but the waitress never checked back to see if the food was good.  Later she just dropped of my check and walked on by.Update:  As I was buying about $40.00 + of nostalgic candy, chips, sodas and other great goodies, the manager stopped by the register and asked how was my dinner.  So...I told him my story of cold food, now mind you, I still hadn't paid my bill yet.  His response was "sorry for your bad experience and if you come back in sometime this week he would make sure I had a better experience".  Second serious missed opportunity to remedy the poor food/service.  I was absolutely shocked, he didnt comp my $8.00 meal.  I do want to thank the wonderful women who helped me pick out my goodies in the store area and the very helpful cashier.  They were delightful!

reviews.name: Stephen M.
reviews.review: There was a 30 min wait so I did takeout.  They were fast 10-12 min, food was right and overall positive experience.  Had egg white omelette and standard breakfast meal.  Waitress was friendly.

reviews.name: Edward S.
reviews.review: Have been in Nashville a few days for a conference. Unfortunately, the seminars start at the butt-crack of dawn so we never got a chance to have breakfast here except for the day we were leaving. Cracker Barrels are for travelers like summer is for Eskimos. We look for the familiar sign next to every hotel we see along the highway. If it ain't there, we keep driving. We were able enjoy dinners a couple of nights.  But, after a week of hotel "continental" caca, we NEEDED a good breakfast and Cracker Barrel came to the rescue. And the nice waitress was very flexible with our healthy(er) alternative requests.The catfish I had one night was very tasty; well seasoned, moist and grilled perfectly. I would NOT call it "spicy" by any stretch, so pay no attention to that part of the description in the menu. The brown rice pilaf, excellent. Vegetables were bright, well seasoned and steamed just right. What can I say about their bacon ........ it's BACON!! But, it's Cracker Barrel bacon so that makes it that much better. Had bacon and eggs for my breakfast. Simple, fast, good, with generous pours of great coffee, and we were on the road in no time. Next time we get back to Nashville, we'll be back here, definitely.

reviews.name: Charlene C.
reviews.review: Had the BBQ RIbs with coleslaw  and my husband had the Friday fish dinner.  We were both extremely pleased with our choices.  Everyone else in our party loved their meals as well, The place is very noisy, the food great, service very good and friendly.  We would eat here again.

reviews.name: Crystal O.
reviews.review: We ate here for breakfast. It was average. There were 5 of us and we were squeezed at a small table and they added chairs. The biscuits were inconsistent. Some looked frozen, hard, and square others were flaky and fresh. The gravy was pretty favorless.

reviews.name: Kanya G.
reviews.review: What amazing service. Loved the charming country decor, which was especially appealing to me since this was my first time in the south. Food was so delicious and you can even have breakfast (like eggs, biscuits, gravy, grits.. yum!) around the clock. Definitely affordable and family-friendly. There's also a neat souvenir store attached. Glad to have experienced good ol' Southern hospitality on our first night in Tennessee!

reviews.name: Jen B.
reviews.review: We only ever eat at a Cracker Barrel when on a road trip, so there is automatically something that is great about eating at a CB. We love diggin' around in the gift shop area. The bathrooms are usually nice and clean at each one you stop at, so if you see the sign you know there is clean facilities available near by.The food is consistent and very down-home southern. Some of our favorites: Hash-Brown Casserole, I like the egg sandwich on toasted sourdough with sliced tomato and mayo. I usually add a slice of cheese to that. The 'old-timer' is a great combo breakfast that is a little smaller than the others which is helpful if you normally eat too much and hurt yourself for the rest of the day.Bonus: They offer audio books for rental (at ALL Cracker Barrel locations - perfect for road trips!). It's easy.1. Pick out a book on disc.2. Put it on your credit card (plus a $4 additional charge.)3. Listen on those super long drives.4. Return it to another Cracker Barrel anywhere.5. They credit your card back everything but the $4.The pickings are usually hit or miss to slim, but it is a great distraction on a long stretch of highway.

reviews.name: Jay R.
reviews.review: Fantastic! Looking for a nice breakfast? Come to Cracker Barrel! I had the pecan pancakes which are soft and wholesome, but also have a crunch to them on the outside! Service was quick and friendly! I was welcomed at the store by a lady who went to the back of the store to retrieve Cheerwine. One cashier said we have great servers here! And they do for sure! I had my food delivered at a fast speed!

reviews.name: Maria M.
reviews.review: Phenomenal!!!! First time here and Blake our server was amazing! Gave us a little Cracker Barrel history and helped us navigate thru the menu. He did not steer us wrong. Staying across at Opryland and if my pants will allow, we will be back for sure. Hopefully we are fortunate to sit in Blakes section again. Food was soooo good. Absolutely loved the hash brown thingy but now I think we need to be rolled out of the restaurant.

reviews.name: Scott H.
reviews.review: The breakfast was great! The prices are awesome and our server Latoya was fun and talkative. I bought some of the baked apples and a jar to take home they were so good.  I got the sunrise platter it was more than enough food.

reviews.name: Michael L.
reviews.review: We stopped at this restaurant were amazing they were tentative and friendly and the food was fresh and hot. The restaurant was also clean and just well taking care of.  We decided to eat here instead of at Opry Land resort due to the sudden rise in prices.

reviews.name: Dara M.
reviews.review: Okay, I had reeeeeally low expectations for Cracker Barrel. I went here because we needed to get breakfast and there weren't many options. Plus, we figured we were in the South and we should give it a whirl. When you walk into Cracker Barrel--the entry way, not even the restaurant proper, you're smacked in the face with the smell of...years of Southern cooking? I don't know. But definitely something.The service friendly and attentive. The food was better than I expected. I had the fried apples, hash brown casserole (made with "meat seasonings," so not vegetarian, mind you), an egg, and biscuits with apple butter. Yay for apple butter.Be forewarned, though...after you leave, you will smack people in the face with the smell of...years of Southern cooking.

reviews.name: Jesse W.
reviews.review: Cracker Barrel standard. Good breakfast by the fire!

reviews.name: Ama L.
reviews.review: The food was delicious and well priced!!The pancakes melted in my mouth too!The location was across the street from the Grand Opry Land Resort . 10'minute walk !Right outside the entrance to the resort !Enjoy

reviews.name: Larry S.
reviews.review: This is the closest Cracker Barrel to Nashville's airport, and my daughter was famished after taking the red-eye from the west coast.  It was awful cold outside, and it took us an awful long time to get our hot coffee, even though the place was practically empty.  Nevertheless, they kept a roaring fire going, and the food was very good.This isn't the oldest Cracker Barrel, but it's one of the oldest ones, and I'm pretty sure that it was the first one in Nashville.  It's smaller than some of their newer stores, but it's still one of my favorites.

reviews.name: Tina T.
reviews.review: Slow service and RUDE server. He was not 'able to keep up with me' because his lazy butt wouldn't refill my coke. Absolutely pathetic and it seems like they hire anyone.

reviews.name: Elisa M.
reviews.review: We had two fantastic meals served by Erma while we were staying at the Opreyland resort for a conference. She welcomed us so sweetly and took care of our every need! The chicken and dumplings are delicious! The biscuits are tasty and the atmosphere was so fun, the manager was even stoking the real wood-burning fire. Thanks Erma!

reviews.name: Ken F.
reviews.review: We always love to stop at Cracker BarrelRestaurants. Recently we stopped by the Nashville location. It was raining when we stopped and I could swear Cuz' from the Marty Stuart Band was standing out front under the porch with a  black western hat.As we walked past the fireplace, a roaring wood fire was burning and I decided to order French toast from a waitress with that sweet southern draw- I just sat back and recalled how much this reminded me of the way it used to be. For a short time I was at home-if you want to experience this; stop by a Cracker Barrel Restaurant.

reviews.name: Lg M.
reviews.review: Jammed full of people at 10:15 am with a line to put your name in, but we were seated in less than 5 minutes from walking through the door. Our server, Page was sweet, efficient and helpful. We had their blueberry pancakes and the special: apple streusel French toast. Awesome. Poached medium eggs were cooked perfect too which is not always the case at other restaurants. Always love the fun shopping area.

reviews.name: Maggie F.
reviews.review: I love this place, have eaten in just about every one I come across. It's cool that I finally get to eat where they started. TN is the Cracker Barrel's home state.  Breakfast is served 24/7 and there's no way I was leaving Nashville without their biscuits and gravy or hash brown casserole. I got the pork chop and eggs with all the usual fixings... Biscuits & gravy, grits and hashbrown casserole.   The pork chop was well seasoned but a little dry, get the ham-it's really much better. I probably should have gotten the apples, would have complimented the chop better, but I can't resist those potatoes!  Biscuits were perfect, light, not too dry and the perfect partner for their gravy.  Grits could have been better, why do I remember just loving them before? Not so much today.Overall, this visit was no disappointment, service was quick and friendly, food was as expected and price was quite reasonable.  I'm probably not going to eat for the rest of the day.  My whole meal, including fresh squeezed OJ was less than $12, no complaints there!

reviews.name: Corey W.
reviews.review: I feel like cracker barrel is a great place to go to when you have a hangover. Nothing like cheap greasy breakfast food to cheer up a splitting headache. The store gives you plenty of junk to play with while you wait or if you're really hung over a nice rocking chair to get some much needed fresh air.The menu seems to be made up of endless combinations of about 12 different choices. Nothing new, just staple American breakfast choices usually in portions that make you need to loosen a belt buckle and start an aspirin regiment if you were to eat the whole thing.Family friendly and its always packed. Why? Because your bill is going to be cheap.

reviews.name: Matt S.
reviews.review: This place is great! We have been coming to Cracker Barrel for a while now and every one we go to is amazing, they change up the menu just enough so it's new and fresh but always keeping the same Cracker Barrel classics. If you've never been I definitely urge you to give it a try. Hope this helps!!!

reviews.name: Russell M.
reviews.review: It takes a lot to mess up an experience with Cracker Barrell. Food and service are usually good. This is my first time at this location and it didn't dissappoint. Greeted and sat quickly, order taken, and brought out in a timely manner. Again hard to complain.

reviews.name: Aimee S.
reviews.review: Typical Cracker Barrel..good food, good service. It was a nice quick breakfast before heading out to explore Nashville.

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: I seriously can't express how thankful I am for such a loyal amazing staff that works here. Today I lost a $100 dollar bill in the country store. I cried my eyes out because I for sure thought it was gone. I knew Cracker Barrel was the last place I had been, so I called them. It turns out a young girl had found it and turned it in. I went back in and I was greeted by the manager and two other employees who remembered me. They were so happy to be able to return my money to me. My heart is still warm.  Thank you.

reviews.name: Kat M.
reviews.review: This is the good old homestyle cooking that my hubby sometimes favors.  I ordered the shrimp with coleslaw.  He ordered the chicken and dumplings with green beans and corn.I did not like our waiter.  As soon as we sat down, he asked us if we knew what we wanted to order.  We told him no, and he went to get our drinks.  30 seconds went by, our faces were looking down at the menu, and he asked us if we knew what we wanted to order yet.  I, again, told him NO.  This annoyed me.  Obviously he was a total moron.  People who are staring down at a menu most likely do not know what they want to order.My fried shrimp were much smaller than I expected.  I have never had small fried shrimp before (I am not much of a homestyle cooking restauranteur), but they were decently tasty.  I also liked my coleslaw.  The hubby was very happy with his chicken and dumplings.  I was happy stealing some of his sides.  For some reason, I like grossly overcooked green beans.  They are much tastier this way.So as soon as our dinner arrives, the waiter slaps down the bill.  This further annoys me.  I tell him we are going to order dessert.  He asks me if we know what we want to order.  I told him NO and that I wanted to finish my dinner first.  I knew if I gave him an order, our dessert would be out 2 minutes later.  I did not appreciate how rushed we felt by this idiot.  I noticed that he was treating his other tables the same way.  Management should really talk to him about his customer service.After we were done with dinner, we ordered the mixed berry cobbler.  It was just okay.  I make much better at home.  The food was pretty good, but the service was fairly lousy.  I don't like feeling rushed when I am eating dinner and the place was not all that busy.

reviews.name: Amy C.
reviews.review: Great place for breakfast...ALWAYS consistent no matter which location you are dining at.

reviews.name: Nicole B.
reviews.review: This place is ok. Food is satisfying but nothing special. Plain old country cooking I guess but, the flavors are super bland. So if your starving its a good place to stop because the tables tub quick and the service is great!

reviews.name: Heath C.
reviews.review: I love this place.  The southern feel, the food and the service are great.  First off, there are no Cracker Barrels anywhere near my home, so I go every chance I'm by one.  If you've never been, you have to try it.  They all have a nice little country store where you can pick up souveniers etc.I love the chicken fried steak and order it every time.  They have it down here - it's not all greasy or grissly or hard or dry or soggy or burnt or undercooked, like the average place.  Although this is not the best, all the other food is consistently good, from what I've tried.I've never had bad service here, so there must be decent training, protocals and follow through within this company.  Every server I've had was nice, friendly, helpful and attentive.Overall, you just gotta try this place, at least to say you've tried it.  As long as you're not expecting the best food ever, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Jeff H.
reviews.review: Mmmmm...Nothing outta the ordinary for this area but I am from CA and for me, this place reminds me of the last time I was in the south...delicious and heart deadly....The other cracker barrels in the southwest are no good but the ones in TN meet my approval

reviews.name: Frank M.
