reviews.review: Cracker Barrel is the same no matter what city or state.  Just plain ordinary.  Now, wouldn't you expect a place that specializes in breakfast to include omelets?  Well, the do have them - just not on the menu!!  Must be saving money!!Although, based on their origins, I understand them not having bagels BUT, for a national company, you would think they might want to include such an outstanding staple :)Cracker Barrel is the place to go for breakfast when you can't find another place.

reviews.name: Thomas L.
reviews.review: Great breakfast and great service from our server. Cracker barrel delivers great breakfast again..I came by here on a Saturday to grab breakfast with my wife on my birthday.  We were seated promptly and were greeted promptly by our server.  Our server's name was Trevor and I highly recommend  him.      We both got some coffee and I ordered  the Multigrain n' Berries Pancake Breakfast. The pancakes were great along with the raspberry syrup. I really liked the taste of the pancakes and the syrup wasn't overly sweet. The bacon and eggs were decent as well.    My wife got the Two Eggs* n' Biscuits and an added order of hash brown casserole. Everything was cooked well and she had no complaints.  Trevor, our server kept our coffee cups full and checked back often to ensure our satisfaction.We both were very pleased with our breakfast, which started out my birthday on a very positive note.

reviews.name: Chuck S.
reviews.review: Good food, bad service and when paying your bill they pressure you to buy more junk. I will never never eat at a Cracker Barrel again!!!!

reviews.name: Bill F.
reviews.review: We arrived Wed May 23 2012 in Nashville and met a facebook friend for Lunch around 3pm at Cracker Barrel.  A party of 4 including myself. The place was not crowded. Of course we were seated right away.Oh, deja vu.  I felt walking into  the store, I was back in Colorado and never left, except when the employees started speaking.  They had a southern twang instead of a western drawl.  Our friend asked us if we remembered Cracker Barrel Tchotchkes!, (we lived many years in NYC), from  about 20 years ago . We all said yes, and felt the trinkets and "collectibles" were different and unique, now they seem too standardized and commercialized.Late Lunch, As always the food was well prepared, Plate of Biscuits and Corn bread, hot and delicious, actually tasted better than back in Colorado. I'm thinking the humidity in Nashville contributed to the extra texture and taste as well as the Southern Drawal.I ordered the Half lb burger (medium) with onion rings. It's a shame that restaurants now a day make it standard procedure to cook beef at least medium.  My preference with beef is medium rare.  Overall burger had a wonderful charred taste, the Onion rings, absolutely delicious, crunchy, huge and plentiful!!!My wife ordered country ham, potato cheese casserole, apple sauce, and Double Chocolate Fudge Coca-Cola® Cake.  It was the first time she tried the Coca Cola Cake.  She absolutely loved it. I have a feeling it's going to be one of her standard desserts now!!  She always picks Cracker Barrel restaurants to visit when we travel the states.  She says she knows a town is civilized if there is a Cracker Barrel Restaurant in that locale!!! Our friend Lori, ordered chicken spinach salad with vinaigrette dressing.  Also delicious as always.Forgot what my other friend ordered.  Overall we enjoyed our experience at Cracker Barrel restaurants.  The service and and servers did a good jobI rate Cracker Barrel restaurants by my wife's experience.  It's not my style of restaurant, nor is it my restaurant choice. However as chain restaurants go, it's very competent and enjoyable place to meet with friends and make my wife happy.

reviews.name: Tim S.
reviews.review: It's Cracker Barrel people.  You know what your getting.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Great service. Seated immediately.  Healthy breakfast selection with big portions. I didn't finish my plate. Would come back to this one if back in Nashville, near Opryland Hotel.

reviews.name: Cerene P.
reviews.review: Never been to any of the numerous Cracker Barrel's before, this one did not disappoint. The menu was expansive, the food was fresh and the price was right. Not bad at all.

reviews.name: Adam N.
reviews.review: Enjoyed the atmosphere here! There aren't many vegetarian options at all, and even the ones that look vegetarian are often cooked in a chicken broth. I was concerned, though, with the healthiness of the meal--I don't know if my heart and arteries will forgive me for eating there...Overall it was a good place to eat and I enjoyed my time. Good prices, too.

reviews.name: greg j.
reviews.review: As a New York city slicker, I don't often hit these chain stores for my meals...preferring the more boutique variety....but the seating was quick...the hospitality and service was solid..the menu had an abundance of choices.. And the food, was fine, although not extraordinary in any way....the decor had that kind of throw back country store on steroids vibe....if it was toned down a little bit more it actually might feel more authentic...but did I really care that much? Naaw... The pancakes were what I wanted and what I got.l.its hard to mess that up...on the way out I bought a box of something or other...to pack in my suitcase figuring it would be cheaper than the same selection at the airport.....which is kind of what the concession felt like....have pan cake batter will travel...hi-ho!

reviews.name: Mark M.
reviews.review: Consistent cracker barrel. If you hve been to one then you know likely what is on the menu. Simple home type meals. Free refills. Can be crazy at noon or on near holiday season with opryland activity.

reviews.name: Jaime S.
reviews.review: Never been here before bc we came from out of town. Chicken n dumplings was pretty good, I got the sampler plate and my mom had the brisket. We came back once more before we left town, def a must eat at place!

reviews.name: David B.
reviews.review: Best chain for southern cooking.  I have never been disappointed with my breakfast here and this location was no different.

reviews.name: Mr. O.
reviews.review: Never been here before so I want to check it out for myself. Tried the CB sampler with meat loaf, ham & chicken dumplings. Too little to late.My friends say this place is good for breakfast. Maybe I will give them another chance in my next life.Will never come back here for lunch, it's not worth it. E i E i O!!!!!!!!!

reviews.name: Stephanie R.
reviews.review: OMG!  i could gain 50 pounds in a week if i lived in TN.  The food here is so comforting and good and sooooo bad for you.  the service is wonderful too!!just try not to go on a sunday, the after church crowd could make a wait for longer than half an hour.  which if your starving sounds like an eternity.

reviews.name: Angie M.
reviews.review: Damn you people who have Cracker Barrels close by!  Went here for my last hurrah breakfast before leaving the music city and it absolutely hit the spot.  Eggs, turkey sausage, grits, biscuits/gravy, and hashbrown casserole... I could feel myself slowly expanding in my jeans.  Everything was tasty and CHEAP!  $14 for two huge plates of food! The store connected to it is fun.  Was able to pick up an Elvis Christmas ornament for my mom, and some candy for myself.  I can't help but love a store that smells like cinnamon.But the best part was when we were getting seated for breakfast.  Noticed the hostess was Filipina, and when she showed us to our table, I guess she couldn't help but say something, "Are you from an Asian country?"  Yay!  Asians unite!

reviews.name: Jill N.
reviews.review: We ate breakfast at the Cracker Barrel twice since we've been here, and probably will again.The bacon is probably some of the best bacon I have eaten.The wait staff is very friendly and engaging.  The meat and eggs breakfast is really good and the biscuits are fantastic.  I would have given a 5th star if they were more able to manage order changes.  I was hoping to get the special eggs/potato and veggie bowl with 2x veggies and no potatoes, but the waitress said it's just made that way.  Maybe a different waitress might have had a different answer, I don't know.Prices were reasonable, and breakfast was good.

reviews.name: Casandra M.
reviews.review: This was my first meal in Tennessee. Our waitress jerilou was so friendly and sweet. The food was amazing and comfy, good portions as well. I love Tennessee :)

reviews.name: BL R.
reviews.review: I should have known better, but when you're hungry and start thinking about getting good comfort food, you sometimes lose you sense of reason. The wait staff were nice, but the food is out of a can.  Yuk.

reviews.name: Brigette W.
reviews.review: Very good food. Great for breakfast! I love the shop, and the biscuits and gravy was wonderful! Plus the service was very wonderful. Overall, a pretty decent place to go eat.

reviews.name: .elin f.
reviews.review: Soggy carrots, mushy green beans, lumpy mashed potatoes, deep fried chicken fried steak...  EVERYTHING tastes better with gravy.And dear waitress, how DID you know that we were not from around there?  We could've very well worked at the nail salon or the chair massage kiosk at the mall and just been on our lunch break.I did like the general store attached to the restaurant where I loaded up on $0.10 candy sticks and a Boyds Bear dressed up as a pear.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: When I first moved to Nashville my first task at hand was to find a cracker barrel and take in the experience. I know that this place is near and dear to Southerners hearts and though I love the down home country feel the food is just not very good. My favorite part about Cracker Barrel aside from their fabulous signature rocking chairs are their servers that without skipping a beat accustom me to be being called honey and darling. However aside from their flavorsome roast their southern charm does not make up for not so tasty food.

reviews.name: Joe C.
reviews.review: I live within 2 hours of Nashville so when there with my brother and sister, we decided to get a good steak dinner.   It was Friday night and it was packed and without a reservation we decided to sit in the bar area at a high top table (my favorite type of arrangement anyways).   I did not have the opportunity to sit in the main dining area but it looked very nice and the atmosphere was what you would expect at a high end restaurant. The bar servers waited on us and as busy as it was, we received prompt service.   The mixed drinks were great and the appetizers were also good.  Had Baked Escargot, which I had never had before and surprisingly tasty.I had the filet with potatoes and since I like it medium well, it is sometimes dry.  In this case the steak was perfectly cooked and not dry but very moist.  I am not a steak person but have one every once in a while.  I have had filets at Ruth Chris and Flemings; this rate at or above theirs.  I noticed the reviews are all over the place but in my opinion, it is a 5 and I would go again.

reviews.name: Jackie W.
reviews.review: Not impressed!  Very expensive for substandard quality of food and service --  Watched the chef all dinner long touch steaks with his bare hands, toss and spin the cooking utensils in the air as though he were a cook at a fast food chain with no knowledge of health and food handling, the servers would come by the chef and dish warming station and use their bare hands to rip apart greens for garnish and place on plates, and a server in the dish washer room wiped his nose and forehead then hands with the same towel and  proceeded to handle the greens and place on the dinner plates - does anyone in that restaurant wash their hands with soap and water?- Steak not grilled or served with crisp grilled sear - visually and taste unappealing; boiled/broiled with juice from bottle poured on plate prior to serving (saw that from our table too)- The server - very scripted, unfriendly, asked my husband and I if he should spill what's left in the bottle of wine we ordered (instead of asking if we would like to take it home with us), timing off, etc.Overall, there are other steakhouses in Nashville that you can get better quality of food and service for your money!

reviews.name: Christopher S.
reviews.review: Let's talk about how underwhelming this place is.  And how bad the service is.  This guy "Duboise" was horrible.  HORRIBLE.  Everything is overpriced.  Like, $15 for a "lobster" bisque overpriced (a/k/a a bowl of cream with some lobster pieces).Should also add that the decor is hilariously bad.  Everything is a dark gray, and the lighting was hideous.  It felt like I was eating on the set of a bad Steven Seagal movie.  Wait, every Seagal movie is bad. . . Nevermind.. . . I can't say I understand it.  Just saying, don't go here.  It's an amazing rip-off.  Food is ok if your boss is paying.  If it's your money . . . go somewhere that's ACTUALLY GOOD.

reviews.name: David A.
reviews.review: I'm the occasional red meat eater. The steak was cooked exactly as ordered. The truffle butter on top added nice extra flavor. The sides were hot and flavorful. Just a bit too much garlic on everything. I was belching garlic breath for hours afterwards. Not a good thing on a date night.The atmosphere was kind of gloomy. Someone mentioned a S. Segall movie. Yeah, like that. Food was good with large portions. Just a bit pricey. I didn't feel we received the full value of $100 per person, but still nice. Maybe for a special date night.

reviews.name: Charlie S.
reviews.review: Expected a little more from this place. I have eaten in many of the high end steak house chains and this one was a bit of a disappointment.The service was very good, friendly and fast. We had brisket tacos and crab bisque soup starters and both were very good.The bone in ribeye was slightly over cooked and poorly seasoned. The sea bass dish seemed to be moments form spoiling as it was really fishy. Have had great experiences in the past at Morton's, this may have just been an off night.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: Underwhelming food. Ridiculous prices. Much better steakhouse options. Not to mention a dark dingy decor reminiscent of a funeral home.

reviews.name: Jim P.
reviews.review: Morton's has always been my favorite upscale steak house, both for entertaining clients and also to celebrate family events. I'm afraid they no longer hold that title. Had dinner with my wife and was mildly disappointed.  Granted, I hold them to a very high standard, but they usually easily eclipse my expectations.  Food, as usual, was very good. We both had the filet with well-prepared sides, and the key lime pie was solid. My problem was with the service.  Our server would disappear for long periods of time.  He would occasionally walk past us failing to notice that my wife's wine glass was empty. He had larger tables he was attending to. Maybe it was an off night and I am not going to write off Mortons based on one bad evening, but there are other options now available InNashville.

reviews.name: Eric D.
reviews.review: I don't mind spending the money once in a while at an upscale steakhouse, but this place was terrible. I ordered the ribeye med rare and it was blue at best and the quality of the meat wasn't there either. For my side I ordered the chopped salad, pretty sure it was made from leftover lettuce and tomatoes. I will not go back.

reviews.name: Morgan O.
reviews.review: I sat two seats away from Robert during the "hat" incident. The food was good yet overpriced, but of course the incident left a bad taste in our mouths and made us too easily forget anything else that had transpired that night. To this day I still feel as if the whole situation was handled poorly. I posted the original viral post on Facebook. Over 9,000 shares currently. You can read it here: facebook.com/morganoverh…

reviews.name: Candice C.
reviews.review: The service was fantastic. The Brussels sprouts were a fave at the table but I don't eat bacon so I passed. The crabcake was fine- a little fishy. The wild mushroom side was amazing! I think everyone enjoyed the sides more than the main course! All that to say...the food is fine but the price is ridiculous!! It ended up being about $100 per person. Overall, not my favorite place but a decent meal...especially if someone else is buying!

reviews.name: Cassandra P.
reviews.review: First time visitor to Nashville, and to Morton's, and I wanted to thank the staff and the Manager, Cory Mason, for helping to make this one of the best birthday dinners ever!The service, food, staff, and atmosphere were wonderful, and in addition, I have a menu with my name on it, and a great picture of my husband and I,  to help me to always remember this very special night!

reviews.name: Rose M.
reviews.review: We have been going to Morton's for over 5 years now, unfortunately I have to say that last night was rather disappointing. We ordered the lobster bisque, and there were exactly 2 pieces of lobster and it. For $15 that's ridiculous. Afterwards I ordered a 12 ounce filet mignon, and I wanted it medium. It came out rare and we sent it back, but it came out still not medium, but I was so hungry, I ate it anyway.But if I am paying $52 for a steak and $13 extra for fries, I expect more..I am not really sure what has changed it used to be so great in there... Not anymore.

reviews.name: Scott D.
reviews.review: We have been sitting here for 90 minutes and still no sign of food.  I hope it's good, but I'm borderline full from the loaf of bread I ate waiting for them to slaughter the cow and cook it.  I can't imagine it would be taking this long if the cow was already slaughtered before we got here.I likely won't ever come back and if I do I will eat before I get here.  Not the quality of service you expect and this price.  What a rip-off....

reviews.name: Andy S.
reviews.review: This is the second time I have eaten at Mortins Stake House and again the best stake I've ever eaten thank you Ryan the waiter you were right in it all the way through the meal.!

reviews.name: Suzy Q.
reviews.review: Prime ribExcellent ServiceIntimate atmosphereThe food was delicious.  Pricey of course.

reviews.name: Russ T.
reviews.review: Bar service is bad. All the bar tenders lack personality. Ashley is a top notch sever in the bar area tables. Food took forever but there was a very large party ahead of us. Food was good but overpriced.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: I had a decent experience at Mortons happy hour, but wouldn't rush back. A couple things that I wasn't a fan of:-NO drink specials. Really Mortons? Give us house wine discounts or something. Even a couple dollars off would be nice.-Overcooked/flavorless filet mignon sandwiches on the happy hour menu-Super crowded bar, and we couldn't move into the dining room; didn't make for a high end experienceI did enjoy the crab cake sliders, tuna tacos, and truffle parmesan fries from the menu, and I know the waiter did the best he could with such a packed bar. But our happy "hour" was more like two and we rushed to get to the ballet. I liked it ok, but nothing really blew me away from the experience or the food.

reviews.name: Julie P.
reviews.review: Visiting Nashville for the New Year. Came to Morton's on Dec 30th, without a reservation. Sat at the bar. Barman was not unfriendly, but not exactly welcoming either. I had high expectations, as I've only had wonderful experiences at Morton's in other locations (such as San Francisco where I live)Food was very disappointing overall except for the steak. My friend and I shared the chopped spinach salad, Short rib steak tacos and mixed grill (fillet, bacon wrapped scallops and jumbo shrimp. Salad was mediocre at best, could not taste any dressing. Tacos were very disappointing. Scallops & shrimp were terrible. Definitely the worst part of the entire meal. Our fillet however was cooked perfectly and was very good.  I would not return here and am sorry that I did not read reviews before going here.

reviews.name: Jessica A.
reviews.review: I have been to the bar for Bar Bites which is their happy hour. There are no drinks on happy hour, so having a drink will cost almost triple the happy hour meal you order. I only go here when desperate and there is nowhere else. The mini burgers are good, but it's just way too expensive when you can get the same quality elsewhere for cheaper.

reviews.name: Kristin Marie S.
reviews.review: Sorry Morton's but your happy hour did not make me happy. The steak was a little grisly and tough. The drinks were over-priced, which I'm sure is where they make up for the food prices, and overall I just wasn't feeling it. The service, however, was impeccable. Morton's does train their staff well. This review is mainly for happy hour at the Nashville location. I have had full steak dinners elsewhere and it was fantastic. When I win the lotto, or if someone else is paying, I'll head back to Morton's for a large, juicy piece of meat, otherwise I am taking my happy hour business elsewhere.

reviews.name: Rachel H.
reviews.review: My husband surprised me by making reservations here for our 6th Anniversary. We arrived and they personalized our menu by writing "Happy 6th Anniversary" at the top of the menu which was a thoughtful touch BUT they also printed the incorrect date. The table had confetti spread on top which made it feel more like a New Years Eve bash than a romantic anniversary dinner.We started with a bottle of wine which was just "ok" and with a $70 price tag we were hoping for more. Typically I feel steak houses have decent bread and we were both starving so we were excited when this huge loaf was brought to our table but it was horrible! The taste was bland and it wasn't even warm. We both started with our own shrimp cocktail appetizer and it was delicious! Well with the price. The shrimp were HUGE!I ordered the salmon and asked for it to be "cooked all the way through" but apparently that means burn it to the point that it's so dry it has no taste! It was barely edible. My husband ordered a mix grill which consisted if a steak, bacon-wrapped scallops and shrimp which he said was overall "good."We then ordered 2 sides: the Brussel sprouts and asparagus with a balsamic glaze. The asparagus was delicious! But the Brussel sprouts had bacon cooked with them and I don't eat bacon. Since the menu didn't state they had bacon I thought when I requested another order sans bacon they would bring it at no charge. Well that wasn't the case. So we spent $26 on 2 sides of Brussel sprouts. And the sprouts didn't even come out till I was almost finished with my dried out, now cold, salmon. We did receive a complimentary desert since it was our anniversary and it was yummy. Chocolate molten cake with ice cream. How could they screw that up?At the end if the day we spent $300+ for sub-par food, service and ambiance. I will NEVER go here again!

reviews.name: Michael K.
reviews.review: Great place. Great people providing great food and service. I don't care what everyone else says.

reviews.name: Chassity S.
reviews.review: Omg where do u begin! My boyfriend took me to Morton's to celebrate a new job and I've been in love ever since. The staff set up a whole surprise celebration dinner for me. Special menus that read "Congratulations!" and they even came to take a photo of the two of us afterward and presented it in a card signed by the entire staff!...From the valet to the manager...!  The service was amazing. Ask for Allison! She's the best.! Not to mention the food was great. Yes...better than Flemings! Worth every penny.

reviews.name: Mickey W.
reviews.review: Never paid so much for poor service and overpriced food.from the moment we arrived I felt like I was rushed in so I could be rushed out. Our waiter was rarely ever there for us and I practically had to get another waiters attention for WATER.  What was supposed to be a nice night out turned into an over priced waste of time.  I'm sorry a party of two isn't going to net you the mandatory 15-20% tip for a larger party.  but showing a lack of service to smaller parties is just uncalled for.  I will not be returning.  I will also not, repeat, NOT suggesting this establishment to friends.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: I was alone at the bar, tonight.....I didn't feel like cooking and I was in the neighborhood, so I thought I would go have a drink and maybe a salad before heading home.Ordered a Bourbon on the rocks and the lobster appetizer.Looked around and saw the place bustling.It made me feel good that they were doing good business.Appetizer was perfect.Bourbon was perfect.Bartender was perfect.I am so glad Yelp got rid of all the trouble on this restaurant.Hoping people use their brains next time, instead of their fists!

reviews.name: Heather T.
reviews.review: The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was nice. I ordered the lobster and it was ok- not the best I've ever had. My husband ordered the filet and enjoyed it. So, overall it was good, but for the money I will try another place next time.

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.review: I'm dreading writing this review. Honestly, the food was fantastic (some of the best prosciutto the hubs and I've ever had), the drinks were well-crafted (hello, Secret Garden cocktail), even our waitress (whose name escapes me) made sure we were well attended to. So, why the one-star rating, you ask? Well, it's simple, friends. Customer service and human decency go a LONG way.Basically, 16 of us dined this evening for my hubby's company holiday party. Several appetizers, entrees, and sides (and cocktails!) later, we racked up a $2000 tab and were well on our way to ordering desserts.Relevant sidenote: The hubs' boss is undergoing chemo treatments for a bout of cancer that has left him with a cold sensitivity, especially with the typical hair loss. When he put on a wool beanie in the restaurant to keep warm, he was immediately asked to remove it... which he did. When his family mentioned his condition and questioned the treatment from Catrina, the assistant manager, they were told he could wear it if he presented a doctors' note... or if we had given them previous notice so we could be accommodated elsewhere. (Out of sight, out of mind?)In short, what followed was shock/disbelief (can't say that I blame them) and the cops being called (huh?), and we were (all 16 of us) asked to leave.On our way out, my protective spouse asked the manager if we looked like criminals. To which he responded, "the cops just patrol this area and decided to check in." Riiiight.So. I reiterate: Customer service and human decency go a LONG way. I've been in Nashville close to 15 years and I really hate to think that the city I love has an establishment so pretentious that they would discriminate against someone with a life-threatening condition. Is a wool beanie on one individual's head that much of a threat to sales and ambiance?

reviews.name: Andi S.
reviews.review: Before ordering the Caesar salad, I asked the server if they prepare it the genuine way, with anchovies, and the server said "Yes", so I ordered it as well as the lobster bisque, which had very little lobster in it.  I politely asked the server to please rectify the situation and she flipped her lid.  It was incredible.  Not only did she fail to rectify the problems, but she would not let me speak with any manager and to top it off, I had to pay the full bill even though I only ate two bites of each dish.This place is HORRIBLE.

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: I can't believe what transpired at Morton's Steakhouse tonight.  I just came there from a company Christmas party, and I've never been treated so poorly.One person in our party is a cancer patient - and he needs to wear a wool cap in order to keep warm. His recent treatment makes him feel cold, and his measly wool cap helps him regain some warmth in these cold winter days.  Our party of 16 went  to Morton's and had dinner.  Near the end of the evening, the person dons his wool cap, and was immediately told by the assistant manager, Catrina, that hats are not allowed inside the restaurant.  After being told that the person was going through cancer treatment, the assistant manger told him THAT HE NEEDED A DOCTOR'S NOTE.   You read that right - he was supposed to have a doctor's permission to wear a wool cap in Morton's.  He and his family soon got up and left.After the rest of us complained - get this - MORTON'S CALLED THE POLICE ON US.  We were not unruly, and quite civil given the absolute rudeness of the management.  I was told by a manager that the police officer was just casually patrolling the area and came in, but I was told later that was a total lie.It would be one thing if we were just a couple of guys, splitting an appetizer and causing a commotion.  However, we were a table of 16 with a $2,000+ tab and being treated like criminals.I will never step foot in this establishment again, and I will tell everyone that listens to take their business elsewhere.  I will also make sure their corporate management hears about how awfully we were treated.

reviews.name: Nina G.
reviews.review: I ordered my steak medium and I got a well-done butterflied steak. That's definitely not what I expect from a steakhouse . You should be able to cook my steak in one piece to medium. Very disappointing we will not come back. The lobster bisque was 15 $ and had 1 tiny little piece of lobster in it . Unacceptable . We did cancele our reservation for today and go somewhere else . Never again . I can not recommend this place .

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: Finally. Finally. Finally. I have waited for years to have dinner at Morton's. Thanks to a celebration dinner was served in the "private" Boardroom of this Church Street establishment. It was my first time in the building after Castner-Knott vacated it a couple of years ago (wink). Dinner started with a round of drinks that ranged from fine wines, water, sodas, coffee and few in the party had Blue Moon and Miller Lite. The Prime Ocean appetizer platters were served family style and included cold and baked seafood. I especially enjoyed baked scallops wrapped in bacon. They were perfectly cooked and simply flavored for memorable experience. The crusted baked Shrimp and Shrimp Cocktail was served by an amazing cocktail sauce that became a dip for the giant onion bun served. The Oysters Rockerfeller was okay, but nothing spectacular. The steamed lobster was tasteless and very chewy. The condiment offerings compensated for the overcooked lobster. The Caesar Salad and the Bibb Lettuce Salads were very large in portion. Each individual order could have and should have been shared. The steakhouse favorite, Caesar was served with very clean, cold, and crisp Romain and heavily coated with a "just right" traditional dressing. The anchovies were unnoticeable (as they should be). The generous sized Parmesan shavings seemed fresh and was mild in flavor. The two sliced croutons were well prepared and gave the nice crunch to the salad. The Bibb Lettuce Salad was easily at least ONE FULL HEAD of Bibb dressed with a sweet dressing. The Bibb was accented with some cheese and walnuts. I think that the two salads shared between four guests would be plentiful and give a balance of sweet and savory dressings. The server suggested the Cajun Ribeye that marinates for a lengthy time. However, I wanted to experience the simple majestic taste of Midwestern beef and ordered the Filet Mignon. The meat arrived cooked to a perfect medium (nice sear on the outside and warm red in the middle). It seems that the only seasoning was salt and pepper and the steak was wonderful. Of course, the meat was tender and melted like butter in my mouth. The sides were served up family style and just simple spoonful of a few was plenty to eat. The best side of the night were the Sautéed Brussels Sprouts with bacon. They were a bit overcooked, but BS craze prevailed they were still very good. The Twice Baked Gratin was simply potatoes covered in cheese and bacon...and almost perfect. The Creamed Corn was sweet and creamed well with a mix of spice and some sausage for an average experience. The Grilled Asparagus were the very thick variety and required the sauce served with the dish...meh. The desserts were perfect as they were classic without being fussy. The Hot Chocolate Cake (saucy chocolate, molten lava) was certainly the best dessert with a scoop of Häagen-Dazs Vanilla Ice Cream. The richness of the chocolate was not overpowered by the sweetness that is typical with this dessert. It was very, very, very good. The Creme Brûlée with the specks of vanilla bean was simply prepared, smooth, and mildly flavored...perfect. The Chocolate Mousse was European style which is not as sweet as American style...it, too, was perfect. The coffee was simple, nothing fancy, but was helpful between the various samplings of so many wonderful desserts. Our dinner part of 16 was served by a delightful server and she was assisted by a couple of other servers. The service was very good without being pretentious or too casual. Glasses were never empty. And, even better, conversations were never interrupted among the dinner guests, but plenty of interaction was shared between us and the server. The server knew how to work with us for three and half hours. Very cool.I wasn't impressed with ambiance of the place. It seemed to lack a sense of warmth that "incandescent" lights should provide. I suggest lowering the lights a little and adding better candles to the place. The place was not very busy, but had enough patrons to make it feel as if it was a "place to be." hope to have a dining experience at Morton's again!

reviews.name: Jonathan N.
reviews.review: i thought we lived in pretty equal right state. So much for good business kicking out a cancer patient. Thats jsut plain wrong tsk tsk 1star

reviews.name: Stefanie P.
reviews.review: My husband and I are casual folks that love really good food. So we frequent Mortons - Bar specifically. Valet is right at the door and fast. They have bar bites, and drink specials that are great and a bit lower priced then their regular menu items - but I like ordering off the regular dinner menu in the bar. I recommend the Mixed Grill - 6 oz filet plus grilled shrimp and scallops. I tried the chopped salad and it was awesome. The servers are friendly and It's all around my happy place. Fantastic Food and great service. Oh and the onion loaf - OH MY.

reviews.name: Deen W.
reviews.review: Where do I even begin with Morton's? In its day, it was THE place. So many things have changed, though. In the past year, Morton's was bought out by Landry's. I think it all went downhill from there.We called to make a reservation and to have them put back 2 pieces of their prime rib. No problem, said the hostess. Husband called again on the day of our reservation and to make sure they put back prime rib. "No problem! We've got you down!"  We get there, only to find out they no longer serve prime rib. At all. Wish we would have know this from the get-go! Our server was terrible. There were fruit flies in the restaurant. (Server told us they didn't spray for bugs last week - whatever. Fruit flies in the restaurant mean fruit flies in the kitchen) No one came by with the little silver knife/table tool to scrape away crumbs. The crabmeat cocktail was about 90% lettuce in a martini glass with about 6 pieces of actual lump meat on top. My husband's filet,  while cooked properly, was not anywhere as tender as a prime cut should be. There were patrons in there wearing t-shirts and flip flops.......(whatever happened to "appropriate attire? - this is not the Sizzler, people!)Unfortunately, with all these changes, the prices are still the same. $200 for a dinner that we left hating. Next time, we'll head over to The Palm.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: To be clear, this review is just for the bar, Bar 12*21As one of my pals put it, "It's really just an upscale Applebee's"THE MOST EXPENSIVE BOOZE IN THE WOOOOOOORRRRRRRLLLLLD.Seriously, for the price of a Martini, I could buy a fifth of good, dry English gin.   I'm not sure of the accounting that goes into computing their cocktail pricing, but I am pretty sure there are hidden fees and taxing structures - the wife works for the Dept of Revenue and can't figure it out.  I've never had a bad drink here, but I always look at my check and scratch my head afterwards.On a side note, I've never had a bad dinner at a Morton's restaurant.

reviews.name: Stacey D.
reviews.review: VERY DISAPPOINTED!  We were a party of four (christmas eve 2014). Two steak orders were WAY overcooked.  They cooked  two more steaks and only one was cooked to order, the other was still WAY overcooked. Not only was it still overcooked, it appeared to be a much thinner cut of meat that the Filet Mignon as originally ordered.  It's a steakhouse - they should be experts at cooking steaks. If that wasn't bad enough, when the Manager or Sommelier stopped by our table to inquire how everything was - I told her about the steaks and her answer was (I quote), "I'm not the person who cooks the steaks." REALLY? I was shocked at her reply. How unprofessional.  There was no quality control of food items leaving the kitchen. Its a steakhouse - the steaks should be perfectly cooked to order.  The grilled shimp and scallops were overcooked also, but they were edible. The twice baked scalloped potatoes were tasty (2 thumbs up).  We will never go back.

reviews.name: Emilie B.
reviews.review: So disappointed.Our waiter, Jimmy, was very slow and inattentive. He sucks up to the older, presumably wealthy patrons though.The bread at the table tasted dry and stale. For an appetizer, we started off with a shrimp cocktail. It was good...but not worth $22.We then got lobster bisque...it was so bland and barely had a lobster flavor, we actually sent them back. For our entrees, my boyfriend got a 12oz filet and I got the salmon mixed grill plate. My dinner was alright...the salmon was a bit dry, but overall, wasnt bad. His filet honestly tasted like roast beef...not high quality steak.We had ordered our dessert when we ordered our meal (apple pie a la mode), but decided at the end of dinner to get our dessert to go. Our waiter brought out the dessert and bill at the same time...umm...dumb move, dude! He put the container of ice cream right on top of the hot pie...it was already melting by the time he brought it to our table!We waited 10 minutes for him to come by and grab the credit card/check so we could pay and leave, and he was nowhere in sight. We ended up having to flag down a manager to run it for us.Overall, the experience was awful, considering how much we paid to eat there. We probably would have had a better experience at Red Lobster...seriously. So disappointed.

reviews.name: V T.
reviews.review: Came for a corporate event and was not expecting the best. Great crab cake apps, could not stop eating them. Only option was Caesar salad and only steak option was the filet. Salad was run of the mill and looked like they rushed to plate it. The filet was a disaster; ordered med-rare and they brought out well done. Had to wait 20 mins for another one while the rest of the table was eating. Steak came out medium instead but was too hungry to send it back again. Filet was lukewarm, no sear and under seasoned. I think they massed cooked the filets in the oven knowing that it was a corporate event. Ordered berry dessert and had a sundae cup with 3 half strawberries with whip cream. Did not bother to eat. Would not be my first choice to come to a chain steak house, especially with all the great dining options in downtown Nashville.

reviews.name: Katherine I.
reviews.review: We came here for the Eve of New Year's Eve and Morton's did not disappoint. All the Morton's locations I have been to are pretty consistently awesome. The chopped spinach salad is great! If you are looking for a healthy salad, this probably isn't your best bet with the bacon and bacon dressing, but it is worth the caloric splurge. I know this is a steak house, but the seafood is also awesome. The crab cakes here are great with very little filler. The fiance sticks with the steak which does not disappoint. If you are not too full, get the molten chocolate cake.  It is rich and wonderful.

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: Great place to take a client or just have dinner yourself. Stopped in last week. Everything was great. I had the Wedge Salad and a steak. GREAT

reviews.name: M P.
reviews.review: Stopped at bar for a drink at 9:00 p.m.  Bartender was breaking down the bar and oblivious to guests.  Was chatting about the tips for the night with other bartenders . . . crass.  No class for a $$$$ restaurant!

reviews.name: Angie A.
reviews.review: So my dear husband and I have dined here for special occasions over the last 6 years since moving to Nashville.  The last time we went which was a few months ago, my husband & I both became very ill in the middle of the night after dining there. We contacted Mortons just to let them know (4 times to be exact) by phone and was told that a manager would contact us. I have no proof that this is what caused us both to be sick but the fact that a manager didnt even attemp to contact us is in my opinion, poor service. We'll find other places to enjoy and celebrate lifes memorable moments in the future.

reviews.name: Parker R.
reviews.review: I love this place! My steak was perfect! The service was perfect, and the staff was helpful and fun. All around amazing with one exception: it is a bit pricey

reviews.name: D B.
reviews.review: While visiting on business I experienced slow service, mediocre food, and rude staff.  The price of the meal did not reflect the quality.  The taste wasn't there, some items were overcooked, and the staff seemed less than invested.  Morton's may want to consider revamping this whole operation. Retraining and fresh blood could really benefit this location that is not up to the usual Morton's standard, pricing should really be brought inline with comparable places. Until then - stay away, much better choices nearby that care about your business.

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: Birthday dinner was great! They customized the menu so it said "Happy Birthday" and also offered a dessert on them, food was amazing, service was superb.

reviews.name: dajian x.
reviews.review: Last night I ate at Mere Bulles.  In comparing these two restaurants, I felt or I feel that it would be an insult to Mere Bulles to give Morton's four stars.  Putting everything side-by-side, and valuing my total experience including the cost of the meal, I have reduced Morton's steakhouse to three stars.  I feel more than before this restaurant is exorbitantly overpriced.  And I also feel that the food is simply nothing justified but these high prices.  In considering this change I looked at something of the places in some of the other restaurants and my previous equation was simply wrong.  So, my apology to the readers but when you have a much better restaurants with comparable service and better food and less expensive, Morton loses.

reviews.name: Charles S.
reviews.review: I took my wife to Morton's for our anniversary. It's a bit out of my price range usually, but thankfully I had a gift card to lessen the blow this trip. I had never dined at Morton's before; I've made a run of all the high-end steakhouses in this city and across the US, but somehow Morton's slipped through the cracks. Shame on me. We started our meal with a cocktail. My wife's Lemon Drop was well made, it was the perfect balance of sweet and tart and the bartender obviously freshly squeezed the lemon juice, as there were bits of lemon pulp throughout the martini. I've never met a dirty martini I didn't like, and this one was no different. My martini had just enough olive juice and was so well-shaken it not only had ice shards, but the ice had almost started to refreeze before I got the martini. I hope the bartender had some insulated mixing tins because shaking a martini that much gets the hands cold rather quickly. We moved from cocktails into the appetizer. It was the only part of the meal that was not perfectly prepared. The scallops were underdone. I know, I know, scallops aren't supposed to be cooked til they're chewy, but there is done and not done. They obviously used too hot of a pan to sear the scallops...the outside was the perfect golden brown color, but because the temperature was too high the scallops browned before they were done. Scallops shouldn't still be cold in the middle when they make it to the table. I would almost think that perhaps Morton's used frozen scallops that hadn't quite thawed all the way. Thankfully the server noticed rather quickly my wife's reaction to her first bite and apologized and had the kitchen prepare us another order. The second time they were perfect. Our salads were excellent; my wife's Caesar wasn't overly dressed, a welcome change from most restaurants. I LOVED the Morton's Salad; I usually hate anchovies whole or chopped, but I loved them here. The creamy zing of the bleu cheese was the perfect complement to the salty anchovy. My wife and I each ordered the filet. Both my extra rare and her medium were perfectly prepared. I am sure that if I had a thermometer the centers of the steaks would've temped perfectly; kudos to Morton's. Even the high-end steakhouses struggle with extra rare sometimes. All too often a grill cook hears extra rare and either thinks the guest wants it seared, or the grill cook just cooks a normal "rare". Thankfully Morton's had no trouble. This was definitely the best filet I have had in Nashville. We finished our meal with the lava cake; paired with espresso it was a fittingly decadent end to our meal. Almost every aspect of our meal was perfect; minus the hiccup with the scallops this would be a five star rating. The service, the drinks, the atmosphere; all was perfect for a romantic evening with my wife. Now if I only can get another gift card so I can go back...

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: *This review is for the bar area only*It's one of the new classier/nicer bars downtown (aside of the obvious, Oak Bar, which is much better) so it gets a star for that. The drinks have always tasted good and strong... it's the service that has always fallen a little flat to me. It's Morton's - I expect a certain level of service, even if it is in the bar. For example, the bartender took my order and walked away at lightning speed before my friend could place her order (didn't even look at her.) When the bartender returned, my friend asked if she could place her order and was told "There are lots of other people ahead of you." Actually, no. But ok. Eventually, she got her order as well and we went on our way. I may be back to give it another try... but I'll probably go by Oak Bar first if I'm downtown.

reviews.name: Janet Y.
reviews.review: My husband and I were stoked that Morton's offered a Happy Hour type menu through its Morton's Bar Bites, where menu items start around $6. But I have to say... we've had better food and better service elsewhere. There weren't as many food options on the bar bites menu compared to other similar restaurants AND they really get you with the price of drinks... $14 for a drink is a little ridiculous in my opinion.However, I will give Morton's credit for offering an affordable menu option. With a great location downtown, it's still worth a visit.

reviews.name: Mary Beth S.
reviews.review: I love this place!  It's what I'd call a special occasion restaurant, since it's pricey, but it is well worth the money.  The service is amazing!  Our waiter (Kurt, you rocked!) was great at describing the wines and helping us pick a couple of glasses.  I tried the beet salad to start, it was so good.  And not too beety.  We had the Chicago ribeye and the six ounce filet with steamed broccoli and horseradish mashed potatoes.  Yowza!  The meat was cooked perfectly and was delicious!  The potatoes were fantastic, not too overwhelming with the horseradish, just right.  The broccoli was good, but we really only ordered it to make us feel better about ordering desert.  Lemon souffle, y'all, oh my gosh.  I may not wait until my next birthday to go back!

reviews.name: Karen G.
reviews.review: What a shame!  My husband and I have eaten at Mortins for special occasions a number of times and we've never had a bad experience.  So when my parents came in to town from Florida we decided to treat them to Morton's. We went when they had the special $49 four course meal... My husband wanted to change out the salad for the French onion soup which was offered as an appetizer to begin with. The main reason is my husband really cannot handle eating any kind of salads  And he explained this to the server.We were told absolutely not!  This was surprising since we had eaten at Morton's a number of times and we had never had any trouble Requesting this substitution. My husband was in the food industry for a number of years and he understands the cost of meals and the profitability factor so this was a fair exchange... Especially since we had ordered several martinis and also I was drinking wine.  The server forgot to bring my wine and a totally separate person had to get it for me. Then whenever the server would stop by our table it was if she was breezing by... Finally at the end... My husband complained to Cory the Manager.  He said that if we had gotten the $59 special we could've exchanged out for the $11 soup of which there was no indication that any other special was going on. In fact, in the front room there was a big easel with only the $49 special being advertised So one would've thought that this mysterious $59 special would've come up in the course of conversation with the server no? The ultimate embarrassment was when the server came to the table and threw the bill down and dramatically double checked it in front of everyone and declared that it was correct!! If this is what Landry's has done to Morton's Steakhouse... then what a shame.

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
reviews.review: If you've read any of my other reviews before, you know I love me some late night dining trips.  I work long days in lab and by the time I get home and do the things I have to do, it's late, and I don't always feel like cooking.  Or, I don't have time to eat before some event/show/game/concert I'm attending and so after enduring a growling stomach for hours I am on the prowl for something to enjoy after hours, when there are less people and I can relax more. So once again I have to say, I have never eaten the traditional dinner at Morton's.  Morton's is where I go after a show at the Ryman or TPAC, to sit at their bar with their excellent and experienced bartenders, to enjoy their bar bites menu.  Though as always, I find great small plates a bug indicator of how good their big plates must be.  And the steak ALWAYS smells HEAVENLY coming from the kitchen.But here's pretty much a great night for me: a ballet, musical, opera, or play at TPAC, following by a stroll through downtown Nashville to end at the Morton's bar.  This all feels very NYC to me, and it's a really great, fun, and intimate date or catch-up time with a friend.  I've already professed my love of oysters and you can get them on the half shell at the bar.  I adore their crab cake BLTs and mini filet sandwiches.  These are great plates to share.  They change up the bites occasionally, and I've had a great salmon and lox-style flatbread here before.  You can order from the full menu at the bar as well (I've never done it but I've witnessed others do it).  But late in the evneing, sometimes a smaller yet decadent meal is called for.  Their drinks (from aforementioned fantastic bartenders) are perfectly prepared and always kept full if you so desire.  The bar is quieter, typically, and just a great place to be overall.  The large windows allow for great people watching as well, which again to me feels so New York.  This place has the old-boys-club kind of steakhouse feel while still being not so chain restaurant like (even though this place IS a chain) and I like that.The food is delicious, the service top-notch, and the setting classy...so grab a seat at the bar and give it a try!

reviews.name: UncharteredNashville A.
reviews.review: The Bar Bites are available in the bar Sunday - Friday from open until 6:30 pm and then 9 pm to close and feature high end appetizer like variations of their normal dinner menu for a fraction of the price. The servings are generous even though they are called Bites so we decided to share a few.   We went with the Crab Cake BLT ($6 HH), Petite Filet Sandwiches ($6 HH), and Blue Cheese Steak Fries ($5 HH). While the Crab Cake BLT had a little too much crab for my taste (a good problem to have), Cole loved it, specifically the quality and crispiness of the bacon. One tip if you try the BLT, order extra mayo, as the combination of the bread, crab, and bacon, can be a little on the dry side. The Filet Mignon sandwiches come on a soft sesame bun with a pile of perfectly cooked filet mignon and are as delicious as they sound and a steal for the $6 price. The steak fries are crispy on the outside with a velvety texture in the middle and rival any fries I've tasted.Read More - uncharterednashville.blo…

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: So in the interest of honesty, I have never been the biggest Morton's fan.  The one in Dallas was so bad that I refused to ever go back.  But I'm not in TX anymore and there was a company sponsored dinner at Morton's so I decided to give it a go! First off: parking.  You can find some street parking depending on what time you go and how patient you are.  I got there at 6pm and I am also the most impatient person on the planet...sooo valet to the rescue.  The valet guys were friendly and I didn't fear leaving my car with them.  Too much anyway.The bar area looks pretty cool and I did note that there was a happy hour special in the bar with appetizers and various other things for $6 each.  Apparently there are drink specials too.  Sounds like a good idea - definitely want to try that out sometime.So we were seated in a private room that looks as though it would hold about 30 people depending on configuration.  We had Caesar salad to start and it was decent - lots of dressing, some croutons, cracked black pepper.  For my entree I obviously got the filet, medium rare.  It came with mashed potatoes and garlic green beans.  The steak was cooked perfectly - hot red middle.  Overall lacking some oomph but not a bad steak.  They brought out some creamy sauce for it also (can't remember exactly what it was) but I didn't like it and removed it from my steak.  I guess I should always remember I don't like white creamy things eh?  For dessert we were sent home with cheesecake.  I didn't get a choice and I don't really like cheesecake that much but it wasn't bad.  No sauce, just a strawberry on top.  I would have liked it better with some sauce on it.  Overall liked the location downtown and liked the way the restaurant looked, especially the bar area.  The food didn't wow me but it certainly made me willing to come back and try some things on my own dime.  Yay, I'm no longer a Morton's hater!!

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: The location, the atmosphere, the wine And THE FOOD, well it is MORTON'S...

reviews.name: Essjay W.
reviews.review: Excellent steaks. On the pricey side but truly delicious. The sides are also perfection.

reviews.name: Kristen Z.
reviews.review: This, to me, is the best steakhouse in Nashville.  We went for a birthday celebration.  They had a menu with my husband's name printed on it, which was a very nice touch!  Yes, this place is expensive, but worth every penny!The salad was perfect, very fresh and crisp dressing on the side. My steak was cooked exactly right, not overloaded with seasoning; it was so moist, juicy, tender and delicious!  Like I said, worth every penny!The service was impeccable. They lay out the meat and seafood for you to see, which is sort of gross, but cool. They are attentive, but not annoying.

reviews.name: Robert S.
reviews.review: Took my brother here on Christmas eve for a hoped-for night of beefy goodness.  $9 for a Bloody Mary was bloody steep.  Coat check was a nice touch, as my coat was a bit wet from falling snow.I like the low light, old-fashioned, clubby feel, with the unobtrusive service, low volume music and quiet table conversation.I had signed up for the signature 3-course menu (2 people, 3 courses, $109.99).  Each of us received:Caesar Salad orMorton's SaladSingle cut filletBroiled Sea Scallops (bacon-wrapped) orColossal Shrimp Alexander orJumbo lump crab cakeOne potato dish to shareOne fresh veggie dish to shareMorton's Legendary Hot Chocolate Cake orKey Lime Pie orCreme BruleeIt was a TON of food, I was hard pressed to finish, and it killed my energy level for our after dinner bar-hopping.  My bro said his steak was dry (he ordered it medium).  My chow was good.One of the grand dames of the high-end steakhouse industry shows why they are at the top of the heap.

reviews.name: Ken H.
reviews.review: Complete rip off--- they couldn't get the sides out with the steaks, and to be honest one of the sides was French fries---amazing how McDonald's can get this right however Nashville's "best steak house" can't. Save your money.

reviews.name: James G.
reviews.review: One star goes to my waiter who I thought was pretty good.  I wanted to order one of everything on the menu after listening to him describe our options.  The other star goes to the manager who did not charge me for my mediocre meal.  Both seemed to be genuinely concerned about my dissatisfaction.  Thank you.      The pricing on the menu is far too ambitious for what is actually received on the plate.  When I order a $49 ribeye at a steak house, I guess I just expect more.  The steak was dry with little flavor. I think the Foie Gras topping was interesting but just didn't pair up with the steak for me.     I also had the spinach salad with the warm bacon dressing and the grilled asparagus drizzled with balsamic vinegar.  I think they were tasty enough but there was nothing impressive about either dish.  The fibrous ends of the asparagus where still left on and the dressings did not catch me as being homemade.     I tasted the other plates on my table and had the same experience.  Way too ambitious for the price.  I'm sorry if this offends but I would go to Outback or Sizzler first.  I will not be back.

reviews.name: Guy G.
reviews.review: I should have heeded the warnings of other reviews! The waiter was pretentious, the ambiance was so-so, the $50 dollar steak was subpar. I understand steaks and the such costing more, but how can a glass of coca cola cost $4.25? Is the soda at Mortons of a finer quality than that of McDonald's? I will never return here. I am so upset that I wasted the time and money here. This was special trip for my wife and I and I asked the hotel staff for the best local steak house. This was their suggestion. They were wrong don't waste your time or money.  Two steaks, two cups of soup, one soda, one tap water $122.  What a waste.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: continuing the Happy Hour Crawl. ...Small bar area with the mandatory TV screens, volume off and some nice music playing.  Arguably the most expensive martinis in town and easily some of the worst.  $13.95 for a blood orange martini, large portion BUT horribly made with Skyy Orange Vodka (corporate rules I guess). Artificially nasty in every way.  We split this and had the steak sliders(4)  $7, meat was delicious but the bun so ordinary all bread was left.  Crab cakes (3 mini) $7 very tasty.I could get the same dirty martini here for $17.50 instead of the $5 perfect one I just had at Flemings.Value for Money - Meh not reallyService - Meh - polite but had that "Like I give a toss that you really don't like our Skyy Orange Vodka, we know its horrible."Would not go back here for Happy Hour and also do not care for their dinners either.

reviews.name: Tiffany E.
reviews.review: I go for the occasional power hour. Good for a small to medium sized group in front of the windows. Staff is helpful. Appetizers and drink specials could be improved.

reviews.name: Stephanie P.
reviews.review: Morton's is my favorite steak place in Nashville. I prefer to sit in the bar. The bar bites are a great value. We usually get the steak special and some bar bites. I love the twice baked potato gratin - it is worth every calorie. The chocolate cake is incredible - order it before you finish dinner b/c it takes a while to bake.

reviews.name: Kelley W.
reviews.review: A one of a kind experience!! We went to celebrate our 1 year anniversary and were treated wonderfully! They greeted us with a happy anniversary, sat us a table prepared for us with decorations & personalized menus with "happy 1 year anniversary Mr. & Mrs. Stephens"! Once seated they took our picture to capture the moment (they later printed the picture, put it in a card and all signed it!). Our waitress, Deborah, was attentive, helpful and kind. She left us lacking for nothing. The food was delicious- We had the crab cake appetizer (small but rich so was the perfect amount), the ribeye with the blue cheese butter with the Mac & cheese & the molten lava chocolate cake. It was more than enough and all delicious!! In one word, all I would say is GO! Although pricey, it really was worth it. I'm excited to go next year!

reviews.name: Sumesh T.
reviews.review: Let me first say that I'm vegetarian, so take this review for what it's worth. The food was pretty good (I had three items from the Summer Fresh menu).  The citrus salad was quite good.   Tangy flavors mixed with candied pecans.  My meal was essentially two sides: Snap Peas and Mushrooms.  Mushrooms were very good.  Meaty texture with parmesan cheese.  The snap peas were average.  Pretty much blanched with soy sauce.Honestly, my biggest complaint about Morton's is that it's a very stale environment.  Felt old school and unremarkable.  And the desserts were all mentioned as being served with "fine Haagen Dazs ice cream".  I would prefer a restaurant of this caliber to say served with "fine homemade ice cream".  It makes it feel like The Cheesecake Factory of steak houses.Service was very good (though the "speech" was a bit too rehearsed).  My gut would say that there are much better and more unique steak houses in downtown Nashville.  However, we were only able to get a table at Morton's (which may have been a sign).

reviews.name: RC C.
reviews.review: This place has ok food, extremely rude service and a filet mignon shoved so far up their smokestack they feel they are gods gift to cooking up a steak.  Try Ted's of Beverly Hills!

reviews.name: Sam Y.
reviews.review: Good place in Nashville for a steak. I had the fillet and shared potatoes and creamed spinach which was fantastic. Very pricey so come with a empty belly and full pocketbook.

reviews.name: Robby H.
reviews.review: How can you go wrong with Mortons. The food is great, service is spectacular, and the atmosphere is wonderful. The bar is also great.

reviews.name: Elizabeth E.
reviews.review: I can't lie - I've only enjoyed Morton's Bar Bites due to budget restrictions, but man, I love it!I live nearby and have decided to hit up the lounge area for happy hour more regularly. The bartenders are nice, the burgers are DELICIOUS and the drinks are, of course, made how they should be. Morton's lounge is a great place to visit before a show at The Ryman or the Downtown Art Crawl.

reviews.name: Gerald P.
reviews.review: I have eaten at a lot of nice restaurants and several Mortons.  This was not a great experience at Mortons in downtown Nashville.  First, a bad attitude from the hostess and our waitress.  Sure, I just arrived for my meeting and wanted to eat without making a big dress up event.    Dinner,  Lobster bisque,  1 star.  very spicy, overwhelming and the lobster was grizzly,  I had to spit out a hunk of cartilage.  What the heck?  I had the beef steak tomatoes for salad. sort of ok, didn't impress me.  Bread, burnt onion?  my wife wouldn't eat it.  6 oz Fillet, cooked correctly at medium rare, but they must have basted it in an onion broth.  It tasted like I was eating it with french onion soup poured on it.  I eat Fillet because I like it.  I don't want it to taste like something else.    Molten chocolate for dessert. Tasted ok, but then the waitress didn't come back so I could take part of back to my room. After waiting 5 minutes or so, we left.   My recommendation is don't eat here.

reviews.name: mumin k.
reviews.review: The problem with high end steak houses such as Morton's is that people go there with very high expectations and are ready to pay good sums for the things they have been hearing here and there. My expectations very very high and I was ready to pay. Unfortunately, Morton was not able to meet my very high expectations. I ordered a salad assuming the portions are "human" size. Well it turns out the portions at Morton's are a little larger than what I refer to as human portions. The salad itself could have been enough for me but since I was there for the steak, i only had 1/10th of the salad. I ordered filet and asked it to be medium and although it was more on the well done side, I was somewhat happy with it. The sides of asparagus was pretty good and very generous. By the time it was time for desert, I was already full but could not resist the chocolate cake with ice cream which was nothing special.Overall, I was somewhat satisfied with my experience here but would expect better quality for the price. The problem with my experience at Morton is that they gave me the impression that Morton is more about quantity than being about the quality of food. The portions were huge, so be careful while ordering. The salad alone could make you full. The service was good as expected from a high end steak house.

reviews.name: Mandy C.
reviews.review: Loved it!  I dined with my husband and another couple this past weekend to celebrate friend's birthday.  This was my first time dining at Morton's and I had been hyped up about it from my friend.  Needless to say, I was not disappointed.  I enjoyed every minute from the moment we walked in to the sad walk out. They greeted us, took a picture for the birthday boy then immediately seated us in a comfortable grand booth!  Our server was the WONDERFUL Christopher.  He knew the menu backwards and forwards and was very convincing on the items we asked about.  And humorous on top of that.  So we were lucky to get a great server to make dining experience even more enjoyable.  But as with all meals, it is about the food and this food was fantastic.  I had it in my mind that it was going to be similar to Fleming's and now I feel it exceeds Fleming's high standards.The onion bread loaf was fresh, fluffy and delicious.  I only wish it was served with an oil for dipping instead of butter.  However, I enjoyed it with no accompaniments.  My husband ordered the center cut iceberg salad with their house made thousand island dressing- I was impressed.  The portion size was incredible.  Him and I ended up sharing it because it was so large.  Our companions enjoyed their caesar salad and lobster bisque.   I ordered the Filet Oscar cooked medium, which had two small filets on top of a potato with asparagus and fresh lobster on top covered in a creamy sauce.  Even though I was stuffed, I wanted more because it was so good. My husband ordered the double cut filet, medium rare and said it was the best steak he's had in a restaurant.  We ordered the sauteed spinach & mushrooms and green beans for sides to share- both also very good and filling.  We skipped dessert, but the waiter brought out a massive slice of New York style cheesecake for the birthday boy, which they said was awesome as well.  Seemed to be the running theme for the night!Worth the price tag.  Wonderful meal.  We will be back!

reviews.name: Kurt K.
reviews.review: went last night and waiter and hostess were fabulous. Mixed spinach salad was great. Scallops were good, filet was grilled perfect. Seabass with crab was excellent and key lime pie was really good......great place but pricey as usual.......was quiet on monday night...

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: First time here.  Went for a business lunch.  Had the super obvious choice.  Filet Mignon.  Had it cooked medium because why would I ruin a steak and cook it medium well (I wish I could find a Republican joke to insert here, but sadly its the liberals that usually have a steak cooked medium well so, well...damnit..moving on).  Steak was great but not fantastic.  I would go back if someone else was paying.

reviews.name: Sara S.
reviews.review: We were the last customers in the restaurant Saturday night but we definitely didn't feel like it. our server took great care of us and made us feel right at home until the second we walked out the door. I must say it was one of the most fantastic meals I've had in a long time. I even got a steak! You can't go to Morton's without at least tasting it. And I don't do steak on the reg. Delish. Also, you must try the Brussels sprouts! Insane. Great meal. Great.

reviews.name: Ted A.
reviews.review: Great again and i cant say enough nice things about this place.  The staff is seasoned and professional and more importantly they have worked together for a long time - which makes for an extremely friendly and qualified team.  They traditionally greet by name and they go out of their way to make sure you are one of the club, because its more like a private club atmosphere than a dining room.  As a matter of fact from the presentation of the food, the lighting, the way they greet you - it feels as though you are amongst old friends no matter how many times you have been there.The food and steaks are terrific, they are as good a quality as you can get anywhere in the world and if that's not enough, then the souffle's will be the show stopper.  Order them early so they are ready about the time you'd expect.  that means order dessert when you order dinner - Hell i order dessert first, because between the Souffle and the lava cake its the toughest decision of the night.The Bar is spectacular and the drinks are poured in a healthy dose.  This is the way a restaurant and bar should be run.  The attitude starts to pull you in when you see that new faces are mixed with regulars and everyone is in the conversation and the staff see's to it that you - no matter who you are- are in the mix.  The martini's are stout and dry, the refills keep flowing so be careful, because by the time you're done eating and relaxing and enjoying yourself, you may have had a few too many, because you left your're troubles at the door, where they belong.  There is no trouble on this side of that entry door.  This place is a welcome mat for anyone living in Nashville or visiting.  It set's the standard for every restaurant i visit around the world - and i travel more than 200 days  a year - i think i know what i am talking about.  Anyone reading this and about to go eat there, i am jealous and envious - go enjoy

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: The food was the best that we had in the area of the convention center. The scallops were amazing. They accommodated our group of 12 and the food was great. I'm normally not a fan of chains but it was the last night in town and we were tired of the other offerings downtown that were supposed to be good and weren't. Pleasantly surprised.

reviews.name: Joseph L.
reviews.review: Went there before the Elton John concert last night. We had drinks, a Ceasar Salad and ordered the filet sliders from the bar hoping to kill some time and just hang out. I was right, 45 minutes for the salad and another 15 for the sliders. The sliders were so grizzly with fat that we couldn't eat them. Changed my order to a hamburger and fry's ($17.00 burger) and waited another hour before we finally left without eating. Manager finally came over when we were walking out the door and apologized. The place looks reallly nice and the bartender was very friendly and tried her best. From my perspective, a great place to open a restaurant with food. Go to Ruth Chris where the filets are great!!

reviews.name: Carol S.
reviews.review: I very much enjoyed a Happy Hour at Morton's on Thursday evening.  The French Kiss Martinis were perfect and the small bites...  well, they weren't small.  Definitely got more than money's worth!  And, our server was precious!

reviews.name: Robert D.
reviews.review: The food we had tonight was AWESOME..  And the service was even better. I highly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.name: Ryan D.
reviews.review: Amazing steak here!  Had a wonderful evening out and was treated very well by the staff.

reviews.name: Latoya C.
reviews.review: I was taken here and it was very delicious to me. Its kind of pricey here so if you sign up to be on their email list they will send you deals like 2 people can eat for $110 dollars. When you begin to order they roll out a cart of meat to show you the different cuts they have. after you choose, you pick you sides and trust me one side can take care of 2 or 3 people. The portions of the sides are way more than enough. For an appetizer we had  Colossal Shrimp and they were colossal indeed. My steak was cooked perfectly to my liking. The asparagus were very tasty. They didn't overcook them like most restaurants do. They had a nice bite to them. Their desserts are great as well. I enjoyed their Creme Brulee I just wish the portion size of it were bigger. The waiters were friendly and everyone greeted you with a smile. It was a tad but noisy when we went for dinner. They do have private rooms available if you want to have a quiet intimate dinner. Great place to bring the one you love and have a nice dinner together!

reviews.name: Ben Z.
reviews.review: So I pretty much went to Morton's based on some reccomendations and the mere fact that it's one of the few remaining steakhouses I've been to in Nashville.  I've still yet to check out Kayne Prime or Stockyard (ain't gonna happen) and I could be missing one..  I'll try to focus on this experience alone and compare it to other competitors towards the end....We showed up early enough to have a drink at the bar but our hostess seated us right away which was fine with me.  I'd say for a Wednesday the crowd wasn't bad at 7:15..  The bar was fairly full with the dining room close to 50% capacity..  I like a little atmosphere chatter so it was just fine with us.  It worked out even better as I requested that my wife and I be moved to a small table as opposed to one of their large booths because we wanted to face each other rather than sit side by side.  Our server was very accomodating of course.  Her name was Cheryl and she was very prompt and personable the entire evening.  One thing I HATE is when the entrees are dropped right after the soup/salad and we easily had 15 - 20 minutes to enjoy ourselves and the evening in it's entirety was paced perfectly.  Absolutely no complaints there.  We started with Louisiana Shrimp and split the Onion soup so we would have plenty of room for our Steak/King Crab Legs.  I ordered our bone-in-ribeye Rare Plus which in my experience (I can't cook but I know what it's supposed to look like) is a pretty difficult task but Morton's absolutely NAILED it.  Very impressive.  Despite that though, I don't feel the urge to get into each dish because I just don't feel like anything was truly memorable.  Everything was "very good"..  But the problem with that is I'm not spending $300 on dinner/drinks to have a "very good" meal..  I've had GREAT meals at Flemming's, Ruth's Chris, Red Pony and even Stoney River for easily a $100 less.  I don't want to give a negative review because there was truly nothing negative about our experience..  But my thing is, if you're going to drop that kind of cash on dinner, which I only do 3 - 4 times a year, I want it to blow my socks off.

reviews.name: Rahel K.
reviews.review: So I try to stay away from chains.  But, damn, Mortons is good.  I finally went there for the first time last Saturday night.  The atmosphere is spot on.  My date and i started with cocktails in the bar; I had a sweet "Mortini" that was heavy on the alcohol....nice.  We then got sat in a cozy little booth that overlooked the restaurant.  Our waitress, Heidi, was a little cold at first - but we warmed her up and she really loosened up by the end of the meal.   I got anchovies with my salad that were delicious - even though there was way too much salad.  I'm figuring their clientele don't come here to count calories - so the big portions are fine.  Our entrees were delicious.  I had never heard of of bone-in filet...it was awesome, perfectly cooked, and well worth the money (alright, alright, he paid ;-)   I also had the bacon-wrapped scallops - they were a little over-done, but this is a steakhouse!  We ordered a bottle of wine and the wine buyer (I don't think he was a sommelier), came over to make suggestions on our tastes....nice touch.Great dinner, very romantic, great time.

reviews.name: Crista H.
reviews.review: This is my favorite restaurant of all times. I ALWAYS get the Bone-in-Ribeye cooked medium rare, mushrooms and onions, creamed spinach and a bottle of BV Pinot Noir. The service is outstanding and I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant to anyone that enjoys fine dining.

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: Went this evening with my father. Great service, great food except for the shrimp cocktail. Had the bone in ribeye. It was one of the better steaks I have ever had. I recommend the chocolate lava cake. Great way to finish the evening.

reviews.name: Scarlet R.
reviews.review: I had heard of Morton's, but since there are so many restaurants around home, I had never tried it. When we went to Nashville for a conference, it was super convenient because it was right behind our hotel.  The short review: Tasty food, cooked perfectly, flavorful. Huge portions, so share, share, share! Awesome service.The long review:  We walked in and at first I considered leaving because the host/greeter was rude. We just got off an airplane, it was raining buckets, and it was like 85 degrees of humid hotness outside. We are from Cali, rude guy, we're not used to this crap. Cut us a break. So we weren't in suits or business attire, but we still have money. He gave us the once over and said in his best snooty voice, "Um, we can see you in about 30 minutes. Or you can go to the bar. They have menu service too."  We just went to the bar because like I said, hungry, just got off a plane, don't care if I eat on a mat on the floor, just give me food.Our server, Keith, was AWESOME! He made good conversation and clued us in to some places to check out while we were in town. He had great recommendations. The food. Try the lobster bisque. It is the creamiest, smoothest, perfectly peppery with a hint of brandy. Served with a large chunk of lobster meat. We got a claw. Delicious.
