Best I've ever had.  The prawn cocktail was good, 4 huge prawns, clean, chilled.  The cocktail sauce could use more horseradish, but I like my cocktail sauce to bring me to tears.  My husband thought it was fine.  We shared a porterhouse (single cut) and got a side of steamed asparagus with hollandaise.  The porterhouse was done perfectly, excellent flavor.  The asparagus was just ok. It was a little too thick, and the woody stems were shaved down, but still not good to eat, in my opinion. I've made better hollandaise at home.  I would love to try the grilled asparagus with balsamic reduction next time.We ordered the Hot Chocolate Cake to finish.  When it came out I was underwhelmed. It looked so innocent and unassuming, and I thought it was going to look different.  BUT... when we dug into it, it was all melty and chocolatey and hot.  It was a passionate food. When hubby and I took our first bites, we met eyes and it was that look like "Yum. This is good. We're gonna have sex later. In a vat of chocolate."  That might sound weird, but it's really the only proper way to explain how good it is.  Try it and see.Now that I'm back home, we're definitely going to try the Morton's here.

reviews.name: Jeffrey S.
reviews.review: Great place for a happy hour.  They have "Happy Bites"? or something where you can get great deals on their bar food, but no drink specials.  Great place to eat if you are trying to impress a business client.

reviews.name: M. Y.
reviews.review: nice service. "full dinner service at the bar" but service was faster/nicer overall in dinner area. steak when medium rare a little too chewy. good cocktails.

reviews.name: Biff Y.
reviews.review: I love Morton's.  I've had the ahi (yellowfin tuna on the menu) the last time, and it was great.  Nicely done - seared on the outside, raw in the middle.  I also stole some rib eye from someone else's plate.  The soy/ginger sauce that come with the ahi goes really well with steak, by the way.  I'm going to ask for that sauce on the side the next time I get a steak.The previous time, I got the rib-eye, which came a perfect medium rare.  I'm a big fan of the chopped salad there, but I've also opted for the tomato salad.  Both are great salad choices.   I also love the grilled asparagus with the balsamic reduction.  The service is always great.  There was some huge Banana Republic party going on at the same time, but I never found my water glass empty, and they consistently checked on everything from the wine to the crumbs on the table.  Last (but certainly not least), Paige is awesome.  I'm going back next week!

reviews.name: Nathan W.
reviews.review: So Mortons isnt a new thing, and frankly its great steaks and menu are about the same anywhere you go.  The difference at this Mortons is the bar.  Ask for Mother Theresa and you will be very happy.  She is a delightful bar tender, and attentive doesnt begin to describe her.  This bar is busy in bad economies and good.  Its happy hour is unbeatable and belive it or not you can leave full and drunk for less than $80 a couple.  Dont believe me?  Give it a try, but ask for Theresa.

reviews.name: Nate C.
reviews.review: Morton's is a pretty good steak house, but it's not all that different from othe steak houses. I do fancy their ribeye steaks; it has good flavors. However, I think their hit is more of their happy hour stuff. It's not the greatest, but they have this steak sandwich that's the bomb. I've only had it several times, but it's off the hook. They just renovated the side of the building and added a bar and bar tables. I haven't been to the new section yet, but I will per I only live across the street. Like I've said, this isn't a steakhouse that's any different from the others; the decore is all wood and dim. you get the picture, but their happy hour is stronger suggested. =]

reviews.name: Mark W.
reviews.review: Went to Mortons on my recent anniversary.   Pretty good food, but pretty pricey too.   Atmosphere was very noisy, could not carry on a conversation.   Service was good, but a little cold/standoffish.   For the money, you can do better.

reviews.name: D J.
reviews.review: I hate steakhouses. I especially hate steakhouses that serve up grilled vegetables as their entree du jour pour vegetarien. But what I hate most is when these ghastly gastronomic horrors show up on your plate without the slightest flourish. Case in point - my dinner at Mortons consisted of bushes of steamed broccoli, and whole, boiled, skinned tomatoes and whatever little real estate was left on the plate was haphazardly crammed with gigantic asparagus, spinach and mushroom - appetizing? Mashed potato and green beans just became delectable!  Seriously, how hard can it be for these establishments to spend a fraction of time that it takes to serve up a filet mignon or a prime-rib, put a smidgen of effort to come up with something more palatable and at least pleasing to the eye for a herbivore? This isn't a review, it's a rant - damn them steakhouses!

reviews.name: Lyn C.
reviews.review: The steak and desert was unbelievably good, but the rest was just so so. The hash browns that I had been looking forward to were just horrible. All and all it's a maybe only if someone else is paying, otherwise it is hugely over priced for the experience.

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: I was so excited to eat at Morton's, but I must say it did not meet my expectations. We had a tray of raw oysters, which had a very salty, oceany, bitter taste I have ever tasted in oysters. Normally I love oysters, but these just had something amiss about them. The lobster bisque was good, but not outstanding by any means. I ordered my steak very rare, but the waiter insisted that they cook them so rare already i should just order it medium rare. Mistake. It was fine in the middle, but the outer portion was too cooked for my taste, plus it was kind of cold when it arrived. My friend's steak was even colder. We did enjoy a great glass of wine, and the ambiance is classy and elegant. This is not a bad restaurant, I just feel that for the prices and hype, they need to pay more attention to details for those who want true fine dining in Nashville. We really liked our waiter because he was nice and accomodating and explained the various entrees and appetizers well and with gusto.

reviews.name: Lauren A.
reviews.review: I was taken here for the first time this week and I have to say I was really impressed.  From the minute you walk in the door to the point where your waiter first greets you, the people are very professional and friendly. Instead of being handed menus here, the waiter will roll a cart over to your table and show you what your options are for dinner.  The 4lb Lobster on a silver platter was moving around and eyeing you, which at the same time made you not exactly want to eat it... but added a nice touch that you see your Maine lobster was alive and fresh.  You also have a tray filled with all cuts of beef... including a bone-in double cut filet.  If only I could afford a $60 steak..    Then they also have the salmon and the tuna.. but come on, who's gonna order salmon for dinner at a steak restaurant?  So after the waiter unsuccessfully tried to persuade the lobster to "kill", he decided to give us our "cheat sheet" menus (which included the price so you could know what kind of damage to expect later).  He also then told us about the internet special that he told us we saw on the internet...  which for $99 we got two small filets (seriously, there was nothing small about them), two starters, two salads, two sides, and two desserts.  This is an amazing deal.  Its way more food than you can possibly eat (since they start you off with this delicious loaf, yes loaf, of onion bread) and its a total steal considering the fact that its easy for 1 person to eat for that price when ordering al a carte.  I had a house salad, small filet, shrimp with a lemon beurre blanc, steamed gigantic asparagus with a hollandaise sauce, pan fried potatoes with caramelized onions, and key lime pie.  (the sides are designed to be shared with another person).  I left with enough leftovers for another meal and completely full that I didn't even want to think about food for the rest of the night.  So, I would recommend this place, but only if you are ready to enjoy a really nice, old fashioned meal with someone special.

reviews.name: Sippy C.
reviews.review: Okay, so It was little late..almost closing time when i visited this place. I understand that i wasnt late enough since they ot me and my husband seated and asked for our order. But little to our joy, they served us reheated chicken tenders and col mashed potatoes. I do not recommend this place if u r planning to go around closing hours. I once visited them for lunch. It was superb.

reviews.name: Taylor B.
reviews.review: There aren't many sit-down restaurants at this airport so this was OK. Let's just say I wouldn't go if it was located outside an airport. Service was OK. She wasn't very friendly but we got our food pretty fast. I ordered he Wild West Burger. The burger itself tasted great but the bacon and onion rings on it were disgusting(see picture). I usually send stuff back because I have no shame but I just wasn't in the mood. My co-workers salad with grilled chicken was huge and she said that she enjoyed it. Wouldn't go back if I was there again, but like I said there are very few sit- down places in the Nashville airport.

reviews.name: Casey H.
reviews.review: Terrible. Unorganized. My boyfriend placed an order to go for me to pick up. When I went to pick it up, I was directed to the bar area and then back to the front. A lot of confusion going on. So, one of the servers said he was going to check in the back. I finally get my order. A few weeks later, my boyfriend called in an order. This time they were better but the service at the carry out counter isn't the quickest or friendliest. Also, they do not carry everything that is on the O'Charley's website.

reviews.name: Lea T.
reviews.review: Fast service! I got my food in 15 minutes and the check on the table while I was still eating. Would've been nice to relax and not feel rushed, but as an airport restaurant I imagine most patrons didn't have as much time as I did before their flight departed. Good amount of options for breakfast, I tried the Ultimate Scramble sub egg whites for 99 cents. A side of fruit salad is also offered for $2.99. Good portion and breakfast potatoes were decent, but my one slice of toast was so soggy and greasy. This seems like a healthier option than the Burger King around the corner and you can hit the bar as early as 6 am if you need a little pre-flight beverage to calm your nerves.

reviews.name: Roma J.
reviews.review: Better than expected restaurant and service at an airport. I had a 3 hour layover in Nashville so I decided to walk the whole terminal C area and choose the best looking place with wifi. Turns out there was NO WIFI. Just getting normal 3G or LTE reception sucked! On the other hand, as the waitress brought over the two free soft rolls with butter made me smile immediately. My sirloin steak was surprisingly tasty and juicy. It came with the choice of 2 sides so I requested the mashed potatoes and broccoli. I also ordered the 'best tasting' cabernet wine on the menu which went down well with my meal. I guess having no reception wasn't so bad... but I wanted to snapchat my friends what a great meal I was having.....again, at the airport!!

reviews.name: Christie L.
reviews.review: Got the french dip while waiting for my flight. It was the saltiest thing I've ever had....rolls were good, server was nice, but overall not worth the money.

reviews.name: Craig A.
reviews.review: Better then what the reviews say. Had lunch before our flight. One of the best Chicken Salad plates I have had.  Looked great. Tasted even better. Wife had Fish and Chips. She said fish was lite and fries were perfect. Waitress was kind and efficient. For a few dollars more, drop the fast food line and eat here. We sat for quite a while waiting for our flight and were not hurried out.

reviews.name: Joelle L.
reviews.review: I got a local beer that was good, always a treat in an airport. The positives end there. I got a steak medium rare, it was rare when I got it. I normally wouldn't mind but it was cold in the middle. I asked to put it back on the grill, which they did but I think all they did was sear the side I cut off. It was still cold and purple in the middle after asking it to be recooked.I got a side salad, the menu said they had cider vinaigrette which they didn't actually have. The lettuce was clear, poor quality. The broccoli side was completely raw. I normally don't mind slight under cooked vegetables, crisp, but it was not cooked. The smashed potatoes were very gluey. I think the cooks don't actually cook instead they put warmed(if that) food on a plate

reviews.name: Mr T.
reviews.review: Sad. Just the saddest breakfast I've had. I've eaten hospital food that was better. The addition of copious amounts of salt and pepper helped somewhat, but the wife wouldn't even finish hers. I sent it back the first time, then resigned myself to downing their second attempt so that my stomach would have something in it for the flight. I'm having trouble understanding how eggs, spinach, mushrooms and cheese can have no flavor and just be kind of wet and soggy.The wife and I ordered the same thing, yet hers came with potatoes and mine did not. As for the toast, it was more like slightly warned miniature bread. I covered it with jelly. Then we went over to Auntie Anne's and got the wife something tasty.

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: My last meal ever in Nashville was of course at BNA. I was originally in line at Burger King, but when a woman cut in front of me, and then the cashier had a hard time operating his register, and then he tells me to go to a different line, I decided to find someone I can tip for some service.Greeted immediately and seated. Solid, no-nonsense service.Had a standard cheeseburger and fries. Fries were more on the soft side, but it hit the spot. I asked for a medium rare burger, but the burger was only rare in the middle. But by then, I was already full, so it didn't matter. My last Southern-style "sweet tea" was good. Other than that, there was really nothing memorable about the meal. I got what I paid for and flew out of Nashville without any regrets.

reviews.name: Emily B.
reviews.review: Blackened tilapia was good, service was a little slow.  We, a party of two, waited almost ten minutes before being acknowledged after being seated.  We had plenty of time before our flight.

reviews.name: Andrea P.
reviews.review: They have a gluten free menu. I only got a small appetizer but loved it! It's a nice choice when your in a hurry.

reviews.name: Charmaine S.
reviews.review: 5/26/14This restaurant is located in the Nashville Airport. One of the better of food options out of all that I saw. I was greeted by a nice older gentleman who asked if I wanted to eat in or order for carryout. He gave me a menu and gave me a moment to look it over so that I could see what I wanted to order. Once I had my order he rang me up and I paid and he told me to have seat in the little waiting area they had. Luckily they had an outlet near the bench so that I could charge my phone while I waited. My order took about 10 minutes to complete. The gentleman placed everything in a bag for me with extra napkins and utensils and I was on my way. I decided to eat near my gate. I ordered the half a BLT sandwich and a Cesar salad. Both were super yummy and hit the spot right before I boarded my delayed flight back home.

reviews.name: Bobby D.
reviews.review: Had the bruschetta chicken with broccoli.  Came quickly & and presented well.  Ordered the octoberfest!  I'm a sucker for octoberfest beer.Staff was friendly, quick & helpful.  Not an upscale place, but great for a quick hit in an airport.

reviews.name: Pam H.
reviews.review: I don't know what is with these people complaining about airport food.  We had a 3 hour layover and after spending some time at the USO headed over there for dinner.  Hubby had the turkey burger it was charbroiled and he said it was one of the best he has ever had, fries were hot & crispy.  I had the chicken tenders and steak with broccoli & loaded potato soup for the sides. Yes, there was an up charge for the soup but so worth it. Steak was perfectly grilled medium rare, very tender and flavorful. Had to laugh that I received a plastic steak knife but it cut like butter anyway. 3 large lightly hand breaded tenders, perfectly crispy and not greasy.  Nice portion of grilled broccoli which went right into that large luscious bowl of bacon topped potato cheese soup. Yum!  Robert our server was great and even though the bar was backed up a bit got hubby his beer and brought a basket of warm dinner rolls as well.  No complaints here!

reviews.name: Tina L.
reviews.review: You need enough time to wait for your food here, not a good place if you are in a rush.

reviews.name: Peter H.
reviews.review: Smaller menu than the normal O'Charlies. Not a problem, since I don't want to be flipping through a menu with limited time while waiting for a flight. It is definitely one of the better food options at the airport, and would have rated more stars, but when the place is empty, don't sit me at a dirty table and huff when something is said.

reviews.name: Kelly T.
reviews.review: Had the nicest and friendliest waitress here.  The food is decent, had the grilled fish and salad, can't complain, this while waiting for my delayed flight.As mentioned by another reviewer, they have outlets in the bar area and so while I had my meal, I was able to charge my phone and iPad.

reviews.name: Larisa N.
reviews.review: They don't have a full menu, I think that's the oh con. For instance, they don't serve lunch and from fishes they only have tilapia. No wifi. However, they still serve their signature rolls, they have a full bar with TVs. I like that they have a few seats in a bar area with outlets bill on countertop. Comes very handy for your laptop. The service was very fast, but I'm traveling on a Christmas Day and the airport is almost empty. No free pie on Wednesdays.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: When it comes to airport restaurants, the drinks have to be on in order to score...this place fell short, way short. $12 bloodies with exactly 1 shot of vodka, not for me. $7 tapper of miller lite, could live with it if it came up cold, but it didn't. The breakfast menu offers about 10 options, most without meat. Tried the quesadillas and the Spanish scramble, both tasted good but the portions were on the small side. Definitely won't be stopping by again given all the other options in concourse C.

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: Possibly one of the worst meals I've had in my life. I asked for warm water and got water with ice. Then I ordered a strawberry lemonade half sweet and it was twice as sweet as it should be. I asked if they could make it less sweet and the only option was to dilute it with club soda.Since it was cold outside, I decided to try the pot roast. There just seemed to be something wrong with the meat, and I wasn't sure what until the girl next to me asked me how it was - she wanted to try it but played it safe with a salad. We eventually concluded that the meat was probably precooked out of a bag. The sauce was also too salty and peppery. And to top it off, the whole thing just didn't sit well with my stomachNever again, never again.

reviews.name: Shon T.
reviews.review: For airport food this place is not bad. The drinks are pretty cheap, specifically the beers. The nacho and boneless chicken appetizer's were pretty good. The environment is nice and relaxed and a great way to get away from the busy stressful airport environment.

reviews.name: Antonio M.
reviews.review: I love O'Charley's. My favorite chain of restaurants by far. The food is always great! I love their rolls! Some of the best bread at any given restaurant. The food is always fresh, hot and made to order. I love their Louisiana Sirloin Steak with their Cajun butter with a side of baked potato and some fries. Sooooo good. I also love their fish and chips, it's on $8.99! Can't beat it. Their salads are pretty good too, I really enjoy their house salad with ranch. Definitely love this place and will return.

reviews.name: Jennifer W.
reviews.review: Really no complaints here. It is not spectacular food but I can tell you that compared to other airport food this was really good. I had the turkey club with sweet potato fries. Food came out fast and fresh. Fries were piping hot and perfectly crispy on the outside. I did. It feel rushed not did I feel that I had to wait long. I would definitely come back here.

reviews.name: Angela G.
reviews.review: Service here was absolutely terrible. The waitress didn't write down our meals, and everything we ordered was incorrect in at least one way. Our nachos had pico de gallo on it (we asked for no pico), my steak was incorrectly cooked not once, but TWICE, and my friend got the wrong sides for his steak. We also never got the "famous rolls" and had to ask for them toward the end of our meal. To top it off, everything was pretty gross - the steak was gristly, the broccoli was wilted and old, and the mashed potatoes were a lump of hard, flavorless starch. After dinner, I got really sick with stomach pains and was in agony throughout my trip back to Philly. STAY AWAY.

reviews.name: Tony J.
reviews.review: OMG...I have never wrote a review that slams a restaurant but I have to this time. If a restaurant is in an airport terminal and After security...would you expect to wait 20 mins for a server to take your order? Would you expect him to confirm the order 3 times? would you expect him to charge coffee by the number of refills? Would you expect a well done steak when you order it medium. There is a reason the place is empty at 7am when the rest of the restaurants are full.  For all of you coming in do yourself a favor wait in line at one of the other choices. you will end up getting out at the same time, pay less and not board your plane frustrated. Oh and you will not be stressed trying to get to it. Also you should know the menu is a limited menu. it is not the full Menu you may be use to. the only redeeming quality here is they have a view of the tarmac...assuming you are strong enough to hold back the urge of wanting to jump out on to it. Sorry guys but I am an incredibly easy to please dude. A lot of points are given to common sense. of which there is very little at this restaurant.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Oh Charley - you always have me at prime rib pasta!

reviews.name: Holly C.
reviews.review: I had a meal here during my layover, and it was enjoyable. The rolls were delicious, and I liked my California chicken salad a lot. I also ordered a strawberry lemonade but didn't like it too much because it was slightly carbonated, and I'm not a fan of that. It's got great food from what I see for an airport restaurant though!

reviews.name: Joseph R.
reviews.review: I had hoped it would be good but the pot roast came out cold. No manager came to talk to me. I sent it back and just paid for the tea. I get it, it's a airport eatery so don't expect much but the good could have, should have been heated to a temperature that was healthy. I am not saying I wonder t come here again but it was disappointing.

reviews.name: Kelly S.
reviews.review: This is one of the most bizarre experiences I've ever had at an airport bar. This is why. The bartendresses were weirdly surly with each other and with the patrons. They're apparently mad about some new process?The one server kept pressuring me to order... so I did. And my spinach salad looked awesome when it arrived. And it was decent. Not necessarily inspired by any stretch but pretty large. SOAKED in dressing though -- ask for it on the side.Also, the pinot grigio is among the sweetest Ive had. Bordered on sugar water and was $10 -- for barefoot -- which is egregious. I wouldnt recommend O Charleys if you have another alternative.

reviews.name: C S.
reviews.review: Had a steak here and asked or it to be well done.  It came out still bleeding as I cut into it.  The waiter agreed and took it away.  It then came back and it was the same steak as I had cut before. I asked if it was policy to do so, he apologized and cleared my bill.

reviews.name: Megan C.
reviews.review: This location gets four stars due to it being some of the best sit-down food that I've consumed in an airport.  Specifically.  It is not the greatest restaurant I've ever visited, but that was never my expectation.  Usually I find airport food to be edible, at best, and terrible, slimy, spoiled, or mushy at worst.  This O'Charley's location was fast, friendly, and my salad actually tasted fresh.  I'd come here again if my flight was delayed around dinner time (as it was per this visit).

reviews.name: Dave W.
reviews.review: The culmination of our unexpected overnight stay in Nashville and it was not bad at all. We all had breakfast and, while it was not spectacular, it was certainly good enough to get our engines started. We had Eggs, over easy, with bacon, Spanish Scramble and a Spinach/Mushroom Scramble. Add a side of bacon along with coffee and tea and you get a good meal from an airport restaurant.Clean environment, nice view and attentive servers. Not too bad at all.

reviews.name: Taryn N.
reviews.review: Had plenty of time until my flight when got there. Was still waiting for my food 30 minutes later! (And no drink refill.)  Had to get my order to go and I hate eating a full meal on the plane! (I hate smelling other peoples' food...I'm sure they don't appreciate smelling mine.) Not sure I would return to the airport O'Charleys....but I love their rolls!

reviews.name: Vivian W.
reviews.review: My first O'Charley's experience happened to be at the Nashville Airport, it won't be my last O'Charley's experience but it may be the last one at the airport.  Came by on Wednesday evening at around 5:15PM with a flight leaving at 6:30PM.  We got in and out quickly but the food was sub-par and the service was just okay.  I ordered the grilled shrimp on rice with smashed potatoes and asparagus.  I forget what my colleague ordered, just remembered that she ordered it with sweet potato fries instead of regular fries.  Food comes out, my shrimp is extremely salty but the rest of the plate was okay.  Asparagus was cooked well, potatoes were delicious and rice was good.  Colleague didn't get her sweet potato fries and got regular fries and decided not to fuss about it so we wouldn't miss our flights.  Got the bill and the upcharge was still there for the sweet potato fries, but we're in a rush and didn't want to fuss much.  I did lose my boarding pass and they did find it for me though, so that was very nice of them.  People are nice but everything else is eh.

reviews.name: Charlie M.
reviews.review: I thought the food was good for an airport restaurant. I gave it 3 stars because Yelp doesn't have a 3.5 star rating. Hey, you're not going to find too many great restaurants at an airport. I sat at the bar and the bartender was very friendly and was always checking on me. Ordered the fried chicken sandwich w/out mayo and I thought it was good. It's on a ciabatta bread, so if you don't like that type of bread, you've been warned. Also ordered a couple of Yazoo IPAs, very good, not too hoppy. Jeanie was my bartender and she was cool. Nice experience in Nashville from a So Cal boy. I'll be back in less than two years for a conference or maybe in less for a pleasure trip.

reviews.name: Anna E.
reviews.review: I rarely do sit down restaurants in an airport, let alone order a full on pasta meal.  However, we were wrapping up a girls trip and wanted some QT before we all went our separate ways.  I had the bowtie pasta with chicken and it was quite tasty!  The pasta was cooked perfectly and it was served with some type of creamy (but not alfredo creamy) sauce with a little bit of kick.  I also had the strawberry lemonade, which was a little too sweet and $$ for my taste.  Overall, solid place for an airport!

reviews.name: Carla C.
reviews.review: Who would have thought that an airport restaurant would have such great food AND service?  We all had the breakfast quesadilla -- should have split between two of us, they were huge!  Even the salsa was great!  And, if you're lucky, Marian will be your server.  She heard me say that part of my order was "for later (traveling over lunchtime, too), so she delivered (my bagel) packaged to go.  Great experience.  And I have to say that this place is pretty consistently good, as I have eaten here several times this year.(NOTE:  This was drafted 9/2013 from my cell phone but just finally posting now.)

reviews.name: Ryann G.
reviews.review: I am utterly ashamed of myself for not checking Yelp before walking into this place for dinner while waiting for my connecting flight to Philadelphia.  Ordered the "special" blackened tilapia with asparagus. Tilapia was dusted with some weird seasoning and cooked until it was completely dead, dry, and disgusting. My asparagus was four tree-trunk sized spears with overcooked tips and woody as hell stems.  The date had a chicken "bruschetta" which was a small piece of chicken coated in a raw, cold, sweet sauce with cheese and a grilled tomato on each side.  If the dishes were 5.99 each, it would have been acceptable fare, but for $15 a dish? HECK NO!I could have cooked ten times better at home.  On the bright side, the side house salad was crisp and refreshing.  The unsweetened iced tea was icy and lacking sweetness.If you can, go elsewhere!

reviews.name: Lauren H.
reviews.review: Overpriced and not good!  There were limited food choices in the whole airport, especially concourse B, but I was disappointed with O'Charley's!  I figured it would be similar to that of TGI Friday's or Ruby Tuesday, but the food did not taste good and made me feel sick.  The waitress failed to mention the beer I ordered would be $8.50, so I was a little miffed when I got my bill.   The waitress was kind of pestering, but I guess that's better than being ignored!

reviews.name: Nikki B.
reviews.review: First time at O'Charleys, and first time in Nashville! I wanted to give this place a 5 star review, because honestly, that is how addicted I am to their "Unsliceably Soft Yeast Rolls", but the service was TERRIBLE. I ordered the panko breaded shrimp which were delicious and my two sides were the rice pilaf - very meh - and the mashed potatoes - even more meh. But! I would go back just for the shrimp and the rolls. Someone help me figure out the recipe please and thankkkkk you!

reviews.name: Greg H.
reviews.review: My wife and I just had lunch here. It was a great experience considering the usual airport fare. My bacon cheddar cheeseburger was awesome and made rare just as I ordered. Normally that order will only get me medium well at best. I sopped up the drippings with the fries which were fair to good.  Ask for Aida. She was very sweet and on the spot with everything. We had a very pleasant time leaving relaxed and ready for our journey.

reviews.name: George F.
reviews.review: What's great surprise - I am a big guy with a big appetite and was pleasantly surprised by the black and bleu steak salad. Fresh, perfectly cooked steak and a big fresh salad. All for just under 10 bucks!

reviews.name: Teresa B.
reviews.review: I usually fly out of the same gate and O'Charley's is nearby.  I usually sit at the bar and watch the news while waiting for my flight.  The bartenders are always friendly and attentive and recognize me when I come in.  Not a bad place to kill time at the airport.

reviews.name: Michelle C.
reviews.review: Actual conversation I had with a server today at O'Charley's:Me:  What beers do you have on tap?Her:  Miller, Miller Lite, Budweiser, Heineken, Yazoo...Me:  What kind of beer is Yazoo?Her:  It's...uh...a beer?Me:  ...Fortunately, a guy on the bar stool next to me saved the day by explaining that it was a local pale ale.  One Yazoo, please!Despite being not-so-in-the-know in the beer arena, the service was otherwise heartfelt, and I was pleasantly surprised at how tasty my set of four mini-burgers was.  I generally assume that I'll have to dress up my restaurant burgers to make them taste good, but just a bit of cheddar and pickle was the only foil needed for these flavorful patties (never frozen, according to the menu).  The fries had veered into lukewarm territory by the time they arrived and weren't as crispy as I like them, but my Yazoo was large enough to smooth over that misstep AND ease my path home.Not half bad for airport food.  Yazoo!

reviews.name: Natalya S.
reviews.review: This restaurant has become the go-to place for me and my co-workers over the past month.  We travel on a weekly basis through the Nashville airport.  Their food is okay and they have a pretty standard variety of food from burgers, to pasta, to salad, etc.  I have had both burgers and pasta here, and all were satisfying enough.  The price is not bad as well considering it is an airport.  While they do not serve a large variety of alcohol, they do serve enough staple beers and have a few cocktails that aren't bad either.  The service has been good every time I have gone as well, admittedly, I seem to have had the same woman every time!  I recommend this place if you are hungry and have a little bit of time before your flight.

reviews.name: Jeff L.
reviews.review: Ordered breakfast. The biggest one they had. Cold...luke warm at best.Sausage tasted ok, but cold.Bacon was good, but cold.Steak...Tough and cold.Eggs - Flat, come on....they are scrambled... fluff them up a bit!Toast, slightly burned.Service was OK, except I think they left my food on the counter too long before they brought it.Was anybody paying attention in the kitchen before they sent this out?I will try the other places before I come back.

reviews.name: Jacelyn C.
reviews.review: It was okay and decent food. just had the food to go during a visit to Nashville. Prices were decent too. Just don't expect anything too fancy.

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: how can you screw up a chicken ceaser salad? guess you have to eat here to find out. Pre-made rubbery chicken and premade fridge tasting salad - hey it's an airport and we'll probably never see you again - got that part right!

reviews.name: Whois J.
reviews.review: I must agree with previous posts.  I came here for breakfast on my way home to California.  It was early and breakfast was all that they were serving.  I ordered the prime rib omelet.  I should have know better.  Now if they were to make an omelet and put a small slice of prime rib on the side this would have been a different review.    But what they did is take blocks of prime rib and fold it into and overcooked omelet.   Results is overcooked and tough prime rib.  The home fries were nice and crisp ( I requested that).  On the good side they gave me coffee in a to go cup at the end of the meal, an nice touch to extend the dining experience.  I liked that part, but the overcooked omelet was the down fall of this place.

reviews.name: Dan Z.
reviews.review: The Good: Spicy Tuna Roll; seaweed salad; the serviceThe Bad: A bit pricy; $65 for two sodas, three rolls, a couple of salads, and tip.The Rest: The best part is the rolls were fresh snd good. Sat at the bar and service from David was perfect. The chef (The Conquerer) rolls a mean and good sushi! Only been opened one week as of today.

reviews.name: Harriette J.
reviews.review: I have been craving sushi all week, the more than satisfied my craving,  I rank them in my top 10!!!!

reviews.name: Matt M.
reviews.review: Had the salmon and avocado roll and some miso soup ( and a goose island IPA) .  The fish was tasty and fresh and the portion was ample.

reviews.name: Missy W.
reviews.review: Hooray for a Great quick meal at BNA. Our server Tish provided over the top good service. Don't eat before you arrive for your flight. Save it for Hissho.

reviews.name: Faith H.
reviews.review: Sushi at an airport? It cant get much better. For being in an airport, the price point for the rolls actually aren't that bad. Not only that but the selection is creative and delicious, I myself enjoyed mango mochi and a Living Color roll. Jill and Tish are absolute dolls! Glad my connecting flight was in Nashville :-)

reviews.name: Molly B.
reviews.review: These are seriously AMAZING! They are gluten free (and free of a lot of other allergens, but I can't remember) and they are so moist and delicious. Seriously, the best gluten free cupcakes I've ever had.

reviews.name: Michael M.
reviews.review: Joanna is just a wonderful young entrepreneur combining kindness and  delicious gluten free allergen free cakes for everyone to enjoy.  They are so good you cannot even tell they are GF free.   My wife has celiac and is in love.

reviews.name: Deidra L.
reviews.review: Nice stop if you are waiting to get into the Ryman but I would not stop in outside of that. The food was pricey for what you received but was good. Limited beer options but they have a few. Nice outdoor seating for some good people watching before your show.

reviews.name: Kelly M.
reviews.review: The food was pretty good. The prices are okay -- especially considering the prices in the rest of downtown. My biggest issue is that all of the food comes either IN or ON plastic, and yet there are no recycling bins. That's a MASSIVE amount of ecological waste happening when it doesn't have to.Do better, Cafe Lula.

reviews.name: Margaret P.
reviews.review: The menu is limited... I ordered off a menu & received a sandwich in clamshell container. I guess I had a preconceived notion it would be more "restaurant" than "snack stand". The atmosphere was nice...

reviews.name: Sara B.
reviews.review: Convenient stop. Previous reviewer said the menu is limited, which is true but what they have is very tasty. Try the roasted pork sandwich with pimento cheese! All the sides were very good. We had Mac and cheese, potato salad with bacon, squash casserole and cucumber salad. The cornbread was both sweet and spicy and one of the favorites. I like that they have wine and beer and the decor is really cute.

reviews.name: Chris G.
reviews.review: Now I know this place is at a truck stop but it seriously has pretty good food. Did I mention you can have seconds? Or thirds? Or fourths? Plus it has a decent salad bar. I try to eat everywhere around town at least once and I have visited this place on more than one ocassion. This truck stop was completely remodeled after the flood and is very nice. I know it's in a not so nice part of town but they have security so it is never been an issue there. I would feel good about letting my wife go there at lunch alone if that tells you anything. The place is always clean and the waitresses have been very nice. Sometimes you might have to wait a little bit because they have a lot of tables but I've never had bad service there. One day when you and friends are looking for someplace to go to lunch suggest this place you will not be sorry you did!

reviews.name: Craig L.
reviews.review: Typical truck stop diner.  Friendly service and way too much food for your own good.  Be careful when the waitress asks "do you want a refill?"  I  thought I was ordering another soda and she brought me another open faced pot roast sandwich.  That is just sick.  It turns out 1500 calories where not enough.  Good food.  This is why truckers are all in shape (hey! Round is a shape)

reviews.name: Jolly R.
reviews.review: Little slice of heaven. All you can eat breakfast specials. Clean and remodelled after the great flood. Plenty of space to relax. Not a crowded breakfast dinner spot. Enjoy

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: There are just times when quantity flat out beats quality, and since there is so little at this restaurant, located inside the Travel Center of America off of 1st Street near the James Robertson Bridge.The only way to describe it is for you to imagine a place where you pay diner prices for various dishes, but they keep bringing it to you if you ask for more.  Yes, it's an all you can eat place.  If I a really craving a steak, I don't go to any of the traditional places, where $25 gets you the cheapest cut of meat, I go to country pride, open 24/7, and keep eating steak and potatoes until I'm so full I can barely walk.Is the quality of the steak even moderately good? No.Is it a place you'd go on a date? Nope.Is this a place non-truckers want to admit they go to? Probably not.Is it a heck of a deal where they'll keep bringing you food until you burst? Absolutely!Relatively easy to get to.  No one will find you there, and you won't be so light in the wallet.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Want to meet a trucker? Come have some coffee at this east Nashville truck stop spot. Inside the Travel Centers of America truck stop, the food is guaranteed to stick to your gullet and fill ya up.

reviews.name: Erin W.
reviews.review: Great service over lunch yesterday.  Had a salmon salad, paid $10.95 for a really nice salad, but only 4 pieces of salmon.Really good service, nice atmosphere and meal itself was okay--if this salad was $5.95, I would totally give this 5 stars.  But size for cost do not equate.

reviews.name: Shannon M.
reviews.review: They messed up the drink order.The food is taking forever. Been here for almost an hour and no food yet. I wouldn't recommend this place.

reviews.name: Heidy C.
reviews.review: I went with my soon to be husband for my birthday & i was soo disappointed that i wanted to cry... Their lobster is the same size of a shrimp, our steaks were not the steaks we ordered. The salad greens were bitter....... should of stayed home and cooked but it was a good laugh, there goes $77.00. I really think if a real long horns knew about this one here they would shut it down asap, very sad

reviews.name: Mike S.
reviews.review: We arrived about 6:45 pm on a Sunday - Rachel came by our table about 5 minutes after we were seated.   She retuned with our drinks and we were ready to order - she was clearly not.  We convinced her to take our order - just before 7 pm. The appetizer arrived about 10 minutes later - Onion petals (or whatever Longhorn's name is for the fried onion thing).  The onion was a little soggy - not crisp like it should be - and not hot.  My salad - which was to come at the same time - was no where to be seen. It's now 7:10 pm. Rachel never stopped by to check on our app. About 7:40 pm, Rachel arrived with my salad.  At that point we were done, we asked for the check and the manager.  She told us don't worry about it, but we insisted on the manager. The manager informed us the ticket was started 5 minutes earlier when she entered it - clearly we were the victim of the classic "forgotten order".  We gathered our things in search of better service.  The manager did try to make up for the epic fail with some gift cards which we will surely use at another location at some point in the future.

reviews.name: Jennifer E.
reviews.review: This place is a chain and we usually do not eat at chains.  However, we are renting a house in the area and the night we got in we wanted something close.  Usually with chains you can expect a certain level of quality.  Not at this Longhorn.  Terrible service followed by worst food.  Three times we were told she would be right back.  Finally, she came to take our drink order.  25 minutes after we were seated we got to order our food.  Once the food came it was terrible.  SALT all over everything.  I was drinking so much water to get the food down.  I actually made my father stop eating.  He has a heart conditions and the amount of salt was not going to e good for his heart.  We are in this house for two weeks but will never return to this location.  Terrible.  Improve the service as well.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: Came here for lunch yesterday with a couple coworkers, and ordered straight out of the lunch menu hoping to get a decent sized portion for a decent price. Sorta kinda worked out. I got a prime rib half sandwich that came with the potato soup w/ bacon. There was literally 10 tiny blocks on bacon on my soup - oh well, guess its healthier that way. The sandwich though, TINIEST SANDWICH I'VE EVER SEEN, small in all dimensions. And the meat itself was really stringy and not very flavorful, the only thing I really tasted in the sandwich was the red onions, which were soggy. I really wish I'd taken a picture, it was literally the size of a numberpad on a keyboard. TWO of these would have made a half sandwich without exaggeration.Now regarding the potato soup, I picked it hoping to get some tasty bacon, which obviously didn't happen. The soup itself was pretty bland - the only real redeeming quality of it was that it was dense (as potato is by default) so I was actually able to ward off hunger for a couple hours despite the miniscule sandwich half.But seriously, I would not come back here again. Small portions, bland food, and I really doubt their actual steak (seeing as it is a steakhouse) is that good considering the bad quality of the lunch items.

reviews.name: R R.
reviews.review: A+ service, but Longhorn's food is just meh and way overpriced. Nothing too exciting.

reviews.name: Noelle T.
reviews.review: I was asked to meet some co-workers here for lunch and my snob radar turned on.  I didn't want to eat in this area and I didn't want to eat at LongHorn.  My plan was to attend the meeting and decline any food but what a surprise!  This place was packed for lunch and there was a 10 minute wait.  It has a little atmosphere too but what sold me was their selection of under 500 calorie meals.  I ordered the flo filet and added it to the strawberry walnut salad.  It was delish!  I will be back.

reviews.name: Svetlana D.
reviews.review: My hubby went for lunch here today. He normally always orders the parmesan chicken and today was no different. However, after eating he's been feeling queasy all afternoon and is now suffering from diaherea. I'm shocked and appalled by the quality of food. Never going there again!

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Ranch House Cobb Salad - huge, 12oz Prime Rib with a delicate horseradish and pot au jus, Martini (shaker filled two glasses), a Sam Adams, side of fresh tomatoes and unseasoned fries (delicious).  Total $40 ish, great value and all served with zero attitude and just the right amount of attention.  Nice dimly lit bar and ample parking, makes a welcome change from major attitude, small portions and overpriced steaks at some of the places around town.  Always been a fan of the Steakhorn on Murfreesboro Rd.  Lunch time Cowboy Pork chop special for $9.99 hits the spot.

reviews.name: Buck C.
reviews.review: Fantastic meal. 18oz Outlaw Ribeye cooked perfect. Loaded potato was hot and salad was cool and crisp. Topped off with a couple of Budweiser Black Crown's, it was one of the best restaurant meals I have had in a while.

reviews.name: shaun p.
reviews.review: Close to the airportNot to far from downtownLots of hotels aroundVast menuGreat food great staff this longhorn has a lot of people that have been there for a very long time.Which means it has to be a great place.This longhorn has constant quality food which makes it great to come back to. This is an old school longhorn 20th in the company if its not right they make it right.This longhorn cares and values it's guests.Now time to talk about the food.Start off with the wild west shrimp lightly battered popcorn shrimp tossed in garlic butter pepperoni mix served with ranch.And if you want to be really bad get the western cheese fries.Or the savory lobster shrimp dip. And don't forget the 5 cheese stuff mushrooms.With the main courses the best bets are the Flo's filet or the Outlaw  flamed grilled 18oz bone-in Ribeye. The Salmon and trout are wonderful .And the parm chicken is to die for. and the side salads are very good a few made in house dressings are greatThe key lime pie is a great way to end it some of the best I have ever had.

reviews.name: Theresa B.
reviews.review: OMW...I stopped in the other night...I was so afraid..I'm not a fan of steakhouses...so I was certainly not going to order a steak...I just wanted a good, juicy hamburger...it surpassed my expectations...you know how your dog rolls around on things they like a lot??...I wanted to rub the burger all over my face...LOL..I have had many a hamburger, this one moved up the ranks and I'm going back again tonight...Not sure I'll go with a steak just yet..but another burger...DEFINITELY!!!...And the best part wasn't the first night of eating it..the best was when I warmed it for lunch the next day...SO GOOD!!!I ordered it to go at the bar and had a Chardonnay while I waited.  The bartender was great.  I also got the dessert sampler...also delicious!!!You gotta try them out...I don't know what the other stores are doing ...but this one gets my vote!!

reviews.name: Amy D.
reviews.review: The salad here is AMAZING its so hard to find a good Ranch Dressing and this place has it!. The steaks were cooked well according to those in my party who ordered them, I had a burger... It was good nothing spectacular. Broccoli was really good flavored well good french fries and they sent me home with to go soda i think that was a nice touch. Servers are all nice overall its a nice place cost about 70 for 3 people about 20 a plate for the steaks and 10 for hamburger then you start adding in drinks and lo an behold youve spent 70. Ill go back again.

reviews.name: Cassie L.
reviews.review: been here a couple of times now and is always good-went out last night wit the bf and i ate but he didnt rlly want nuthin-now from havin worked in restaurants sounds like two broke ppl we're not but thats wat it looked like lol-server still gave us great service  steak was peeerfect as always-not over seasoned juicey and tender-perfectly medrare-quickly becoming my favorite chain --bearded white dood that was our server last night and short thick blk girl that was our server last time we were here before last night-yall rock keep up the good work

reviews.name: Monica D.
reviews.review: I recently visited with my friend here.  I didn't know what to expect because I had never visited before, and I don't normally like ordering steak at a restaurant because they never have seemed to get it right. I know, I'm odd.  BUT OH MY GOSH.  I ordered the medium cooked fillet Mignon with their sweet potato topped with cinnamon sugar....best ever!  It was so so good! I felt like God made my steak!  And our server was so nice and always made sure our drinks were filled! Awesome, awesome service! Well worth the price...and they have coke zero...bonus points for me. :)

reviews.name: Albert P.
reviews.review: As a dedicated yelper I rarely go to chains, but the reviews seemed the best for nashville and steakhouses. We were surprisingly pleased. The strawberry pecan salad was great, and our sides were delicious too (steamed veggies & asparagus). My 9oz filet was supposed to be MW and came out too rare, but waiter may have thought I said MR and I didn't mind. It was flavorful and tender. I ordered the homemade chips recommended in a few reviews and the family snacked on them until dinner came, I tried to quit eating them but had trouble. As an ex-waiter I can always find flaws in service, the biggest being not picking up plates as we finished each course, but it didn't ruin the meal.

reviews.name: S G.
reviews.review: I usually skip the burritos, which are fine but usually too much food to eat in one sitting, and I order a couple of soft tacos on corn tortillas.  The brisket, chicken, and chorizo sausage are all particularly good.  Chips and salsa are usually fresh and tasty and the iced tea is fresh brewed. The service is iffy but it is not a tableservice kind of place so it doesn't really matter.  The line moves quickly.   I think their business has slowed down somewhat since some other taco places opened downtown. This one is still my favorite amongst the bunch.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: Okay, I work at the Bat Building downtown and I get tired of the same old foods...so every now and then I like to go to new places and try them out..well, I have walked by this place a million times over the past 4yrs and HECK FIRE..I have never noticed this in the before..I know I am old but am I blind now too????Anyway, I went in today and I was pleasantly surprised. Larger inside than I thought.  I got my order to go. I ordered a chicken burrito with all the veggies and beans and rice inside the burrito also, it was really stuffed full..I love guac..so I asked for extra on the side I love that stuff..I also got some chips to go and went over to a salsa bar where there was like five different types to choose from so, I got a little container of each, and a couple containers of some I thought I would really like..I am a salsa NUT..I love salsa...is that weird?  BYW, I also make a mean hot salsa myself homemade, but I still like to try salsa when I am out.I got back to the office and ummmm it smelled so good. Everyone was like, heck Melissa whatcha eating over there...everyone loved the aroma from my mexicali meal...it was really good. I just wish the salsa containers were larger, but they were all good salsa..I liked them all. The chips could have been a little more salty but hey that is my taste buds..the food was good.I will definitely go back here again.And AGAIN...prices not bad either !!!!

reviews.name: Brady B.
reviews.review: Best Mexican in Nashville I've had so far !!  You get what you pay for its fast and filling!!   Way better then Nashville street tacos or el rays, or San Antonio's tacos!  Don't waste your time else where this is the spot to be!

reviews.name: James H.
reviews.review: Much like the fast food joints, the burrito joints around town now seem to be a dime a dozen. Like one of my friends said, if you are hungry and don't have much money, go to one of the burger chains with the 99 cent menu and order a few things and a water. Well, if you're hungry and have a few dollars more, you might like Chile Burrito about as much as you would like those other burrito places that seem to be everywhere, not on every corner like Walgreen's but getting close.Here, its par for the course, some meet, some cheese, some beans, a whole lot of other stuff to throw in there and add some chips and a soda and you won't be hungry again for a few hours. The folks working there are efficient enough and friendly enough. The place was clean. Nothing to write home about, but ok.

reviews.name: Kelly M.
reviews.review: If you want some authentic Mexican good eats, this is the place. The staff was friendly and efficient and fast, a little too fast actually. Felt rushed.Ordered a quesadilla with chicken and sour cream with chips. Omg soo yummy! The chips taste homemade not processed an loved how cheesy the quesadilla was!Def would come back!

reviews.name: Barnabas P.
reviews.review: Fast and friendly staff, but the food is just decent. I enjoyed it, but it wasn't special.

reviews.name: Meredith H.
reviews.review: Nachos were delicious! I was surprised at how expensive it was, though. I just wanted lunch but I spent like half my paycheck! So many things were extra and it just snuck up on me!

reviews.name: Kate O.
reviews.review: Love this place. It helps that it's only a block from my office and therefore perfect for weekday lunches, but then again they're only open for weekday lunches, so I guess it's kismet. The managers/owners have been very supportive and clear about letting me know the beans, rice, and guac are all vegan, so this is an ideal place for a vegan-friendly burrito, bowl, or salad. And speaking of salads, that's what I eat when I'm eating raw, and there are plenty of veggies to add (along with guacamole, of course!) to make it a substantial meal. Their guacamole, by the way, is different from most others in town: it's heavy on cilantro and lime, I think, and that gives it a really refreshing flavor. I'm a fan, but if you don't like cilantro and lime all that much... well, what are you doing eating at a Mexican place anyway?My only complaint is that I wish they were open for dinner and on the weekends, since I sometimes work late enough to want to grab dinner nearby, and I live near enough that this would be a great weekend option.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: What is it with these Burrito places putting together burritos with no discernible flavor?  I go in, order a Carne Asada medium burrito, and almost nothing.  It was spicy, since I got the hot sauce on it, but the marinade on the meat was nothing, the meat itself was nothing, the cheese was nothing.How is it that Chipotle can do it so well, and almost everyone else is so freaking bland?

reviews.name: Erik J.
reviews.review: I had a Chorizo bowl and cannot say that I was too impressed. The Chorizo was cooked fresh for my order, but it didn't look like a very appetizing piece of sausage to begin with.Behind the counter was quite a mess, and the topping ingredient area was littered with bits of each topping in another topping's container. Those with any kind of food allergies might want to beware.The taste was acceptable, but the quantity of food in the bowl for the total price after the "additional" guacamole and sour cream was added was not that great.If you want some really quick and tolerable eats in the area and don't want to walk all the way for BBQ, this place will do the trick.  I'll probably go again in a pinch, as I stay at the Courtyard next door quite often.

reviews.name: Jason B.
reviews.review: Great consistent food. ...they get so busy sometimes that they over charge by accident. So make sure to check ur bill. Other than that, they are great.

reviews.name: Jamie D.
reviews.review: A-OK is OKAY!Went here with co-workers for lunch today. I was happy to see that in my burrito bowl that they automatically put seasoned rice and black beans. Yaya for good health.Tuesday was fish taco day. Our lunch guest had them, and I have to say they looked delicious. I was very unhappy with myself for not eating those. And, unlike the fish tacos of the West, they are made with catfish here. Ha, go figure. Darn I missed an opportunity. I had the burrito bowl with beef brisket. I know - beef brisket in a Mexican bowl - well, its not Mexico after all. As much as I love brisket, this must have been smoked and cook in the same oven as pork. My gut feeling (for real, a tummy rumbler) says so. See, I don't eat pork (health reasons), so, I can tell when something is a little porky (like fishy but pork, ah nevermind). And, it taskted more salty than usual.They give you a ton of toppings to choose from. Think Chipotle but with a mid-southern REAL Mexican twist. And, you can head over to the salsa bar and add your own red/green hot/mild sauce or grab you a lemon/lime to squeeze.Overall, def a good lunch spot if you are in the downtown area. OYE!

reviews.name: Erik N.
reviews.review: Pretty delicious burritos, definitely the best to go to in the area.

reviews.name: Amy W.
reviews.review: Quick, fresh ingredients. Healthy menu options. I was impressed for such a speedy lunch in-and-out place!Go for the fish taco deal on Tuesdays.

reviews.name: Brent W.
reviews.review: Down in the bowl...where I werk...there's a cabillion-famillion really average places to get a styro-yuck for nearly ten-buck...but Chile Burrito is a dang good option downtown for gettin' fresh food and nice people who make it in front of you for a price you can neeeerly dictate. If you wanna get by on the cheap and still get freshed up, you can get a small veg-head black beano burrito with fresh ingreedayents fer less than 5...I reckon. I like to get in that 7 to 8 range and eat GOOD with smoked, pulled pork nachos or a burrito. These people are really nice and they do it up fresh. If you are thrifty, you can share a full lunch for jes-less than ten, considering you have one friend in this crummy werld who will share with you...NO YOU DON'T HAVE TO FEED EACH OTHER OFF THE SAME PLASTIK FORK! Sheesh. Anyway, it ain't real Mex, but it's fresh Southwest...facing south...yup.

reviews.name: T. C.
reviews.review: I am salivating just thinking about this place.  They have, hands down, the best steak salad I have ever had (well, you order the salad and then you pick all your fixin's)  I love their chipotle ranch dressing, I love the tortilla strips on top of the salad, I love how their steak tastes, I love their black beans, I love the cucumber, omg, I love it all...Like Joe's comment on their nachos, I always walk away stuffed.  For a less ravenous person than me, a salad could probably go for two meals.  Just be prepared for a line out the door if you go exactly at lunchtime.  Plus you may or may not be able to find a seat so be prepared to take it to-go.  The only downside to this place is that it's only open on weekdays!  Booooo...

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: Delicious and wonderful. One burrito will fill you up, but get the chips so you can get a few cups of salsa.

reviews.name: Cole D.
reviews.review: Not a bad burrito joint. Probably the best bet for a burrito in downtown, but there are better spots in town. I prefer Nuevo Burrito in East Nashville or Blue Coast.

reviews.name: Joe C.
reviews.review: I have been eating at The Chile Burrito since it opened and I worked just across the street at the L&C tower downtown. Since then I've moved on and I now work down at the Nashville City Center off of Union. Anyways, I still make the walk to Chile Burrito because of two reasons: Fish Tacos and the Nachos. The portions are nearly at insane levels for the nachos, so don't eat lunch there and expect to have anything for dinner. And I would be remiss if I didn't mention the fish tacos. They are simply amazing. They take great care to make it well - the ingredients are all very fresh and well worth the cost. For a fast-food Mexican place, it really is hard to beat. One thing to watch out for is the lady working the register isn't always the happiest person in the world. The owner is almost always there, which is nice - but that woman behind the register usually sours the experience for me a little. Anyways, if you can get past her - this is an excellent place to eat for lunch.

reviews.name: Emily Y.
reviews.review: 3.5 stars.  it's not authentic, but it's great to grab a bite for a quick lunch.  try the enchilada soup . .  it comes w/ chips, and since there's an open fixins' bar, you can help yourself to your own concoction of a slsa mix.

reviews.name: Christian S.
reviews.review: What a great place. The truck sits permanently in front of a brick and mortar, just south of Thompson Lane on the east side Murfreesboro Road. Tacos are $1. They are small, so if you're hungry, you'll want to order 4-6. Al pastor was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Tacos consist of corn tortillas, your choice of meat, onion and cilantro only. Pickled vegetables (they had carrot slices when I was there) and red and green salsas are served on the side.Call your order in ahead of time if you want - several folks there in front of me were waiting for their pick up orders. There was a medium-sized line, but I was still out of there in less than 15 minutes, and there's no question it was worth it.

reviews.name: Donnie A.
reviews.review: I honestly love this place. Dollar tacos???!!!  Yes please!  Sign me up!!! Best authentic taco truck in Nashville!!!

reviews.name: Lindsay M.
reviews.review: Ordered through Inndelivery.com when i was staying at the red roof inn. It was delicious. Toppings were fresh, sauce is amazing and the crust is perfect both crispy and chewy. Try it and you won't regret it.

reviews.name: Kayla O.
reviews.review: Gross. Ordered chicken Parmesan and it was awful!! The chicken was a frozen chicken patty. And the noodles were hard and crusted. Will NOT order from here again. Not to mention it is in a BAD part of town and you have to get out and park no where near the actual place be there is about 2 parking spots for Romas. It is awful. Do not eat here.

reviews.name: Jusmary T.
reviews.review: Love, love, love the grilled chichen pizza. They're always quick with my orders. And really nice  !!!

reviews.name: Drew Z.
reviews.review: My girlfriend and I split the large pepperoni pizza. Although the price was great, 7.99, the pizza was just average. It's do able because of the price, but if you're looking for something extravagant I would pass

reviews.name: Natalie D.
reviews.review: Did not care for Roma's. Ordered for the office last week and was very disappointed. The crust is thin but not the good crisp thin crust. The pizza just lacked flavor... The chicken wings were fatty and soggy. The dessert was stale at best, the tiramisu was still frozen and the chocolate cake was stale. Will never order again. No thank you Roma's...

reviews.name: Maria C.
reviews.review: I had never tried Roma til earlier this year. I tend to lean toward more of a homemade pizza than a chain restaurant pizza, but Roma is excellent. Their veggies are always fresh, delivery is always prompt, and they always get my order right. Their sandwiches are great, too!

reviews.name: Jeff D.
reviews.review: Solid traditional combo plates, good chunky house salsa with a nice selection of bottled hot sauces.  It's kind of a hole in the wall but it's clean & has a nice quiet atmosphere.  Definitely coming back

reviews.name: Marty S.
reviews.review: Food was good.  Chips and salsa were great!  Lot's of food per serving.

reviews.name: Maegan P.
reviews.review: So. Freakin'. Good.This is my absolute favorite Mexican place in Nashville. My husband and I go here all the time. I usually get the Chiles Rellenos & he usually gets the Chimichangas Especiales. The food is plentiful and cooked correctly. What I really like about the chiles is they come stuffed with cheese (no meat), lightly fried with salsa roja on top. It's the way to go. Of course, there's free chips & salsa. Service is good and they have pretty good drink specials, too.Donelson is pretty quiet for the most part so they are not open that late. A small price to pay, in my opinion. Getting take out? I'm pretty sure they are the only Mexican restaurant around that will still hook you up with free chips & salsa on a to-go order. How cool is that? They usually include 1 bag of chips & 1 cup of salsa per entrée. I dig it. Affordable as you'd expect from a place like this. Most entrees run you $8-$10. Check it out.

reviews.name: Melissa L.
reviews.review: A little above the average Americanize Mexican restaurant in Nashville.  The carnitas were very good.

reviews.name: Melinda A.
reviews.review: Definitely better than the run of the mill Mexican places that seem to be co oped.The Chili Relleno was delicious. A nice light batter. The tacos de carne asada were good. Mexican style with onions and cilantro. 3" corn tortilla shells doubled. It looks like they can handle a crowd. The fun part for me is that President Obama stopped in for a to go order last week!!If its good enough for the POTUS its good enough for me.

reviews.name: Danelle C.
reviews.review: Food was below average. Service was slow and waiter was extremely rude, didn't even ask how things were at any time during the night. Never would I go back or recommend to anyone.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Genuinely inauthentic mexican food that's great. The $5.99 lunch special of two burritos, one beef and one chicken, both smoothed in queso, way too large to eat in one sitting but re-heats well makes it worth occasionally getting panhandled in the parking lot.

reviews.name: Gary R.
reviews.review: Small, unassuming authentic Mexican restaurant and food, in a quite strip center. If you stay, or have reason to be near the airport, this is a great find. VERY reasonably priced.  Seriously the food was really great. I have had many great carnitas, including some of the best at Carnitas in Tijuana across from Caliente, but these May be the best I have ever had.

reviews.name: Phillip A.
reviews.review: Typical east coast Mexican Restaurant with one exception, above average food, way above. I perused the menu till I stumbled upon the Carnitas and I love Carnitas also Carne Adovada when I can get it. They were done very well with just the right amount of spices and very tender and served with some perfectly done corn tortillas, the dish was succulent and the sides of refried beans and rice were perfect which isn't hard to do but I've been to many "Mexican" joints that just can't do rice and beans right. Served with Lettuce, tomatoes  and big dollop of real tasty Guacamole for a truly memorable dinner. Now the best part, with Ice Tea it was all under $10!!  Mexican food is not expensive food to make or prepare and to see a restaurant do it right for a decent price with great service is a rarity. Way recommended!!

reviews.name: Jeff S.
reviews.review: When I was here it was not busy at all and therefore the service was excellent. I got a combo plate with a hard taco, burrito and a tamale. Everything was excellent, the beer was ice cold and all at a very reasonable price. I will definitely eat here again if I am ever in the area.

reviews.name: Rob B.
reviews.review: Wow! I know there's some hate going on here but I've enjoyed the place on the handful of visits I've made during my travels to Nashville. Lets just stick to the most recent visit.Feeling hungry I went all out and ordered the Jalisco's Tacos with one chicken, one pork, and one steak. They were served in the traditional style of two corn tortillas with onion,  cilantro and a lime. All three were very tasty. I also included a sliced avocado which to my surprise was a whole avocado! Also had a side of beans and rice which were pretty standard. The best thing was a little tip from the Yelp photos, I ordered the Chili Toreados. These beautiful jalapeño's that are split on one end, deep fried and dusted with chili powder! Holy cow they were amazing!!!They also have a good bottled beer selection of some Mexican favorites as well as the standard draft fare.

reviews.name: Eddie B.
reviews.review: This place has pretty good authentic Mexican food.  They give you plenty of chips and salsa for free to start and the prices are very reasonable.  I had the soft tacos and they were almost as good as tacos I had in Guatemala, served very simple with meat, cilantro and onions.   And it was great that they had non Mexican meals for kids (chicken nuggets and cheeseburger).

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: Closes at 9 on a Saturday. What the heck?   Also before we knew that, while waiting inside the door at 10 til 9, we were simply told they're closed.  Won't be back.

reviews.name: Tamela L.
reviews.review: I first discovered this place when I worked in a call center behind it. It has by far been my favorite Mexican restaurant. I always order their Shredded Chicken Nachos. Their chicken is never dried out. They give you a lot of food. I also love their tortilla chips & salsa. There's is way better than las palmas, and all the other chain Mexican restaurants.

reviews.name: Arne R.
reviews.review: Great service, good food, the homeless person was still sitting outside...Chips were good, not too salty, and the queso was great as was the salsa. Per my daughter, the fish tacos were filling. Tajitas were average, and the t-bone was ok, they were out of Carnitas : (

reviews.name: John O.
reviews.review: Typical delicious Mexican cuisine with a very friendly staff. The homeless woman outside kinda turned me off a bit. The meal was great during our brief stay in Nashville!

reviews.name: Brian S.
reviews.review: DON'T judge a book by its cover. From the outside the shopping center is rather run down/old and the restaurant is very unassuming looking. Had a layover while traveling and after reviewing yelp decided to give it a try. Good carnitas, overall good experience, give it a try!

reviews.name: Bridget O.
reviews.review: We live down the road and go there frequently. Not the best Mexican food I've ever had (I grew up in LA), but we enjoy it. The staff is nice and they are always quick to throw together a take out order for us.

reviews.name: Jasmine M.
reviews.review: This is the best Mexican restaurant close to my job...thus far. I like it because they use bacon in their food which makes it unbelievably flavorful. Bacon + me= LOVE! But seriously, the food is decent. Service is just ok and could be so much better. My co-worker orders the steak fajita nachos and I have to admit, I love it but I don't order it because she usually gives me some of hers. I usually just order the fajitas and that is good enough w/some of her nachos. Salsa and chips are average but at least it's fresh.

reviews.name: Tammy T.
reviews.review: Looks amazing tastes amazing... Cheap prices.

reviews.name: Pritish Z.
reviews.review: I will take back my above review b'coz:1. They don't hear to customers - I ordered a veggie fajita "WITH NO MEAT" and what I got was with Chicken fajita. The waitress replaced it and got me Veggie fajita and once again I saw pieces of chicken in the fajita. ( I didn't eat the rest as I was really pissed off). 2. They don't apologize - The lady never apologized me for the mistake. Final words: I am NEVER EVER going back to Jalisco Mexican Restaurant.

reviews.name: Colleen C.
reviews.review: Great place! Yummy food and attentive service. I went with a group of over 60 people and that should have been a night mare for the converge factor alone. NOPE... we got hot yummy food with wonderful attentive service!If you order the Especial it says it's for 2 people... you WILL need a doggie bag.  Loaded with tasty shrimp, potatoes, beef, pork and chicken with beans, cheese, tomato and lettuce sides.  If that is not enough you get 1/2 quesadilla with it too! Highly recommend if you're in the Donelson area or need to stop by before you catch your flight at BNA.

reviews.name: Warren R.
reviews.review: Why 4 stars for Jalisco? Value & flavor. Realistically, it's kind of hard to judge Mexican food as so many are so similar. I bumped the rating here to a 4 for a few reasons. #1, they gave me a huge bowl of pretty decent salsa. I hate running out and that is usually the case at most restaurants. I ordered the fajita combo and it was not only large, there was plenty of meat, not just grilled veggies. My server was attentive without being a pain. I can recommend this place.

reviews.name: Krista A.
reviews.review: Food was nasty.  Cheese dip was runny.  Food was apparently reheated. Last time I will go there.

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: It was okay.

reviews.name: Jennifer D.
reviews.review: I wish I'd just gone to Taco Bell and bought a bottle of Tequila. I've only been to one worse Mexican restaurant in all my life and it's closed down. Welcome to the bottom spot, Jalisco.I sat at the bar, because I was by myself. It took the server a long time to get to me and when she did she offered me a drink.  I ordered a margarita. I had to ask twice more before someone finally got me a menu.The margarita was lackluster.  I ordered a combo meal and added a taco- and asked for no cheese on any of my food.  When the food came out, I noticed it all had cheese on it.  When I pointed it out to the server, she took the taco back in a huff.  As she started to walk away, I said "Is there cheese on the rest of this?"  As she continued to walk away she said "The cheese is just on top, not inside."Oh, is that what I asked for?  Just not inside?  Nope, no cheese means no cheese- but she clearly wasn't concerned with that at all, so I just scraped the cheese off the top (along with all the sauce in the process) and ate it anyway.  Disappointing.If it had been good, I might have forgiven that.  But it was mediocre at best, and the service was poor.  I was going to put hot sauce on top of it but the bottle was crusty and had no cap.  That sounds like food poisoning waiting to happen, no thanks!I think I'll steer clear of this place the next time I'm in the area. Yech.

reviews.name: Joe K.
reviews.review: We recently ate here and thought food was good.  Service was excellent, even though the cashier messed up on my change.  I would have no hesitation about eating here again !!!!

reviews.name: Jane L.
reviews.review: I am from Southern California and I used to live in Mexico. When I came to Nashville for the first time, the last thing I expected the concierge at my hotel to ask me was whether I liked Mexican food. She sent me to a place called Jalisco's, where the last thing I expected to find was real Mexican food being served by real Mexicans.I ordered the al pastor tacos Jalisco style. When they came out I requested some salsa verde to go with my tacos. The salsa I got was not verde, but it was definitely delish. It was spicy but not too hot, and the taste of the chiles came through perfectamente. The pork was super tender and reminded me of Los Angeles and Tijuana, just the way I like it.The only thing that could have been better was the tortillas. They were a bit dry, but I imagine good tortillas are hard to come by in Nashville.  If they had been made in-house, Jalisco's would have scored five stars from me, easy. I would say this place is doing a bang-up job of bringing a true ethnic flavor to a place that isn't fortunate enough to see a lot of ethnic diversity.A big shout out to the waiter from Jalisco, Mexico for holding steady in a town that is probably not always proud to have him. ¡Viva la raza, compa! ¡Que le vaya bien!

reviews.name: Robert B.
reviews.review: I gave this 5 stars to offset some of the low ratings by some people. I really don't understand all the negativity. Is it a perfect Mexican restaurant? No. However, it is one of the better ones in Nashville. I would give it probably slightly over 4 stars. 1. Every time I go, the service is always excellent.2. Fresh salsa with actual cilantro, onions, and peppers. (you would think this would be standard at a Mexican restaurant, but in Nashville this is not so. Most of the time you get tomato sauce with spice thrown in). 3. Excellent prices in general, but it should be noted that there are food and drink specials every day of the week....not too shabby!Am I some kind of food expert? Not really, but I used to live in the southwest US (where there are WAY more quality Mexican restaurants), and I think that this restaurant would do pretty decently stacked up against restaurants from out there. If this restaurant was located in the Southwest, then I would probably give it 3 stars. Since this is Nashville and good Mexican restaurants(with decent prices) are few and far between, then I still stand by my original rating of slightly over 4 stars. In conclusion, if you are in Nashville and are looking for some great Mexican cuisine, then check out Jalisco. You won't be sorry.

reviews.name: Jerry R.
