reviews.review: My wife and I visit a lot of Mexican restaurants through our group (Spanish Meetup) every week.   I arrived early this evening ahead of the rest of the group to check out the menu for vegetarian options.  To say I was disappointed was an understatement.  Cheese enchiladas was about it. :-(  Later when the group was ready to order I asked the server if they could make a mushroom quesadilla.  No - no way... they don't have mushrooms.   Oooookay!!!???  But they could make a vegetarian dish with cactus leaves.  Would I be interested in that?  Ummm... no.  We finally settled on veggie fajitas - not on the menu.To make a long story short, the fajitas were great but if they could do them, they needed to be on the menu that is woefully lacking on vegetarian options.  My advice - go elsewhere if you are vegetarian.

reviews.name: Marty Y.
reviews.review: Not very good, had a touch of food poisoning after eating there, beer was good thou.

reviews.name: Serena R.
reviews.review: Well anyone who knows me, knows I love "Quality" food n Mexican Food is my fave so I'm very picky when it comes to taste. I have dined at many Mexican Restaurants in many different states n I can honestly say that Jalisco is by far one of the BEST! They take pride in their business and it proves itself in every bite! The staff is amazing, great service and a home away from home atmosphere is really hard to find these days. At least 3 days a week you will find me in the bar where I'll be in my usual booth drinking Palomas n stuffing my bottomless pit while watching sports. I guarentee you will love this restaurant and if you don't I will give you a whippy and I'll eat the rest of whatever you didn't! LOL! :D

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: Amazing food and great service! Went on a Friday night and was promptly greeted at the host station by the gentleman who was my server. Server was attentive and the food arrived quickly. I had both the cheese dip and the chimichangas espesciales. Both were very good. Margaritas are also great. Would recommend to anyone.

reviews.name: Aubrey H.
reviews.review: This was the worst Mexican restaurant I have ate at in the Nashville area.  The meat in the entree I ordered was terrible looking-I could not tell if it was supposed to be ground beef (as described in the menu), shredded beef or chunks of beef.  It was so disgusting looking I couldn't even take a bite.  When concerns over the dish were voiced to the waiter, he was rude-offered no apology or replacement.  Poor food quality and customer service.  There are much better choices in the area.

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: Went for lunch because I had a coupon. It was 1:00 and the lunch rush was over but they hadn't recovered. It took longer than you expect to get seated, to get water, to place our order, and for food to arrive.  The salsa was fantastic. The rest of the food was just okay. Not steaming hot which I expect with Mexican food and not very flavorful. I had to add salt and salsa to the entire plate. Price was good and I'd go back but only if it was the only option other than fast food.

reviews.name: Rebecca B.
reviews.review: Ick! This tasted like bad school cafeteria food. I came here on a Thursday afternoon at 2pm and it was totally empty. I thought it was just late after the lunch rush but its because the food, the atmosphere, and the service ALL SUCK!!! Find somewhere else folks! Seriously!

reviews.name: Matthew C.
reviews.review: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Donelson. The others tend to taste more American and very store bought, if that is something you like I would avoid Jalisco.The Alambres is my favorite dinner item, but it is a lot of food, bring a friend who likes bacon.

reviews.name: Lauren B.
reviews.review: Nothing says happy holidays like canceled flights and unexpected nights in a city you wouldn't visit anyway. Needless to say, I was pissed off at American Airlines and Mother Nature. After schlepping to a mediocre hotel I decided my weary body needed nourishment but not before it got some alcohol. Using my trusty Yelp app, I saw that there was a place just a few block away with the same name as my undergrad chimichanga and margarita hang out... so I ventured out...I knew I was in love when the menu said they served breakfast all day. Ay dios mios?! Huevos Rancheros for dinner?! Yes, please. I don't really remember the food except that it came out fast, was salty cheap and generally good. I had two margaritas and lounged to glorious sound of my Saints beating th Falcons...oh yes, these are the holidays...

reviews.name: Greg S.
reviews.review: I've eaten here a few times before. It's close to the airport for travelers.  Has a cool view by the window.  Food is well priced. Service has always been great.  Food has always had some flavor.  I can't really say anything to bad about it.  Im not a fan of their salsa.  It's very sweet.  Not spicy.  Never alot of people there.  I don't know it's just a basic Mexican restaurant.  Nothing really stands out.  But i am satisfied when i leave.  With my wallet and my stomach.

reviews.name: Jeremy F.
reviews.review: Oh man. Take it from a Texan, this place is GREAT!!! the food is exactly on target for authentic Mexican. The carne asada was perfectly seasoned and the carnitas were so tender and flavorful. No greasy imitation stuff here. Prices are good, the staff is friendly and quick, and the drink prices are great too. Thanks Jalisco for making this Texan feel at home!!!RECOMMENDED!!

reviews.name: Steve L.
reviews.review: Excellent  carne asada at a very reasonable price.

reviews.name: Carrie D.
reviews.review: Whose idea was it to put velveeta in a chile rellano. Yuk.

reviews.name: Ilana T.
reviews.review: Save your money and taste buds and go to taco bell, unless you like terrible service along with your inedible food.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Standard Nashville Mexican Menu, unremarkable except for the Camarones Diabla which is better than most.  I eat this every time and it is consistent. Add a side of Nopales, canned sure, but nevertheless I'm addicted to these little green things. Top Shelf Margaritas will make sure you don't return to work after lunch.  Service friendly and Punctual.

reviews.name: Laurie G.
reviews.review: The food was really good. Service was good and fast. Would definitely eat here again!

reviews.name: Piyush S.
reviews.review: Jalisco is a good place for friends to meet over mexican fare. There is a lot of parking available and the drinks are reasonably priced. I have not tried the margeritas here but the food is pretty much like most of the other mexican restarurants in nashville area. Decent grilled pork, beef, brown rice and beans. If you are craving for mexican food and are near the donelson area, this is a good place. enjoy.

reviews.name: Spike J.
reviews.review: Had the Shrimp Quesadilla, very good.  Service, Good.  Why 5 stars? The freakin salsa was the best I've ever had!  They swear there is no sugar in it, so great tomatoes must be the secret- heat was good for most people, the flavor was OUTSTANDING.

reviews.name: Rusty T.
reviews.review: Very good food. Came out hot and quick. Good quality ingredients and good service. I will eat here again!

reviews.name: Jeffrey W.
reviews.review: I had dinner here based on another review I read on Yelp, and because it was close to my hotel. I had the carne asada and it was quite good. It was served on a bed of nopales and grilled onions, which were also delicious. I'll even mention the refried beans and the rice because they were very flavorful. All this was $9.99 - not bad. I washed it down with a cold Dos XX and I was good to go. The place is typical casual Mexican restaurant decor with tables and booths. My server was friendly and attentive.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the area.

reviews.name: Buck G.
reviews.review: The ground beef at this place was disgusting and tasted like it had been reheated at least three times. My wife's chimichanga was soggy and was obviously a microwave reheat.

reviews.name: Cathryn D.
reviews.review: Highly enjoyable!Husband and I are here this past week for a late breakfast early lunch.I was really impressed with the variety they offer, I had a breakfast sandwhich with egg whites ham and cheese and it was scrumptious l. My husband had the olive oil and Rosemary bagel with bacon egg and cheese and I enjoyed the few bites of his better than mine, I think it was his choice of bagel. Either way very enjoyable quick and easy!We will be back!

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: This was Noel's first trip to Bruegger's to try their bagels. I usually eat at the one near Vanderbilt. We were on our way to Nashville West to shop so we decided to stop and get some BREAKFAST..and I am glad we did...The interior was clean and airy. I liked the feel of the interior. We were greeted immediately and we placed our order. I got an Everything Bagel with plain cream cheese toasted and Noel went with the new Chorizo Jack Bagel and then we both got Italian Sodas for our drinks, I went with regular orange and she went with Blood Orange..they were both very good!!! We would definitely eat here again!!! The cost was $12.53 and left the change out of $15 as a tip in the jar on the counter top...Definitely great breakfast!!! Recommend to all.....

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: Ahhhh Bruegger's, I love you. I come here whenever I crave an Herby Turkey and really enjoy the people that work here. They are friendly and quick when serving up orders. The bagels are also delicious!

reviews.name: Alexandra F.
reviews.review: Bruegger's gets 5 stars from me! Their cream cheese section alone is amazing. If I was purchasing cream cheese for like a party or big breakfast, I would get it from here.Never once have they messed up my order and the service is quick! I love the egg and cheese on the Asiago bagel with the jalapeño cream cheese. CHEESE CHEESE CHEESE! This place is perfect to grab breakfast on your way to work or whatever. But it's also good enough that I would sit down with someone and just enjoy. Highly recommend!

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: Love our bagel place. Faster than downtown one. Service is awesome and they are helpful for locals they know their interests. Son has western most visits and best flavored bagels and seasonal cream cheeses.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: I've liked this place ever since I was a kid. There's also a location nearby, by the Harding/HWY 100 split. You can't go wrong with the bacon, egg, and cheese bagel, but lately I've been loving that promotional bagel with the Canadian bacon on it. The sun dried tomato bagel is to die for. This is my favorite place to go for breakfast :)

reviews.name: Dee a.
reviews.review: Good bagels and breakfast sandwiches, friendly staff, and quick service. mucho gusto.

reviews.name: Anna B.
reviews.review: Good bagels!  plus a very friendly staff who were chipper considering it was only 6 am when i got there. I got a boring bagel so I won't report on that.  It was nice of them to give me a full size cup for my water, and I ended up staying around doing work (they have that free WiFi hook up) for hours.  Also,  an incredibly clean bathroom.  All in all a great experience,  considering it's a chain.

reviews.name: Ashley H.
reviews.review: I love brueggers but this location has the WORST service. I always try to run in around 2 before school and even though they don't close till 3 I am rushed out and barely given a chance to tell them my whole order. The new girl has made my sandwich wrong Everytime and instead of adding cheese on my sandwich she just put on top of the already wrapped up sandwich and put it in the bag. I have never been given a chance at check out to add chips or a drink I have to ask after they already are grabbing for my card. Also one time I've walked in around 230 and they already had turned the soups off and told me I can MICROWAVE it at home if I want it.... That's the most ridiculous shit I've ever heard of!!!

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: What's not to love about bagels and coffee? I think one of my favorite breakfasts would have to be a nice hot cup of coffee and a toasted bagel & smear. Preferably veggie smear when I'm at Bruegger's.Service here is always friendly and quick. My girlfriend and I stopped in yesterday morning for a quick breakfast and to our surprise it was free coffee day! Free give outs are awesome, but when its free coffee at 7AM, its even more awesome. They even gave us a coupon for free coffee the next time we are in.Since it fall it's necessary for every establish to pack their shelves with anything and everything pumpkin. The Pumpkin Spice Coffee here is not to be missed. They also have pumpkin cream cheese, which I will for sure try next time I'm there.

reviews.name: Elise G.
reviews.review: Never go to this location if you are in a big hurry.  The staff doesn't have very much pep in their step :/  This has been my experience the last 4 or 5 times, but they still make a decent bagel.

reviews.name: Jamie D.
reviews.review: Gosh darn you Bruegger's Bagel. You hit the spot! Having one of those morning's recently where that super healthy breakfast just wouldn't get me through my day, I accidentally came across this location. Although, bagels by nature, aren't really unhealthy; you must stop by here and try one of their delicious bagels topped with cheese. I was very surprised that when I let one foot hit the floor that the woman behind the counter enthusiastically greeted me. That was a nice start to the morning! Customer service here is equally as amazing as is the quality of the food. They have a bunch of different cream cheeses that you can match to your bagel. The variety and freshness of the bagels is at rockstar status. Although not near where I live...I will be sure to make this a stop on my way anywhere near the shop.

reviews.name: Stuart W.
reviews.review: This place is as middle of the road as one can get  - generic bagels with generic spreads, pretty good coffee and decent sandwiches. In fact Bruegger's would scream 'ok' except that would be out of character, so it would just probably say it in a medium voice so as not to offend.

reviews.name: Josh B.
reviews.review: Solid, if unoriginal bagel cafe.  They have a decent selection of bagel varieties, as well as cream cheese offerings.  Some of their sandwiches are a little uninspired, but the staff does their best, and definitely adds to the experience.I do wish that Brueggers would toast their bagels just a little bit longer.  Rather than having a nice crunch to them, they can be a little chewy.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Baked fresh daily with no preservatives, Bruegger's Bagels are good. Honey grain, pumpernickel, blueberry and asiago parmesan bagels plain or in a sandwich are my top choices. Garlic cream cheese with roasted peppers, tomateo, lettuce and red onion make their Leonardo da Veggie sandwich my favorite animal friendly choice. Wheat bread, wrap or bagelwich with over a dozen topping choices means there are hundreds of possible sandwich combinations. But Bruegger's bagels boil down, for me, to good bagel baking.
